Words.English Translation: → English: 11 + basic (information) from english 11 eleven + english basic (information) essential; fundamental
Words.Definition: (military, abbreviation) a soldier's official identity card, given to replace their national identity card (pink IC) when they are enlisted into the SAF.According to the Ministry of Defence (MINDEF), it stands for the 11 basic pieces of information written on the card; namely: name, NRIC number, photo, race, blood group, birth date, country of birth, sex, service status, military rank status, and address. It may entitle the holder to discounts and promotions on occasions like SAF day.The 11B is retained after national service is completed, but with a sticker pasted over the military status indicating that the serviceman is now an NSMan.

Words.English Translation: → English: 1206 from english 1206 (numerals)
Words.Definition: (military) a form signed in the SAF by a soldier who has lost or caused damage to SAF equipment, acknowledging a deduction in their pay. Pronounced twelve-oh-six.
Words.Example: Jialat... my chocolate bar fell off? Later go back must sign 1206 ah?

Words.English Translation: → English: 1211 from english 1211 (numerals)
Words.Definition: (military) a form for documenting the receipt and issuance of goods

Words.English Translation: → English: 15 + a from english 15 fifteen + english a alphabet
Words.Definition: (military) a temporary military identity card issued to a soldier who has lost their military IC2 (11B). It has to be used alongside a valid photo ID and a police report.

Words.English Translation: → English: 302 from english 302 (numerals)
Words.Definition: (military) a form signed by a soldier to declare that they are homosexual. Pronounced "three-oh-two".
Words.Example: - Eh, hear say Rayner got sign 302.- Huh issit? He not like very gu niang one leh.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 四 poj: sì + 八 poj: poeh + 九 poj: káu + 六 poj: la̍k + 死爸 poj: sí-pē + 够力 夠力 poj: kàu-la̍t from hokkien (poj) 四 sì four; 4 + hokkien (poj) 八 poeh eight; 8 + hokkien (poj) 九 káu nine; 9 + hokkien (poj) 六 la̍k six; 6 + hokkien (poj) 死爸 sí-pē extremely; very + hokkien (poj) 够力 夠力 kàu-la̍t powerful; strong
Words.Definition: (slightly vulgar) extremely powerful; incredibly strong
Words.Example: Despite being 'cancelled' previously, Namewee will still be going ahead with his year-end concert. Named after the Hokkien slang ‘4896’ which means ‘Super Powerful’, this best defines the theme of his highly anticipated concert tour.

Words.English Translation: → English: 4 + digits from english 4 four + english digits digits
Words.Definition: the most popular lottery game in Singapore, run by Singapore Pools. It is believed to have originated in Kedah in 1951. The name refers to the four-digit number players choose, from 0000 to 9999, which is matched against a draw of 23 winning numbers.

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 十五 pinyin: shí wǔ from general chinese (pinyin) 十五 shí wǔ ten five
Words.Definition: a game played by at least two people, or a larger group of any size.Players hold up both fists, and take turns shouting out a multiple of five (0, 5, 10, 15, 20 - or higher, bounded by the number of players in play), while all players simultaneously open none, one, or both of their hands. The number corresponds to the player's guess of the number of fingers held up (hence being a multiple of five). While rules may vary, one variant is that if a player guessed correctly on their turn, they get to guess again, and if getting two correct guesses in a row, the others have to perform a forfeit.Originated as a Chinese drinking game.

Words.English Translation: → English: 5 + C from english 5 five + english C the letter c
Words.Definition: a phrase referring to the five status symbols of cash, car, credit card, condominium, and country club, historically held to be the five goals of a successful working Singaporean. Sometimes also alludes to the clout and materialistic goals many spend their lives chasing after in order to impress others.

Words.English Translation: → English: 6 + C from english 6 six + english C the letter c
Words.Definition: a phrase referring to the six status symbols of career, cash, car, credit card, condominium, and country club, historically held to be the six goals of a successful working Singaporean. Sometimes also alludes to the clout and materialistic goals many spend their lives chasing after, in order to impress others.

Words.English Translation: → English: early + 7 + 8 ↻ Hokkien / general chinese: 七早八早 poj: chhit-chá-poeh-chá from english early near the start of a day + english 7 seven + english 8 eight ↻ hokkien / general chinese (poj) 七早八早 chhit-chá-poeh-chá very early; early morning ← hokkien (poj) 早 chá early; morning + hokkien (poj) 七…八… chhit … poeh … haphazardly; randomly; anyhow ← hokkien (poj) 七 chhit seven + hokkien (poj) 八 poeh eight
Words.Definition: (idiom) very early in the morning
Words.Example: Angmoh where got 7 early 8 early wake up one...sun rises at 5am...body rises at 830...brush teeth, lim kopi, jiak roti...zoom here zoom there at 9...from home...

Words.English Translation: → English: -ide & -ize/-ise + Hokkien: 屎 poj: sái from english -ide general word ending & english -ize/-ise general word ending + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion; (vg.) shit; lousy; useless
Words.Definition: clipping or alteration of various English word endings containing the diphthong /aɪ/

Words.English Translation: → English: attract + attention from english attract invite; draw + english attention notice; recognition
Words.Definition: (initialism) describing someone who is routinely solicits the attention of others through loud, showy, provocative, tactless, and unabashed means.
Words.Example: Never see she show half ball meh.. so A.A.!

Words.English Translation: → English: abacus + bead ↻ Hakka: 算盘子 算盤子 pinfa: son4 pan2 zi3 from english abacus device for performing calculations ← latin abacus/abax board for counting; board ← ancient greek ᾰ̓́βᾰξ ábax board for counting; board; slab + english bead small round ball ↻ hakka (pinfa) 算盘子 算盤子 son4 pan2 zi3 abacus bead ← hakka (pinfa) 算盘 算盤 son4 pan2 abacus ← hakka (pinfa) 子 子 zi3 grain-like object; small object; seed
Words.Definition: a Hakka dish, made with a dough of taro and tapioca flour that is typically shaped into rounded biconcave discs and boiled, before being stir-fried with various ingredients like minced pork, mushrooms, and spring onions. Since its namesake - the abacus - is associated with accounting, abacus beads are often taken as a symbol of wealth and prosperity.

Words.English Translation: → English: abacus + seed ↻ Hakka: 算盘子 算盤子 hrs: son panˇ ziiˋ from english abacus device for performing calculations ← latin abacus/abax board for counting; board ← ancient greek ᾰ̓́βᾰξ ábax board for counting; board; slab + english seed fertilized ovule of a plant ↻ hakka (hrs) 算盘子 算盤子 son panˇ ziiˋ abacus bead ← hakka (hrs) 算盘 算盤 son panˇ abacus ← hakka (hrs) 子 子 ziiˋ grain-like object; small object; seed
Words.Definition: See abacus beads.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: abang from malay abang older brother; male person older than oneself
Words.Definition: term of address or endearment for a male person slightly older than oneself; big brother
Words.Example: Tucked away at a tiny little coffeehouse in Ang Mo Kio, Abang Gemuk is a halal-certified Western food stall from the same people behind Fatty Bom Bom.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: abang + English: body from malay abang older brother; male person older than oneself + english body physical form of a human
Words.Definition: a fit and muscular man; a man who works to build an aesthetically pleasing, muscular physique through lifestyle, diet, and exercise
Words.Example: From 'ah pui' to 'abang body': Dad of two shares how he lost 13kg in 10 months

Words.English Translation: → Malay: abang + sepuh from malay abang older brother; male person older than oneself + malay sepuh (of metals, esp. steel) hardened; quench-hardened; annealed ← javanese ꦱꦼꦥꦸꦃ sepuh (of metals, esp. steel) hardened; quench-hardened; annealed
Words.Definition: an extremely muscular and toned man; a bodybuilder; a man who has built an aesthetically pleasing, muscular physique through lifestyle, diet, and exercise
Words.Example: i think i know why men prefer gym majapahit rather than gym komersil ... (they get free assistance from abang-abang body builder sepuh)

Words.English Translation: → Malay: air batu campur from malay air batu campur sweet shaved ice dessert ← malay air batu ice ← malay air water + malay batu stone; rock + malay campur mixed
Words.Definition: another name for ice kacang
Words.Example: This wacky dessert is served up in malls, food centers, and hawker stands. The locals often refer to it simply as ABC ...

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain English: ABC &/or Possible, but not certain [vitamins] A, B, C from english Possible, but not certain ABC basics; fundamentals &/or english Possible, but not certain [vitamins] A, B, C names of vitamins
Words.Definition: a simple Chinese soup usually made from some combination of carrots, pork ribs, corn, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and chicken (usually wings or dumsticks) boiled in water
Words.Example: ABC Soup can be boiled without meat. In the recent years, however, my mother began cooking a vegetarian version of the ABC soup. She puts more onions into the soup to add sweetness and sometimes maize or beetroot to enhance the flavour.

Words.English Translation: → English: a bit from english a bit slightly; to a small extent; rather
Words.Definition: a little; to an extent
Words.Example: - Want get dessert? Got a very nice cendol place round the corner.- If you want you go ahead ba; I still abit jelak from dinner.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: abit + English: the from singlish abit a little; (sarcastic, meiosis) quite; rather; very ← english a bit slightly; to a small extent; rather + english the definite article
Words.Definition: (sarcastic, meiotic) quite; rather; very
Words.Example: You a bit the blur leh...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 抑无 抑無 poj: a̍h-bô + Singlish: then from hokkien (POJ) 抑无 抑無 a̍h-bô or/if not + singlish then interjection used to ask for elaboration on something said, or point out the obviousness of a statement; usually in a rhetorical or sometimes impolite manner. ← english then next to occur; afterwards; besides that
Words.Definition: if not, what?
Words.Example: Abuden? I ownself buy from ownself isit?

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act cute buay cute from singlish act cute buay cute pretend to be cute when one is not ← singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + english cute charming; adorable; quirky; innocent
Words.Definition: abbreviation of act cute buay cute

Words.English Translation: → English: accent from english accent pronunciation associated w a region, nationality, social grp., etc. ← latin accentus accent; tone
Words.Definition: to put on or attempt to feign a higher-prestige accent that is not one's natural speaking accent in a language, often in an attempt to sound high-class or educated in front of others — especially an obviously forced or poor imitation of a general British, American, or Australian English accent
Words.Example: Take a walk through the streets of Singapore, and you will hear a mishmash of languages, perhaps a lot of Singlish, but almost never Standard English in its purest form, unless maybe when you toking with angmor, then maybe u action bedek a bit and wanna accent accent to act atas.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: acar from malay acar ← hindustani अचार acār a South Asian pickle ← classical persian آچار āčār preserved meats, pickles, or fruits
Words.Definition: a local variation of Indian pickles (achar), usually made using a mixture of vegetables, chilli padi, shallots, lime, and sometimes other ingredients including fruits and peanuts.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Hokkien: 阿明 poj: a-bêng from english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 阿明 a-bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: to behave like an Ah Beng; to pretend (often exaggeratedly) to be a gangsterlike, uncouth delinquent
Words.Example: Hilarious! ... Want to act ah beng then in the end kenna whacked by someone twice his age.

Words.Word: act ah lian 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: act + Hokkien: 阿莲 阿蓮 poj: a-liân from english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 阿莲 阿蓮 a-liân young Chinese woman, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and associated with street gangs; bimbo; stereotypically common female given name
Words.Definition: to behave like an Ah Lian; to pretend (often exaggeratedly) to be an unrefined, uncouth bimbo or delinquent
Words.Example: I know one secondary school mate who uplorry ... but hor she is a chao ah lian, likes to act ah lian in school ... hearsay she kenna accident and uplorry before 20 years old ... she uplorry I no feeling

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Hokkien: 明 poj: bêng from english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 明 bêng Ah Beng; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: to behave like an Ah Beng; to pretend (often exaggeratedly) to be a gangsterlike, uncouth delinquent
Words.Example: No wonder everyone just assume you freshie... Some more try and act beng by spewing vulgarities, really childish man.

Words.Word: act beng buay beng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + Hokkien: 明 poj: bêng from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + hokkien (poj) 明 bêng Ah Beng; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: describing someone behaving like or pretending (often exaggeratedly) to be an Ah Beng, which is obviously feigned or a front, and comes across as unnecessary, attention-seeking, and annoying
Words.Example: Dont know the son doing what also, looks like a blur fuck through out the whole show dont know what to do, and never do things right, long finger nails, so unhygienic and worst, got the kind of wanna act beng buay beng kind of looks, those that always kanna bully de and in turn can only bully primary school kids.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: besar from english act behave like; feign + malay besar big; large
Words.Definition: to act as if one were far more important than one actually is, implying that this comes across as narcissistic, lacking self-awareness, and annoying
Words.Example: I won't bloody stop my car for them man even if they surround me. You know if you stop you are going to die. I'm not saying this just to act besar, I will really do it in that situation. Damn rempits.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + big from english act behave like; feign + english big significant; important; great; huge
Words.Definition: to act as if one were far more important than one actually is, implying that this comes across as narcissistic, lacking self-awareness, and annoying
Words.Example: theres literally nothing in the world i hate more than those yps who have an ego taller than burj khalifa that try to act big all the time. most of them also have no moral decency to act like a normal human being and do whatever it takes to stand out and be “cool”…

Words.Word: act big buay big 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + English: big from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + english big significant; important; great; huge
Words.Definition: describing someone behaving as if they were far more important than they actually are, and which comes across as narcissistic, lacking self-awareness, and annoying

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Singlish: blur from english act behave like; feign + singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy
Words.Definition: to feign ignorance; to play dumb
Words.Example: Alamak, you next time really must act blur ba.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act blur + English: live + longer from singlish act blur feign ignorance; play dumb + english live be alive; survive; outlast + english longer (comparative) for a greater duration
Words.Definition: do not present yourself to be as capable as you really are, or pretend you are incompetent and ignorant, and you will encounter less troubles and problems, or be given less work.Possibly originated as military slang.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: bodoh from english act behave like; feign + malay bodoh stupid; idiot; fool
Words.Definition: to feign ignorance; to play dumb
Words.Example: Lay low first, act bodoh, act humble ... Sinkies memories very short one.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Hokkien: 俏 poj: chhió/chhiò from english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 俏 chhió/chhiò pretty; handsome; charming; lovely
Words.Definition: to behave in an (often exaggeratedly) charming or vain manner; to act pretty; to pretend as if one is extremely beautiful
Words.Example: lesser chance to act chio take pictures this time round. fell sick right before the trip ...

Words.Word: act chio buay chio 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + Hokkien: 俏 poj: chhió/chhiò from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + hokkien (poj) 俏 chhió/chhiò pretty; handsome; charming; lovely
Words.Definition: describing someone behaving in an (often exaggeratedly) charming and vain manner or acting as if they were extremely beautiful when they obviously are not, which comes across as fake, unnecessary, attention-seeking, and annoying
Words.Example: Dont know the son doing what also, looks like a blur fuck through out the whole show dont know what to do, and never do things right, long finger nails, so unhygienic and worst, got the kind of wanna act beng buay beng kind of looks, those that always kanna bully de and in turn can only bully primary school kids.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + cool from english act behave like; feign + english cool stylish; suave; hip; dashing; enviable
Words.Definition: to pretend as if one is extremely stylish, suave, dashing, etc.
Words.Example: Whenever I was around her, I would try to act cool and show off in the hope that she would like me too. She didn’t notice my actions initially, but slowly began to warm up to me.

Words.Word: act cool buay cool 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + Hokkien: 俏 poj: chhió/chhiò from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + hokkien (poj) 俏 chhió/chhiò pretty; handsome; charming; lovely
Words.Definition: describing someone behaving (often exaggeratedly) as if they were extremely suave, dashing, fashionable, etc. when they obviously are not, which often comes across as fake, unnecessary, attention-seeking, and annoying
Words.Example: Ending off with this act-cool-buay-cool photo. Hahaha, pardon me for the spamming of photos of myself!

Words.English Translation: → English: act + cute from english act behave like; feign + english cute charming; adorable; quirky; innocent

Words.Word: act cute buay cute 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + English: cute from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + english cute charming; adorable; quirky; innocent
Words.Definition: describing a person behaving in an exaggeratedly cutesy manner, which is obviously feigned or a front, and comes across as unnecessary and irritating. Can also describe the manner in which they are acting.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Singlish: dao from english act behave like; feign + singlish dao arrogant; snobbish; aloof; supercilious ← cantonese (jyutping) 高窦 高竇 gou1 dau3 arrogant; snobbish; stuck-up

Words.English Translation: → English: act + fierce from english act behave like; feign + english fierce ferocious; threatening ← old french fers brave; fierce; savage ← latin ferus fierce; savage; wild
Words.Definition: to put on a threatening, imposing display; to behave intimidatingly
Words.Example: Why the black shirt guy act fierce only but kenna smashed and lose the fight

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: garang from english act behave like; feign + malay garang fierce; ferocious; strong
Words.Definition: to put on a brave, imposing, manly, or gung ho front
Words.Example: Nothing wrong with reporting sick. If you feel unwell. Do not act garang to participate actively when u feel unwell.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: gerek from english act behave like; feign + malay gerek bore; drill a hole, (slang) cool; awesome
Words.Definition: to pretend as if one is extremely cool, suave, awesome, dashing, etc.
Words.Example: In Singapore, they will lay out pizza, even that, each only get 2 slices, bosses will come out act gerek, den announce company earn abit only, den drive a new bentley the following week....

Words.English Translation: → English: act + General chinese: 乖 pinyin: guāi from english act behave like; feign + general chinese (pinyin) 乖 guāi well-behaved; good; obedient
Words.Definition: to act obedient; to pretend to be well-behaved, innocent, and not troublesome
Words.Example: It is competitive in CCAs but if you wanna try for Student Council, it is actually quite easy as long you made solid friends at the start of school and act guai, you can get in one.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: jambu from english act behave like; feign + malay jambu any plant of the genus Syzygium or its edible fruit, (slang) cute; adorable; pretty; beautiful ← javanese / old javanese ꦗꦩ꧀ꦧꦸ jambu any plant of the genus Syzygium or its edible fruit ← sanskrit जम्बु jambu Syzygium cumini or its edible fruit
Words.Definition: to act cute; to attempt to make oneself look more adorable, pretty, attractive, or innocent

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: kaya from english act behave like; feign + malay kaya rich
Words.Definition: to act as if one is rich or extremely well-off, when this is obviously feigned or a front

Words.Word: act ke lian 简 繁

Words.Definition: to act pitiful, often to seek attention or for some ulterior motive

And he’s damn good at acting kesian lo! While watching the movie i had to keep convincing myself that he’s just acting in a movie to prevent myself from crying of sympathy. Damn traumatizing.

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Hokkien: 莲 蓮 poj: liân from english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 莲 蓮 liân Ah Lian; stereotypically common female given name

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: act … buay … + Hokkien: 莲 蓮 poj: liân from singlish act … buay … pretend to be when one is not ← english act behave like; feign + hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not + hokkien (poj) 莲 蓮 liân Ah Lian; stereotypically common female given name

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: minah from english act behave like; feign + malay minah gal; dudette; Jane Doe ← malay Aminah popular Muslim female given name ← arabic أَمِينَة ʔamīna popular Arabic female given name ← arabic أَمِين ʔamīn archangel Gabriel; faithful; loyal; reliable; trustworthy

Words.English Translation: → English: act + Malay: pandai from english act behave like; feign + malay pandai clever; smart; skilled ← prakrit (brahmi) 𑀧𑀁𑀟𑀺𑀅 paṃḍia wise man ← sanskrit पण्डित paṇḍitá scholar; clever; wise
Words.Definition: to act smart; to be a smartass
Words.Example: I did teach him but he always like to act pandai. Maybe feel superior than me coz he has more than 30 years work experience ...

Words.Definition: (transitive) to pretend that; to act as if

Words.English Translation: → English: action from english action perform a motion; (imp.) command to begin sth., esp. a performance or act ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action
Words.Definition: blustering, arrogant, and pompous in one's behaviour and bearing
Words.Example: Wei Kiat admits that his grasp of English grammar is poor and his vocabulary, weak. He does not speak "high class English" to his friends and family. Says Wei Kiat, "Wait people think I very action."
Related: khiang tioh ho, mai keh khiang

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: action + Malay: bedek from singlish action (of people) appearing as if they were something they are not ← english action perform a motion; (imp.) command to begin sth., esp. a performance or act ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action + malay bedek bluff; lie ← javanese Possible, but not certain bedek-bedekan ask riddles
Words.Definition: blustering; arrogant
Words.Example: The video clip can be summed up in two words: "Action Bedek". I've never been at a briefing where a commander uses such emotive words. You leave that for the pep talk, not the briefing. Unless you're filming for the benefit of some daft purpose. It seems petty and insecure.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ada udang di [se]balik batu from malay ada udang di [se]balik batu (pvb.) there is a hidden agenda; there are ulterior motives ← malay ada have; exists; there is + malay udang prawn; shrimp + malay di at; in + malay [se]balik behind + malay batu stone; rock
Words.Definition: (idiom) there is a hidden agenda; there are ulterior motives behind something
Words.Example: there is no way they can deactivate the account without informing the account holder ... there must be ada udang di sebalik batu

Words.English Translation: → Malay: adik from malay adik younger sibling; term of address for a younger sibling in a family
Words.Definition: younger sibling; term of address or endearment for a younger sibling

Words.English Translation: → Malay: aduh from malay aduh ouch
Words.Definition: ouch!; an exclamation in response to physical pain, or sympathy to another's pain, or expressing emotional hurt as a reply to an insult.
Words.Example: 😂adoiiiii...I sgt faham the cat,mesti trauma after this

Words.English Translation: → Malay: agak from malay agak guess; conjecture; estimate
Words.Definition: to guess; to estimate
Words.Example: - You sure?- Not really, I agak only.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: agak + tarik from malay agak guess; conjecture; estimate + malay tarik pull
Words.Definition: hold back; not go too far
Words.Example: Don't give the kids so much homework in one day lah. Agak tarik a bit, they've got other classes to study for as well!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: agak-agak from malay agak-agak reduplication of 'agak' ⇇ malay agak guess; conjecture; estimate
Words.Definition: to guess; to estimate
Words.Example: When cooking, for example, if asked how much sugar you put in, you could reply 'I just agak-agak.'

Words.English Translation: → Malay: agar-agar from malay agar-agar a jelly typically made from the gracilaria and gelidiaceae genera of red algae ⇇ malay agar the red algae from which agar-agar jelly is produced
Words.Definition: an edible jelly-like substance made from red algae, traditionally used as an ingredient in making jellied desserts.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: agak + English: -(r)ation from malay agak estimate; guess + english -(r)ation an action or process, or the result thereof ← old french -ation an action or process, or the result thereof ← latin -ātiō form of the -tiō suffix added to a noun to form another noun relating to an action or the result thereof
Words.Definition: a guess; an estimation
Words.Example: I didn't mean that I watch exactly 10 hours of TV every week for sure; that figure was just an agaration.

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 啊 pinyin: a from general chinese (pinyin) 啊 a general particle or interjection
Words.Definition: used at the end of a sentence as a question or interrogative marker; tag asking for clarification
Words.Example: This is free? I take two also can? → This is free ah? I take two also can ah?

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 鸭母捻 鴨母捻 peng'im: ah4 bho2 nim3 from teochew (peng'im) 鸭母捻 鴨母捻 ah4 bho2 nim3 ah balling (glutinous rice balls with filling in a sweet soup; tangyuan) ← teochew (peng'im) 鸭母 鴨母 ah4 bho2 female duck; mother duck + teochew (peng'im) 捻 捻 nim3 to pinch with the fingers
Words.Definition: a dish of glutinous rice balls with filling, such as ground peanut or sesame paste mixed with sugar, in a sweet soup; Teochew tangyuan. It is popularly eaten during the Winter Solstice Festival.
Words.Example: Tangyuan for the Teochews is known as “Ah Balling”, ... which means “mother duck’s eggs”. The term is used to describe tangyuan’s resemblance to floating duck eggs while being cooked in soup.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿明 poj: a-bêng from hokkien (poj) 阿明 a-bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young Chinese man, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike. The male counterpart of an Ah Lian or Ah Huay.
Words.Example: The boys are called Ah Bengs and the girls Ah Lians. I have been warned by friends never to make eye contact with them, never to laugh at their ridiculous clothing combinations (white, skin-tight trousers and vest, black belt and a bright yellow handphone stuck to the hip) and never to get into an argument with them because they are usually armed with knives or, wait for it, parangs.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿明阿成 poj: a-bêng a-sêng from hokkien (poj) 阿明阿成 a-bêng a-sêng Ah Bengs and Ah Sengs ← hokkien (poj) 阿明 a-bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man + hokkien (poj) 阿成 a-sêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a posse of uncouth, uneducated delinquents and their ilk.
Words.Example: Don't go mix with those Ah Beng Ah Seng over there...

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Ah Beng + English: -ified from singlish Ah Beng of or relating to young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese men ← hokkien (poj) 阿明 a-bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name + english -ified (suffix) made into or done ← old french -ifier (suffix) make into or do ← latin -ificare (suffix) make into or do
Words.Definition: past participle and simple past of ah bengify
Words.Example: lol, it tot its an Ah Bengfied version of "ba" or "bah". I mean...look at the way ah bengs type man...

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Ah Beng + English: -ify from singlish Ah Beng of or relating to young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese men ← hokkien (poj) 阿明 a-bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name + english -ify (suffix) make into or do ← old french -ifier (suffix) make into or do ← latin -ificare (suffix) make into or do
Words.Definition: (pejorative) to decorate; to adorn; to pimp up; to furbish or refurbish, often in a loud, flashy, showy, or garish manner
Words.Example: Those wheel arches scare me. Why’d they have to Ah Bengify every new iteration of the Neo? I think the original non-CPS models looked the best, honestly.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 阿兵哥 pinyin: ā bīng gē from mandarin (pinyin) 阿兵哥 ā bīng gē soldier boy ← mandarin (pinyin) 阿 ā endearing prefix + mandarin (pinyin) 兵 bīng soldier + mandarin (pinyin) 哥 gē older brother
Words.Definition: a soldier boy; a National Serviceman (especially in the SAF)
Words.Example: so put his photo big big, then can find!if he chut stunt, bring to car by ah bing ge!if very naughty, gun shoot him piang piang

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 抑無 抑无 poj: a̍h-bô from hokkien (poj) 抑無 抑无 a̍h-bô otherwise; or; if not
Words.Definition: otherwise; or; if not

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿 poj: a + English: boy from hokkien (poj) 阿 a honorific, dimin., or endearing prefix + english boy young male person; male person younger than the speaker
Words.Definition: term of address or endearment for a young man or male child who is younger than the speaker. Male equivalent of an Ah Girl.
Words.Example: Ah Boy, can help me check the time?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿母 poj: a-bú from hokkien (poj) 阿母 a-bú mother
Words.Definition: mother; term of address for one's mother

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿姊 poj: a-ché/chí + Cantonese / teochew: 阿姐 jyutping: aa3 ze2-1 from hokkien (poj) 阿姊 a-ché/chí elder sister; polite term of address for a woman + cantonese / teochew (jyutping) 阿姐 aa3 ze2-1 elder sister; term of address for a woman; a famous and established actress
Words.Definition: elder sister; term of address or endearment for an elder sister
Words.Example: Ah che just came back from her uni exchange program today, and bought us a bunch of goodies from overseas!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿叔 poj: a-chek from hokkien (poj) 阿叔 a-chek father's younger brother
Words.Definition: one's father's younger brother

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 阿斗 pinyin: ā dǒu from mandarin (pinyin) 阿斗 ā dǒu nickname of Emperor Liu Shan; useless and incapable person (esp. a leader)
Words.Definition: an ineffective and incapable person, especially someone in a position of political power, leadership, management, or privilege
Words.Example: CDL stocks on a downtrend ever since Ah Dou took over and lost money like no tomorrow
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿 poj: a + English: girl from hokkien (poj) 阿 a honorific, dimin., or endearing prefix + english girl young female person; female person younger than the speaker
Words.Definition: term of address or endearment for a young woman or female child who is younger than the speaker. Female equivalent of an Ah Boy.
Words.Example: Ah Girl, what time you coming home for dinner tonight?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿花 poj: a-hoe from hokkien (poj) 阿花 a-hoe young Chinese woman, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and associated with street gangs; bimbo; stereotypically common female given name.
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young Chinese woman, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and associated with street gangs; a bimbo. The female counterpart of an Ah Beng or Ah Seng.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿狗 poj: a-káu from hokkien (poj) 阿狗 a-káu ← hokkien (poj) 阿 a dimin. prefix, or used to express familiarity and friendliness + hokkien (poj) 狗 káu dog
Words.Definition: endearing nickname for someone acting cutesy

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿公 poj: a-kong from hokkien (poj) 阿公 a-kong grandfather
Words.Definition: grandfather; term of address or endearment for one's grandfather
Words.Example: Every Chinese New Year, we gather at Ah Kong's house for a festive reunion dinner.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿哥 poj: a-ko͘ from hokkien (poj) 阿哥 a-ko͘ elder brother
Words.Definition: elder brother; a term of address or endearment for an elder brother
Words.Example: Ah kor always takes care of us, giving advice and support whenever we need it.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿倌 poj: a-koaⁿ from hokkien (poj) 阿倌 a-koaⁿ hermaphrodite; male prostitute; transgender woman
Words.Definition: (derogatory) an effeminate man

Words.English Translation: → Hainanese: 亚坤 亞坤 a˧ kun? from hainanese 亚坤 亞坤 a˧ kun? Loi Ah Koon (黎亚坤), Hainanese immigrant and founder of Ya Kun Kaya Toast
Words.Definition: Loi Ah Koon (黎亚坤), a Hainanese immigrant and the founder of Ya Kun Kaya Toast
Words.Example: However attempts to duplicate such toasts at home might prove some difficulties as if you would have realize, the loaf bread that Ah Kun uses in their store are generally thicker than those found in the bakeries and supermarkets.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿莲 阿蓮 poj: a-liân from hokkien (poj) 阿莲 阿蓮 a-liân young Chinese woman, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and associated with street gangs; bimbo; stereotypically common female given name
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young Chinese woman, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and associated with street gangs; a bimbo. The female counterpart of an Ah Beng or Ah Seng.
Words.Example: She is so ah lian, always dressed in chintzy clothes, hanging out at the pool table and smoking with the Ah Bengs, and speaking loudly on her phone wherever she goes.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 阿窿 jyutping: aa3 lung1 from cantonese (jyutping) 阿窿 aa3 lung1 loan shark ← cantonese (jyutping) 阿 aa3 dimin. or endearing prefix + cantonese (jyutping) 大耳窿 daai6 ji5 lung4-1 loan shark ← cantonese (jyutping) 大 daai6 big + cantonese (jyutping) 耳窿 ji5 lung4-1 ear cavity; ear hole; ear piercing
Words.Definition: a loan shark
Words.Example: Around July 2017, Lua was promoted to an “Ah Long”. The syndicate also handed him $30,000 as capital for his moneylending business. He continued to receive a monthly salary of $1,000.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 阿妈 阿媽 poj: a-má from min nan (poj) 阿妈 阿媽 a-má grandmother; elderly woman
Words.Definition: grandmother; term of address or endearment for one's grandmother
Words.Example: During peak tourist season, tour groups chock full of ah mas and aunties descend upon the most popular sites across East Asia, each donning sweaters in the most garish of neon shades, and with none of their outfits complete without a wide-brimmed sun hat and hawkish leopard-print-framed sunglasses.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 阿明 poj: a-mêng from min nan (poj) 阿明 a-mêng common given name
Words.Definition: Ah Meng (c. June 1960 – 8 February 2008), a female Sumatran orangutan (Pongo abelii) who became a cultural icon and ambassador of the Singapore Zoo
Words.Example: Ah Meng had it pretty good her whole life. She was probably the most pampered orang-utan in the whole world. Ah Meng was also an ambassador for her wild counterparts. She lived in captivity and met humans, showing them how lovely and adorable orang-utans are.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿姆 poj: a-ḿ from hokkien (poj) 阿姆 a-ḿ elderly woman; honorific term of address for a woman slightly older than one's mother; father's elder brother's wife
Words.Definition: one's father's elder brother's wife

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 阿 peng'im: a1 + Teochew: 雅 peng'im: ngia2 from min nan (peng'im) 阿 a1 dimin. or endearing prefix + teochew (peng'im) 雅 ngia2 pretty; beautiful
Words.Definition: a young and beautiful girl or woman

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 阿爸 pinyin: ā bà from general chinese (pinyin) 阿爸 ā bà dad; daddy; papa
Words.Definition: father; term of address for one's father

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿伯 poj: a-peh from hokkien (poj) 阿伯 a-peh father's elder brother; old man
Words.Definition: one's father's elder brother

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿伯 poj: a-peh + English: ice cream from hokkien (poj) 阿伯 a-peh father's elder brother; old man + english ice cream sweet frozen dairy dessert
Words.Definition: (endearing) alternative term for potong ice cream, especially when sold by an itinerant hawker
Words.Example: So this comes with two scoops of raspberry ripple ice cream, which actually isn't what you see sold at those Ah Pek ice cream pushcarts. The traditional version with the thick slab of ice cream sandwiched is coming up next.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿兵哥 poj: a-peng-ko͘ from hokkien (poj) 阿兵哥 a-peng-ko͘ soldier boy ← hokkien (poj) 阿 a endearing prefix + hokkien (poj) 兵 peng soldier + hokkien (poj) 哥 ko͘ older brother
Words.Definition: a soldier boy; a National Serviceman (especially in the SAF)
Words.Example: Cannot let enemies know of our ah peng kor infection rate lah ... If many of our ah peng kors stay home for recovery then enemies attack us how?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿肥 poj: a-pûi from hokkien (poj) 阿肥 a-pûi fatty; fatso ← min nan (poj) 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + hokkien (poj) 肥 pûi fat; obese
Words.Definition: fatty; a fat person. Can be derogatory, neutral, or endearing.
Words.Example: The Pokemon Go aunties have endearingly nicknamed Snorlax 'Ah Pui', the Hokkien term for a 'fatty', for its striking similarity to an out-of-shape ah pek.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿成 poj: a-sêng from hokkien (poj) 阿成 a-sêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young Chinese man, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike. The male counterpart of an Ah Lian or Ah Huay.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hinghua: 阿舍 poj: ā-sià from min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿舍 ā-sià rich kid who spends money freely; playboy; prodigal son ← min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿 ā dimin. or endearing prefix + min nan / hinghua (poj) 舍人 sià-jîn children of aristocrats or nobles
Words.Definition: (pejorative) the son of rich parents who spends money freely and extravagantly, living a life or pleasure and leisure without financial worries or responsibilities; a playboy; someone born with a silver spoon in their mouth

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hinghua: 阿舍母 poj: ā-sià-bú from min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿舍母 ā-sià-bú rich kid who spends money freely; playboy; prodigal son ← min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿 ā dimin. or endearing prefix + min nan / hinghua (poj) 舍人 sià-jîn children of aristocrats or nobles + min nan / hinghua (poj) 母 bú woman; female
Words.Definition: (pejorative) the daughter of rich parents who spends money freely and extravagantly, living a life or pleasure and leisure without financial worries or responsibilities; a playgirl; a woman born with a silver spoon in her mouth
Words.Example: golden spoon ah sia bu, without the rich lao peh she will just be a nasi padang stall assistant

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hinghua: 阿舍囝 poj: ā-sià-kiáⁿ from min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿舍囝 ā-sià-kiáⁿ rich kid who spends money freely; playboy; prodigal son ← min nan / hinghua (poj) 阿 ā dimin. or endearing prefix + min nan / hinghua (poj) 舍人 sià-jîn children of aristocrats or nobles + min nan / hinghua (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ child; kid; son
Words.Definition: (pejorative) the son of rich parents who spends money freely and extravagantly, living a life or pleasure and leisure without financial worries or responsibilities; a playboy; someone born with a silver spoon in their mouth
Words.Example: And it is up to us and for us now to prove that we can protect the nest egg and that Singaporeans are capable of being prudent and responsible, well beyond the founding generation. We are not ah sia kia. We are responsible. We are also forefathers one day of generations yet to be born.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿嫂 poj: a-só from hokkien (poj) 阿嫂 a-só elder brother's wife (sister-in-law)
Words.Definition: one's elder brother's wife (sister-in-law)
Words.Example: After the British soldiers left Singapore, she worked as a coffee lady (kopi ah soh) in offices, making drinks and carrying out cleaning chores.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: ah + then from singlish ah interjection; particle (see main article for details) ← general chinese (pinyin) 啊 a interjection; particle + singlish then interjection used to ask for elaboration on something said, or point out the obviousness of a statement; usually in a rhetorical or sometimes impolite manner. ← english then next to occur; afterwards; besides that
Words.Definition: so what?; so?; duh; OK, and?; no shit. A sarcastic or rhetorical rebuttal to an obvious or stupid statement, often dismissive and impolite.
Words.Example: - I heard that if you want to lose weight, you should eat less. - Ah then?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿中 阿中 poj: a-tiong from hokkien (poj) 阿中 阿中 a-tiong (derogatory or endearing) a person from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + general chinese (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China
Words.Definition: (derogatory slur or endearing) a person from mainland China

Words.Word: ah tiong bu 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿中 阿中 poj: a-tiong + 母 poj: bú from hokkien (poj) 阿中 阿中 a-tiong (derogatory or endearing) a person from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + general chinese (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China + hokkien (poj) 母 bú mother; female
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a woman or girl from mainland China
Words.Example: Why Bugis turned into Ah Tiong bu town? Just now went there... so many china girls with beijing accent. I thought i'm in china

Words.Word: ah tiong bu de cheese pie jin ho jiak 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 阿中 阿中 poj: a-tiong + 母 poj: bú + Mandarin: 的 pinyin: de + Singlish: cheese pie + Hokkien: 真 poj: chin + Min nan: 好食 poj: hó-chia̍h from hokkien (poj) 阿中 阿中 a-tiong (derogatory or endearing) a person from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + general chinese (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China + hokkien (poj) 母 bú mother; female + mandarin (pinyin) 的 de 's; possessive particle + singlish cheese pie (euph.) cunt; vagina; vulva ← hokkien (poj) 膣屄 chi-bai (vg., offensive) cunt; vagina; vulva + english cheese pie pie filled with cheese ← english cheese food made from curdling or fermenting milk ← latin cāseus cheese + english pie pastry with a crust and filling + hokkien (poj) 真 chin really; truly; very + min nan (poj) 好食 hó-chia̍h delicious; tasty; yummy
Words.Definition: (vulgar) mainland Chinese women's vaginas are really tasty
Words.Example: I know of one common claim, but I cannot substantiate personally.Ah tiong bu de cheesepie jin ho jiak.

Words.Word: Ah Tong Ah Seng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 阿东 阿東 jyutping: aa3 dung1 (?) + 阿成 jyutping: aa3 seng4 from cantonese (jyutping) 阿东 阿東 aa3 dung1 (?) a common male given name + cantonese (jyutping) 阿成 aa3 seng4 a stereotypically common male given name; an uncouth, unrefined young man.
Words.Definition: any old body; placeholder names for unspecified ordinary people; Tom, Dick, and Harry
Words.Example: In the age of the Internet, every Ah Tong Ah Seng can become a leading expert in any field of knowledge overnight - or so most of them believe, at least.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 爱 愛 poj: ài from min nan (poj) 爱 愛 ài want; need to; must, love
Words.Definition: to want

Words.Word: ai beng buay beng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱 愛 poj: ài + 明 poj: bêng + 𫧃/袂 𣍐/袂 poj: bōe/bē + 明 poj: bêng from hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want; need to; must, love + hokkien (poj) 明 bêng Ah Beng; stereotypically common male given name + hokkien (poj) 𫧃/袂 𣍐/袂 bōe/bē cannot; not; won't ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not + hokkien (poj) 会 會 ē can; able to; will + hokkien (poj) 明 bêng Ah Beng; stereotypically common male given name
Words.Definition: to be a wannabe gangster; describing someone behaving like or pretending (often exaggeratedly) to be an Ah Beng, which is obviously feigned or a front, and comes across as unnecessary, attention-seeking, and annoying

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱面 愛面 poj: ài-bīn from hokkien (poj) 爱面 愛面 ài-bīn sensitive abt. one's appearance, reputation, etc. ← hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài love; want + hokkien (poj) 面 面 bīn face; reputation
Words.Definition: enjoying fame or attention; wanting to be in the limelight
Words.Example: This trip, mum also said a few times that I was someone who “ai-bin,” literally, someone who “desires face.” It means that I was someone who hungers for fame and for the limelight.

Words.Word: ai kia stead mai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 爱莫 愛莫 poj: ài-mài + Hokkien: 行 poj: kiâⁿ + Singlish: stead from min nan (poj) 爱莫 愛莫 ài-mài (interrog.) (do you) want or not want (sth.)? ← min nan (poj) 爱 愛 ài want + min nan (poj) 莫 莫 mài contraction of 毋愛 ← min nan (poj) 毋爱 毋愛 m̄-ài not want + hokkien (poj) 行 kiâⁿ walk + singlish stead go steady ← english go steady (inf; dated) date someone exclusively
Words.Definition: (dating) do you want to go steady (or not)?
Words.Example: During recess, he mustered up the courage to ask her, "Ai kia stead mai?"

Words.Word: ai lian buay lian 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱 愛 poj: ài + 莲 蓮 poj: liân + 𫧃/袂 𣍐/袂 poj: bōe/bē + 莲 蓮 poj: liân from hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want; need to; must, love + hokkien (poj) 莲 蓮 liân Ah Lian; stereotypically common female given name + hokkien (poj) 𫧃/袂 𣍐/袂 bōe/bē cannot; not; won't ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not + hokkien (poj) 会 會 ē can; able to; will + hokkien (poj) 莲 蓮 liân Ah Lian; stereotypically common female given name
Words.Definition: describing someone behaving like or pretending (often exaggeratedly) to be an Ah Lian, which is obviously feigned or a front, and comes across as unnecessary, attention-seeking, and annoying

Words.Word: ai mian zi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 爱面 愛面 pinyin: ài miàn zi from mandarin (pinyin) 爱面 愛面 ài miàn zi sensitive abt. one's appearance, reputation, etc. ← mandarin (pinyin) 爱 愛 ài love + mandarin (pinyin) 面 面 miàn zi face; reputation
Words.Definition: sensitive about one's reputation, public image, etc.; afraid of losing face
Words.Example: Hahaha.. no wonder la.. Best friend then hard.. Some guys ai mian zi.. cannot lose face in front of their friends..

Words.Word: ai pee ai chee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 爱便爱鲜 愛便愛鮮 peng'im: ain3 pin1 ain3 cin1 from teochew (peng'im) 爱便爱鲜 愛便愛鮮 ain3 pin1 ain3 cin1 want cheap, want fresh ← teochew (peng'im) 爱 愛 ain3 want + teochew (peng'im) 便 便 pin1 cheap; inexpensive + teochew (peng'im) 爱 愛 ain3 want + teochew (peng'im) 鲜 鮮 cin1 fresh; new; special; brightly coloured
Words.Definition: (lit.) want cheap, want fresh/pretty. Describing a person who always demands the best of both worlds; someone who has unrealistic expectations; someone hard to please.
Words.Example: The food critic was notorious for being ai pi ai chee, rarely giving out positive reviews to the hawker stalls she visited.
Related: ai pee ai chee ai tua liap nee

Words.Word: ai pee ai chee ai tua liap nee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 爱便爱鲜 愛便愛鮮 peng'im: ain3 pin1 ain3 cin1 + 爱 愛 peng'im: ain3 + 大粒 peng'im: dua7 liab8 + 奶 peng'im: ni6 / ni1 from teochew (peng'im) 爱便爱鲜 愛便愛鮮 ain3 pin1 ain3 cin1 want cheap, want fresh ← teochew (peng'im) 爱 愛 ain3 want + teochew (peng'im) 便 便 pin1 cheap; inexpensive + teochew (peng'im) 爱 愛 ain3 want + teochew (peng'im) 鲜 鮮 cin1 fresh; new; special; brightly coloured + teochew (peng'im) 爱 愛 ain3 want + teochew (peng'im) 大粒 dua7 liab8 (esp. of round objects, grains, or pieces) large; big + teochew (peng'im) 奶 ni6 / ni1 breasts
Words.Definition: (lit.) want cheap, want fresh/pretty, want big breasts. Describing a person who always demands the best of both worlds; someone who has unrealistic expectations; someone hard to please.
Words.Example: Singaporeans want to live in a garden city, close to nature; but when birds come to visit their estates, they complain noisy lah, pangsai everywhere lah, unsightly lah, why gahmen never come cull them and clear their breeding habitats. Ai pi ai chee ai dua liap ni.

Words.Word: ai piak piak mai 简 繁

(do you) want or not want (sth.)? ← hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want + hokkien (poj) 莫 莫 mài contraction of 毋愛 ← hokkien (poj) 毋爱 毋愛 m̄-ài not want + singlish piak piak (onom.) hit; slap; have sex ← hokkien (poj) 拍 phiak hit; slap; clap; whack, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap or hokkien (poj) 擗 phia̍k/pia̍k hit, (onom.) sound of a hit; sound of a flap or flutter
Words.Definition: 'do you want to have sex?'; used to propose an offer of sexual intercourse to someone
Words.Example: My father got GCB and I'm the only child, ai piak piak mai?

Words.Word: ai sio kan mai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱莫 愛莫 poj: ài-mài + 相奸 相姦 poj: sio-kàn from hokkien (poj) 爱莫 愛莫 ài-mài (interrog.) Words.Word: ai stead mai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱莫 愛莫 poj: ài-m̄-ài + Singlish: stead from hokkien (poj) 爱莫 愛莫 ài-m̄-ài (interrogative) (do you) want or not want (sth.)?; 愛 + contraction of 毋愛 ← hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want + hokkien (poj) 毋爱 毋愛 m̄-ài not want + singlish stead ← english go steady (inf; dated) date someone exclusively

Words.Word: ai sui mai mia 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爱媠莫命 愛媠莫命 poj: ài-súi-mài-miā from hokkien (poj) 爱媠莫命 愛媠莫命 ài-súi-mài-miā love/want beauty, don't want life ← hokkien (poj) 爱媠 愛媠 ài-súi beauty-conscious; vain (lit: love beauty) + hokkien (poj) 莫 莫 mài contraction of 毋愛 + hokkien (poj) 命 命 miā life

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 爱莫 愛莫 poj: ài-mài from min nan (poj) 爱莫 愛莫 ài-mài (interrog.) (do you) want or not want (sth.)? ← min nan (poj) 爱 愛 ài want + min nan (poj) 莫 莫 mài contraction of 毋愛 ← min nan (poj) 毋爱 毋愛 m̄-ài not want

Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + hokkien (poj) 大支 大支 tōa-ki big stick ← hokkien (poj) 大 大 tōa big; large + hokkien (poj) 支 支 ki stick; measure word or classifier for long, thin objects

Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + hokkien (poj) 大粒 大粒 tōa-lia̍p (esp. of round objects, grains, or pieces) large; big

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: a-mo-橄榄 a-mo-橄欖 poj: a-mo-kaⁿ-ná from hokkien (poj) a-mo-橄榄 a-mo-橄欖 a-mo-kaⁿ-ná fruit of the tree Spondias dulcis ← malay Likely, but other possible etymologies exist ambra fruit of the tree Spondias dulcis ← sinhala ඇඹරැල්ලා æᵐḅarællā fruit of the tree Spondias dulcis + hokkien (poj) 橄榄 橄欖 kaⁿ-ná Chinese olive (Canarium album); olive (Olea europaea)
Words.Definition: the edible fruit of Spondias dulcis, a tree native to Southeast Asia and the Pacific region. The fruits are egg-shaped and around 6 - 9 cm in length, and come in bunches of a dozen or more on a single stalk. They are good source of vitamins A, B, and C. They may be eaten raw, but are also commonly processed by pressing into a juice. The tree's leaves are sometimes used culinarily to impart a sour taste to dishes.[1][2][3]

Words.English Translation: → English: epaulette from english epaulette (mil.) patch worn on the shoulder, usually to indicate rank ← french épaulette epaulette ← french épaule shoulder + french -ette (f.) dimin. suffix
