Words.Definition: what's the matter; what's up
Words.Example: An zua? Eh don't call lim peh again, understand? Bloody scam callers, I tell you!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: anak dara tua from malay anak dara tua spinster; old maid; older unmarried woman ← malay anak dara virgin; maiden ← malay anak child + malay dara virgin; maiden + malay tua old
Words.Definition: (derogatory) an older, unmarried (especially Malay) woman; a spinster; an old maid
Words.Example: Single, unmarried women wishing to pursue a PhD or focus on their career development are commonly dissuaded on the basis that by the time they obtain that doctorate or career success, they will be labelled an “anak dara tua”. This term carries the stigma of an old maid, with few prospective partners. Additionally, her “overqualification” brings about the concern of intimidating potential suitors.

Words.Word: ang bak jio 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红肉蕉 紅肉蕉 poj: âng-bah-chio from hokkien (poj) 红肉蕉 紅肉蕉 âng-bah-chio breed of banana ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 肉 肉 bah flesh; meat + hokkien (poj) 蕉 蕉 chio banana
Words.Definition: a breed of banana with a slightly tangy and less sweet taste than other breeds, making it a popular breed for cooking or frying. It has thick skin and slightly dry, yellowish-white flesh..
Words.Example: When ripe, these bananas have a slightly sweet flavour with notes of pineapple, strawberry and apple. Ang Bak Jio develop from pale yellow to golden yellow and finally to almost black when ripe. The black-brown lines are a result of the flesh becoming sweet and are not a sign of spoilage. When unripe, the cream-coloured flesh under the skin is astringent, sour, and unripe. As it ripens, it becomes softer and thicker and acquires a creamy consistency ...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红车 紅車 poj: âng-chhia from hokkien (poj) 红车 紅車 âng-chhia red car or vehicle ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 车 車 chhia car; land vehicle
Words.Definition: an iconic anti-riot vehicle of the Police Tactical Unit (PTU), a special anti-riot and crowd control unit of the Singapore Police Force
Words.Example: This big red bus, also known as the “Ang Chia”, was once one of the most recognisable police vehicles.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红牙 紅牙 poj: âng-gê from hokkien (poj) 红牙 紅牙 âng-gê ruddy; flushed; with healthy red cheeks ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 牙 牙 gê tooth; teeth
Words.Definition: ruddy; flushed; having healthy red cheeks
Words.Example: I prefer last year's Mickey's face (top picture). Last year was colder but he was more ang geh~

Words.Word: Ang Ji Kau 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 红舌狗 紅舌狗 poj: âng-chi̍h-káu from min nan (poj) 红舌狗 紅舌狗 âng-chi̍h-káu red-tongued wolf logo of Blood Wolfe, Guinness' 19th century Singapore distributor ← min nan (poj) 红 紅 âng red + min nan (poj) 舌 chi̍h tongue + min nan (poj) 狗 káu dog
Words.Definition: (metonym) Guinness stout
Words.Example: Local stout, whether Baron’s, ABC, or Guinness, is, despite marketers’ efforts, a drink for old uncles and exhausted labourers, something sold in huge bottles under fluorescent lights and drunk around plastic tables, something with enough malt and barley to compensate poor diets and sufficient alcohol to make difficult lives seem more pleasant… Ang jikao is not for ang mohs.

Words.Word: ang kha hae 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红跤虾 紅跤蝦 poj: âng-kha-hê from hokkien (poj) 红跤虾 紅跤蝦 âng-kha-hê F. indicus or F. merguiensis, two closely related marine prawns ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 跤 跤 kha leg + hokkien (poj) 虾 蝦 hê prawn; shrimp
Words.Definition: Fenneropenaeus indicus (or sometimes its less common relative F. merguiensis), both also known variously as the white prawn, sea white prawn, red leg banana prawn, banana prawn, Indian prawn, etc., a marine prawn species commonly eaten throughout maritime regions in Asia. Contrary to its name, it does not always have red legs.
Words.Example: Ang Kar prawns are one of the most abundant wild sea prawns which you can find at the wet markets. That is why it is the most common prawn that is used by jumbo Prawn Mee places. The shell is thin and the tail is very meaty, so you do get a good amount of prawn meat per kilo.

Words.Word: ang ki ki 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红支支 紅支支 poj: âng-ki-ki from hokkien (poj) 红支支 紅支支 âng-ki-ki very red ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 支支 ki (ideophonic)
Words.Definition: (ideophonic) very red; as red as can be
Words.Example: Our favourite here is the Chinese Heritage Centre rabbit - we simply love the detailed and ang ang kee kee Chinese traditional costume. Super huat!

Words.Word: ang ko li 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 红哥鲤 紅哥鯉 peng'im: ang5 go1 li2 from teochew (peng'im) 红哥鲤 紅哥鯉 ang5 go1 li2 Nemipterus virgatus (golden threadfin bream) ← teochew (peng'im) 红 紅 ang5 red + teochew (peng'im) 哥 哥 go1 elder brother + teochew (peng'im) 鲤 鯉 li2 carp
Words.Definition: Nemipterus virgatus, commonly known as the golden threadfin bream. The most common fish of choice for making fish head curry, among other popular dishes.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 尪公 poj: ang-kong from hokkien (poj) 尪公 ang-kong idol; deity, portrait; drawing, tattoo ← hokkien (poj) 尪 ang puppet; doll + hokkien (poj) 公 kong honorific male Chinese title; grandfather; elder
Words.Definition: a tattoo; a drawing made in the skin with a sharp needle and ink or some pigment
Words.Example: One Hakka spirit medium claimed that angkong was a Penang word; a temple committee member described it as 'colloquial,' and claimed that the term sin (shen) was more standard.

Words.Word: ang kong kong 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红绛绛 紅絳絳 poj: âng-kòng-kòng from hokkien (poj) 红绛绛 紅絳絳 âng-kòng-kòng very red; crimson ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 绛 絳 kòng crimson
Words.Definition: (ideophonic) very red; as red as can be
Words.Example: wear until ang kong kong = more huat 🤑

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 尪公 poj: ang-kong + 痟 poj: siáu from hokkien (poj) 尪公 ang-kong idol; deity, portrait; drawing, tattoo ← hokkien (poj) 尪 ang puppet; doll + hokkien (poj) 公 kong honorific male Chinese title; grandfather; elder + hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy
Words.Definition: (derogatory) loving and/or having a lot of tattoos; tattoo-crazy
Words.Example: To Ms Jamie Leo, who got her first tattoo of a plant at 20, her body is a canvas and a "sticker book" for tattoo ink ... However, Ms Leo's parents were at first unimpressed by her tattoos, calling her "ang kong siao".

Words.Word: ang ku kueh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红龟粿 紅龜粿 poj: âng-ku-kóe from hokkien (poj) 红龟粿 紅龜粿 âng-ku-kóe red tortoise kueh ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red ← hokkien (poj) 龟 龜 ku tortoise ← hokkien (poj) 粿 粿 kóe kueh
Words.Definition: a small oval-shaped dumpling, consisting of a sweet filling such as green bean paste, ground peanuts, and sugar, wrapped in a (typically red-coloured) skin made of glutinous rice flour. The dumpling is pressed into a form resembling a tortoise shell, and has a sticky, chewy texture.As eating tortoises was associated with longevity in Chinese culture, it is traditionally eaten to celebrate special occasions such as birthdays or the first month of a newborn baby.

Words.Word: Ang Mo Kio1 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + 桥 橋 poj: kiô from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) + hokkien (poj) 桥 橋 kiô bridge
Words.Definition: a planning area and residential town to the north of central Singapore, first redeveloped by the HDB in 1973[1]
Words.Example: The name Ang Mo Kio in Hokkien literally translates to “red-haired man’s bridge”, where ang mo is a colloquial term for a Caucasian person.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; Western; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair
Words.Definition: a Caucasian person; white person; person of Western descent
Words.Example: "Ang moh" is still used today with an implicit sense of the cultural power ang mohs wield in postcolonial Singapore, whether we admit it anot.

Words.Word: ang moh chu 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛厝 紅毛厝 poj: âng-mô͘-chhù from hokkien (poj) 红毛厝 紅毛厝 âng-mô͘-chhù Western-style building; (lit.) white man's / Caucasian house
Words.Definition: a Western-style building, especially from the colonial era, such as a bungalow or a black-and-white house.
Words.Example: These black and white Anglo-Indian bungalows (which come from the term Bangala or Bengali for from Bengal) or “Ang-Moh Chu” (White Man’s House) are designed in the “revival architectural style”.It’s not just a residential estate. As you would expect the British, when they stayed there had a town centre, with some bistros and convenience stalls. The Village Square still serves this purpose today.

Words.Word: ang moh kau 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + 猴 poj: kâu from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; Western; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + hokkien (poj) 猴 kâu monkey; ape
Words.Definition: (derogatory, racist) a Caucasian person; white person; person of Western descent
Words.Example: this is assualting a civil servant...trespassing into private property, intrusion.....if the story is true, then i think this ang moh gao must be expelled from our country ... but then why the army boy don't apprehend the ang moh gao? he supposed to protect his homeland when there's any foreign intrusion

Words.Word: ang moh kong kuan 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + Likely, but other possible etymologies exist Min nan: 公馆 公館 poj: kong-koán from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; Western ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + min nan (poj) Likely, but other possible etymologies exist 公馆 公館 kong-koán public hall; Chinese club or association ← min nan (poj) 公 kong grand; great + min nan (poj) 馆 館 koán building; office
Words.Definition: a Western-style marching band or jazz band
Words.Example: The Chinese associations funeral bands were called 'kong kuan' and the jazz bands were 'ang moh kong kuan'. The kong kuan would pay their respects positioned infront of the coffin at the wake just before the funeral proceeds.

Words.Word: ang moh kui 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + 鬼 poj: kúi from min nan (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ (lit.) red hair; (fig.) Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) + min nan (poj) 鬼 kúi ghost; demon; devil
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a Caucasian person; white person; person of Western descent

Words.Word: ang moh lang 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + Min nan: 侬 儂 poj: lâng from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; Western; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + min nan (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person; people; human being
Words.Definition: a Caucasian person; a white person; a person of Western descent

Words.Word: ang moh liu lian 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛榴莲 紅毛榴蓮 poj: âng-mô͘ liû-liân from hokkien (poj) 红毛榴莲 紅毛榴蓮 âng-mô͘ liû-liân soursop ← hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Western; Caucasian + hokkien (poj) 榴莲 榴蓮 liû-liân durian
Words.Definition: soursop (fruit of the Annona muricata tree)

Words.Word: ang moh lor kor 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + Hokkien / teochew: 锣鼓 鑼鼓 poj: lô-kó͘ from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ Caucasian; white person; Western ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + hokkien / teochew (poj) 锣鼓 鑼鼓 lô-kó͘ percussion band; percussion instruments ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 锣 鑼 lô gong + hokkien / teochew (poj) 鼓 鼓 kó͘ drum
Words.Definition: a Western-style marching band or jazz band
Words.Example: My vocation also siong. Have to play angmo lor kor when there's death involving military personnel. Simi NDP, SAF Parade, Officer Parade...knn. The only thing good is 8 - 4 hours job.

Words.Word: ang moh pai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + 派 poj: phài from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ (lit.) red hair; (fig.) Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) + hokkien (poj) 派 phài sect; faction; manner or style
Words.Definition: (pejorative) a Chinese Singaporean, or the set of Chinese Singaporeans in general, who speak English well but have poor skills in Chinese languages, and/or who are only in touch with Western culture and behave too "Western".
Words.Example: So we look Singaporean but we 讲话怪怪 From the bottom to the top, Ang Moh Pai... Uh, they say we wanna be American Talk and dress like black dudes when we are Singaporean

Words.Word: ang moh tua kee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + 大支 poj: tōa-ki from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ (lit.) red hair; (fig.) Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + hokkien (poj) 大支 tōa-ki big stick ← hokkien (poj) 大 tōa big; large + hokkien (poj) 支 ki stick; measure word or classifier for long, thin objects
Words.Definition: (derogatory, pejorative) an expression used to highlight or point out the perceived superiority, arrogance, and privileged treatment of white (ang moh) men in Singapore
Words.Example: All our enrolments were made possiblt, simply because my father worked as a cook for the School Principal of RGS. She was an Englishwoman, married to and Englishman, and the English were our Colonial Masters. It was a case of 'Ang-Moh-tua-kee' at that time.

Words.Word: ang moh tua liap 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红毛 紅毛 poj: âng-mô͘ + Min nan: 大粒 poj: tōa-lia̍p from hokkien (poj) 红毛 紅毛 âng-mô͘ (lit.) red hair; (fig.) Caucasian; white person; person of Western descent; English (people, culture, and language) ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 毛 毛 mô͘ hair + min nan (poj) 大粒 tōa-lia̍p (esp. of round objects, grains, or pieces) large; big
Words.Definition: (derogatory, pejorative) an expression used to highlight or point out the perceived superiority, arrogance, and privileged treatment of white (ang moh) women in Singapore
Words.Example: Those ang mo dua liap will be treated like goddesses here....
Related: ai pee ai chee ai tua liap ni

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红牌 紅牌 poj: âng-pâi from hokkien (poj) 红牌 紅牌 âng-pâi red card; red badge ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 牌 牌 pâi card; plate; badge
Words.Definition: (idiom) very important; famous; significant
Words.Example: Perhaps no member of the Phantom Squad is as well known in the Force as Ponnaya Ganesan, or P. Ganesan as he is known, who shared how he was trained to be a pie kia ang pai (Hokkien for gangster undercover cop) ... We could not just arrest and charge them. You had to do the actual combat with them, go and fight them and disperse them. We formed the pie kia ang pais.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 红包 紅包 poj: âng-pau from hokkien (poj) 红包 紅包 âng-pau red packets ← hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red + hokkien (poj) 包 pau packet; package
Words.Definition: red packet; a (usually red, or some other auspicious colour such as gold) envelope containing money, given as a gift during occasions such as birthdays, weddings, and especially at Chinese New Year.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: angan-angan from malay angan-angan daydreams; wishful thinking; hallucinations ⇇ malay angan daydream; wishful thinking; hallucination
Words.Definition: daydreams; wishful thinking; hallucinations
Words.Example: We’re hoping for something that is beyond just colour themes but this is angan angan aje for now. It will still depend on whether our decorators boleh execute what we have in mind.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: angkat from malay angkat carry; lift; raise
Words.Definition: to curry favour; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone, or get into their good books.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: angkat + bodek from malay angkat carry; lift; raise + malay bodek (vg.) scrotum; male genitalia
Words.Definition: (vulgar, idiom) to suck up to someone; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone; to bootlick; to brownnose
Words.Example: Very good observation and if you notice there are no oustanding officers who would become S1s or S4s but usually the angkat bodek arrow king type.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: angkat + bola from malay angkat carry; lift; raise + malay bola ball ← portuguese bola ball; sphere ← old occitan bola ball; sphere ← latin bulla bubble; bubble-shaped object
Words.Definition: to curry favour; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone, or get into their good books.
Words.Example: She's always trying to angkat bola the manager, hoping for a promotion.

Words.English Translation: → English: angry from english angry feeling strong displeasure or hostility ← old norse angr distress; sorrow
Words.Definition: angry; upset; furious
Words.Example: I don’t know who needs this but if you are having a bad day, here’s an angwee kitty to cheer you up!!

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: அஞ்செடி añceṭi from tamil அஞ்செடி añceṭi (derog.) young, delinquent Tamil woman ← tamil Likely, but other possible etymologies exist ஐந்தடி aintaṭi five-foot ← tamil ஐந்து aintu five + tamil அடி aṭi foot ↻ english five-foot [way] continuous ground-floor walkway featuring a overhanging second storey, common in British colonial architecture
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young, delinquent Tamil (or other South Indian) woman, often associated with negative stereotypes such as smoking, excessive drinking, truancy, gansterism, going clubbing, and peppering their speech with Tamil vulgarities. The archetypal Anjedi has a certain style of dress such as having multiple tattoos and piercings, dyed hair, false eyelashes, a football jersey (often Manchester United), and sunglasses (though often not actually worn over the eyes), and listens to Kuthu music (Tamil: குத்து, a type of fast-paced, percussion-heavy Tamil folk pop).
Words.Example: Ah lians ah bengs of the chinese society... mats and minahs of the malay society and Anjedi's of the indian society ... These r people that are nonsensical n the pariahs we dun need.

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Tamil: அஞ்சாக் añcāk from tamil Possible, but not certain அஞ்சாக் añcāk (derog.) young, delinquent Tamil man ← tamil அஞ்செடி añceṭi (derog.) young, delinquent Tamil woman ← tamil Likely, but other possible etymologies exist ஐந்தடி aintaṭi five-foot ← tamil ஐந்து aintu five + tamil அடி aṭi foot ↻ english five-foot [way] continuous ground-floor walkway featuring a overhanging second storey, common in British colonial architecture + tamil Possible, but not certain குப்பை kuppai rubbish; junk; trash
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young, delinquent Tamil (or other South Indian) man, often associated with negative stereotypes such as smoking, excessive drinking, truancy, gansterism, going clubbing, and peppering their speech with Tamil vulgarities. The archetypal Anjek has a certain style of dress such as having multiple tattoos and piercings, dyed hair, a rattail hairstyle, a football jersey (often Manchester United), and sunglasses (though often not actually worn over the eyes), and listens to Kuthu music (Tamil: குத்து, a type of fast-paced, percussion-heavy Tamil folk pop).
Words.Example: - "but you don't look anjek"- oh im sorry lemme just-smoke smoke 💨 ... enna pakkure (என்னா பாக்குற) ah??? ... poda dei

Words.English Translation: → Malay: anjing from malay anjing dog
Words.Definition: dog
Words.Example: Why the double standard ? Babi cannot but anjing can ?

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: அண்ணன் aṇṇaṉ + அண்ணா aṇṇā from tamil அண்ணன் aṇṇaṉ elder brother + tamil அண்ணா aṇṇā elder brother
Words.Definition: elder brother; term of address for an elder brother

Words.English Translation: → Japanese: あのね ano ne from japanese あのね ano ne feminine or childish intj. or filler word; 'hey...', 'well...'
Words.Definition: a cutesy, childish, and innocent girl or young woman
Words.Example: Ah girl, you already 30 over years old. Dun act so anone lah...

Words.English Translation: → English: or not from english or not optionally used at the end of a yes/no question to emphasize the negated option ← english or conjunction presenting two options; else + english not adverb used to negate sth.
Words.Definition: (interrogative) used at the end of a statement to turn it into a yes/no question
Words.Example: She got ask. → She got ask anot?

Words.English Translation: → English: any old how from english any old how in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english old intensifier + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc.
Words.Definition: in any way or manner whatsoever; in a random fashion
Words.Example: Hello don't any old how translate his words into negative. Those kaisu people who hoard Maggie noodles and toilet paper should be ashamed of yourself

Words.English Translation: → English: anyhow from english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc.
Words.Definition: in any way or manner whatsoever; in a random fashion
Words.Example: You don't go anyhow say people hor.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anyhow + Malay: cakap from singlish anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc. + malay cakap talk; speak
Words.Definition: to talk nonsense; to spout rubbish
Words.Example: Eh anyhow cakap cock! Apa lah sial.
Related: ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anyhow + Malay: hentam from singlish anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc. + malay hentam hit; beat; do sth. flagrantly with no regard for consequences
Words.Definition: to do randomly, improperly, sloppily, spontaneously, or unsystematically, without necessarily having the requisite knowledge, planning, or skills
Words.Example: Ur PM name also u don't remember. All anyhow hentam only. From cotton came from sheep, East Coast Plan (we have a together) to this. *Slap Forehead*

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anyhow + Malay: rembat from singlish anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc. + malay rembat hit; whack; whip (horizontally)
Words.Definition: to do randomly, improperly, sloppily, spontaneously, or unsystematically, without necessarily having the requisite knowledge, planning, or skills
Words.Example: Wah this guy.. who say i never contribute? Use your head before assuming bro, anyhow rembat only ... No link la dei, you talk also like your gov. Bloody brainwashed already.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anyhow + whack from singlish anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc. + singlish whack do without necessarily having the requisite knowledge or skills ← english whack hit; beat; smack ↻ hokkien (poj) 拍 phah (lit.) hit; (generally) do or perform an action; used to verbify a noun & hokkien (poj) 拂 hut act recklessly; disregard everything; do without care for the consequences & hokkien (poj) 刜 hut/phut strike forcefully; hit; do recklessly without care for the consequences & malay gasak hit; beat; whack & malay hentam hit; beat; do sth. flagrantly with no regard for consequences
Words.Definition: to tackle a task randomly, improperly, spontaneously, or unsystematically, without necessarily having the requisite knowledge, planning, or skills to do so
Words.Example: Instead of following the recipe, she decided to just anyhow whack and see what happened.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anyhow + English: -ly from singlish anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english anyhow in any way or manner whatsoever ← english any at all; some + english how what way, degree, manner, extent, etc. + english -ly suffix to form an adverb from an adjective or noun
Words.Definition: in an anyhow manner; using any way or manner whatsoever; in a random fashion

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa from malay apa what
Words.Definition: what; which

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa ini from malay apa ini 'what is this?' ← malay apa what + malay ini this
Words.Definition: 'what is this?'; expression of disbelief, confusion, request for clarification, etc.
Words.Example: Apa ini? How come my EZ-Link card so fast out of money already?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa + Hokkien: 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 poj: lān-chiáu from malay apa what + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu penis
Words.Definition: (interrogative, vulgar) what the hell; what the shit
Words.Example: The “apa lanjiaooo” guy became a meme in 2016 after arguing with an apartment complex security. He now pleads netizens to stop using the meme.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa + tengok-tengok from malay apa what + malay tengok-tengok look at; take a look ⇇ malay tengok see; look
Words.Definition: what are you looking at; what are you staring for
Words.Example: Husky to uncle: apa tengok-tengok? Never see lion cut is it

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apam + balik from malay apam appam ← tamil ஆப்பம் āppam appam; palappam; hopper (thin pancake made from fermented rice batter and coconut milk) + malay balik turn; reverse; turn around
Words.Definition: Malay name for min chiang kueh, a type of sweet pancake with peanut filling. Also known as martabak manis in Indonesia.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apam + manja from malay apam appam ← tamil ஆப்பம் āppam appam; palappam; hopper (thin pancake made from fermented rice batter and coconut milk) + malay manja spoilt; pampered; gentle
Words.Definition: a very small version of apam balik which can be eaten in one mouthful, often folded in half around a filling of kaya, grated coconut, custard, chocolate, or some other sweet condiment

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: அப்பா appā from tamil அப்பா appā father
Words.Definition: father; term of address for one's father

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: ஆப்பம் āppam from tamil ஆப்பம் āppam appam; palappam; hopper (thin pancake made from fermented rice batter and coconut milk)
Words.Definition: a thin pancake with crispy, paper-thin edges and a soft, bouncy centre, made from fermented rice batter and coconut milk; also known as palappam, and known as hopper in Sri Lanka. Similar to idiyappam or putu mayam.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: anneh + Dubious or unconfirmed (nonce word) from singlish anneh elder brother; (derogatory, racist) an Indian person, especially of Tamil or South Indian descent, or a migrant worker from the Indian subcontinent ← tamil அண்ணன் aṇṇaṉ elder brother & tamil அண்ணா aṇṇā elder brother + singlish Dubious or unconfirmed (nonce word) likely a nonsense word based off racist impressions of the sound of the Tamil language
Words.Definition: (derogatory, racist, offensive) a racist slur for an Indian person, especially of Tamil or South Indian descent, or a migrant worker from the Indian subcontinent.
Words.Example: Even now, you can still hear Chinese grandparents asking their grandkids to behave, if not Apu neh neh will catch. I believe that they don't know how sensitive and hurtful it is.

Words.Definition: to curry favour with; to get into one's good books
Words.Example: So if you ar with the IC... you can jiak zua a bit.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 合 poj: a̍h + 甲 poj: kah + 折 poj: chi̍h from hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h curry favour; get along well with + hokkien (poj) 甲 kah until; to the point of; to the extent that + hokkien (poj) 折 chi̍h snap; bend; twist; break

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 合甲像子 poj: a̍h kah chhiūⁿ chí from hokkien (poj) 合甲像子 a̍h kah chhiūⁿ chí get along well with sb. to the extent of being like testicles ← hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h get along well with + hokkien (poj) 甲 kah until; to the point/extent of + hokkien (poj) 像 chhiūⁿ be like; resemble + hokkien (poj) 子 chí testicle
Words.Definition: (vulgar) like peas in a pod; extremely close with somebody

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 合 poj: a̍h + 甲 poj: kah + 了 poj: liáu from hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h curry favour; get along well with + hokkien (poj) 甲 kah until; to the point of; to the extent that + hokkien (poj) 了 liáu finished; completed; to the end
Words.Definition: to attempt to curry favour until one is in someone's good books; to work hard to become close to somebody
Words.Example: After working together for almost three years, Ajay and Ismail were ar ka liau.

Words.Word: ar lip bo ar chut 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 合 poj: a̍h + 入 poj: ji̍p / li̍p + 无 無 poj: bô + 合 poj: a̍h + 出 poj: chhut from hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h curry favour; get along well with + hokkien (poj) 入 ji̍p / li̍p in; enter; join; become a member + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô do not; to not + hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h curry favour; get along well with + hokkien (poj) 出 chhut out; outside
Words.Definition: to show favour only to a person or a group of people in one's inner circle; to grant favours and advantages to those in one's clique only
Words.Example: The boss at my old workplace was so ar lip bo ar chut that it got really toxic, and I had to leave or I'd have no chance of advancing in my career.

Words.English Translation: → English: around from english around in a circle; surrounding; near
Words.Definition: around

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 合 poj: a̍h + English: -able from hokkien (poj) 合 a̍h curry favour; get along well with + english -able suffix to form an adjective, meaning able to de done or inclined to ← latin -ābilis able to be acted upon
Words.Definition: very amenable to sycophancy; easy to curry favour with
Words.Example: This new boss is so argable. Heard Lewis is already in line for a pay review just because he got into his good books early on.

Words.English Translation: → English: ugly from english ugly unsightly ← old norse uggligr fearful; dreadful
Words.Definition: ugly; not good-looking; unsightly
Words.Example: Don’t go to the 7-11 to pick up a copy of TODAY, because the caricature damn argly, can?

Words.English Translation: → English: armskote from english armskote (mil.) armoury; room where weapons and ammunition are stored ← english arms weapons ← old french armes weapons ← latin arma weapons + punjabi / hindustani * ਕੋਟ / कोट koṭ fort; castle; fortress ← sanskrit कोट्ट/कोट koṭṭa/koṭa fort; stronghold
Words.Definition: (military) an armoury; a room where weapons and ammunition are stored
Words.Example: In particular, one of the most stressful changes has been my appointment as an Armskote IC. ... it basically means that I'm one of the three sorry sods who has to take care of the weapons and ammo.

Words.English Translation: → English: arrow from english arrow a pointed shaft fired from a bow; a symbol in such a shape pointing to sth.
Words.Definition: to be delegated or chosen, especially for an undesirable task.
Words.Example: Sian. I kena arrow to cover all of Fatima's cases because she go jiak hong in Bali until next week.

Words.English Translation: → Hainanese: 压 壓 hts: ad? + 粑 hts: ʔbua3 from hainanese (hts) 压 壓 ad? press; apply pressure + hainanese (hts) 粑 ʔbua3 cake; food that is cake-like
Words.Definition: a traditional Hainanese sweet cake made from shredded ginger, grated coconut, palm sugar, glutinous rice flour, flour, salt, and water, sometimes flavoured with pandan.[1]
Words.Example: All these chats with my mom did not lead to any action till last Lunar New Year dinner when I saw a colander full of shredded ginger when helping with the dishes. Immediately, I knew my mom was going to make buah dah art. I was really excited and came armed with my barang barang.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: asam masam from malay asam masam sour; Garcinia parvifolia; tamarind ← malay asam sour + malay masam sour
Words.Definition: a snack made from any of several sour fruits which are dried, preserved, and sweetened with sugar
Words.Example: Treat your taste buds to a delightful blend of sweet, sour, and tangy flavors with our handcrafted Asam Asam preserved fruits. Made from high-quality, carefully selected ingredients, our collection includes: Sweet Preserved Plums ... Zesty Candied Ginger (Halia) ... Tangy Tamarind Treats ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: asam masam + manis from malay asam masam sour; Garcinia parvifolia; tamarind ← malay asam sour + malay masam sour + malay manis sweet
Words.Definition: a snack made from any of several sour fruits which are dried, preserved, and sweetened with sugar

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: ai sio gan mai from singlish ai sio gan mai 'want to have sex?' ← hokkien (poj) 爱相奸莫 愛相姦莫 ài sio-kàn mài 'want to have sex?' ← hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want + hokkien (poj) 相奸 相姦 sio-kàn (vg.) fuck each other; have sex ← hokkien (poj) 相 相 sio each other; one another + hokkien (poj) 奸 姦 kàn (vg.) fuck; have sex w. + hokkien (poj) 莫 莫 mài contraction of 毋愛 ← hokkien (poj) 毋爱 毋愛 m̄-ài not want
Words.Definition: (vulgar, crude) abbreviation of ai sio gan mai

Words.English Translation: → English: ask for a favour from english ask for a favour seek someone's kind help to do something
Words.Definition: to ask for a favour; to seek someone's kind help to do something

Words.English Translation: → Malay: asam from malay asam sour food
Words.Definition: tamarind (the fruit of the Tamarindus indica plant), a common ingredient in cuisine in Singapore and the surrounding region, such as in dishes like assam fish

Words.English Translation: → Malay: asam + laksa from malay asam sour food; tamarind + malay laksa spicy soup noodle dish ← hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 辣沙 la̍t-sa spicy and grainy or classical persian Possible, but not certain لاکچه lākča noodles
Words.Definition: a soup noodle dish of Peranakan origin, made with laksa noodles, a fish or other broth flavoured with tamarind (assam) paste, and a rempah of shallots, garlic, galangal, chilli, lemongrass, and other ingredients[1]
Words.Example: When she first invited me to her home to taste this dish of Assam Laksa, I was rather apprehensive. At first, I was overwhelmed by the pungent smell from the gravy that filled her house. Then, I was put off by the unappealing orange-black broth in the bowl ... To my surprise, I fell in love with it immediately.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: assam + pedas from malay assam sour food; tamarind + malay pedas spicy; pungent
Words.Definition: a sour and spicy fish curry flavoured with tamarind (assam).

Words.Word: asshole dai di 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: asshole + Singlish: dai di from english asshole (lit., vg.) anus, (fig.) contemptible, obnoxious, mean, unpleasant person; term of abuse ← english ass buttocks; anus + english hole cavity; orifice; opening + singlish dai di Singaporean-rules variant of a shedding card game extremely popular in East Asia ← cantonese (jyutping) 锄大弟 鋤大弟 co4 daai6 di2 shedding card game extremely popular in East Asia ← cantonese (jyutping) 鋤 锄 co4 discard; remove; get rid of + cantonese (jyutping) 大 大 daai6 big; elder; great + cantonese (jyutping) 弟 弟 dai6 younger brother
Words.Definition: (vulgar) a variation of dai di for at least four players, where players are assigned roles for the next game based on their finishing positions. The loser is named the 'asshole', with the second-last player having varying titles including 'scum' or 'peasant'. The first- and second- placed players are usually known as the 'king' and 'queen' respectively (though other terms may also be used). At the start of the game, the 'asshole' must trade their two objectively highest-value cards over to the 'king' in exchange for their worst two, while the second-last-placed player gives their single best card in exchange for the 'queen's' worst one.While rules vary, in most rulesets, if the 'asshole' wins a round within the game, the ranking of all cards is reversed for the next round. This is known as a 'revolution'.In the West, a game with similar rules based on tai ti or some similar Chinese card game is known as "President" or "Asshole"; another similar game is known as "Daifugō" in Japan.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: ah tiong from singlish ah tiong (derog. or endearing) sb. from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿中 阿中 a-tiong (derog. or endearing) sb. from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + general chinese (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China

Words.Example: WAH WHERE THE TOILET? MY ONE AT CUSTOM LIAO

Words.English Translation: → Malay: atas from malay atas on top of; above; upper
Words.Definition: high or elevated, or perceived as such, in terms of prestige, esteem, character, class, language, etc.
Words.Example: He still preferred to eat at the hawker centre downstairs, as the chic new cafés popping up like mushrooms around the block were a little too atas for his liking.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: ah tiong bu from singlish ah tiong bu (derog.) woman or girl from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿中 阿中 a-tiong (derog. or endearing) sb. from mainland China ← hokkien (poj) 阿 阿 a dimin. or endearing prefix + general chinese (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China + hokkien (poj) 母 母 bú mother; female
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a woman or girl from mainland China
Words.Example: Got chio n kanasai one lah...coffeeshop near my place has one atb aunty serving noodle and sweet meimei selling dimsum...

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: ஆத்தா āttā from tamil ஆத்தா āttā mother; grandmother ✂ tamil ஆத்தாள் āttāḷ mother; grandmother
Words.Definition: mother; term of address or endearment for one's mother
Words.Example: Her family’s favourite dishes of hers — ghee rice, fried chicken and chicken curry — have been documented in a series of photos titled From Atha to You, taken by her daughter ... Her grandchildren calls her "atha", or grandmother, and have written, "I love you so much", "from young I’m eating your food", "I’m so grateful to you".

Words.English Translation: → Malay: atap + Hokkien: 子 poj: chí from malay atap Nypa fruticans, a.k.a. nipa palm ← malay atap roof + hokkien (poj) 子 chí child; son; seed
Words.Definition: the immature fruits of the nipa palm (Nypa fruticans), which are oval-shaped, translucent, and approximately 3cm long. Commonly used for their chewy, gelatinous texture in sweet desserts.
Related: hum ji bo ji attap chee

Words.English Translation: → English: attend + b from english attend (of a medical professional) to care for; to administer medical help or advice to + english b second letter of the English alphabet
Words.Definition: (military) a medical status exempting a soldier from all but light duties

Words.English Translation: → English: attend + c from english attend (of a medical professional) to care for; to administer medical help or advice to + english c third letter of the English alphabet
Words.Definition: (military) a medical status exempting a soldier from all duties

Words.Word: au au salakau 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Hokkien: 嘔 呕 poj: áu + 三六九 poj: saⁿ-la̍k-káu from hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 嘔 呕 áu onomatopoeic; chosen to rhyme with 九, "káu". + hokkien (poj) 三六九 saⁿ-la̍k-káu 369 (name of an infamous gang)
Words.Definition: (provocative, crass) a gang shout used by the infamous 369 (Salakau) gang. Associated with violent gangsterism, delinquency, criminals, and low-class behaviour.

Words.Definition: bad; substandard; poor; inferior; awful; terrible; low-quality

Words.English Translation: → English: auntie from english auntie dimin. of aunt (female relative of the same generation as one's parent) ← asian languages "auntie" equivalent of "auntie" in various languages and cultures; woman of older generation than oneself
Words.Definition: a middle-aged or older woman
Words.Example: Auntie, want to sit?

Words.English Translation: → English: automatically from english automatically spontaneously; on its own accord ← english automatic spontaneous; on its own accord ← french automatique automatic ← french automate automaton ← ancient greek αὐτόμᾰτον autómăton accident; pure chance + french -ique suffix to form an adj. from a noun ← latin -icus suffix to form an adj. pertaining to sth. + english -al suffix to form an adj. pertaining to sth. ← latin -ālis suffix to form an adj. pertaining to sth. + english -ly suffix to form an adv.
Words.Definition: automatically; spontaneously; on its own accord
Words.Example: The gunman just need to throw charcoal/burning things at the ventilation shaft to send smoke in, the ppl will auto come out.

Words.English Translation: → English: Autobot from english Autobot fictional faction of transforming robots in the Transformers universe ← english automobile car; automotive ← french automobile car; automotive ← french auto- automatic; self- ← ancient greek αὐτο- auto- self- + french mobile moving; mobile ← latin mōbilis movable; mobile + english bot clipping of 'robot' ✂ english robot intelligent, humanoid mechanical being made to do work ← czech robot intelligent, humanoid mechanical being made to do work ← czech robota arduous work; drudgery; servitude
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a trans woman; a male-to-female transgender person
Words.Example: knn this autobot treat dating like some ****ing phd subject ... asgm enough liao ... still do cost-benefit analysis

Words.English Translation: → Malay: awek from malay awek girl; girlfriend
Words.Definition: a young Malay girl or woman, often one who dresses conservatively (such as in a tudung); term of address for a young Malay girl or woman

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam from malay ayam chicken
Words.Definition: a chicken

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: ayam + Baba malay: buah keluak from malay / baba malay ayam chicken; chicken (meat) + baba malay buah keluak the seeds of the Pangium edule tree ← malay / baba malay buah fruit; any small or roundish object + baba malay keluak Likely, but other possible etymologies exist (onom.) vomiting sound; nausea
Words.Definition: a Peranakan dish consisting of chicken (ayam) stewed with buah keluak in a gravy of pounded spices including tamarind (assam), candlenuts, turmeric, chilli, lemongrass, galangal, and belacan. In some recipes, the flesh of the buah keluak nut is be mixed with ground meat and stuffed back in before stewing, while others let the flesh be. In both cases, nevertheless, the dish is served with the flesh still in the nut's shell as part of the presentation. It takes a lot of influence from Indonesian cuisine. The dish is infamous, like many other Peranakan dishes, for its incredibly long preparation time; for example, the buah keluak has to be boiled, buried, and soaked for up to forty days beforehand to draw out the toxic hydrogen cyanide naturally present in the raw nuts. This process results in the nuts turning the dark black colour that they familiarly appear with in the dish.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam kampung from malay ayam kampung free-range village chicken ← malay ayam chicken + malay kampung village; community; hometown
Words.Definition: a breed of free-range chicken, typically slightly smaller and less productive than most farmed chicken breeds. Their meat is considered a culinary delicacy and valued at a higher price than that of normal chickens, and their skin usually also has a yellower hue.
Words.Example: Despite great expectations, the chicken with wheat and the Thai-style mango chicken turned out to be no great clucks. But they were meaty — no stringy ayam kampung here.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam masak merah from malay ayam masak merah chicken cooked with tomato-chilli sauce and spices ← malay ayam chicken + malay masak cook; cooked + malay merah red
Words.Definition: a Malaysian and Singaporean Malay dish of chicken fried with turmeric and braised in a red sauce of made of chilli, onions, tomato sauce, and various spices. It is often served as a dish in nasi padang.
Words.Example: Local favourites run the gamut, with offerings like ayam (chicken) panggang, ayam masak merah, udang (prawn) masak sambal petai, and ikan (fish) gulai asam, all promising to quell the craving for the familiar.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam + Javanese: penyet from malay ayam chicken; chicken (meat) + javanese penyet flattened; smashed; squeezed
Words.Definition: a type of fried chicken originating in Javanese cuisine, where the fried chicken is crushed or flattened (such as by using a pestle and mortar) to split the fibres of the meat and thus mechanically tenderize it.The chicken is pre-cooked in a preparation of spices before being deep-fried.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam + percik from malay ayam chicken; chicken (meat) + malay percik sprinkle; scatter drops
Words.Definition: a Malay dish of chicken (ayam) marinated in spices and then grilled over charcoal. The chicken is basted with a sauce consisting of ground chilli, shallots, garlic, ginger, candlenuts, pepper, coconut milk, assam (tamarind), etc. while it grills, hence giving rise to the name "percik".

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ayam + Hokkien: 烧 燒 poj: sio from malay ayam chicken; chicken (meat) + hokkien (poj) 烧 燒 sio roast; cook
Words.Definition: a Peranakan dish of chicken roasted or braised with a ground paste of shallots, garlic, tamarind (assam), sugar, tau cheo, coriander seeds, soya sauce, or other aromatic ingredients.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: ஐயா aiyā & அய்யா ayyā &/or Malay: ayah from tamil ஐயா aiyā father; sir & tamil அய்யா ayyā father; sir ← pali ayya lord; master; noble ← sanskrit आय्य āyya lord; master; noble &/or malay ayah (f.) father
Words.Definition: father; term of address or endearment for a father

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 吧 pinyin: ba from mandarin (pinyin) 吧 ba used at the end of a sentence to indicate suggestion, speculation, incredulity, etc.
Words.Definition: used to indicate suggestion
Words.Example: Late already, we do tomorrow.→ Late already, we do tomorrow ba.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: buah kedondong from malay buah kedondong fruit of the tree Spondias dulcis or related Spondias spp.
Words.Definition: the edible fruit of Spondias dulcis, a tree native to Southeast Asia and the Pacific region. The fruits are egg-shaped and around 6 - 9 cm in length, and come in bunches of a dozen or more on a single stalk. They are good source of vitamins A, B, and C. They may be eaten raw, but are also commonly processed by pressing into a juice. The tree's leaves are sometimes used culinarily to impart a sour taste to dishes.[1][2][3]
Words.Example: Signature dishes include Penang char kway teow, assam laksa and nasi lemak, as well as sweet desserts like Penang cendol as well as buah long long juice.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: Baba from malay / baba malay Baba male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born man ← translingual baba father
Words.Definition: a male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans
Words.Example: Most of the Chinese ancestors of the Babas came from Fujian and Guangdong of southern China. Within the Peranakan community, there are Hokkien Baba, Teochew Baba, Cantonese Baba and Hakka Baba.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: Baba + English: Malay from malay / baba malay Baba male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born man ← translingual baba father + english Malay language(s) of the Malays ← malay Melayu Malay
Words.Definition: a creole language spoken by the Peranakans which uses Malay as the lexifier but with Hokkien (or Teochew) grammar, with vocabulary also borrowed from Hokkien and some European languages
Words.Example: Just the other day at the local wet market, also known as the pasar or pasair to the Peranakans (the latter if you were trying to sound particularly refined), a curious vegetable seller asked if I was Chinese, and what dialect group I belonged to. I am conscious that I am not about to win a pageant for Miss Chinatown any day.“I am Peranakan, aunty. Nyonya. Baba. Straits-born Chinese. We speak Baba Malay.”

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: Baba + nyonya from malay / baba malay Baba male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born man ← translingual baba father + malay / baba malay nyonya female Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born woman ← portuguese Possible, but not certain dona lady; term of address for a middle-aged or older lady ← latin domna/domina lady; madam or hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 娘 niû/niô͘/niâ woman; lady; girl
Words.Definition: a Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans
Words.Example: The Baba Nyonya are Straits Chinese—namely, Chinese born in the Straits Settlements and not Chinese born in China—but not all Straits Chinese are Baba Nyonya.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: babi from malay babi pig; pork, (fig., vulgar) term of abuse or insult for a contemptible person
Words.Definition: pig
Words.Example: Yeesh, that fella so pui, eat also no manners, macam babi sia.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: babi + Dubious or unconfirmed Hokkien: 炕猪 炕豬 poj: khòng-tir from malay babi pig; pork + hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 炕猪 炕豬 khòng-tir slow-cooked or stewed pork ← hokkien (poj) 炕 炕 khòng slow-cook or stew + hokkien (poj) 猪 豬 tir pork or hokkien (poj) 茶 茶 tê tea
Words.Definition: a Peranakan stew of pork braised in a gravy made from tau cheo (fermented soya bean paste), garlic, shallots, gula melaka (palm sugar), and other spices. The stew often includes other ingredients, such as bamboo shoots, mushrooms, potatoes, or sea cucumber.

Words.English Translation: → Punjabi: ਬਾਬੂ bāpū + ਸਿੰਘ siṅgh from punjabi ਬਾਬੂ bāpū sir; papa; dad ← prakrit (brahmi) 𑀩𑀧𑁆𑀧 bappa daddy; papa + punjabi ਸਿੰਘ siṅgh surname; lion ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion
Words.Definition: (possibly racist) a Sikh man; term of address for a Sikh man

Words.English Translation: → English: back from english back in return; to a previous condition
Words.Definition: re-; again

Words.English Translation: → English: backside + itchy from english backside buttocks; anatomical rear end ← english back rear; behind + english side face; flank + english itchy sensation of needing to be scratched; having a niggling desire to do sth.; jittery; eager; on edge
Words.Definition: (idiom) unable to sit still; listless; restless; constantly having the desire to move about; hyperactive
Words.Example: Backside itchy, the cold weather tempted us to go across the border for a late dinner. Many Singaporeans here and we q-ed for about 30mins before we got a table.

Words.English Translation: → English: bag + of + balls from english bag soft container, usu. made from a flexible material, used to hold items + english of containing; comprising + english balls (slang) testicles
Words.Definition: (military, metaphor) undesirable, unpleasant, boring, or menial work or tasks; dirty work

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bagus from malay bagus good
Words.Definition: good

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 拜年 pinyin: mandarin from mandarin (pinyin) 拜年 mandarin visit for Chinese New Year; exchange New Year greetings ← mandarin (pinyin) 拜 mandarin visit; make a courtesy call + mandarin (pinyin) 年 mandarin year
Words.Definition: to visit one's relatives or friends during Chinese New Year
Words.Example: I went Bai Nian (拜年) in Bukit Batok East earlier today and visited many seniors. It was wonderful to see them well and in good spirits.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: baik from malay baik good; ok
Words.Definition: good
Words.Example: Wah, I thought this chair was good, but this one lagi baik.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: baju from malay baju shirt ← classical persian بازو bâzu arm; upper arm
Words.Definition: a traditional Malay upper-body garment, typically worn during festive occasions such as weddings or Hari Raya

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉 poj: bah from hokkien (poj) 肉 bah meat; flesh; pork
Words.Definition: meat; flesh

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉粽 poj: bah-chàng from hokkien (poj) 肉粽 bah-chàng dumpling of glutinous rice wrapped in flat leaves (usually bamboo), typically stuffed with meat and/or other ingredients.
Words.Definition: a tetrahedral dumpling of glutinous rice wrapped in flat leaves (usually bamboo), typically stuffed with meat and/or other ingredients. It can be savoury or sweet, and comes in various forms depending on culture, such as Nyonya, Hokkien, Hakka, Cantonese, etc. It is commonly eaten during the Dragon Boat Festival, but is also enjoyed as a popular dish or snack throughout the year.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 目睭 poj: ba̍k-chiu from hokkien (poj) 目睭 ba̍k-chiu eye; eyes; eyeball
Words.Definition: eyes
Words.Example: 看什物看？看你的目睭 (khòaⁿ sím-mi̍h khòaⁿ? khòaⁿ lí ê ba̍k-chiu) 我的目睭死爸细, so I can't even see you! (óa-ê ba̍k-chiu sí-pē sòe)(tr.: See what see? See your eyes;My eyes are so damn small, so I can't even see you!)

Words.Word: bak chiu ang 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 目睭红 目睭紅 poj: ba̍k-chiu âng from hokkien (poj) 目睭红 目睭紅 ba̍k-chiu âng jealous ← hokkien (poj) 目睭 目睭 ba̍k-chiu eye + hokkien (poj) 红 紅 âng red
Words.Definition: to be jealous; to be envious

Words.Word: bak chiu tak sai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 目睭 poj: ba̍k-chiu + 贴 貼 poj: tah + 屎 poj: sái from hokkien (poj) 目睭 ba̍k-chiu eye; eyes; eyeball + hokkien (poj) 贴 貼 tah paste; stick on; be attached + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion; (vg.) shit; lousy; useless
Words.Definition: (idiom) blind; unable to see
Words.Example: The driver bak chiu tak sai ah?
Related: got eyes also don't know mount taishan
got eyes also don't know Mount Taishan

Words.Word: bak chiu tak stamp 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 目睭 poj: ba̍k-chiu + 贴 貼 poj: tah + English: stamp from hokkien (poj) 目睭 ba̍k-chiu eye; eyes; eyeball + hokkien (poj) 贴 貼 tah paste; stick on; be attached + english stamp a small sticker pasted onto letter or envelope as a prepayment of postage, or used for decoration.
Words.Definition: (idiom) blind; unable to see
Words.Example: - Wah, those girls all so chio...- Where got?- Alamak, your bak chiu tak stamp isit?
Related: got eyes also don't know mount taishan
got eyes also don't know Mount Taishan

Words.Word: bak chor mee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉脞面 肉脞麵 poj: bah-chhò͘-mī from hokkien (poj) 肉脞面 肉脞麵 bah-chhò͘-mī bak chor mee ← hokkien (poj) 肉脞 肉脞 bah-chhò͘ minced meat; minced pork + hokkien (poj) 面 麵 mī wheat noodles
Words.Definition: a noodle dish, usually either using mee pok or mee kia as the noodles (though other varieties exist), topped with minced pork, mushrooms, pork slices, a savoury sauce, vinegar, white pepper, sambal, fried shallots, lard, ikan bilis, fried wantan, fried or dried fish, and/or other toppings. It can be ordered either with the noodles in a soup (soup/wet) or with the soup served separately on the side (dry).

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉拊 poj: bah-hú from hokkien (poj) 肉拊 bah-hú meat floss ← hokkien (poj) 肉 bah meat; flesh + hokkien (poj) 拊 hú rub; wipe; beat; process; break down
Words.Definition: a meat floss made by stewing a meat, usually pork, chicken, or beef (though others such as fish are sometimes used) together with spices and sugar until soft enough to be pulled into individual fibres. It is then further beaten and broken down while being heated e.g. by frying in a large wok until it is dry and slightly crispy. The finished product has a texture similar to coarse wool. It is a common topping used to add protein and flavour to various dishes and confectioneries, such as on the popular bakery staple of pork or chicken floss buns.
Words.Example: Bak Hu can be eaten as is or as a topping for congee, rice, noodles, and stir fries. We like to eat it with white bread.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉骨茶 poj: bah-kut-tê from hokkien (poj) 肉骨茶 bah-kut-tê bak kut teh; a soup made of boiled pork ribs, garlic, and white pepper ← hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 肉骨地 bah-kut-tē Teh's pork ribs ← hokkien (poj) 肉骨 bah-kut pork ribs + hokkien (poj) 李文地 lí bûn-tē Lee Boon Teh or hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 茶 tê tea
Words.Definition: a Chinese soup made of primarily boiled pork ribs and a generous amount of garlic and toasted white pepper, sometimes paired with a bowl of white rice

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 肉干 poj: bah-koaⁿ from hokkien (poj) 肉干 bah-koaⁿ bak kwa; a sweet and savoury grilled jerky, usually made from pork but also sometimes beef, chicken, mutton, or others
Words.Definition: a sweet and savoury, jerky-like grilled food of Hokkien origin, usually made from pork but also sometimes beef, chicken, mutton, or others. The meat is seasoned with spices, sugar, and soya sauce, then dried in large, square-shaped pieces around 3mm thick, and finally barbecued over a charcoal fire until a char has formed. It is a very popular food to eat during Chinese New Year.
Words.Example: Everyone indulged in the delicious Chinese New Year cookies on offer at Ah Kong's house. Even Waggie, the dog, got to enjoy a few delicious pieces of bak kwa!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 目屎 poj: ba̍k-sái from hokkien (poj) 目屎 ba̍k-sái sleep (substance); tears ← hokkien (poj) 目 ba̍k eye + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái excrement; bodily secretion
Words.Definition: sleep (the crusty substance that accumulates in the corner of the eyes after sleeping, composed of dried tears, mucus, oil, and other debris)

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 白糖糕 jyutping: baak6 tong4 gou1 from cantonese (jyutping) 白糖糕 baak6 tong4 gou1 white sugar sponge cake ← cantonese (jyutping) 白糖 baak6 tong4 white sugar ← cantonese (jyutping) 白 baak6 white + cantonese (jyutping) 糖 tong4 sugar + cantonese (jyutping) 糕 gou1 cake
Words.Definition: white sugar sponge cake, a steamed Chinese cake made from a fermented batter of rice flour, white sugar, water, and a leavening agent. It is normally portioned into triangular or cuboid slices for serving. If made with brown sugar instead, it is known as wong tong gou.

Words.English Translation: → Japanese: 馬鹿野郎 ばかやろ baka yarō from japanese 馬鹿野郎 ばかやろ baka yarō (vg.) idiot; moron ← japanese 馬鹿 ばか baka idiot; foolish; stupid; useless ← sanskrit मोह móha (Buddhism) ignorance + japanese 野郎 やろ yarō (vg.) bastard; son of a bitch
Words.Definition: (pejorative, offensive) idiot; moron

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: bakwan + Malay: kepiting from baba malay bakwan meatball ← hokkien (poj) 肉丸 bah-oân meatball ← hokkien (poj) 肉 bah meat; pork + hokkien (poj) 丸 oân small, roundish object + malay kepiting crab
Words.Definition: a traditional clear Peranakan soup of a chicken or prawn stock base with meatballs made of crab meat and minced pork and prawns, with bamboo shoots cut into strips that are either incorporated into the meatballs, added separately into the soup, or both.

Words.English Translation: → English: balance from english balance remainder ← old french balance weighing scales ← late latin bilancia that which is two-scaled
Words.Definition: remainders; leftovers
Words.Example: I got a lot of packets at home already lah. The balance you keep.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: balik from malay balik turn; reverse; turn around; back
Words.Definition: to return; to go back; to go back to where one came from, or where one is staying.
Words.Example: This work touches on the identity and roots of Peranakans, and raises the question of belonging and the notion of ‘home’. The term itself, ‘Balik Rumah’, references the language of Malay - once a common tongue among the people of Singapore, it appears that the local lingua franca is dwindling in the face of an increasingly Mandarin dominated society.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: balik kampung from malay balik kampung to go back to one's hometown or place of origin ← malay balik turn; reverse; turn around; back + malay kampung village; community; (fig.) hometown
Words.Definition: to go back to one's hometown or place of origin; go home; pack up and go home
Words.Example: The [fuel] shortage was made worse by the surge in demand that came from motorists filling up to return to their home for Hari Raya celebrations. The “balik kampung” rush had turned chaotic over the past few days ...

Words.English Translation: → English: balls + drop from english balls (slang) testicles + english drop fall straight down; descend suddenly
Words.Definition: frightened; shocked; petrified
Words.Example: Ah Seng was vaping at the back of the school when the discipline master walked by; upon seeing his furious glare, Ah Seng straight away balls drop.

Words.English Translation: → English: balls + shrink from english balls (slang) testicles + english shrink contract; become smaller; withdraw
Words.Definition: frightened; shocked; petrified

Words.Word: ban chian kueh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 曼煎粿 曼煎粿 poj: bān-chian-kóe from hokkien (poj) 曼煎粿 曼煎粿 bān-chian-kóe type of sweet pancake with peanut filling ← hokkien (poj) 满清 滿清 boán-chheng Manchu (dynasty/people) + hokkien (poj) 粿 粿 kóe kueh
Words.Definition: Hokkien name for min chiang kueh, a type of sweet pancake with peanut filling

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 板面 板麺 pinyin: bǎn miàn from mandarin (pinyin) 板面 板麺 bǎn miàn Hakka hand-cut noodles; noodle dish made from such noodles ← hokkien (poj) 板面 板麺 pán-mī Hakka hand-cut noodles; noodle dish made from such noodles
Words.Definition: A type of noodle traditionally made by rolling a dough of wheat flour, salt, and water (and often egg) flat on a board and slicing them with straight cuts by hand using a wooden block as a guide, a technique originating in Hakka cuisine. It is made from the same dough as you mee and mee hoon kueh, and is often white in colour.
Words.Example: Every time I looked at a plate of duck rice or ban mian or Indian rojak, I just felt guilty, OK? Was it speaking to me? Was it maybe crying out to be rescued from its fate?

Words.English Translation: → English: banana &/or Hokkien: 弓蕉囝 poj: keng-chio-kiáⁿ from english banana the edible fruit of the Musa genus of flowering plants ← portuguese / spanish banana banana ← general niger-congo banana* banana &/or hokkien (poj) 弓蕉囝 keng-chio-kiáⁿ (pej.) Chinese person who is overly Westernized or hokkien (poj) 金蕉囝 kim-chio-kiáⁿ (pej.) Chinese person who is overly Westernized ← hokkien (poj) 弓蕉 keng-chio banana or hokkien (poj) 金蕉 kim-chio banana + hokkien (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ kid; child; fella
Words.Definition: (pejorative) a person of Chinese descent who speaks English well but has poor skills in Chinese languages, is only in touch with Western culture, and lives a Western lifestyle
Words.Example: Is there a Hokkien version which includes pinying? I’ve been calling my relatives as taught by hearing (banana here) and in writing by phonetics, and would love to know the proper names. If only for reference for my (even more banana) kid.

Words.English Translation: → English: banana + kid ↻ Hokkien: 弓蕉囝 poj: keng-chio-kiáⁿ from english banana the edible fruit of the Musa genus of flowering plants ← portuguese / spanish banana banana ← general niger-congo banana* banana + english kid young child ← old norse kið young goat ↻ hokkien (poj) 弓蕉囝 keng-chio-kiáⁿ (pej.) Chinese person who is overly Westernized or hokkien (poj) 金蕉囝 kim-chio-kiáⁿ (pej.) Chinese person who is overly Westernized ← hokkien (poj) 弓蕉 keng-chio banana or hokkien (poj) 金蕉 kim-chio banana + hokkien (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ kid; child; fella
Words.Definition: (pejorative) a person of Chinese descent who speaks English well but has poor skills in Chinese languages, is only in touch with Western culture, and lives a Western lifestyle
Words.Example: stayed at Circuit Rd blk 49, 3 room hdb flat. low ses estate with lots of ah bengs n ah lians. I would have been one if i wasn't brought up as a banana kid.

Words.English Translation: → English: banana + money from english banana the Musa genus of flowering plants; the edible fruit thereof ← portuguese / spanish banana banana ← general niger-congo banana* banana + english money currency; cash in the form of notes or coins ← anglo-norman muneie money; coins ← latin monēta mint; money; coins ← latin Monēta Italian goddess of the mint
Words.Definition: paper currency issued by the Japanese government in Singapore, Malaysia, and Borneo during the Japanese Occupation in World War II. So called because of the drawing of a banana tree with several bunches of bananas on the ten-dollar note.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bandung from malay bandung pair; two things that are mixed or come in pairs ← old javanese baṇḍuṅ together; at the same time
Words.Definition: a sweet drink made with rose cordial and milk
Words.Example: Oh 不要忘了 还有一杯 bandung 还有一杯 bandung (Yeah) 还有一杯 bandung

Words.English Translation: → English: bang + balls ↻ Hokkien: 𡳞脬 poj: lān-pha + 拍 poj: phah + 𡳞 poj: lān from english bang hit hard + english balls testicles ↻ hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 lān-pha (vulgar) scrotum; balls + hokkien (poj) 拍 phah hit; whack + hokkien (poj) 𡳞 lān (vulgar) penis
Words.Definition: (idiom) used to express that a plan has backfired, or an unpredictable or unexpected result has occurred

Words.Word: bang ka tioh lam pa 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 蠓 poj: báng + 咬着 咬著 poj: kā-tio̍h + 𡳞脬 poj: lān-pha from hokkien (poj) 蠓 báng mosquito + hokkien (poj) 咬着 咬著 kā-tio̍h bit; bites + hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 lān-pha (vg.) scrotum; ballsack; balls
Words.Definition: (idiom) stuck in a dilemma or quandary; a Catch-22; used to describe a difficult and dire situation where any course of action or inaction will result in undesirable consequences
Words.Example: Why you go and make this my pasal? Now if I tell him, he will angry. If I dun tell him, wait later he find out, he lagi angry. Bang ka tioh lam pa.

Words.English Translation: → English: bang + table ↻ Likely, but other possible etymologies exist Mandarin / cantonese: 拍案[而起] jyutping: pāi àn [ér qǐ] from english bang hit hard + english table furniture with a raised top surface ← old french table table ← latin tabula tablet; board ↻ mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) Likely, but other possible etymologies exist 拍案[而起] pāi àn [ér qǐ] slam the table [and rise to one’s feet] in indignation ← mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 拍 pāi hit; slap; slam + mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 案 àn table + mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 而 ér and; and then + mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 起 qǐ stand up; rise
Words.Definition: to display extreme indignation; to aggressively complain and escalate an issue
Words.Example: I don’t understand why people pay for services not rendered. You got mcdonalds, pay already then wait for food, then the server say sorry no food for you, then you gong gong say orh and walk home empty handed meh? Can bang table at mcdonalds to refund $10, why cannot do the same for thousands of dollars?

Words.English Translation: → English: bang + wall ↻ Possible, but not certain Mandarin / cantonese: 撞墙 撞牆 jyutping: zhuàng qiáng from english bang hit hard + english wall solid structure acting as a division ← latin vallum wall; rampart ↻ mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) Possible, but not certain 撞墙 撞牆 zhuàng qiáng be rebuffed or rebutted ← mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 撞 撞 zhuàng hit; bang into + mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 墙 牆 qiáng wall
Words.Definition: to be extremely frustrated or angry
Words.Example: Can go bang wall already lah. It won't matter how beautiful my nails or my eyeliner, it won't matter cause my hair is ruined forever.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bangkuang from malay bangkuang variant form of 'sengkuang': Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama ← malay sengkuang Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama ← tagalog singkamas Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama ← spanish jícama(s) Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama (plural) ← nahuatl xīcama Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama ← nahuatl xīcamatl Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama
Words.Definition: Pachyrhizus erosus, a.k.a. jicama or yam bean, a plant with a large, edible tuberous root.[1]
Words.Example: Bang Kwang is a large, climbing vine that is harvested for its starchy tuber. The tuber can be eaten raw, stir-fried, or steamed in a variety of dishes, and is most well-known as a component of Rojak and Popiah in Singapore.

Words.English Translation: → Bengali: বাংলা baṅla + English: Bangladeshi from bengali বাংলা baṅla Bengali; Bengal + english Bangladeshi of or relating to Bangladesh
Words.Definition: (derogatory, racist) ethnic slur for a Bangladeshi person, or other dark-skinned person of South Asian descent.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bangla + English: worker from singlish bangla (derog.) Bangladeshi or other dark-skinned South Asian ← bengali বাংলা baṅla Bengali; Bengal & english Bangladeshi of or relating to Bangladesh + english worker sb. who works; manual labourer
Words.Definition: (often racist, derogatory) a Bangladeshi man (or any other darker-skinned person of South Asian descent) who works as a manual labourer, typically in construction
Words.Example: I don’t deny that I used to be a xenophobe. I grew up well-acquainted with racism, as I would hear jokes about “blacker” people and people’s fear of Bangla construction workers. As a child, these Bangla workers were portrayed as scary perpetrators by others: “Don’t be naughty ah; if not, I will ask the Bangla worker to catch you!” I was taught to stay away from them, as they were perceived as “dangerous”.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bantal + busuk from malay bantal pillow + malay busuk smelly
Words.Definition: an old, unwashed, pillow or other huggable item from one's childhood, used for comfort and emotional support
Words.Example: It’s alright to be childish sometimes, keeping your “bantal busuk” to help you sleep soundly at night.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 宝贝 寶貝 pinyin: bǎo bèi from mandarin (pinyin) 宝贝 寶貝 bǎo bèi baby; sweetheart; dear
Words.Definition: baby; honey; sweetheart; term of endearment for a loved one, especially a baby or a significant other
Words.Example: I have been using Aveeno daily baby moisture lotion on baobei since she is a baby , good for sensitive skin kids , helps soothe her sensitive and itchy skin and keep her skin moisturise for 24 hours

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bapok from malay bapok (derog.) transvestite; cross-dresser
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a male transvestite

Words.English Translation: → English: bar from english bar broad stripe ← old french barre bar
Words.Definition: (military) the horizontal stripes in the rank insignia of second lieutenant, lieutenant, and captain

Words.English Translation: → Malay: barang-barang from malay barang-barang things; goods; items
Words.Definition: personal belongings
Words.Example: Grab your barang-barang and clean up before you leave.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 麻汝 poj: bâ-lú + Malay: baru from hokkien / teochew (poj) 麻汝 bâ-lú just now; just; recently ← malay baru just now; just; recently; new + malay baru just now; just; recently; new
Words.Definition: just now; only just; recently
Words.Example: What happen to VA ah? Match baru start i go toilet short while come back, bo liao?????

Words.English Translation: → English: bash from english bash hit hard; crash; try or attempt
Words.Definition: (military) to walk or create a path through dense vegetation, especially where there is no previous or obvious path available

Words.English Translation: → English: basha from english basha a large waterproof sheet or groundsheet; (mil.) a tent or shelter fashioned from such a sheet ← assamese বাসা bāsā home; house; nest ← sanskrit वास vāsá dwelling; residence; home
Words.Definition: (military) a makeshift tent or shelter fashioned from a large waterproof sheet or groundsheet, usually draped over a line of cord.
Words.Example: During field camp, we learned how to dig shellscrape, build basha, deal with heat rash, and hold in our pangsai for seven days.

Words.English Translation: → English: basket + Likely, but other possible etymologies exist bastard from english basket open-topped, often woven container + english Likely, but other possible etymologies exist bastard sb. born out of wedlock, (vg.) asshole; contemptible person ← anglo-norman / old french bastard sb. born out of wedlock ← medieval latin bastardus sb. born out of wedlock

Words.English Translation: → English: because + the + sky + is + so + high + the + bird + shit + in + your + eye from english because for the reason of; due to + english the definite article + english sky upper part of the atmosphere; heavens + english is conj. of 'be' + english so to the extent that; very + english high elevated + english the definite article + english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs + english shit defecate; excrete faeces; poop + english in within; at; inside + english your 2p. possessive pron. + english eye organ used to see

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 米粉 poj: bí-hún + Malay: goreng from hokkien (poj) 米粉 bí-hún rice vermicelli; rice flour ← hokkien (poj) 米 bí rice + hokkien (poj) 粉 hún flour; powder + malay goreng fried

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 米糕 poj: bí-ko from hokkien (poj) 米糕 bí-ko rice cake ← hokkien (poj) 米 bí rice ← hokkien (poj) 米 ko cake
