Words.Example: Bee Koh is the perfect dessert for tea time, particularly on a wet cool afternoon. Its softness and sweetness is very soothing.

Words.Word: bee thai bak 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 米筛目 米篩目 poj: bí-thai-ba̍k from hokkien (poj) 米筛目 米篩目 bí-thai-ba̍k bee thai bak; rat tail noodles; short, thick noodles made of rice flour and cornstarch ← hokkien (poj) 米筛 米篩 bí-thai rice sieve + hokkien (poj) 目 目 ba̍k eye; lump; segment
Words.Definition: short, thick noodles, usually tapered to a point on each end, made of a blend of rice flour and cornstarch

Words.English Translation: → English: beef + ball ↻ Cantonese: 牛丸 jyutping: ngau4 jyun4-2 from english beef meat from any bovine species, such as cattle ← old french buef cow; cattle ← latin bōs cow; cattle + english ball roughly spherical object ↻ cantonese (jyutping) 牛丸 ngau4 jyun4-2 beef ball
Words.Definition: a meatball made from pounded and seasoned beef. The pounding process causes the beef to adopt a texture similar to surimi (which is the paste used to make fishballs). The resulting meatball has a firm, bouncy texture.

Words.English Translation: → English: beef + floss from english beef meat from any bovine species, such as cattle ← old french buef cow; cattle ← latin bōs cow; cattle + english floss light, thread-like or fibrous material
Words.Definition: a food made by stewing beef together with spices and sugar until soft enough to be pulled into individual fibres. It is then further beaten and broken down while being heated e.g. by frying in a large wok until it is dry and slightly crispy. The finished product has a texture similar to coarse wool.
Words.Example: To celebrate the Year of the Ox, Szechuan Court at Fairmont Singapore has incorporated stewed beef cartilage and handmade spicy beef floss — which takes eight hours to make — in its yusheng.

Words.English Translation: → English: beef + Malay / indonesian: rendang from english beef meat from any bovine species, such as cattle + malay / indonesian rendang type of dry curry; rich, spicy stew- or curry-like dish with meat
Words.Definition: a rich, spicy, slow-cooked stew- or curry-like dish with cubes of diced beef and a base of coconut milk. The gravy uses a mixture of spices including galangal, lemongrass, chilli, ginger, turmeric, shallots, garlic, and other spices, fried in oil. The spice mix and beef are slow-cooked in coconut milk until the curry is almost dry and the ingredients have absorbed the liquid in the dish, resulting in a remarkably rich, complex, and flavourful curry. It is typically served with rice.The dish supposedly originated in Minangkabau cuisine. While beef rendang is the most famous form of rendang, other meats can be used, such as in chicken rendang and mutton rendang.
Words.Example: The beef rendang was also a winner. The beef chunks had been braised in coconut milk seasoned with lots of herbs and spices until the flavours absorbed and the liquids evaporated.

Words.English Translation: → English: beef + Malay: serunding from english beef meat from any bovine species, such as cattle ← old french buef cow; cattle ← latin bōs cow; cattle + malay serunding spiced grated coconut condiment ← javanese ꦱꦿꦸꦤ꧀ꦢꦺꦁ srundèng spiced grated coconut condiment
Words.Definition: a highly savoury Malay and Indonesian condiment made from dried pulled beef and grated coconut fried or toasted with a rempah (spice mixture) until it dry
Words.Example: Beef Serunding is easy to store. You can eat it with ketupat, rice, porridge or bread. You can eat it with Nasi Ulam. If you add in more oil, it will keep well and become the "XO Sauce" from your fridge. Every meal with beef serenading can be appetising.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 背多分 jyutping: bui3 do1 fan1 + 贝多芬 貝多芬 jyutping: bui3 do1 fan1 ← German: Beethoven from cantonese (jyutping) 背多分 bui3 do1 fan1 (slang) sb. (usu. a girl) who only looks good from behind ← cantonese (jyutping) 背 bui3 back + cantonese (jyutping) 多 do1 more; many + cantonese (jyutping) 分 fan1 points + cantonese (jyutping) 贝多芬 貝多芬 bui3 do1 fan1 Ludwig van Beethoven ← german Beethoven surname; surname of composer Ludwig van Beethoven ← dutch beet beet; beetroot ← latin bēta beet; beetroot + dutch hoven farms
Words.Definition: someone (usually female) who only looks good when viewed from the back
Words.Example: Cannot say beethoven lah… because beethoven is for back nice front cui people. u haven’t verify the front really cui ma. It’s still an unknown variable. Only thing we can confirm now is the back view jin nice

Words.Word: beh hei ji 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 马花糋 馬花糋 poj: bé-hoe-chìⁿ from hokkien (poj) 马花糋 馬花糋 bé-hoe-chìⁿ butterfly fritter ← hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 花 花 hoe flower + hokkien (poj) 糋 糋 chìⁿ deep-fry; deep-fried food
Words.Definition: a deep-fried dough fritter snack topped with sesame seeds and sometimes stuffed with a filling of sugar and sesame seeds. It has a crispy texture and a sweeter dough than closely related foods like you char kway, and is traditionally fried in coconut oil. The dough is shaped into roughly square or rectangular pieces, and two collinear slits are cut into opposite faces. Alternatively, it may be made from two pieces of dough twisted and conjoined together at a point in the middle. As it puffs and splits open along this line or seam during the deep-frying process, it takes on a shape resembling a butterfly, and thus is commonly known as a butterfly fritter. It is likely of Hockchew or some other Fujianese origin.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 马经 馬經 poj: bé-keng from hokkien (poj) 马经 馬經 bé-keng horse racing manual; horse form (records) ← hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 经 經 keng sacred religious texts; classical; bible
Words.Definition: horse racing manuals, or horse forms (records of racehorses and their results). Usually refers to a newspaper, especially one prominently covering horseracing or other betting sports' results.
Words.Example: Oi, stop bringing the beh keng into the toilet when you do your business. How I read after that?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 马票 馬票 poj: bé-pio from hokkien (poj) 马票 馬票 bé-pio horse racing betting ticket; (in gen.) lottery ticket ← hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 票 票 pio ticket
Words.Definition: ellipsis of tioh beh pio
Words.Example: And ya, he's very chatty, will talk about anything... including beh pio!!! We just had a chat about it yesterday when I dropped by, because my mum's place is near one outlet that recently sold a bunch of winning tickets...

Words.Word: beh teh soh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 马蹄酥 馬蹄酥 poj: bé-tê-so͘ from hokkien (poj) 马蹄酥 馬蹄酥 bé-tê-so͘ beh teh soh; a small, round, and hollow pastry with a dense, flaky, and crispy crust, filled with a sweet and sticky filling made of scallion oil and malt ← hokkien (poj) 马蹄 馬蹄 bé-tê horse hoof + hokkien (poj) 酥 酥 so͘ flaky pastry; crispy
Words.Definition: a small, round, and hollow pastry with a dense, flaky, and crispy crust, filled with a sweet and sticky filling made of scallion oil and malt. The top of the pastry is usually decorated with a red stamp or sesame seeds.Similar to pong piah, which mostly differs in that it is around twice the size of beh teh soh and has a less crispy crust.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: belacan from malay belacan a Malay fermented shrimp paste
Words.Definition: a Malay fermented shrimp paste, used as a condiment in cooking or sauces like sambal belacan.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: belakang + mari from malay belakang back; rear + malay mari come
Words.Definition: to come from behind; to go from the rear
Words.Example: OK, once you make the turn, (or rather first nine, please don’t get confused with our belakang-mari method), the course opens up and you definitely feel less claustrophobic.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: belanja from malay belanja spend; pay out; expenditure ← pali valañja spend

Words.Example: - Some of us are going out after work for dinner, don't say I bo jio! - It's ok lah, I'm trying to reduce my expenses this month, so I'm gonna cook at home. - Don't worry, hear say lim peh getting promoted. This round I belanja everybody one!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: belinjo/belinjau/melinjo from malay belinjo/belinjau/melinjo Gnetum gnemon, a tree with bitter but edible seeds
Words.Definition: the bitter seeds of Gnetum gnemon, which are most commonly eaten by smashing them together into flat discs and then deep-frying them to make a keropok sometimes known as emping
Words.Example: Most of the kropok sell at $5 a kg while belinjo or emping costs $8 a kg.

Words.English Translation: → English: bell curve + god from english bell curve shape produced by a normal distribution ← english bell metal object in the shape of an inverted cup with a flared rim that produces a musical tone when struck + english curve continuous line bending with no angles ← latin curvus bent; curved + english god male religious deity
Words.Definition: a fictional deity who has control over the normalization and moderation systems used in grading examinations (commonly construed by students to be based off a normal distribution, hence the name 'bell curve'), and who is ironically prayed to by Singaporean students for better grades and results during examination periods. The deity may be represented in various forms, with popular ones including an avocado keychain under a tree (at NTU) and a lion in an academic gown (at SMU), and is often enshrined and given various jocular offerings such as tidbits or Pocky sticks as faux joss sticks.[1]

Words.Word: belly button biscuits 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: belly button + biscuit ↻ Cantonese: 肚脐饼 肚臍餅 jyutping: tou5 ci4 beng2 from english belly button umbilicus; navel ← english belly stomach; abdomen + english button small knob or disc used to fasten clothing ← old french boton button; bud + english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread + latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times ← latin coctus cook ↻ cantonese (jyutping) 肚脐饼 肚臍餅 tou5 ci4 beng2 small, light, airy, round biscuit ← cantonese (jyutping) 肚脐 肚臍 tou5 ci4 belly button; navel + cantonese (jyutping) 饼 餅 beng2 cookie; biscuit
Words.Definition: small, airy, round biscuits in the shape of an oblate spheroid or scallop about 1.5 cm in diameter
Words.Example: The original came in a rectangular tin and did not have the icing on top. I think it was from Jacob's. Called "tol chi peang" or belly button biscuit in Cantonese.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Beng + English: -ified from singlish Beng of or relating to young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese men ← hokkien (poj) 明 bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name + english -ified (suffix) made into or done ← old french -ifier (suffix) make into or do ← latin -ificare (suffix) make into or do
Words.Definition: past participle and simple past of ah bengify

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Beng + English: -ify from singlish Beng of or relating to young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese men ← hokkien (poj) 明 bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name + english -ify (suffix) make into or do ← old french -ifier (suffix) make into or do ← latin -ificare (suffix) make into or do

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bengkok from malay bengkok bent; not straight; crooked, (fig.) not honest

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Beng + English: English from singlish Beng of or relating to young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese men ← hokkien (poj) 明 bêng young, stereotypically uncouth, unrefined, and gangsterlike Chinese man; stereotypically common male given name + english English language originating in England, now widely spoken across the world
Words.Definition: a broken version of English spoken by Ah Bengs, Ah Lians, and their ilk who stereotypically do not speak English or have a poor command of English, and which thus has typical features of a language spoken at low proficiency by non-native speakers — having an inconsistent sentence structure, poor grammar, nonstandard pronunciations, a substitution of vocabulary for terms in the speaker's native language(s) (usually one or more of the Chinese languages), etc., and is peppered with vulgarities and crude language
Words.Example: The Ah Beng are famous for their colourful language, which can reduce the most fearsome of pirates into nervous wrecks. Most of their language revolves around mothers, genitals and procreation. The most famous of these is KNNCCB. Other than their mother tongue of Hokkien, Teochew, Hakka or Cantonese, they speak a form of english called Benglish.

Words.Definition: (military, humorous) a beret

Words.Definition: arrogant; big-headed; stubborn

Words.English Translation: → English: best from english best superlative of ‘good’; most good

Related: best in Singapore, JB, and some say Batam

Words.English Translation: → Indonesian / malay / betawi: Betawi + Malay: laksa from indonesian / malay / betawi Betawi of or relating to the native people of Batavia (modern day Jakarta) ← javanese ꦧꦠꦮꦶ Batawi Batavia ← dutch Batavia former name of Jakarta ← latin Batā̆via land of the Batā̆vi tribe (modern day Nijmegen) + malay laksa spicy soup noodle dish ← hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 辣沙 la̍t-sa spicy and grainy or classical persian Possible, but not certain لاکچه lākča noodles

Words.Definition: to send a blind carbon copy of an email

Words.English Translation: → English: boy + girl + relationship from english boy young male person + english girl young female person + english relationship a romantic or sexual association between people
Words.Definition: (abbreviation) a relationship between a young male and female person, such as between teenagers. Usually in the context of discussing issues that arise in such relationships.

Words.English Translation: → Punjabi: ਭਾਈ bhāī from punjabi ਭਾਈ bhāī brother; mister; sir ← sanskrit भ्रातृ bhrā́tṛ brother; kinsman; (fig.) friend
Words.Definition: a Sikh man; term of address of endearment for a Sikh person

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bhai + Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h + 色 poj: sek from singlish bhai (poss. derog.) Sikh man ← punjabi ਭਾਈ bhāī brother; mister; sir ← sanskrit भ्रातृ bhrā́tṛ brother; kinsman; (fig.) friend + hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 色 sek colour
Words.Definition: (racist) a children's game played when someone spots a man (usually Sikh) wearing a turban; they then pinch a friend and ask 'bhai si mi sek', and do not let go until the pinched companion replies with the colour of the turban that was spotted
Words.Example: Indians tend to get seen instead as inherently funny- the very fact of our Indian-ness becomes the joke. Like for example when almost any of us was in school and some kid makes an announcement in Tamil (because of some Indian cultural society stuff or what) and everyone giggles. Or (for a non Tamil example) Bhai simi sek.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𫧃晓䆀 𣍐曉䆀 poj: bōe-hiáu-bái from hokkien (poj) 𫧃晓䆀 𣍐曉䆀 bōe-hiáu-bái arrogant; shameless ← hokkien (poj) 𫧃晓 𣍐曉 bōe-hiáu not know how to; unable to + hokkien (poj) 䆀 䆀 bái bad; disappointing; difficult
Words.Definition: abbreviation of buay hiao bai
Words.Example: Knn, all these ****ing jokesters. All wanna BHB step FO when the reality is far away from your imagination.

Words.English Translation: → English: baby from english baby term of endearment or affection for a romantic partner; recently-born child
Words.Definition: term of endearment or affection for a romantic partner
Words.Example: Bi, my mummy want to meet you soon; you next week how?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: biadab from malay biadab rude; insolent; uncivilized ← persian بی‌ادب bi-adab rude; impolite ← persian بیـ bi- -less; un-; without + persian ادب adab civility; courtesy; manners ← arabic أَدَب ʔadab civility; courtesy; manners ← classical persian دَب dab civility; courtesy; manners ← sumerian 𒁾 dub tablet
Words.Definition: impolite; uncivilized; insolent
Words.Example: “Ha! Take down the title. Go and buy and read it. Then you won’t be so biadap next time! We will hear the transfer application first.,” he barked. “Give them a date,” he said to the court interpreter who duly obliged.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin / hokkien: 变态 變態 pinyin: biàn tài from mandarin / hokkien (pinyin) 变态 變態 biàn tài abnormal; twisted; perverse; lecher
Words.Definition: a pervert; a lecher
Words.Example: the one who says others are very bian tai, are usally themselves the most bian tai. [sic]

Words.Word: bian tai shu shu 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 变态 變態 pinyin: biàn tài + 叔叔 變態 pinyin: shū shu from mandarin (pinyin) 变态 變態 biàn tài abnormal; twisted; perverse; lecher + mandarin (pinyin) 叔叔 變態 shū shu uncle; paternal uncle
Words.Definition: a pervert; a dirty old man; a lecher
Words.Example: I always tell my kid to be wary of bian tai shu shu and voice it out if molested, as a general reminder.

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: bibik from baba malay bibik respectful or endearing term of address for an older woman; madam; auntie; lady ← malay bibi respectful term of address for an older woman; madam; lady ← old persian Likely, but other possible etymologies exist بی‌بی bi-bi respectful term of address for an older woman; madam; matron
Words.Definition: an older (especially Peranakan) woman
Words.Example: "They were quite verbal, not like our audiences today where everybody is still. The bibiks, especially, were very loud and not shy when they talked." Bibiks are Peranakan women of a certain age, who are known to be feisty and loud.

Words.English Translation: → English: bicycle + MRT + walk from english bicycle two-wheeled pedal-propelled vehicle ← french bicycle bicycle ← french bi- two ← latin bi- cycle + french cycle cycle; circle ← latin cyclus circle; circular obj. ← ancient greek κῠ́κλος kŭ́klos + english MRT Singapore’s public train system ← english Mass Rapid Transit Singapore’s public train system ← english mass large group, body, or quantity + english rapid quick; fast + english transit transport; move from one place to another + english walk locomote by stepping one foot in front of the other while keeping the other planted on the ground
Words.Definition: (humorous) three of the most affordable means of transport in Singapore
Words.Example: Multi-modal travel (Bicycle – MRT – Walk) is an option that sometimes can be faster and more convenient than driving ... An “end to end” transport solution and no parking woes.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bidik + kacang from malay bidik stare at; look at; aim at + malay kacang bean; nut; peanut
Words.Definition: meddlesome; annoying
Words.Example: Bladi Gahmen si peh kaypoh one, why always so bedek kacang horh?

Words.English Translation: → English: big + cannon + fairy ↻ Hokkien: 大炮仙 poj: tōa-phàu-sian from english big large; important; great + english cannon large gun used to fire ballistic projectiles ← old french canon cannon; tube ← old italian cannone cannon; tube ← latin canna reed; cane ← ancient greek κᾰ́ννᾱ kánnā reed; cane ← akkadian 𒂵𒉡𒌑𒌝 qanûm reed; cane + english fairy mythical being; immortal being in Chinese mythology ← old french faerie magical realm of the fae ← latin fāta goddess of fate; fairy; fae ↻ hokkien (poj) 大炮仙 tōa-phàu-sian braggart; bigmouth; boaster; braggadocio ← hokkien (poj) 大炮 tōa-phàu cannon, (fig.) braggart ← hokkien (poj) 仙 sian immortal; deity; fairy
Words.Definition: (metaphor) a braggart; a bigmouth; a boastful person
Words.Example: usually they are tua pao sianmy reservist pc is one...say until he is like some investing expert but when others asked him to show his portfolio, he just kept deflecting the request.

Words.English Translation: → English: big + fuck from english big significant; important; great; huge + english fuck (vulgar) intj. expressing dismay or anger; a contemptible person; sexual intercourse
Words.Definition: (vulgar) a term of disdain for a VIP
Words.Example: so... u own a condo & a ferrari, big fuck?

Words.English Translation: → English: big + size from english big large; huge + english size dimensions of sth.
Words.Definition: (of a person) considerably larger than average; fat, chubby, stocky, muscular, jacked, wide, or imposing etc.
Words.Example: When I first won, I asked my mother, who is quite big sized, what she wanted ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bingka + Indonesian / malay: Ambon from malay bingka type of cake made with rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar + indonesian / malay Ambon island and city in Maluku, Indonesia ← ambonese malay ombong dew[2]
Words.Definition: variant of kueh bingka ambon
Words.Example: I came across Bika Ambon when I first went to Medan, Indonesia for work. At the airport coming home, I saw everyone make a beeline to buy boxes of this golden honeycomb cake at the duty free shops.

Words.English Translation: → English: bimbotic from english bimbotic like or relating to a bimbo ← english bimbo conventionally attractive but vacuous and naive woman ← italian bimbo (onom.) male child; baby + english -tic (suffix) forms adj. from noun ending in -o ← ancient greek -τῐκός -tĭkós (suffix) forms adj. from word ending in vowel
Words.Definition: (of a girl or woman) bimboish; ditzy; airheaded; conventionally attractive, but unintelligent, vacuous, and naive
Words.Example: In fact, the MediaCorp artiste does such a good job playing the two loveable bimbos, it's almost easy to assume she's probably as perpetually sunshine-y bimbotic in real life.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 面臭臭 poj: bīn-chhàu-chhàu from hokkien (poj) 面臭臭 bīn-chhàu-chhàu black-faced; having a sour expression; scowling; glowering; sulking; gloomy ← hokkien (poj) 臭面 chhàu-bīn scowling, glowering, sulking, gloomy, black etc. face ← hokkien (poj) 臭 chhàu smelly; ugly; bad; detestable + hokkien (poj) 面 bīn face
Words.Definition: black-faced; having a sour expression; scowling; glowering; sulking; gloomy
Words.Example: izit because they see your face then they bin chao chao? then it can only mean u got a kiampa face.

Words.English Translation: → English: bird + Singlish: ku ku bird from english bird (slang) penis + singlish ku ku bird (childish) penis, especially that of a young boy ← hokkien (poj) 咕咕鸟 咕咕鳥 ku-kú-chiáu (childish) penis, especially that of a young boy
Words.Definition: (childish, vulgar) a penis, especially that of a young boy
Words.Example: Cher! Ivan whack my bird bird!

Words.Word: bird don't lay egg 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: bird + don't + lay eggs ↻ Mandarin: 鸟不生蛋 鳥不生蛋 pinyin: niǎo bù shēng dàn from english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs + english don't contraction of 'do not' ← english do aux. syntactic marker + english not used to negate a verb + english lay eggs deposit eggs (female reproductive cells) outside the body ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 鸟不生蛋 鳥不生蛋 niǎo bù shēng dàn (idiom) desc. a barren, uninhabited place with nothing to want ← mandarin (pinyin) 鸟 鳥 niǎo bird + mandarin (pinyin) 不 不 bù do not + mandarin (pinyin) 生蛋 生蛋 shēng dàn lay eggs
Words.Definition: (idiom, hyperbole) used to describe a place that is extremely remote, nearly uninhabited, with nothing good to offer, and where nothing of interest ever happens
Words.Example: Sometime he travel to "Bird don't lay egg" country, so be a bit patient and I think he'll contact you asap.
Related: bird don't lay egg, dog don't shit

Words.Word: bird don't lay egg, dog don't shit 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: bird + don't + lay eggs + dog + don't + shit ↻ Mandarin: 鸟不生蛋, 狗不拉屎 鳥不生蛋, 狗不拉屎 pinyin: niǎo bù shēng dàn, gǒu bù lā shǐ from english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs + english don't contraction of 'do not' ← english do aux. syntactic marker + english not used to negate a verb + english lay eggs deposit eggs (female reproductive cells) outside the body + english dog Canis lupus familiaris + english don't contraction of 'do not' ← english do aux. syntactic marker + english not used to negate a verb + english shit defecate; excrete faeces; poop ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 鸟不生蛋, 狗不拉屎 鳥不生蛋, 狗不拉屎 niǎo bù shēng dàn, gǒu bù lā shǐ (idiom) desc. a barren, uninhabited place with nothing to want ← mandarin (pinyin) 鸟 鳥 niǎo bird + mandarin (pinyin) 不 不 bù do not + mandarin (pinyin) 生蛋 生蛋 shēng dàn lay eggs + mandarin (pinyin) 狗 狗 gǒu dog + mandarin (pinyin) 不 不 bù do not + mandarin (pinyin) 拉屎 拉屎 lā shǐ defecate; excrete faeces; poop
Words.Definition: (idiom, hyperbole) used to describe a place that is extremely remote, nearly uninhabited, with nothing good to offer, and where nothing of interest ever happens
Words.Example: Why you move to Yew Tee? Happening meh? I thought over there like bird don't lay egg, dog don't shit.
Related: because the sky is so high, the bird shit in your eye

Words.English Translation: → English: bird + talk ↻ Hokkien: 鸟话 鳥話 poj: chiáu ōe from english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs + english talk speak; chat ↻ hokkien (poj) 鸟话 鳥話 chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense; rubbish; nonsense; drivel ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language
Words.Definition: rubbish; nonsense
Words.Example: Edmwers all veri pandai ... Give bird talk replies
Related: talk cock sing song play ping pong

Words.English Translation: → Malay: biskut + dahlia from malay biskut biscuit ← english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook + malay dahlia plant in the genus Dahlia, esp. its flower ← english dahlia plant in the genus Dahlia, esp. its flower ← swedish Dahl surname of botanist Anders Dahl ← swedish dal valley; dale ← old norse dalr valley; dale
Words.Definition: a custard butter cookie traditionally enjoyed during Hari Raya, made in the shape of a piped star, and often decorated with a small cube of cherry in its centre. It is named after its similarity in appearance to a dahlia flower.
Words.Example: Both Primary and Secondary students also tried Hari Raya goodies such as Kuih Tart Nenas, Biskut Dahlia, Cornflake cookies and more.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: biskut + piring from malay biskut biscuit ← english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook + malay piring plate; saucer; small dish ← classical persian پرنگ piring copper
Words.Definition: a flat, light, circular wafer, usually attractively coloured with red, yellow, or green food colouring, mildly sweetened, and sometimes flavoured
Words.Example: I used to see packets of these hanging by the roti man’s truck and wondered if they were edible. Well, of course you can eat them! Each and every biskut piring is light and crispy, and every bite would leave some sticking to your tongue.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: biskut + semperit from malay biskut biscuit ← english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook + malay semperit extruded; piped ← malay Likely, but other possible etymologies exist sempit tight; narrow
Words.Definition: a custard butter cookie traditionally enjoyed during Hari Raya, made in the shape of a piped star, and often decorated with a small cube of cherry in its centre
Words.Example: Viewers will have the opportunity to learn from a professional Anchor chef on how to make Biskut Semperit Lemak Bercheese, the perfect creamy butter cookie to share with loved ones this Eid al-Fitr.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: biskut + telinga + gajah from malay biskut biscuit ← english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook + malay telinga ear + malay gajah elephant; giant ← sanskrit गज gaja elephant
Words.Definition: a hard, mildly savoury biscuit with a cupped or shell-like shape made from wheat and/or soya bean flour, often with a spiral pattern, said to resemble an ear
Words.Example: Telinga Gajah, or otherwise known as 👂耳朵饼 is a favourite among South east Asia with their long history. One of the all time favourite in our store and a great munching experience for you to satisfy your cravings!

Words.English Translation: → English: bitter + gourd ↻ General chinese: 苦瓜 pinyin: kǔ guā from english bitter acrid-tasting + english gourd fruit with a hard shell or rind ← anglo-norman gourde gourd ← latin cucurbita gourd ↻ general chinese (pinyin) 苦瓜 kǔ guā bitter gourd (edible fruit of the Momordica charantia vine) ← general chinese (pinyin) 苦 kǔ bitter + general chinese (pinyin) 瓜 guā melon; gourd; squash
Words.Definition: the edible fruit of the Momordica charantia vine, usually green and oblong, with a bumpy texture on the outside and a hollow cavity on the inside. It is quite bitter, but is a popular ingredient in cooking, where its bitterness can be reduced through preparation techniques such as soaking in water.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bun knife from singlish bun knife rat out; tell on others; backstab ← english bun small roll of bread ← anglo-norman / old french bugne bump on head; sweet dough fritter + english knife sharp tool for cutting ← old norse knífr knife ↻ hokkien (poj) 包刀 pau-to rat out; tell on others; backstab ← hokkien (poj) 包 pau cover; wrap; conceal; bun + hokkien (poj) 刀 to knife; blade
Words.Definition: abbreviation of bun knife

Words.English Translation: → Singlish / english: bak kut teh from singlish / english bak kut teh soup made of boiled pork ribs, garlic, and white pepper ← hokkien (poj) 肉骨茶 bah-kut-tê bak kut teh; a soup made of boiled pork ribs, garlic, and white pepper ← hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 肉骨地 bah-kut-tē Teh's pork ribs ← hokkien (poj) 肉骨 bah-kut pork ribs + hokkien (poj) 李文地 lí bûn-tē Lee Boon Teh or hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 茶 tê tea
Words.Definition: abbreviation of bak kut teh.
Words.Example: Their Classic Bak Kut Teh ($6.70) is a no-frills rendition of the dish, with strong peppery notes and juicy pork ribs to satisfy your BKT cravings.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 不可以 pinyin: bù ké yǐ from mandarin (pinyin) 不可以 bù ké yǐ cannot ← mandarin (pinyin) 不 bù not; do not + mandarin (pinyin) 可以 ké yǐ can; able to
Words.Definition: cannot; may not; not allowed to

Words.Word: black and white 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: black + and + white ↻ Hokkien: 乌抑白抑 烏抑白抑 poj: o͘-iah-pe̍h-iah from english black darkest colour or shade which absorbs all light + english and conj. used to connect two elements together + english white bright and colourless; diffusely reflecting a mixture of all colours in the spectrum of visible light ↻ hokkien (poj) 乌抑白抑 烏抑白抑 o͘-iah-pe̍h-iah children's game played by holding out one hand and flipping it on each syllable ← hokkien (poj) 乌 烏 o͘ black; dark + hokkien (poj) 抑 抑 iah and; then; and then + hokkien (poj) 白 白 pe̍h white + hokkien (poj) 抑 抑 iah and; then; and then
Words.Definition: a children's game where players stand in a circle, each holding out one hand with the palm either facing up or down. They then begin chanting a set phrase in unison while flipping their hand rhythmically on each syllable (or at random if they so please). On the final syllable of the chant, all players stop flipping their hands, leaving a random distribution of players having their palms either facing down ("black") or up ("white"). This may then be used for any required purpose, most commonly for randomly splitting the group into two teams according to "black" and "white".

Words.Word: black dog egg 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 乌狗 烏狗 poj: o͘-káu + 卵 poj: nn̄g from hokkien (poj) 乌狗 烏狗 o͘-káu (MY) Guinness stout, (lit.) black dog ← hokkien (poj) 乌 烏 o͘ black + hokkien (poj) 狗 狗 káu dog + hokkien (poj) 卵 nn̄g egg
Words.Definition: Guinness stout with a raw egg cracked into it, once popular among blue-collar workers as it was said to give one energy and improve virility
Words.Example: That’s “black dog egg” for you or Guinness Stout with an egg (raw, at that!). And why do people drink it? To enhance energy in certain parts of the body.

Words.English Translation: → English: black [in the] face & Cantonese: 黑面 jyutping: hak1 min6 & Mandarin: 黑脸 黑臉 pinyin: hēi liǎn from english black [in the] face angry; glowering; sullen ← english black gloomy; sullen; dark + english face facial expression & cantonese (jyutping) 黑面 hak1 min6 scowl; sulk; glower ← cantonese (jyutping) 黑 hak1 black + cantonese (jyutping) 面 min6 face & mandarin (pinyin) 黑脸 黑臉 hēi liǎn scowl; displeased expression ← mandarin (pinyin) 黑 黑 hēi black + mandarin (pinyin) 脸 臉 liǎn face
Words.Definition: a scowling, sulking, glowering, angry, unhappy etc. face; a sour expression
Words.Example: About a year ago, however, the anger subsided. It was replaced by what my colleagues refer to as my “black face” and what my wife calls “the sulk”. Well, I have improved, going from active to passive anger.

Words.English Translation: → English: black + fungus from english black darkest colour or shade which absorbs all light + english fungus member of the kingdom Fungi ← latin fungus mushroom; fungal infection
Words.Definition: Any edible member of the genus Auricularia, especially A. heimuer, A. nigricans, A. cornea, and A. villosula. When cooked, it retains a desirable crunchy, slightly-gelatinous texture. A popular ingredient in many Chinese foods, such as stir-fries, soups, cold dishes, etc.

Words.English Translation: → English: black sesame + paste from english black sesame variety of Sesamum indicum with a black hull ← english black darkest colour or shade which absorbs all light + english sesame Sesamum indicum, esp. its edible seed ← latin sēsamum sesame ← ancient greek σήσᾰμον sḗsămon sesame ← old aramaic שוּשמא šūššmā sesame ← akkadian 𒊭𒈦𒌑𒈬 šamaššammū oil-producing plant, e.g. sesame + english paste soft, malleable or fluid mixture ← old french paste pastry; paste ← latin pasta paste; dough ← ancient greek παστά pastá porridge
Words.Definition: a thick, sweet Cantonese tong sui or dessert soup made from black sesame seeds ground into a paste with rice flour and sugar syrup; black sesame soup
Words.Example: The menu here is extensive; customers can choose from a bowl of black sesame paste to walnut, white fungus and papaya sweet soup to a steamed milk custard.

Words.English Translation: → English: black + spider from english black darkest colour or shade which absorbs all light + english spider any member of the order Araneae
Words.Definition: a dark soft drink, such as Sarsi or a cola, topped with a scoop of ice cream; a cola float
Words.Example: White Spider? Black Spider?🕷Relak bro, we are not hosting Fear Factor at Al-Azhar! Cool yourself down and enjoy these specialty drinks on a hot day, made from Sprite or Coke with ice cream on top.

Words.English Translation: → German: Blanco from german Blanco brand of correction fluid
Words.Definition: correction fluid or correction tape
Words.Example: During my times, correction fluid is a must-have in our pencil case because when we make a mistake in writing in our exercise book, we cannot just cancel it. If we do, our teacher will just return the exercise book back to us to “blanco” or “liquid” (terms we used, which means “erasing off” the error written in ink) and re-write the answers.

Words.English Translation: → English: blank from english blank expressionless (due to inability to understand); confounded, (of a mind) void; empty
Words.Definition: unable to comprehend what is going on; confused; having an expression suggesting obliviousness and that one's mind is void of thoughts

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blank + English: face from singlish blank confused; unable to comprehend what is going on ← english blank expressionless (due to inability to understand); confounded, (of a mind) void; empty + english face facial expression
Words.Definition: a facial expression indicating confusion, obliviousness, or inability to understand something
Words.Example: So the next time that you’re asked whether you have any questions, don’t get caught staring back with a blank face. Take your interviewers by surprise and bring out a few of these questions!

Words.English Translation: → English: blank + file from english blank empty; void; unoccupied + english file a column of people arranged one after the other ← french file a row of objects arranged one after another ← latin filum string; thread; fibre
Words.Definition: (military) a file in a rank-file formation where there is no one in the centre or rear rank, due to the indivisibility of the total number of soldiers in formation by the number of ranks (three, in the SAF).

Words.English Translation: → English: blanket party from english blanket party (military) form of hazing or retaliation performed on a sleeping or unsuspecting victim ← english blanket a large piece of fabric used to cover the body, usually for warmth, while sleeping + english party (military) detachment of soldiers gathered for a particular purpose; a gathering of people, typically participating in some activity ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division
Words.Definition: (military) a form of hazing, retaliation, or punishment performed by a group of peers on a sleeping or unsuspecting victim, which usually involves the victim being covered in a blanket, restrained, and beaten.
Words.Example: After his negligence resulted in the whole platoon being placed on SOL, the whole bunk subjected Arjun to a blanket party that night.

Words.English Translation: → English: brother from english brother male sibling; term of address or endearment for a male person
Words.Definition: term of address or endearment for a male person
Words.Example: alamak, sorry lah blarder. I apologize to you.

Words.English Translation: → English: block + Singlish: catching from english block a large building, esp. containing flats, apartments, offices, etc. + singlish catching a children's game (variously known as 'tag', 'it', 'tick', etc. in other English-speaking countries)
Words.Definition: A variation of catching, so named because it is played at and around HDB blocks.
Words.Example: Usually, a game of catch would never see completion during our short recess breaks and tend to continue after school. There’s where the fabled, Block Catching, came to be. ... In retrospect, the poor neighbours were the innocent bystanders in this madness.

Words.English Translation: → English: blood rise + go up ↻ Malay: naik darah from english blood rise become angry; start to lose control of emotions ← english blood bodily fluid conveying oxygen and nutrients + english rise go up; ascend + english go up rise; ascend ↻ malay naik darah become angry; lose temper ← malay naik rise; go up; ascend + malay darah blood
Words.Definition: (idiom) to become angry; to lose one's temper
Words.Example: Next, blood go up coz everyday need to think of more bills to pay..

Words.English Translation: → English: blue + ginger ↻ Cantonese: 蓝姜 藍薑 jyutping: lam3 goeng1 from english blue colour between green and violet on the visible light spectrum, approx. 450 - 500 nm in wavelength + english ginger any plant of the genus Zingiberaceae and its edible rhizome ↻ cantonese (jyutping) 蓝姜 藍薑 lam3 goeng1 blue ginger; the rhizome of the Alpinia galanga plant ← general chinese (pinyin) 蓝 藍 lán blue + general chinese (pinyin) 姜 薑 jiāng ginger
Words.Definition: the rhizome of Alpinia galanga, a galangal plant in the ginger family, and also known as lengkuas in Malay. It is used as a spice in many traditional recipes.

Words.English Translation: → English: blue + letter from english blue colour between green and violet on the visible light spectrum, approx. 450 - 500 nm in wavelength + english letter written or printed missive ← old french letre letter (printed character) ← latin littera letter (printed character) or piece of writing
Words.Definition: (medicine) an inpatient consultation referral form
Words.Example: You have to specifically call that doctor who has replied to the initial blue letter. Just flip through the file to look for the ubiquitous blue letter.

Words.English Translation: → English: blue-black from english blue-black dark blue; blue and black ← english blue colour between green and violet on the visible light spectrum, approx. 450 - 500 nm in wavelength + english black darkest colour or shade which absorbs all light
Words.Definition: (metonym) a bruise; a contusion
Words.Example: The victim shouted because of the pain. The accused said 'sorry'... even though the kick was intentional. As a result of the kick, the victim suffered a blue-black (bruise) on her right knee.

Words.English Translation: → English: bluff from english bluff trick or deceive by pretending to be stronger than one actually is
Words.Definition: to lie; to deceive; to fool
Words.Example: Don't try to bluff me! I know you never come that day.

Words.English Translation: → English: blur from english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy
Words.Definition: confused; oblivious; slow to think; absentminded
Words.Example: I am really blur about geography and used to fail the subject in school. ... I’m so blur, I didn’t know they existed.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + English: blob from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + english blob vaguely bulbous or amorphous body, (slang) gen. term of insult or chiding
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded fool
Words.Example: The good news also is that my circuit, which did me in previously, was perfect. The not-so-good news is that I am quite a blur blob speed demon on the road.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + cock from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + singlish cock (vulgar) idiot; contemptible person ← english cock (vulgar) idiot; contemptible person
Words.Definition: (vulgar) someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot.
Words.Example: How to stop being a blur cock? ... I realized that I'm significantly blurrer than my fellow soldiers. ... How do I change it or is blurness innate?

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + Malay: katak from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + malay katak frog; toad
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot
Words.Example: it has been a LONG WHILE since we’ve been here. So when we got here, we blur katak dunno where to go.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + king from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + singlish king (suffix, usu. sarcastic or pejorative) the epitome of sth. ← english king (usu. male) the ruler of a monarchy; a powerful or preeminent person
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + English: like + Malay: sotong from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + english like just as; such as; similar to + malay sotong squid; cuttlefish
Words.Definition: (simile) to be confused, oblivious, or slow to think
Words.Example: Although I act like I’m upset by it at times, I also love the fact that she can be silly and forgetful, really “blur like sotong” sometimes.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + Malay: macam + sotong from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + malay macam like; similar to + malay sotong squid; cuttlefish
Words.Definition: (simile) to be confused, oblivious, or slow to think
Words.Example: He was so confused by all the technical jargon thrown around during the meeting that by the end, his face was completely blur macam sotong.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + queen from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + singlish queen (f., suffix, usu. sarcastic or pejorative) the epitome of sth. ← english queen (f.) ruler of a monarchy; powerful or preeminent person
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot
Words.Example: Boy was I a blur queen today! Can you believe that I happily sat in the train going the wrong direction for awhile..

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + Malay: sotong from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + malay sotong squid; cuttlefish
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: blur + English: toad ↻ Malay: katak from singlish blur confused; oblivious; slow to think ← english blur indistinct; unfocused; hazy + english toad amphibian in the family Bufonidae or related families; any type of frog with warty and dry skin, (slang) detestable person ↻ malay katak frog; toad
Words.Definition: someone who is always confused, oblivious, or slow to think; an absentminded idiot
Words.Example: When some blur toad who will get off the escalator and suddenly stop don't care about people behind

Words.English Translation: → English: bus + MRT + walk from english bus large vehicle for transporting many people along a road ✂ english omnibus large vehicle for transporting many people along a road ← french [voiture] omnibus [vehicle/carriage] for all ← latin omnibus for all + english MRT Singapore’s public train system ← english Mass Rapid Transit Singapore’s public train system ← english mass large group, body, or quantity + english rapid quick; fast + english transit transport; move from one place to another + english walk locomote by stepping one foot in front of the other while keeping the other planted on the ground
Words.Definition: (humorous) Bus, MRT, and/or Walk[ing], three of the most affordable means of transport in Singapore
Words.Example: "BMW" is less comfortable than any BMW car, but more vegan-friendly in a way.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无 無 poj: bô from min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't
Words.Definition: (interrogative) or not?
Words.Example: Sunday want go karaoke?→ Sunday want go karaoke bo?
Related: hum ji bo ji attap chee

Words.Word: bo beh zao 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无马走 無馬走 poj: bô bé cháu from hokkien (poj) 无马走 無馬走 bô bé cháu the very best; top-grade; unbeatable; incomparable ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 走 走 cháu run
Words.Definition: (idiom) the very best; top-grade; unbeatable; incomparable; superb; way ahead of the competition
Words.Example: Her performance in the audition was truly bo beh zao, making the casters' choice of who would play the lead role a no-brainer.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无面 無面 poj: bô-bīn from hokkien (poj) 无面 無面 bô-bīn shamed; humiliated; lost face ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; without + hokkien (poj) 面 面 bīn face; (fig.) dignity; reputation; face
Words.Definition: shamed; humiliated; lost face

Words.Word: bo cheng hu 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无政府 無政府 poj: bô-chèng-hú from hokkien (poj) 无政府 無政府 bô-chèng-hú anarchic; lawless; delinquent ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; without + hokkien (poj) 政府 政府 chèng-hú government
Words.Definition: (often humorous) anarchic; lawless; chaotic
Words.Example: Mr Speaker, Sir, ... If somebody has a traffic offence, he will come to you and say, "Please, can you waive the demerit points?" If we waive all the demerit points, we would be in a state of anarchy, "bo cheng hu".

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无插 無插 poj: bô-chhap from hokkien (poj) 无插 無插 bô-chhap indifferent; pay no heed; ignore ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 插 插 chhap pay attention or heed to; take notice of
Words.Definition: indifferent; unbothered; paying no heed to; couldn't care less
Words.Example: Many people are bo chap about safety, until they get hit with the fine or the consequences.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无闲 無閒 poj: bô-êng from hokkien (poj) 无闲 無閒 bô-êng not free; busy; have no free time ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 闲 閒 êng not busy; idle; unoccupied; leisurely; free time
Words.Definition: not free; busy; occupied; have no spare time
Words.Example: - Want to watch the new Avengers next Thursday? - I this week bo eng, sorry.
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无牙 無牙 poj: bô-gê from hokkien (poj) 无牙 無牙 bô-gê toothless; having missing teeth ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 牙 牙 gê tooth; teeth
Words.Definition: toothless; having missing teeth
Words.Example: Bogay is a medium fur cat rescued from a restricted area. He was found badly matted with very bad rotten teeth. He has had the bad teeth removed and eats both kibble and wet food. Voraciously. His one true love is food.

Words.Word: bo he hae ma ho 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无鱼，虾嘛好 無魚，蝦嘛好 poj: bô hîr, hê mā hó from hokkien (poj) 无鱼，虾嘛好 無魚，蝦嘛好 bô hîr, hê mā hó (proverb) it is alright to settle for something less; better to have something than nothing ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 鱼 魚 hîr fish + hokkien (poj) 虾 蝦 hê prawn; shrimp + hokkien (poj) 嘛 嘛 mā also + hokkien (poj) 好 好 hó good; alright
Words.Definition: it is alright to settle for something less than optimal; better to have something than nothing at all

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无𫝺/甩 無𫝺/甩 poj: bô-hiù from hokkien (poj) 无𫝺/甩 無𫝺/甩 bô-hiù indifferent; pay no heed; ignore ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 𫝺/甩 𫝺/甩 hiù (vulgar) pay attention or heed to; take notice of
Words.Definition: (vulgar) indifferent; unbothered; paying no heed to; couldn't care less
Words.Example: once i saw is china project ... i already bo hiu liao

Words.Word: bo ho mia 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无 無 poj: bô + 好命 poj: hó-miā from min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + min nan (poj) 好命 hó-miā having a fortunate and comfortable life ← min nan (poj) 好 hó good; great; well + min nan (poj) 命 miā life; fate; luck
Words.Definition: having a misfortunate, uncomfortable, and difficult life
Words.Example: "Bonhomie lah," Hee-haw sian jit puah went on. "French for bo ho mia," he exprained. "I not compraining, but is Liddat Lor."

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无核 無核 poj: bô-hu̍t from hokkien (poj) 无核 無核 bô-hu̍t cowardly ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; none + hokkien (poj) 核 核 hu̍t kernel; nut; stone
Words.Definition: (vulgar, of males) cowardly; lacking courage; scared

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无划 無划 poj: bô-hôa from hokkien (poj) 无划 無划 bô-hôa not profitable; not a good deal ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 划 划 hôa profitable; a good deal
Words.Definition: not worth it; not a good deal; more trouble than it's worth

Words.Word: bo huat tor 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无法度 無法度 poj: bô-hoat-tō͘ from hokkien (poj) 无法度 無法度 bô-hoat-tō͘ no means; no way ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; none + hokkien (poj) 法度 法度 hoat-tō͘ means; way ← hokkien (poj) 法 法 hoat means; way + hokkien (poj) 度 度 tō͘ (Buddhism) deliverance; salvation
Words.Definition: beyond help or redemption; there is nothing that can be done; there is no other way
Words.Example: Then the teacher told her of that her daughter is problematic and mixing with the sam-seng. The mother shot back, "she not pregnant yet wat, why you so kan cheong... waste my time!"Bo huat tor...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无 無 poj: bô + English: idea from hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + english idea notion; thought; clue ← latin idea idea; notion ← ancient greek ἰδέα idéa idea; notion
Words.Definition: stupid; clueless; brainless; idiotic

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无子 無子 poj: bô-chí from hokkien (poj) 无子 無子 bô-chí (vulgar, lit.) lack testicles; (vulgar, fig.) cowardly ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 子 子 chí testicle ✂ hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬子 𡳞脬子 lān-pha-chí testicle
Words.Definition: (vulgar, of males) cowardly; lacking courage; scared
Related: hum ji bo ji attap chee

Words.Word: bo jiak png 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无 無 poj: bô + 食饭 食飯 poj: chia̍h-pn̄g from min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 食饭 食飯 chia̍h-pn̄g eat (rice)
Words.Definition: (idiom) tired; weak; lacking energy (from not having eaten)
Words.Example: Eh you today bo jiak png isit? The table also not like very heavy one leh...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无招 無招 poj: bô-chio from hokkien (poj) 无招 無招 bô-chio to not invite sb. along to a social event ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 招 招 chio invite; beckon
Words.Definition: to not invite somebody to a social event or activity; to leave someone out when hanging out
Words.Example: Anyone else wants, feel free to come along - entry is free, don't say I bojio hor!

Words.Word: bo ka si 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无教示 無教示 poj: bô-kà-sī from min nan (poj) 无教示 無教示 bô-kà-sī insolent; impolite; poorly brought up ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 教示 教示 kà-sī teach; guide; instruction
Words.Definition: poorly brought up; uncouth; impolite; insolent; disrespectful
Words.Example: BO KAH SI!!! ... Growing up, this is a phrase heard many times in the neighbourhood..many times accompanied with smacking sounds followed immediately by a loud wail!

Words.Word: bo kao khun 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无够困 無夠睏 poj: bô-kàu-khùn from min nan (poj) 无够困 無夠睏 bô-kàu-khùn not enough sleep ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 够 夠 kàu enough + min nan (poj) 困 睏 khùn sleep
Words.Definition: having not enough sleep; sleep-deprived
Words.Example: All the drivers bo gao kun after world cup nights.

Words.Word: bo kho leng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 无可能 無可能 poj: bô-khó-lêng from hokkien / teochew (poj) 无可能 無可能 bô-khó-lêng impossible
Words.Definition: impossible
Words.Example: Bo koleng so swee first mission per year. Make it a random callup, or even better, make it happen in the middle of a major mission.

Words.Word: bo lan hoot 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无𡳞核 無𡳞核 poj: bô-lān-hu̍t from hokkien (poj) 无𡳞核 無𡳞核 bô-lān-hu̍t cowardly ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; none + hokkien (poj) 𡳞核 𡳞核 lān-hu̍t (vg.) testicles
Words.Definition: (vulgar, of males) cowardly; lacking courage; scared

Words.Word: bo lan pa 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无𡳞脬 無𡳞脬 poj: bô-lān-pha from hokkien (poj) 无𡳞脬 無𡳞脬 bô-lān-pha cowardly ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; none + hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 𡳞脬 lān-pha (vg.) scrotum; ballsack; balls
Words.Definition: (vulgar, of males) cowardly; lacking courage; scared

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无侬 無儂 poj: bô-lâng from hokkien (poj) 无侬 無儂 bô-lâng no one; deserted; unpopulated ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person; people; human being
Words.Definition: deserted; devoid of people; having no one around
Words.Example: Some malls are so crowded when they first open, but after a few years they are totally bo lang.

Words.Word: bo lang ai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无侬爱 無儂愛 poj: bô-lâng-ài from hokkien (poj) 无侬爱 無儂愛 bô-lâng-ài not profitable; not a good deal ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person; people; human being + hokkien (poj) 爱 愛 ài want; love
Words.Definition: (of a person) unwanted; undesired; unloved
Words.Example: I was the suay one .... ugly and no money when young , bo lang ai . So cant get married. [sic]

Words.Word: bo lang zai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无侬知 無儂知 poj: bô-lâng-chai from hokkien (poj) 无侬知 無儂知 bô-lâng-chai nobody knows; forgotten ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person; people + hokkien (poj) 知 知 chai know
Words.Definition: nobody knows
Words.Example: If follow baby ok can go any house but not allowed to work (although keep quiet Bo Lang chai)
Related: bird don't lay egg, dog don't shit

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无力 無力 poj: bô-la̍t from hokkien (poj) 无力 無力 bô-la̍t weak; tired; incapable; ineffectual ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 力 力 la̍t not busy; idle; unoccupied; leisurely; free time
Words.Definition: tired; weak; lacking energy
Words.Example: - Want climb a few more routes before it closes?- Bo lat already... let's just go makan ba.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 玻璃心 pinyin: bō li/lí xīn from mandarin (pinyin) 玻璃心 bō li/lí xīn oversensitive; easily offended; sb. who is oversensitive ← mandarin (pinyin) 玻璃 bō li/lí glass ← prakrit फालिअ phālia crystal ← sanskrit स्फटिक sphaṭika crystal; quartz + mandarin (pinyin) 心 xīn heart
Words.Definition: (derogatory) oversensitive; easily offended; having feelings that are easily hurt

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无聊 無聊 poj: bô-liâu from hokkien (poj) 无聊 無聊 bô-liâu bored; boring; dull; tedious ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 聊 聊 liâu chat; talk about
Words.Definition: bored
Words.Example: I feel damn bo liao every time I have to entertain this cockanathan's nonsense.

Words.Word: bo lin chu 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无认厝 無認厝 poj: bô-līn-chhù from hokkien (poj) 无认厝 無認厝 bô-līn-chhù in a state of mental confusion; frightened; panicked ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 认 認 līn recognize; distinguish + hokkien (poj) 厝 厝 chhù house; building; home
Words.Definition: in a state of mental confusion; frightened; panicked

Words.Word: bo liong sim 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无良心 無良心 poj: bô-liông-sim from hokkien (poj) 无良心 無良心 bô-liông-sim no conscience; unsympathetic; heartless ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 良心 良心 liông-sim conscience; kind heart
Words.Definition: heartless; without a conscience; unsympathetic

Words.Word: bo lor eng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无路用 無路用 poj: bô-lō͘-ēng from min nan (poj) 无路用 無路用 bô-lō͘-ēng useless ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 路用 路用 lō͘-ēng usefulness; travel expenses
Words.Definition: useless
Words.Example: Ayiah. Not only medals, all SAF badges all also bo lor eng one.
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.Word: bo lor yong 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无路用 無路用 poj: bô-lō͘-iōng from min nan (poj) 无路用 無路用 bô-lō͘-iōng useless ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 路用 路用 lō͘-iōng usefulness; travel expenses
Words.Definition: useless
Words.Example: SPF is only interested to protect the pappies and their families. Hardly see their cars go round patrolling . See them more often buying kopi. Bo lor yong, waste the taxpayers' money.
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无镭 無鐳 poj: bô-lui from hokkien (poj) 无镭 無鐳 bô-lui no money; broke; penniless ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 镭 鐳 lui money; coins ← malay duit money; a doit ← dutch duit doit, a Dutch copper coin historically worth 1/8 of a stiver or 1/160 of a guilder; (inf.) money
Words.Definition: broke; penniless; having no money
Words.Example: Visiting the casino is a surefire way to go from "huat ah" to bo lui overnight.

Words.Word: bo lui lang 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无镭侬 無鐳儂 poj: bô-lui-lâng from min nan (poj) 无镭侬 無鐳儂 bô-lui-lâng penniless person; bankrupt ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 镭 鐳 lui money; coins ← malay duit money; doit ← dutch duit doit, a Dutch copper coin historically worth 1/8 of a stiver or 1/160 of a guilder; (inf.) money + min nan (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person
Words.Definition: a penniless person; someone with no money; a bankrupt
Words.Example: as long as not too bui until jialat. Slight bui is still better than too skinny like me. Too skinny looks like beggar, one look already seem like bo Lui lang.

Words.Word: bo mi kia 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无物件 無物件 poj: bô-mi̍h-kiāⁿ from hokkien (poj) 无物件 無物件 bô-mi̍h-kiāⁿ nothing ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 物件 物件 mi̍h-kiāⁿ thing
Words.Definition: nothing; no thing
Words.Example: Went PR yesterday. bo mi kia leh..... they say no stock coming until after christmas.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无 無 poj: bô + Baba malay: pakeh from hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + baba malay pakeh wear (clothes); use ← malay pakai wear (clothes); use
Words.Definition: useless; ineffective
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.Word: bo pan huat 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无办法 無辦法 poj: bô-pān-hoat from hokkien (poj) 无办法 無辦法 bô-pān-hoat no means; no way ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; none + hokkien (poj) 办法 辦法 pān-hoat means; way; solution
Words.Definition: it cannot be helped; there is nothing that can be done; there is no other way
Words.Example: bo pan huat ..... tats life .... full of irony .....

Words.Word: bo peng yau si 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无兵枵死 無兵枵死 poj: bô peng iau sí from hokkien (poj) 无兵枵死 無兵枵死 bô peng iau sí (lit.) starve to death without the army ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; without + hokkien (poj) 兵 兵 peng army; soldier + hokkien (poj) 枵死 枵死 iau--sí starve to death
Words.Definition: (military, sarcastic) used to express that a soldier is working so hard as though the army were his sole means of survival
Words.Example: bo peng yau si. Literally, it means 'without the Army one can starve to death'. (The peng here is used collectively to mean army). This slang smacks of sarcasm and is aimed at the soldier who works so diligently and seriously as though the Army were his only source of survival...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无变 無變 poj: bô-piàn from hokkien (poj) 无变 無變 bô-piàn it can't be helped; there is nothing that can be done
Words.Definition: it cannot be helped; there is nothing that can be done; there is no choice
Words.Example: In Singapore, there is no choice being one of the world’s twenty smallest countries. Boh pien ah.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无 無 poj: bô + Malay: rasa from hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + malay rasa taste; flavour; feeling; sensation ← sanskrit रस rása sap; juice; essence; feeling; character or pali rasa taste; flavour; juice ← sanskrit रस rása sap; juice; essence; feeling; character
Words.Definition: unexciting; unstimulating; boring; too easy or effortless; no sweat

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无势 無勢 poj: bô-sè from hokkien (poj) 无势 無勢 bô-sè lacking power, poise, or authority; weak ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 势 勢 sè power; authority; poise
Words.Definition: weak; lacking power, poise, or authority
Words.Example: Bo seh one.... Sg is screwed

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无心 無心 poj: bô-sim from min nan (poj) 无心 無心 bô-sim unmotivated; ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 心 心 sim heart
Words.Definition: unenthusiastic; begrudging; unmotivated; reluctant; indifferent
Words.Example: I always feel that vouchers are purchased because one does not know what the other pax wants. So vouchers are abit bo-sim like that.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无爽 無爽 poj: bô-sóng from min nan (poj) 无爽 無爽 bô-sóng unhappy; dissatisfied; uncomfortable ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not + min nan (poj) 爽 爽 sóng pleased; happy; satisfied; feel good
Words.Definition: unhappy; dissatisfied
Words.Example: The husband is the one that is so damn bo song with her. I agree that not many pple will be very nice and pleasant with resentments bottled up.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无媠 無媠 poj: bô-súi from hokkien (poj) 无媠 無媠 bô-súi not pretty, biased ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not + hokkien (poj) 媠 媠 súi beautiful; good-looking
Words.Definition: (pejorative) not pretty; ugly
Words.Example: Oh please i have enough experience to tell u that sometimes the bo swee ones are even more guailan than the swee ones based on my past relationships.... i had a dinobu ex before who is ultra princess vs a slim tall ex who dont mind walking taking public transport eat at hawker...

Words.Word: bo ta bo lam pa 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无焦无𡳞脬 無焦無𡳞脬 poj: bô-ta-bô-lān-pha from hokkien (poj) 无焦无𡳞脬 無焦無𡳞脬 bô-ta-bô-lān-pha (fig., vulgar) if you don't drink bottoms up, you have no balls ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 焦 焦 ta dry; (intj.) cheers!; bottoms up! + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't + hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 𡳞脬 lān-pha testicles; (fig.) courage; guts; balls
Words.Definition: (vulgar, drinking toast) bottoms up!; if you don't drink every last drop, you have no balls
Words.Example: Lai, drink! Bo ta bo lam pa! Yaaaaaaaaaaaaam....
Related: hum ji bo ji attap chee

Words.Word: bo tai bo chi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / hinghua: 无 無 poj: bô + 代志 代誌 poj: tāi-chì from hokkien / hinghua (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + hokkien / hinghua (poj) 代志 代誌 tāi-chì problem; affair; matter
Words.Definition: for no good reason; out of nowhere
Words.Example: Bo tai bo chi kenna arrow gao gao...lol

Words.Word: bo tai chi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / hinghua: 无 無 poj: bô + 代志 代誌 poj: tāi-chì from hokkien / hinghua (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + hokkien / hinghua (poj) 代志 代誌 tāi-chì problem; affair; matter
Words.Definition: no problem; no issues; nothing to worry about
Words.Example: Fall into sea sure bo dai ji la.

Words.Word: bo tao bo beh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无头无尾 無頭無尾 poj: bô-thâu-bô-bé from hokkien (poj) 无头无尾 無頭無尾 bô-thâu-bô-bé (mph.) unclear; incomprehensible; nonsensical; chaotic; all over the place ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; don't have + hokkien (poj) 头 頭 thâu head + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; don't have + hokkien (poj) 尾 尾 bé tail
Words.Definition: (metaphor) incomprehensible; hard to understand or follow; can't make head nor tail
Words.Example: Ah ma's accounts of events are always bo tao bo beh, leaving me even more confused about what happened by the end.

Words.Word: bo thak cheh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无 無 poj: bô + Hokkien: 读册 讀冊 poj: tha̍k-chheh from min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + hokkien (poj) 读册 讀冊 tha̍k-chheh read; study; go to school ← hokkien (poj) 读 讀 tha̍k read; study + hokkien (poj) 册 冊 chheh book; (cl.) books
Words.Definition: (derogatory) poorly-educated; unlearned
Words.Example: Look at Bill Gates and Michael Dell. And maybe Michael Cheng soon. They're all Bo Tak Chek. The studious types work in the government for others; the hardworking and rich types les others work for them.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / hainanese: 无 無 poj: bô + 着 著 poj: tio̍h from hokkien / hainanese (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + hokkien / hainanese (poj) 着 著 tio̍h correct; right; then
Words.Definition: incorrect; wrong; false
Words.Example: Bo tioh la, my name is spell 'A-A-R-O-N', not 'Ah Ron'.

Words.Word: bo tua bo suey 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无大无细 無大無細 poj: bô-tōa-bô-sòe from hokkien (poj) 无大无细 無大無細 bô-tōa-bô-sòe (lit.) no big and no small, (fig.) no sense of seniority and juniority ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; don't have + hokkien (poj) 大 大 tōa big + hokkien (poj) 细 細 sòe small
Words.Definition: (idiom) to have no sense of seniority or juniority; showing no respect to seniors or elders
Words.Example: The teacher had had enough with the bo tua bo suay attitudes of the wannabe ah lians and ah bengs in her class.

Words.Word: bo wei kong 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无话讲 無話講 poj: bô-ōe-kóng from min nan (poj) 无话讲 無話講 bô-ōe-kóng useless ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + min nan (poj) 话 話 ōe words; speech + min nan (poj) 讲 講 kóng say; speak
Words.Definition: having no words to say; speechless; dumbfounded; unable to speak or respond
Words.Example: I tell u all something, my fil just call & shout his complain at me. I no give face I vent all my anger out till I keep reprimand him till he bo wei kong.

Words.Word: bo yao kin 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无要紧 無要緊 poj: bô-iàu-kín from hokkien (poj) 无要紧 無要緊 bô-iàu-kín don't worry; no problem; never mind ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô not; don't + hokkien (poj) 要紧 要緊 iàu-kín urgent; pressing; serious
Words.Definition: 'don't worry about it'; 'no problem'; 'never mind'; 'it's alright'

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 无用 無用 poj: bô-ēng from min nan (poj) 无用 無用 bô-ēng useless; a waste of time ← min nan (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + min nan (poj) 用 用 ēng use; usefulness
Words.Definition: useless; ineffectual
Related: char siew more use than you

Words.Word: bo zo kang 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 无 無 poj: bô + 做工 poj: chò-kang from hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô do not; not; don’t + hokkien (poj) 做工 chò-kang do work ← hokkien (poj) 做 chò do + hokkien (poj) 工 kang work
Words.Definition: not doing work; slacking off when one is supposed to be working; idle
Words.Example: You see the downstairs the uWWUUU bird, everyday bo zo kang also God give them eat so full ... You not bird you even more no need scared

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: wowo + Hokkien: 无 無 poj: bô from singlish wowo terrible aim; score poorly in live firing or shooting practice ← english wash-out fail overwhelmingly and totally; unsuccessful; (mil.) flunk out of a training course + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier with terrible aim
Words.Example: Boon Kee should apply to be a Stormtrooper, given how much of a bobo he is.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bobo + king from singlish bobo terrible aim; score poorly in live firing or shooting practice + singlish king (suffix, usu. sarcastic or pejorative) the epitome of sth. ← english king (usu. male) the ruler of a monarchy; a powerful or preeminent person
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier who is the epitome of terrible aim
Words.Example: Bobo King Benny never fails to disappoint, scoring a big fat zero in the critical live firing required for his CSB.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bobo + English: shooter from singlish bobo terrible aim; score poorly in live firing or shooting practice + english shooter sb. who shoots sth., e.g. a gun
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier with terrible aim
Words.Example: Shaun would have been a decent pick for the company sniper, if it weren't for the unfortunate, glaring fact that he is a bobo shooter.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bodek from malay bodek (vg.) scrotum; male genitalia, (slang) suck up to; bootlick
Words.Definition: (vulgar, idiom) to suck up to someone; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone; to bootlick; to brownnose
Words.Example: What is important for the party and the new leadership is not to basically bodek (bootlick) Anwar and defend him. What we need to do is appeal to the people and try to win.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bodoh from malay bodoh idiot; stupid
Words.Definition: stupid
Words.Example: Bodoh lah you, don't know how to use brain to think isit?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bohjan from malay bohjan young (usu. Malay) man who parties, does drugs, drinks, goes clubbing, seeks casual sex, etc. ← malay bohsia young (usu. Malay) woman who parties, does drugs, drinks, goes clubbing, seeks casual sex, etc. ← hokkien (poj) 无声 無聲 bô-siaⁿ silent; noiseless ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 声 聲 siaⁿ sound; noise + malay jantan male; masculine ← old javanese jantĕn male; man; husband
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young, delinquent, promiscuous (usually Malay) man who parties, does drugs, drinks, goes clubbing, seeks casual sex with multiple sexual partners, etc.
Words.Example: Joining the 'lepak, bohsia and bohjan' groups might creating delinquent behavior such as stealing, clubbing, smoking, drinking, free sexual practice and drug addicting. [sic]

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bohsia from malay bohsia young (usu. Malay) woman who parties, does drugs, drinks, goes clubbing, seeks casual sex, etc. ← hokkien (poj) 无声 無聲 bô-siaⁿ silent; noiseless ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 声 聲 siaⁿ sound; noise
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a young, delinquent, promiscuous (usually Malay) woman who parties, does drugs, drinks, goes clubbing, seeks casual sex with multiple sexual partners (especially men that are perceived to be wealthy, for compensation), etc.
Words.Example: The particular 'bohsia' incarnation that has caused the most consternation is the original stereotype of a young girl from a comfortable background spending her time in and around large shopping malls and standing at strategic locations to attract the attention of older men cruising by, either on large expensive motorcycles or luxury cars. Neither the man nor the girl says anything as she accepts a ride, and the implicit deal is done.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 沐水 poj: bok-chúi from hokkien / teochew (poj) 沐水 bok-chúi soft drink; fizzy drink ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 沐 bok (onom.) take a big gulp of liquid; popping sound + hokkien / teochew (poj) 水 chúi water
Words.Definition: a carbonated soft drink; a fizzy drink

Words.English Translation: → Malay: boleh from malay boleh can; able to; may
Words.Definition: can; to be able to
Words.Example: Everyone always says "Malaysia boleh!", but does anyone ever stop to think if Malaysia should?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: boleh + tahan from malay boleh can; able to; may + malay tahan endure; bear with; persist; tolerate
Words.Definition: passable; acceptable; tolerable; bearable
Words.Example: I speak English and Mandarin ... My Malay boleh tahan and I can understand well.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: boleh + English: -land from malay boleh can; able to + english -land country; place of; region
Words.Definition: (humorous, sarcastic) Malaysia

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bom bom from singlish bom bom (onom.) mimicking the sound of a fat person bumbling about
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic) mimicking the sound of a fat person walking or bumbling about
Words.Example: Lai who's next to bom bom?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bomoh from malay bomoh shaman; witch doctor
Words.Definition: a Malay shaman or witch doctor
Words.Example: Ahmad shrugged. "The bomoh is not for orang putih. You ask the Chinese amah. Maybe Chinese temple can help."

Words.English Translation: → Salako / malay: boncet / buncit from salako / malay boncet / buncit pot-bellied; fat
Words.Definition: pot-bellied; having a big belly
Words.Example: Some felt the pair were also an unlikely match. “Someone tweeted how can a princess like Hashy date someone so boncet (big bellied),” Marc tells me with a laugh.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: bongok from malay bongok fat but short; stupid
Words.Definition: stupid; silly
Words.Example: "Sorry, you just lose your million dollar question." … It was the last question of a million dollar, and the bongok cant sleep that night i guess.The answer is Malay.

Words.English Translation: → Jamaican patois: boombastic from jamaican patois boombastic fantastic; grandiose; pompous; intended to impress; inflated ← english bombastic fantastic; grandiose; pompous ← english bombast pompous; inflated; swell; stuffing; padding; cotton ← old french bombace cotton; stuffing ← late latin bombax cotton ← latin bombyx silkworm ← ancient greek βόμβῡξ bómbūx silkworm + english -ic (suffix) adj. pertaining to sth. ← old french -ique (suffix) adj. pertaining to sth. ← latin -icus (suffix) adj. pertaining to sth.
Words.Definition: fantastic; grandiose; pompous; magniloquent; intended to impress; inflated
Words.Example: U see the ajuma wearing polka dot sweatpants, with boombastic Maggie Mee hairdo, plucking bean sprouts at the balcony aredy ur still got feel .... ?

Words.English Translation: → English: boom + Singlish: -z from english boom (onom., intj.) a loud, explosive sound; sth. sudden happening + singlish -z colloquializing suffix; used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang ← english -z (urban slang) suffix used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang
Words.Definition: (humorous, ironic) used to indicate something awesome or indescribable
Words.Example: If I'm feeling naughty, then I'll wear something red, and loud... something, you know, 'BOOMZ'! Something that shouts ME!

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: bo pian + -s from singlish bo pian it can't be helped; there is nothing that can be done ← hokkien (poj) 无变 無變 bô-piàn it can't be helped; there is nothing that can be done + singlish -s colloquializing suffix
Words.Definition: unable to be helped; having nothing that can be done; having no choice
Words.Example: Of course, I met Singaporeans. The intern-turned-friend from my summer job, who taught me that the youth now say “bopes” in place of “bo pian.”

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 借 pinyin: jiè + Malay: pinjam + Tamil: கடன் kaṭaṉ from general chinese (pinyin) 借 jiè borrow; lend + malay pinjam borrow; lend + tamil கடன் kaṭaṉ borrow; lend
Words.Definition: to borrow; to receive something with the expectation of returning it in the future
Words.Example: Can I borrow your phone for a minute?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: botak from malay botak bald; balding ← malay butak bald; balding
Words.Definition: bald; balding
Words.Example: The sergeant kan the chao on recruit for going botak instead of shaving number one. Orbi quek!
Related: ni ma ma mei you mao

Words.English Translation: → Malay: botak + English: head from malay botak bald; balding ← malay butak bald; balding + english head part of the body containing the brain and several sensory organs
Words.Definition: bald; balding
Words.Example: he got receding hairline genes. ok he's rich, but i don't like botak head genes
Related: ni ma ma mei you mao

Words.English Translation: → English: bottle cap from english bottle cap item designed to seal the top of a bottle ← english bottle container with a tapered neck and opening at the top, usually made of plastic or glass, used to contain liquids or small substances + english cap cover or seal for the top of sth.
Words.Definition: a variation of kuti kuti, played in a pinch using bottle caps, when the usual plastic game pieces are not available

Words.English Translation: → Portuguese: beringela from portuguese beringela Solanum melongena or its edible fruit ← arabic بَاذِنْجَان bāḏinjān Solanum melongena or its edible fruit ← persian بادنجان bâdenjân Solanum melongena or its edible fruit ← sanskrit वातिगगम vātiga-gama Solanum melongena or its edible fruit
Words.Definition: the plant Solanum melongena or its edible fruit, also known as the aubergine, baigan, eggplant, melongene, or various other names in other English-speaking regions
Words.Example: An assortment of healthy greens — ranging from brinjal, broad peas and potatoes to baby cai xin — is stir-fried with thyme butter and served alongside the fish.
