Words.Definition: a pastry made from the same ingredients as the outer skin of a traditional mooncake, or effectively a mooncake without any fillings. It traditionally comes in interesting shapes such as a pig/piglet, generic fish, koi, crab, the zodiac animal of the year, etc., but can feasibly be made in any shape. It is a popular snack that can be found at most local bakeries, especially during the Mooncake Festival season.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: mopeng/bopeng from malay mopeng/bopeng pockmarked; pitted; pimpled
Words.Definition: pimply; having bad acne, scars, or other spot-like skin markings
Words.Example: - mopeng really is a death penalty for guys or girls- Ish true. When young, my mom would always tell me to finish up all my rice til the last grain, else my future wife will have mopeng face.

Words.English Translation: → English: more + better from english more to a greater extent than; comparatively higher ↻ malay lagi again; always; more + english better comparative form of 'good'; superior; more preferable
Words.Definition: (humorous) preferable; more desirable; more suitable
Words.Example: Go home change first more better lah.

Words.English Translation: → English: most + best from english most to the greatest extent; comparatively highest + english best superlative of ‘good’; most good
Words.Definition: (humorous) superlative of more better

Words.English Translation: → English: MRT from english MRT Singapore’s public train system ← english Mass Rapid Transit Singapore’s public train system ← english mass large group, body, or quantity + english rapid quick; fast + english transit transport; move from one place to another
Words.Definition: Singapore’s public train system, an important part of the public transportation network

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 莫躇了 poj: mài-tû/thû--liáu from hokkien (poj) 莫躇了 mài-tû/thû--liáu don’t hesitate;; don’t dilly-dally ← hokkien (poj) 莫 mài don’t; do not + hokkien (poj) 躇 tû/thû hesitate; be indecisive + hokkien (poj) 了 liáu already
Words.Definition: abbreviation of mai tu liao
Words.Example: Chiobus, MTL, faster get to know her and ask her out!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 麻糍 poj: môa-chî from hokkien (poj) 麻糍 môa-chî snack of glutinous rice balls with sugar and crushed peanuts ← hokkien (poj) 麻 môa sesame + hokkien (poj) 糍 chî glutinous rice cake or dumpling
Words.Definition: a traditional snack of glutinous rice balls with sugar and crushed peanuts, originating in Southern China in provinces such as Fujian, Zhejiang, and Jiangxi
Words.Example: She told me she wanted to eat muah chee. So I went and got muah chee for her and I gave it to her. And she told me it was the best muah chee she had ever eaten ...

Words.English Translation: → English: mug from english mug (slang) cram; study intensely in preparation for an exam
Words.Definition: to cram for an exam; to study intensely in preparation for an exam
Words.Example: As he grew up, Fred's naive view of libraries as wondrous catalogues of stories and knowledge became sullied as mere places for students to mug in, or pretend that they are mugging.

Words.English Translation: → English: mug + -er from english mug (slang) cram; study intensely in preparation for an exam + english -er suffix used to form a noun which performs the action of the root verb
Words.Definition: someone who studies intensely or all the time, especially in preparation for an exam; a crammer
Words.Example: The IP (integrated programme) kids typically saw those who joined from the O-Level streams as muggers, since throughout the IP there was neither much incentive nor need to study as hard for their examinations.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: mugger + English: toad from singlish mugger sb. who studies intensely or all the time; crammer ← english mug (slang) cram; study intensely in preparation for an exam + english -er suffix used to form a noun which performs the action of the root verb + english toad amphibian in the family Bufonidae or related families; any type of frog with warty and dry skin, (slang) detestable person
Words.Definition: (metaphor, derisive) a crammer; somebody who studies way too much, way too hard, or all the time
Words.Example: I have come across a few other students, however, with a twisted view of what exams are about. They think it’s an occasion for comparison. They mock the high-scorers (“mugger-toad”) and jeer at the low-scorers (“stupid lah sia”).

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 梅菜 jyutping: mui4 coi3 from cantonese (jyutping) 梅菜 mui4 coi3 dried, preserved mustard greens ← cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 霉菜 mui4 coi3 dried, preserved mustard greens ← cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 霉 mui4 moldy; mold; bacteria + cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 菜 coi3 vegetable
Words.Definition: a Hakka condiment of dried, preserved mustard greens (Brassica juncea)
Words.Example: And Chef Lap Fai's has a new creation: Rice dumpling with stewed pig trotter paired with mui choy (S$12.80).

Words.English Translation: → Malay: mukim from malay mukim type of administrative division ← arabic مُقِيم muqīm resident; inhabiting ← arabic أَقَامَ ʔaqāma reside; stay
Words.Definition: a type of administrative division used for survey districts in Singapore, as well as other neighbouring Malayophone countries such as Malaysia, Brunei, and Indonesia
Words.Example: Every land parcel in Singapore is uniquely identified by a lot number. This identifier has two components, namely the survey districts Mukim (MK) or Town Subdivision (TS) number and the lot number.For administrative purposes, Singapore is divided into 30 TS and 34 MK. A TS is located around the city area whereas a MK is found in the outer region surrounding all the TS.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 𬲿𬲿 𩜠𩜠 jyutping: mam1 mam1 from cantonese (jyutping) 𬲿𬲿 𩜠𩜠 mam1 mam1 (childish) food
Words.Definition: (childish) food

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: மஞ்சள் mañcaḷ from tamil மஞ்சள் mañcaḷ turmeric; yellow
Words.Definition: (derogatory or endearing) a Chinese person
Words.Example: When Michael thrust his Brylcreemed jibes in her face, or the boy who collided with her in the swimming pool shouted "Mangali cheebye!" she dismissed their abuse as the vaporous excrescences of marginal cranks, like the venomous muttering about munjen she heard from her uncle Sundar now and then.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: martabak from malay martabak folded fried flatbread with filling ← arabic مُطَبَّق muṭabbaq wrap; dish-shaped; folded fried flatbread with filling
Words.Definition: a type of folded fried pancake (using dough similar to that used in roti prata) with a filling, which is typically a dry curry or korma made with onions, spices, and potato or some sort of chopped or minced meat
Words.Example: The huge chicken murtabak ($5) was one of the better ones I've had — largely because it was freshly prepared on the spot.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: முறுக்கு muṟukku from tamil முறுக்கு muṟukku twist; twirl; snack made of deep-fried twisted pieces or sticks of rice and urad dal flour
Words.Definition: an Indian snack made of deep-fried twisted pieces or sticks of rice and urad dal flour, seasoned with a mixture of spices. The pieces are made by extruding dough through a patterned die into a boiling pot of oil, and may come in various shapes, sizes, and flavours.
Words.Example: Murukku holds a special place in the hearts of most Indians, it is made out of rice and urad dhal flour, water, salt, asafoetida and cumin seeds. It is then deep-fried into spiral, twisted shapes either using one's hand or a murukku mould.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: musang from malay musang Asian palm civet (Paradoxurus hermaphroditus); civet cat
Words.Definition: the Asian palm civet (Paradoxurus hermaphroditus), also known as the common palm civet, a long, arboreal and terrestrial, nocturnal mammal native to Southeast and South Asia. It is primarily frugivorous, but also eats insects and small mammals.[1]

Words.English Translation: → Malay: [Gua] Musang + English: king from malay [Gua] Musang district in Kelantan, Malaysia where the cultivar was discovered ← malay musang Asian palm civet (Paradoxurus hermaphroditus); civet cat + english king (usu. male) the ruler of a monarchy; a powerful or preeminent person ↻ malay Raja [Kunyit] original name of the variety of durian from which Musang King was developed; (lit.) Turmeric King ← malay raja king; monarch ← sanskrit राजन् rājan king; prince
Words.Definition: a cultivar of durian originating in Gua Musang, Kelantan, Malaysia, prized for its texture and flavour
Words.Example: At a press conference on June 27, Agriculture Minister Mohamad Sabu said the variety – also known as Musang King – “must be recognised as a Malaysian product because it is getting popular, particularly in China”.He added that Malaysia’s Agriculture Department and its international trade unit “will initiate the move to patent the Musang King”, reported New Straits Times.

Words.English Translation: → English: mutton + Malay / indonesian: rendang from english mutton meat from any caprine, such as a sheep or goat + malay / indonesian rendang type of dry curry; rich, spicy stew- or curry-like dish with meat
Words.Definition: a variant of rendang using mutton (sometimes lamb) as the meat
Words.Example: Administrative executive Juriah Yatim, 57, contributed the grandmum mutton rendang recipe, which she inherited from her late grandmother, for the e-book.

Words.English Translation: → English: my + one from english my of or belonging to me + english one pro-form (used as a substitute word for a noun or pronoun understood in context)
Words.Definition: mine; belonging to me; first-person singular possessive pronoun

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 娘母个 娘母個 poj: nâ-bé from hokkien (poj) 娘母个 娘母個 nâ-bé (vg.) mother('s) ✂ hokkien (poj) 奸恁娘母个 姦恁娘母個 kàn-ní-nâ-bú-ê (vg.) fuck your mother('s)
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) fuck your mother
Words.Example: Thus the eponymous Heartlander in the comic strip responds to the Cosmopolitan's claims to superiority by calling the latter an "arrogant na beh" ...
Related: kan ni na bu chao chee bai
kan ni na chao chee bai

Words.Word: na beh chee bai 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 娘母个 娘母個 poj: nâ-bé + Min nan: 膣屄 poj: chi-bai from hokkien (poj) 娘母个 娘母個 nâ-bé (vg.) mother('s) ✂ hokkien (poj) 奸恁娘母个 姦恁娘母個 kàn-ní-nâ-bú-ê (vg.) fuck your mother('s) + min nan (poj) 膣屄 chi-bai (vg.) cunt; vagina; vulva
Words.Definition: (vulgar) [your] mother’s vagina
Words.Example: Vulgarity was very common, especially among the Chinese. First thing in the morning, they would burst out "Na bei chee-bye" ... That was their way of wishing you a good morning.
Related: kan ni na chao chee bai

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nah from malay nah 'here!'; 'take this'; used to grab the listener's attention when giving sth.
Words.Definition: 'here!'; 'take this'; used to grab the listener's attention when giving them something
Words.Example: - Sial lah, I never bring cash.- Nah, take. Just transfer me back later.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nak from malay nak want; will ✂ malay hendak want; will
Words.Definition: to want; to want to

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / min nan / hakka / hainanese: 啱啱好 jyutping: ngaam1 ngaam1 hou2 from cantonese / min nan / hakka / hainanese (jyutping) 啱啱好 ngaam1 ngaam1 hou2 just nice; perfect; just right; fortunately ← cantonese / min nan / hakka / hainanese (jyutping) 啱啱 ngaam1 ngaam1 correct; just; barely; be suitable; fit; coincidentally + cantonese / min nan / hakka / hainanese (jyutping) 好 hou2 good
Words.Definition: perfect; just right; spot-on

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 南乳 jyutping: naam4 jyu5 from cantonese (jyutping) 南乳 naam4 jyu5 red fermented bean curd ← cantonese (jyutping) 南 naam4 south + cantonese (jyutping) 乳 jyu5 milk; cheese-like substance
Words.Definition: a variant of fu yu which is red due to fermentation with red yeast rice

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nangka from malay nangka jackfruit (Artocarpus heterophyllus)
Words.Definition: the tree Artocarpus heterophyllus or its edible fruit, both also known as the jackfruit, a species bearing extremely large fruits with a bumpy green skin and segmented flesh. Each segment of the fruit consists of sweet, stringy yellow flesh surrounding a large seed. It is closely related to the cempedak (A. integer), and more distantly the durian.
Words.Example: I enjoyed the exotic sayur nangka lemak ... The jackfruit is tenderly stewed in its own lemak sauce and is an exquisite vegetable accompaniment.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nanti from malay nanti later
Words.Definition: when; supposing; lest; what if

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: napshot from singlish napshot guaranteed win; awesome; good-looking; attractive ← english napshot (horse racing) guaranteed win
Words.Definition: awesome; amazing; great
Words.Example: Wah that girl nap leh. You know her insta?

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: napshot + curry pok from singlish napshot guaranteed win; awesome; good-looking; attractive ← english napshot (horse racing) guaranteed win + singlish curry pok curry puff ← hokkien (poj) 咖喱卜 ka-lí-pok curry puff ← hokkien (poj) 咖喱 ka-lí curry ← english curry type of Indian dish typically featuring various ingredients in a spiced gravy ← tamil கறி kaṟi curry; thick sauce; meat; pepper + hokkien (poj) 卜 pok to divine; (archaic) pop; crack or malay epok-epok epok-epok (a Malay variant of curry puff)
Words.Definition: guaranteed to win
Words.Example: I met a young virgin before, girl-next-door type, I thought sure nap-shot-curry-pok, girlfriend material. Skali lots of personality and character issues.

Words.English Translation: → English: national + physical + fitness + award from english national of or related to a nation or country ← middle french national of or related to a nation or country ← latin nātiōnālis national + english physical of or related to the body ← late latin physicālis of or related to the natural sciences + english fitness condition of being physically healthy ← english fit physically healthy; in shape + english -ness suffixed to an adj. to form a noun meaning “having the quality or state of (the adj.)” + english award prize; reward ← anglo-norman awarder judge; sentence
Words.Definition: (acronym) a standardized fitness test which all primary and secondary school students must take every two years, consisting of six stations: a 2.4 km (secondary) or 1.6 km run (primary), sit-and-reach, sit-ups, standing broad jump, shuttle run, and either of push-ups (post-secondary males), pull-ups (secondary males 15 years old and anove), or inclined pull-ups (males below 15 years old and females)

Words.English Translation: → English: napshot from english napshot (horse racing) guaranteed win
Words.Definition: (horse racing, betting) a guaranteed win
Words.Example: Sent off as the punters' banker and $11 favourite, Billy Elliot was regarded by many as a "napshot". As it turned out, the "certainty" was caught by Fireworks in the last few strides of the 1,400m event.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi from malay nasi cooked rice
Words.Definition: cooked rice

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi + Tamil: பிரியாணி piriyani from malay nasi cooked rice + tamil பிரியாணி piriyani dish of rice cooked with spices and meat and/or vegetables ← classical persian بریانی biryānī dish of rice cooked with spices and meat and/or vegetables ← classical persian بریان biryān roast; grilled
Words.Definition: the full term used for the style of briyani in Singapore, which is based on the Indian biryani but has developed several differences to suit local preferences. It is typically served at Indian-Muslim eateries and stalls.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi campur from malay nasi campur white rice with small servings of a variety of condiments and dishes ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay campur mix; combine, (slang) add
Words.Definition: white rice with small servings of a variety of Malay-style condiments and dishes
Words.Example: Nasi campur that's fast and fuss-free... a lunch that's just right for people on the go.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi goreng from malay nasi goreng fried rice ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay goreng fry; fried
Words.Definition: Malay-style fried rice
Words.Example: Fried Rice ParadiseNasi Goreng, very niceThat's her specialityNinety-nine varieties

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi goreng + istimewa from malay nasi goreng fried rice ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay goreng fry; fried + malay istimewa special ← sanskrit Possible, but not certain आस्तामेव āstāmeva let it continue being so; may it last
Words.Definition: Malay-style fried rice (nasi goreng) topped with a fried egg and sambal, and served with keropok on the side
Words.Example: The chef has modified the chilli sauce to improve the taste, and it is also used for the nasi goreng istimewa ($7+) served with prawn crackers, fried egg and chicken wing.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi goreng + Pattaya from malay nasi goreng fried rice ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay goreng fry; fried + malay Pattaya resort city in Thailand ← thai (paiboon) พัทยา pát-tá-yaa resort city in Thailand
Words.Definition: a Malay-style chicken or seafood fried rice wrapped in a thin omelette and topped with chilli or tomato sauce. It is similar to the Japanese dish omurice, except that the omelette is much thinner and envelops the entire serving of rice.
Words.Example: The egg envelope further enhances the taste of the fried mee. Or, try the equally yummy nasi goreng Pattaya ($4). Similarly served, this rice variation is also popular.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi kuning from malay nasi kuning fragrant yellow-stained rice with coconut milk, pandan, and lemongrass ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay kuning yellow
Words.Definition: rice coloured yellow with turmeric (or sometimes saffron) and cooked with coconut milk, pandan, lemongrass, and sometimes other spices
Words.Example: I went for the udang panggang combo. This consisted of two huge prawns topped with oodles of garlic and served with raw vegetables, vegetable curry and nasi kuning ... I found the prawns mediocre ... and was more enamoured of the yellow rice, that was so fragrant I couldn't stop eating it even though I was full.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi kunyit from malay nasi kunyit fragrant yellow-stained rice with coconut milk, pandan, and lemongrass ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay kunyit turmeric
Words.Definition: rice coloured yellow with turmeric and cooked with coconut milk, pandan, lemongrass, and often other spices
Words.Example: Nasi kunyit or turmeric rice is a mildly spicy rice dish that is a favourite among the Straits Chinese ... the main ingredient to a good nasi kunyit is love — whether it be prepared by wife, mother or prospective daughter-in-law.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi lemak from malay nasi lemak rice cooked with coconut milk and other ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay lemak fat; grease
Words.Definition: a Malay dish of rice cooked with coconut milk and pandan, usually served with a sweet sambal, a mixture of fried ikan bilis and roasted peanuts, a hard-boiled or fried egg, and often some form of meat such as ayam goreng or ikan kuning. It is traditionally served wrapped in a banana leaf. It is the national dish of Malaysia.
Words.Example: You can also tuck into some common local food like kaya toast and nasi lemak after you have browsed the space.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi minyak from malay nasi minyak rice cooked with ghee and spices ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay minyak oil
Words.Definition: a Malay or Indonesian dish of basmati rice cooked with ghee, evaporated milk, and various spices. Coconut milk may sometimes be used in place of ghee. It was likely developed from or based off a form of pilaf.
Words.Example: Enter the realm of aromatic Nasi Minyak, where fluffy basmati rice dances with fragrant spices and creamy coconut milk. ’Tis the rice that's twice as nice!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi padang from malay nasi padang white rice with servings of a variety of condiments and dishes ← malay nasi cooked rice + indonesian Padang capital city of West Sumatra, Indonesia ← malay padang field
Words.Definition: white rice with servings of a variety of assorted Malay- or Indonesian-style dishes, typically a selection or combination of vegetable dishes and meat or fish dishes chosen by the customer from a display. The style of dish originated in Minangkabau cuisine.
Words.Example: Why sit down to an overpriced four-course meal that will invariably involve salmon and chocolate when you can feast on a table laden with spicy dishes at your favourite nasi padang shop for a fraction of the cost?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi pandan from malay nasi pandan rice cooked with pandan and coconut milk ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay pandan plant of the genus Pandanus, sp. P. amaryllifolius; flavour derived from this plant
Words.Definition: rice cooked with pandan and coconut milk
Words.Example: Nasi Pandan comes with a selection of meats and vegetables ... We can mix and match with any style of meat. Usually, I serve Nasi Pandan with shrimp or grilled chicken ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nasi paprik from malay nasi paprik white rice with pad prik ← malay nasi cooked rice + malay paprik Thai-inspired Malaysian sweet and spicy sauce ← thai (paiboon) ผัด pàt stir-fry; stir-fried + thai (paiboon) พริก prík chilli pepper
Words.Definition: white rice with pad prik, a Thai-inspired Malaysian dish of meat (usually chicken) stir-fried with a sweet and spicy sauce
Words.Example: Now, about half their customers eat nasi paprik ($4) or nasi Pattaya ($5). The food shop sells about 70 plates of each every day, more on weekends.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: no action, talk only from singlish no action, talk only saying, commenting, promising, etc. a lot about sth., but not actually doing anything
Words.Definition: acronym of no action, talk only
Words.Example: Singapore must not become like NATO - No Action Talk Only, say some people. Yes, indeed, it must not. And unlike Nato's current campaign in Kosovo, it must not be half-hearted.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: na beh from singlish na beh (vg.) fuck your mother; fuck; fucker ← hokkien (poj) 娘母个 娘母個 nâ-bé (vg.) mother('s) ✂ hokkien (poj) 奸恁娘母个 姦恁娘母個 kàn-ní-nâ-bú-ê (vg.) fuck your mother('s)
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) abbreviation of na beh (or na bu)
Related: kan ni na bu chao chee bai

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: na beh chee bai from singlish na beh chee bai (vg.) fuck your mother; fuck; fucker ← hokkien (poj) 娘母个 娘母個 nâ-bé (vg.) mother('s) ✂ hokkien (poj) 奸恁娘母个 姦恁娘母個 kàn-ní-nâ-bú-ê (vg.) fuck your mother('s) + min nan (poj) 膣屄 膣屄 chi-bai (vg.) cunt; vagina; vulva
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) abbreviation of na beh chee bai (or na bu chee bai)
Related: kan ni na bu chao chee bai

Words.English Translation: → English: national + day + parade from english national of or related to a nation or country ← middle french national of or related to a nation or country ← latin nātiōnālis national + english day set 24-hour calendar period + english parade (mil.) organized procession involving soldiers marching in formation; general show or display of military force or drills ← french parade military display; ostentatious procession ← italian parata military parade; preparation; ostentatious display
Words.Definition: the National Day Parade, an annual celebration held on 9th August (the day Singapore became independent from Malaysia), typically comprising a variety of mainstay performances such as singing National Day songs, a skydiving performance by the Red Lions (the nickname given to the SAF Parachute Team), a parade involving military, police, and civil defence personnel, vehicles, and technology, song and dance performances, Singapore-themed floats, and fireworks
Words.Example: For the first time in NDP history, we will feature a virtual choir performing an interlude, and the singers will come from various walks of life.

Words.English Translation: → English: never from english never not ever; not previously; did not; have not
Words.Definition: did not; have not; will not
Words.Example: Hear say the towkay neh give bonus last year. Why he so niao ah?

Words.English Translation: → English: nanny nanny boo boo from english nanny nanny boo boo (childish) playground taunt
Words.Definition: (childish) used to taunt someone else, implying that one is in a better position or situation than the taunted

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 奶奶 poj: ne-ne from hokkien (poj) 奶奶 ne-ne breast ⇇ hokkien (poj) 奶 ne breast; milk; breast milk
Words.Definition: breast; breasts
Related: ai pee ai chee ai tua liap nee

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 奶奶噗 poj: ne-ne-phok/pok from hokkien (poj) 奶奶噗 ne-ne-phok/pok breasts; nipples ← hokkien (poj) 奶奶 ne-ne breast ⇇ hokkien (poj) 奶 ne breast; milk; breast milk + hokkien (poj) 噗/凸 phok/pho̍k/pok protrusion; protrude; jut out
Words.Definition: nipple
Related: ai pee ai chee ai tua liap nee

Words.English Translation: → English: Nescafé + Milo from english Nescafé brand of instant or packaged coffee ← french Nestlé food and drink corporation ← french Nestlé surname of Henri Nestlé, the Frenchified form of Heinrich Nestle ← german Nestle surname of Heinrich Nestle, founder of Nestlé ← swabian german Nestle small bird’s nest + french café coffee ← italian caffè coffee ← ottoman turkish kahve coffee ← arabic قهوه qahwa coffee + english Milo Nestlé chocolate-flavoured malted drink and drink powder product ← ancient greek Μῆλος Mêlos Milo of Croton, six-time Olympic wrestling champion who competed between c. 540 - 512 BC
Words.Definition: a drink made from a mixture of Nescafé instant coffee and Milo, two popular Nestlé drinks

Words.English Translation: → English: never from english never at no point in time; not ever; negative particle ← english ne not + english ever at some point in time; always; all the time
Words.Definition: negative particle; not; did not
Words.Example: - Not you say meh?- Why you all looking me? I really never say one!

Words.Word: never die before 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: never + English: die + before ↻ Mandarin: 没死过 沒死過 pinyin: méi sǐ guò from singlish never did not; have not; do not; negative particle ← english never not ever + english die become dead; stop living + english before previously; at some earlier time ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 没死过 沒死過 méi sǐ guò describing sb. who acts recklessly and carelessly, flaunts rules and laws, etc. ← mandarin (pinyin) 没 沒 méi not have; have not; did not + mandarin (pinyin) 死 死 sǐ die; death + mandarin (pinyin) 过 過 guò before; used to indicate past completion of a verb
Words.Definition: used to describe somebody who acts recklessly and carelessly, flaunts rules and laws, offends or messes with the wrong people, etc., as if they were oblivious to the consequences and the trouble they may get into
Words.Example: You dog, you still dare to make me wait? You fucker, never die before, right ...
Related: hongster never die, tiong sim is a lie
tiong sim is a lie, hongster never die

Words.English Translation: → English: new + bird ↻ Hokkien: 新鸟 新鳥 poj: sin-chiáu from english new recent; inexperienced + english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs ↻ hokkien (poj) 新鸟 新鳥 sin-chiáu newbie; beginner; inexperienced person ← hokkien (poj) 新 新 sin new + hokkien (poj) 鸟 鳥 chiáu bird
Words.Definition: a newbie; a beginner; a novice; an inexperienced person

Words.English Translation: → English: next time from english next time the following occasion ← english next immediately following ← english time occasion; occurrence
Words.Definition: in the future

Words.English Translation: → English: nice + from + far + far from + nice from english nice pleasant; good; favourable + english from used to indicate a reference + english far from or over a great distance + english far from not at all; in no way + english nice pleasant; good; favourable
Words.Definition: (abbreviation, usually of a person) looking attractive or pleasing from a distance, but very much the opposite on a closer look

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin / cantonese: 嗯 jyutping: ńg/ňg/ǹg from mandarin / cantonese (jyutping) 嗯 ńg/ňg/ǹg used to exp. acknowledgement, agreement, confusion, etc.
Words.Definition: used to express acknowledgement; 'OK'; 'noted'

Words.English Translation: → Translingual: ng from translingual ng (imit.) sound of a grunt
Words.Definition: (childish) to defaecate; to poop; to go for a poop

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 猫 貓 poj: ngiau from min nan (poj) 猫 貓 ngiau cat, (slang) stingy
Words.Definition: stingy; miserly; overly frugal
Words.Example: Rich folks are generally super ngiau + ability to make more money than average people, resulted in them becoming rich.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 五香 poj: ngó͘-hiang from hokkien / teochew (poj) 五香 ngó͘-hiang five spices (in Chinese cuisine); dish of ground pork and/or other meat, five spice powder, etc. rolled in beancurd skin and deep-fried ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 五 ngó͘ five + hokkien / teochew (poj) 香 hiang fragrance; aromatic
Words.Definition: a Hokkien and Teochew dish of ground pork and/or other meats, five spice powder, and other ingredients rolled in beancurd skin (tau kee) and deep-fried. Each roll is usually cut transversely into several smaller round pieces. It may be served as a dish on its own with chilli and a sweet sauce, or used as a topping or part of another dish.
Words.Example: Generations of regulars return for classic dishes such as ngoh hiang, braised pork belly and sambal crab.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: only from singlish only merely; just; simply ← english only merely; just; simply ← asian languages "only" only; merely; just; simply
Words.Definition: (used at the end of a clause or sentence) only; merely; just; simply
Words.Example: Ha? Liddat ni? How you want us to be full sia?

Words.Word: ni ma ma mei you mao 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 你妈妈没有毛 你媽媽沒有毛 pinyin: nǐ mā mā méi yǒu máo from mandarin (pinyin) 你妈妈没有毛 你媽媽沒有毛 nǐ mā mā méi yǒu máo (taunt) ‘your mother has no hair’ ← mandarin (pinyin) 你 你 nǐ your; you + mandarin (pinyin) 妈妈 媽媽 mā mā mother + mandarin (pinyin) 没有 沒有 méi yǒu not have; don’t have + mandarin (pinyin) 毛 毛 máo hair; fur; bodily hair
Words.Definition: (juvenile, offensive, sometimes jocular) expression of contempt; used to insult a person’s mother, or by extension insult or provoke said person themself, by insinuating that their mother has no hair

Words.Word: ni na beh 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 恁娘母个 恁娘母個 poj: ní-nâ-bé from hokkien (poj) 恁娘母个 恁娘母個 ní-nâ-bé (vg.) your mother('s) ✂ hokkien (poj) 奸恁娘母个 姦恁娘母個 kàn-ní-nâ-bú-ê (vg.) fuck your mother('s)
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) fuck your mother
Related: kan ni na bu chao chee bai
kan ni na chao chee bai

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 尔 爾 poj: niā from hokkien (poj) 尔 爾 niā only; merely; just; that’s all
Words.Definition: (used at the end of a clause or sentence) only; merely; just; simply; that’s all
Words.Example: 10 cents nia, don’t so kiam siap lah!

Words.English Translation: → English: ninja from english ninja sb. trained in ninjutsu, often conducting espionage, assassination, etc.; move stealthily and efficiently ← japanese 忍者 にんじゃ ninja sb. trained in ninjutsu, often conducting espionage, assassination, etc.
Words.Definition: to sneak off stealthily without others noticing; to leave quietly; to pull an Irish goodbye

Words.English Translation: → English: ninth + core + value from english ninth (ordinal) 9 + english core central; fundamental + english value moral code or belief system ← old french value worth; valor ← latin valeō be strong and powerful; have worth
Words.Definition: (military, metonym, humorous) ‘do anything you want, just don’t get caught’. This refers to the common attitude in the military that one can, in practice, do whatever one pleases outside of standard protocols and regulations, so long as such actions are not uncovered by a superior who is a stickler for the rules.
Words.Example: ... it is no wonder then, that the Ninth Core Value remains so ubiquitous within the context of the SAF, no matter how much the regulars try to stamp it out.

Words.Word: nng kha peng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 软 軟 poj: nńg + 跤 poj: kha + 兵 poj: peng from hokkien (poj) 软 軟 nńg soft; weak; feeble + hokkien (poj) 跤 kha leg; foot + hokkien (poj) 兵 peng soldier; warrior
Words.Definition: (military, teasing or derogatory) a seaman; a sailor in the navy

Words.English Translation: → English: all talk and no action + Singlish: only from english all talk and no action saying, commenting, promising, etc. a lot about sth., but not actually doing anything + singlish only merely; just; simply ← english only merely; just; simply ↻ asian languages "only" only; merely; just; simply
Words.Definition: (idiom) commenting, speaking, opining, promising, etc. a lot about something, but not actually doing anything or following through; all bark and no bite
Words.Example: But without a deadline set to achieve these resolutions, it looks like they are heading into the infamous Nato zone: No Action, Talk Only.

Words.Word: no come no come, one come all come
Words.English Translation: → English: no + come + no + come + one + come + all + come from english no not any; zero + english come arrive; move tw. + english no not any; zero + english come arrive; move tw. + english one a thing; an instance; 1 + english come arrive; move tw. + english all entirety of; every thing + english come arrive; move tw.
Words.Definition: used to describe the phenomenon or situation where things appear to happen overwhelmingly and all at once instead of at regular intervals, due to e.g. poor scheduling, positive feedback, coincidental timing, social dynamics, etc.
Words.Example: During a difficult interaction with the people regarding poor bus services when I was Minister for Transport, I quoted a line by Wang Sha and Ye Feng, 'No come, no come, one come, all come.' It immediately lightened the mood.

Words.English Translation: → English: no + eye + see ↻ Cantonese: 冇眼睇 jyutping: mou5 ngaan5 tai2 from english no not any + english eye organ used to see + english see look; observe visually ↻ cantonese (jyutping) 冇眼睇 mou5 ngaan5 tai2 unable to bear the sight of sth. any further; unable to stand; cannot care anymore ← cantonese (jyutping) 冇 mou5 no; not have + cantonese (jyutping) 眼 ngaan5 eye + cantonese (jyutping) 睇 tai2 see; look
Words.Definition: to be unable to bear the sight of something any further; unable to stand; to not care anymore
Words.Example: Anyway, yesterday i really first time watch ah boy match until i lost it and just shut down the youtube cos i no eye see. Usually, no matter how badly he losing I will watch to the end de... haiz
Related: because the sky is so high, the bird shit in your eye
bird don't lay egg, dog don't shit

Words.English Translation: → English: no + Singlish: feel from english no none; not any + singlish feel motivation; desire; inspiration ← english feeling emotional sensation; sensibility
Words.Definition: unenthusiastic; unmotivated; indifferent; unwilling; not interested; unbothered
Words.Example: I no feel to study liao… after class just sleep only.

Words.Word: no fish, prawns also can 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: no + fish + prawn + Singlish: also can ↻ Hokkien: 无鱼，虾嘛好 無魚，蝦嘛好 poj: bô hîr, hê mā hó from english no not having; without + english fish cold-blooded, aquatic vertebrate that typically has gills and fins; meat of such an animal + english prawn crustacean in the suborder Dendrobranchiata; shrimp; meat of such an animal + singlish also can be fine as well; work too; permissible as well ← english also in addition; as well + singlish can affirmative particle; able to; permitted to ← english can able to; may; be possible; permitted ↻ hokkien (poj) 无鱼，虾嘛好 無魚，蝦嘛好 bô hîr, hê mā hó (proverb) it is alright to settle for something less; better to have something than nothing ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have + hokkien (poj) 鱼 魚 hîr fish + hokkien (poj) 虾 蝦 hê prawn; shrimp + hokkien (poj) 嘛 嘛 mā also + hokkien (poj) 好 好 hó good; alright
Words.Definition: it is alright to settle for something less than optimal; better to have something than nothing at all

Words.English Translation: → English: no + Singlish: gahmen ↻ Hokkien: 无政府 無政府 poj: bô-chèng-hú from english no not having; without + singlish gahmen government ← english government the body ruling or controlling a state, including its people, land, resources, etc., and with the power to enact, pass, and enforce its laws ← old french governement government ↻ hokkien (poj) 无政府 無政府 bô-chèng-hú anarchic; lawless; delinquent ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; without + hokkien (poj) 政府 政府 chèng-hú government
Words.Definition: (often humorous) anarchic; lawless; chaotic
Words.Example: Yes, Gahmen made it into the dictionary. Really no gahmen already.

Words.Word: no head no tail 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: no + head + no + tail ↻ Hokkien: 无头无尾 無頭無尾 poj: bô-thâu-bô-bé from english no not any; zero + english head part of the body containing the brain and several sensory organs + english no not any; zero + english tail posterior appendage of an animal extending from the backbone ↻ hokkien (poj) 无头无尾 無頭無尾 bô-thâu-bô-bé (mph.) unclear; incomprehensible; nonsensical; chaotic; all over the place ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; don't have + hokkien (poj) 头 頭 thâu head + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; don't have + hokkien (poj) 尾 尾 bé tail
Words.Definition: (metaphor) incomprehensible; nonsensical; hard to understand or follow

Words.Word: no horse run 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: no + horse + run ↻ Hokkien: 无马走 無馬走 poj: bô bé cháu from english no not any; zero + english horse Equus ferus, a domesticated hoofed animal used for work, riding, transport, racing, etc. + english run move at a speed faster than walking, with both feet leaving the ground at regular intervals ↻ hokkien (poj) 无马走 無馬走 bô bé cháu the very best; top-grade; unbeatable; incomparable ← hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't have + hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 走 走 cháu run
Words.Definition: (idiom) the very best; top-grade; unbeatable; incomparable; superb; way ahead of the competition

Words.English Translation: → English: no + kick from english no not any + english kick thrill; sth. fun or amusing
Words.Definition: unexciting; unstimulating; boring; too easy or effortless; no sweat

Words.English Translation: → English: no + link from english no not any; zero + english link connection
Words.Definition: used to retort that a statement is off-topic, a non sequitur, irrelevant, nonsensical, etc.
Words.Example: I watch a epl replay and it's just a simple tap in and the commentator say until got dragon got phoenix and all the horse back cannon theory all come out. Great vision, good instinct, excellent play. Bro it's just a Tyco tap in. Totally no link leh.

Words.English Translation: → English: in no mood from english in no mood unwilling; unmotivated; uninterested, often due to anger or frustration
Words.Definition: unenthusiastic; unmotivated; indifferent; unwilling; not interested; discouraged, often due to anger or frustration
Words.Example: Go to work like zombie. No mood. Everyday sian.

Words.English Translation: → English: no more from english no more not any longer; no further
Words.Definition: to be finished; to be used up; to be gone
Words.Example: So fast no more already? Aiyah, next time must come earlier ba.

Words.English Translation: → English: no + need from english no none; not any + english need require; necessitate
Words.Definition: do not have to; need not; do not require
Words.Example: - You want me to put here just in case?- No need.

Words.English Translation: → English: no + sound + no + picture from english no not any; zero + english sound noise; vibrational frequencies perceived by the ear ← old french son sound ← latin sonus sound + english no not any; zero + english picture image; visual representation of sth. on a 2D surface ← old french picture painting ← latin pictūra painting (art form); picture
Words.Definition: (idiom) to have no sign of one's whereabouts; to disappear without a word; to give no news and no trace
Words.Example: So you may stop slapping your monitor screen (and pounding your F5 key), wondering how come no new updates.It's me who didn't blog for a few days liao.Hence the no sound, no picture.

Words.English Translation: → English: no + Singlish: spiak from english no not; not at all + singlish spiak speak; talk, perhaps pretentiously ← english speak talk; say; verbalize + singlish piak hit; slap, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap ← hokkien (poj) 拍 phiak hit; slap; clap; whack, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap or hokkien (poj) 擗 phia̍k/pia̍k hit, (onom.) sound of a hit; sound of a flap or flutter
Words.Definition: (humorous) used to convey that one has been left speechless and dumbfounded
Words.Example: It isn't broken English - God forbid that citizens of a former Crown Colony "no spiak English" - it's just English of a different sort, like American slang generously laced with local oomph and zest.

Words.English Translation: → English: no + Singlish: standard from english no not having; without + singlish standard great or outstanding quality ← english standard acceptable quality or grade; recognized benchmark of quality
Words.Definition: poor quality; lacklustre; subpar; bad

Words.English Translation: → English: not + happy ↻ Hokkien: 𫧃爽 𣍐爽 poj: bōe-sóng from english not used to negate sth. + english happy joyful; contented ↻ hokkien (poj) 𫧃爽 𣍐爽 bōe-sóng unhappy; dissatisfied; unwell ← hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not; cannot + hokkien (poj) 爽 爽 sóng pleased; happy; satisfied; feel good
Words.Definition: unhappy; dissatisfied
Words.Example: Not happy? Bway song, ah? Complain, lor.

Words.Word: not happy, talk outside 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𫧃爽 𣍐爽 poj: bōe-sóng + 后尾 後尾 poj: āu-bóe/bé + 讲 講 poj: kóng + English: not + happy + talk + outside from hokkien (poj) 𫧃爽 𣍐爽 bōe-sóng unhappy; dissatisfied; unwell ← hokkien (poj) 𫧃 𣍐 bōe not; cannot + hokkien (poj) 爽 爽 sóng pleased; happy; satisfied; feel good + hokkien (poj) 后尾 後尾 āu-bóe/bé behind; at the back + hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; talk; say + english not used to negate sth. + english happy joyful; contented + english talk speak; chat + english outside external; not a part of; not inside; beyond some area or limit ← english out not in + english side region or area in relation to sth.
Words.Definition: (rude) used to issue a challenge to someone who one feels has transgressed against or has a problem with oneself, inviting the other party to settle things outside (implying an escalated altercation possibly involving physical violence)

Words.English Translation: → English: not + here + not + there from english not used to negate sth. + english here distinct or indicated location near to the speaker + english not used to negate sth. + english there distinct or indicated location not near to the speaker
Words.Definition: (idiom) not quite right; at an uncomfortable in-between stage which does not fit nicely into things; an unhappy medium
Words.Example: The void deck is a space not quite here nor there: it’s not outside, but also not inside or “home”. Susie’s neighbours and husband share the same feeling: that “not here”, “not there” feeling, like they are just waiting for something to happen, for that unexciting finale that many dread.

Words.English Translation: → English: not + I + say + Singlish: one from english not used to negate sth. + english I 1p. sing. pron. + english say tell; speak sth. + singlish one used to highlight an origin or emphasize sth. ← english one pro-form (used as a substitute word for a noun or pronoun understood in context)
Words.Definition: used when saying something dubious or unverifiable, such as a piece of advice, to qualify that the speaker cannot be named as the one who gave that dubious statement or idea, or held responsible if one takes it at face value
Words.Example: Not I say one But some shoulder surgery is really no better than sham aka fake surgery … one of the side effects of rotator cuff repair is “significant and difficult to treat postoperative pain“. I quoted it because not I say one. It’s what is published in Anaesthesia, which is a very reputable peer reviewed journal.

Words.English Translation: → English: not + interested from english not used to negate sth. + english interested showing interest; enthusiastic ← old french interesse interest ← latin interesse lie between; take part in
Words.Definition: unenthusiastic; unmotivated; indifferent; unbothered; uncaring

Words.English Translation: → English: not + needed from english not adverb used to negate sth. + english needed necessary
Words.Definition: used in response to a superfluous statement or a joke that one feels has fallen flat

Words.English Translation: → English: not to say that from english not to say that used to clarify sth. is not meant to prevent misunderstanding or overgeneralization
Words.Definition: ‘not to say that …’; used before a statement to clarify what is not meant by it, to prevent misunderstanding or overgeneralization, or soften its harshness
Words.Example: Not say she fat or lazy lah… but she stay HDB second floor nia, still must take lift?

Words.English Translation: → English: not yet from english not yet currently not, but expected later ← english not used to negate sth. + english yet currently; at present
Words.Definition: not yet; currently not, but expected later
Words.Example: He asks if he can set me down. I think he feels I am getting heavier. But he is too kind to let me know. I shake my head. "Notchet," I mumble—not yet."Notchet, notchet, notchet." Papa teases me. I giggle. I hug him tightly for a few seconds more. I don't want to let him go.

Words.English Translation: → English: naughty from english naughty mischievous; badly-behaved; playful
Words.Definition: naughty; mischievous; badly-behaved

Words.English Translation: → English: now + then from english now currently; at present + english then at which time
Words.Definition: ‘yet it is only now that’; used to express incredulity, surprise, or sarcasm when something finally happens, though much later than anticipated or than it should have
Words.Example: Kena hacked 4mths ago now then know ah?

Words.English Translation: → English: national + registration + identity card from english national of or related to a nation or country ← middle french national of or related to a nation or country ← latin nātiōnālis national + english registration sth. that registers ← english register officially record ← medieval latin registrum register (book for recording information) + english -ation an action or process, or the result thereof ← old french -ation an action or process, or the result thereof ← latin -ātiō form of the -tiō suffix added to a noun to form another noun relating to an action or the result thereof + english identity card small official document used to contain a person’s particulars, information, etc. ← english identity individual details e.g. name, by which one is recognized + english card flat, stiff, usually rectangular piece of plastic, paper, etc.
Words.Definition: a plastic card issued to every Singaporean citizen and permanent resident (PR) which holds information such as a photograph, name, NRIC number, date of birth, race, etc. The card is pink for citizens and blue for PRs.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 懒 懶 poj: nōa from hokkien (poj) 懒 懶 nōa lazy; sluggish
Words.Definition: to laze about; to slack off; to rest
Words.Example: Shag man, cannot wait to get back to bunk and nua.

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: -nya from baba malay -nya ’s; used to form the possessive ← malay -nya of; belonging to; used to form the attributive
Words.Definition: ‘s; used to form the possessive form of a noun or pronoun
Words.Example: - This one whose book one?- I think is Philipnya book, I got see him reading just now.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: nyatuh from malay nyatuh tree of the spp. Palaquium obovatum or Payena lavilandii or its durable wood
Words.Definition: any tree of the genera Palaquium or Payena (especially Palaquium obovatum or Payena lavilandii), or its durable wood, which is commonly used for making furniture
Words.Example: In the living area, a nyatoh wood TV console adds storage flexibility, while a plaster feature wall brings focus to the plasma TV and is miniature digital accoutrements.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: nyonya from malay / baba malay nyonya male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born man ← portuguese Possible, but not certain dona lady; term of address for a middle-aged or older lady ← latin domna/domina lady; madam or hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 娘 niû/niô͘/niâ woman; lady; girl
Words.Definition: a female Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans
Words.Example: However, neither rain nor shine, nor lack of pocket money could keep the Nyonyas and Bibiks from this game. If their sourve of income was cut off, they would simply pawn their jewellwery. Other popular games of the Nyonyas and Bibiks were mahjong and chap ji kee.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: nyonya + kuih from malay / baba malay nyonya male Peranakan or descendant of Peranakans; honorific term for a non-Malay but Straits-born man ← portuguese Possible, but not certain dona lady; term of address for a middle-aged or older lady ← latin domna/domina lady; madam or hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 娘 niû/niô͘/niâ woman; lady; girl + malay / baba malay kuih small snack cakes, biscuits, confectioneries etc. ← hokkien (poj) 粿 kóe steamed cake made from rice flour or glutinous rice flour

Words.Example: We serve Nyonya kueh when we have tea sessions with our customers ...

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 乌 烏 peng'im: ou1 + Hainanese / hokkien: 乌 烏 hrs/poj: ɔu1/o͘ from teochew (peng'im) 乌 烏 ou1 black; dark + hainanese / hokkien (hrs/poj) 乌 烏 ɔu1/o͘ black; dark
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) black; without milk
Words.Example: She will come in the morning, about 9 am, and drink a cup of teh-o and have some food. Sometimes she will go the the salon at the end of the block to do her hair.

Words.English Translation: → English: owe + money + pay + money ↻ General chinese: 欠债还钱 欠債還錢 pinyin: qiàn zhài huán qián + English: $ from english owe be in debt of + english money cash; currency; legally accepted means of quantifying and exchanging wealth ← anglo-norman muneie money; coins ← latin monēta mint; money; coins ← latin Monēta Italian goddess of the mint + english pay give money in exchange for goods and/or services + english money cash; currency; legally accepted means of quantifying and exchanging wealth ← anglo-norman muneie money; coins ← latin monēta mint; money; coins ← latin Monēta Italian goddess of the mint ↻ general chinese (pinyin) 欠债还钱 欠債還錢 qiàn zhài huán qián (saying) a debtor must repay their debts ← general chinese (pinyin) 欠债 欠債 qiàn zhài owe a debt; be in debt ← general chinese (pinyin) 欠 欠 qiàn owe; ask for + general chinese (pinyin) 债 債 zhài debt + general chinese (pinyin) 还钱 還錢 huán qián repay; pay back; pay ← general chinese (pinyin) 还 還 huán return; pay + general chinese (pinyin) 钱 錢 qián money + english $ symbol of currency; 'dollar sign'; money (dollars, pesos, etc.)
Words.Definition: abbreviation of 'owe money, pay money', a phrase infamously used by loan sharks (ah longs) as a threat to borrowers who have failed to return their money on time. It is often graffitied on the walls of their home or business properties.
Words.Example: Soon, police will have eyes round-the-clock at "hotspots" for this "public menace": Illegal moneylenders who splash, paint or scrawl O$P$ (owe money, pay money) on walls.
Related: see no touch, touch no see, see and touch, pay money

Words.English Translation: → Japanese: お婆さん おばあさん obāsan from japanese お婆さん おばあさん obāsan grandmother; old lady
Words.Definition: a woman whose fashion style is sloppy and outmoded, and is reminiscent of aunties and women from a much older generation
unfashionable; gaudy; garish

Latin American ballroom dance or its music

Words.Word: oh my guanyin ma 简 繁

Words.English Translation: → English: old + flower ↻ General chinese: 老花 pinyin: lǎo huā from english old existing for a long time + english flower usu. colourful reproductive structure in angiosperms ← anglo-norman flur flower ← altin flōrem flower ↻ general chinese (pinyin) 老花 lǎo huā nearsightedness; presbyopia

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: switched on from singlish switched on extremely focused; highly attentive; mentally engaged ← english switched on turned on, esp. e.g. of a device; (inf.) excited; extremely focused, attentive, and mentally engaged ← english switched changed from one state to another + english on enabled; operating; powered

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ondeh-ondeh from malay ondeh-ondeh small, spherical, pandan-flavoured kueh with a chewy skin filled with gula melaka and rolled in grated coconut ← tamil உண்டை uṇṭai ball; sphere; mouthful of food
Words.Definition: a small, spherical, pandan-flavoured kueh consisting of a chewy skin, which may be made variously from glutinous rice flour, tapioca starch, sweet potato starch, etc. or a mix of several flours, and which is filled with gula melaka and rolled in grated coconut

Words.English Translation: → English: one + General chinese: 个/的* 個/的* poj/pinyin: ê/de from english one pro-form (used as a substitute word for a noun or pronoun understood in context) + general chinese (poj/pinyin) 个/的* 個/的* ê/de possessive particle; nominalizer; emphasis, etc. (*etc.; non-exhaustive)
Words.Definition: suffixed to the attributive form of a possessive pronoun (e.g. my, your, her, etc.) or a noun in possessive form (-'s) to use it predicatively (equivalent to e.g. mine, yours, hers, etc.), even if both forms would be the same in English (e.g. his, whose, anybody's, etc.)
Words.Example: This laptop is mine.→ This laptop is my one.

Words.English Translation: → English: one + come + all + come from english one a thing; an instance; 1 + english come arrive; move tw. + english all entirety of; every thing + english come arrive; move tw.
Words.Definition: used to describe the phenomenon or situation where things appear to happen overwhelmingly and all at once instead of at regular intervals, due to e.g. poor scheduling, positive feedback, coincidental timing, social dynamics, etc.
Words.Example: I was somewhat less frustrated when I heard one of my fellow commuters say to her girlfriend, "Don't come, don't come. One come, all come!"
Related: don't come don't come one come all come
no come no come, one come all come

Words.English Translation: → English: one-of-a-kind from english one-of-a-kind unique
Words.Definition: (pejorative) difficult; stubborn; frustrating; unaccommodating; troublesome

Words.English Translation: → English: one + Singlish: times from english one the first natural number; 1; unity + singlish times general measure word; used to indicate discrete amounts of items, objects, people, etc. ← english times multiplied by ← english time occurrence of sth. + english × mathematical symbol for 'times' (no. of occurrecnces of sth.)
Words.Definition: one; 1; a single instance of something

Words.English Translation: → English: one + Singlish: times + English: good + one from english one the first natural number; 1; unity + singlish times general measure word; used to indicate discrete amounts of items, objects, people, etc. ← english times multiplied by ← english time occurrence of sth. + english × mathematical symbol for 'times' (no. of occurrecnces of sth.) + english good great; proper; effective; satisfactory; positive + english one a thing; an instance

Words.English Translation: → English: onion + Singlish: prata from english onion Allium cepa, and esp. its edible bulb ← old french oignon onion ← latin ūniō type of onion + singlish prata type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha ← tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread
Words.Definition: a prata with sliced or diced onion (or sometimes spring onion, or other related vegetables) folded inside as an ingredient
Words.Example: To the relief of my hunger, my own order of onion prata came shortly. It was quite a big rectangular piece, its ends jutting out of the serving plate.

Words.English Translation: → English: only from english only merely; just; simply ↻ asian languages "only" only; merely; just; simply
Words.Definition: used after an adjective to emphasize and intensify it; utterly; simply; completely
Words.Example: Sian, must wake up at 4am tomorrow and Thursday for field test. Like shag only.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: on3 + -z from singlish on3 used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc. ← english on happening; taking place, (inf.) used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc. + singlish -z colloquializing suffix; used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang ← english -z (urban slang) suffix used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang
Words.Definition: 'OK!'; 'it's a deal'; 'you're on'; used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc.
Words.Example: "Actually, if you don't mind, would you like to come with me? I think Ah Ma would really like you. Like how I really like your company. Onz?"YOLO, right? And we did have a lovely afternoon on Ubin.I nod. "Onz."

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: onz + Malay: tak from singlish onz used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc. ← singlish on3 used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc. ← english on happening; taking place, (inf.) used to accept a suggestion, proposal, challenge, etc. + singlish -z colloquializing suffix; used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang ← english -z (urban slang) suffix used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang + malay tak not ✂ malay tidak not

Words.Word: oon oon jiak bee hoon 简 繁

Words.Definition: capable; ready; solid; reliable; trustworthy; composed; keeping cool under any situation. An emphasized variant of steady1.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: upih from malay upih wide leaf sheath, esp. of the areca nut palm; spathe
Words.Definition: short for opeh leaf or opeh hak
Words.Example: How symbolic the passing of "opeh" the good, sturdy, dried palm leaf, which was used for noodles, rojak, and other dishes.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: upih + Hokkien: 箬 poj: ha̍h from malay upih wide leaf sheath, esp. of the areca nut palm; spathe + hokkien (poj) 箬 ha̍h leaf sheath, esp. of large-leaved bamboo
Words.Definition: the large leaf bases or leaf sheaths of Areca catechu, the areca palm (also known as the betel nut palm), which are traditionally dried (after which they turn a pale brownish-tan colour) and used to wrap food such as Hokkien mee, chee cheong fun, and chai tow kway. They are said to impart an aromatic, woody fragrance to the dish enclosed within.
Words.Example: The opeh hak was more than just a wrapping - it was like one of the essential ingredients for the best fried Hokkien mee, fried hor fun, fried kway teow, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: upih + English: leaf from malay upih wide leaf sheath, esp. of the areca nut palm; spathe + english leaf usually green and flat organ of a plant, typically responsible for photosynthesis, transpiration, etc.
Words.Definition: the large leaf bases or leaf sheaths of Areca catechu, the areca palm (also known as the betel nut palm), which are traditionally dried (after which they turn a pale brownish-tan colour) and used to wrap food such as Hokkien mee, chee cheong fun, and chai tow kway. They are said to impart an aromatic, woody fragrance to the dish enclosed within.
Words.Example: In the old days, if you had it for takeaway, you'd be served your beef kway teow in opeh leaves.

Words.Definition: (euphemistic) to have the fly of one’s trousers open; having one’s zipper undone

Words.English Translation: → English: opposition + -ie from english opposition political party opposing the incumbent govt. ← old french oposicion opposition ← late latin oppositiō opposing; opposition + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth.
Words.Definition: (politics, sometimes pejorative) of or relating to the opposition
Words.Example: All oppositions step down better lar. Let PAP has 100% mandate. Then we see which group actually has the better foresight: PAP or oppie supporters.

Words.Word: or bak kak 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 乌目角 烏目角 poj: o͘-ba̍k-kak from min nan (poj) 乌目角 烏目角 o͘-ba̍k-kak black eye ← min nan (poj) 乌 烏 o͘ black + min nan (poj) 目角 目角 ba̍k-kak corner of the eye ← min nan (poj) 目 目 ba̍k eye + min nan (poj) 角 角 kak corner

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 乌青 烏青 poj: o͘-chheⁿ from hokkien (poj) 乌青 烏青 o͘-chheⁿ bruise; contusion; haematoma ← hokkien (poj) 乌 烏 o͘ black; dark + hokkien (poj) 青 青 chheⁿ blue-green
Words.Definition: a bruise; a contusion; a haematoma

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 蚵煎 poj: ô-chian from hokkien (poj) 蚵煎 ô-chian oyster omelette ← teochew (peng'im) 蚵 ô oyster + teochew (peng'im) 煎 chian pan-fry

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 乌公 烏公 poj: o͘-kong from hokkien (poj) 乌公 烏公 o͘-kong fine; penalty ← malay hukum law; rules ← arabic حُكْم ḥukm judgment; decree; rule; sentence
Words.Definition: a fine; a penalty
Words.Example: ... common folks like us who've been "punished" (eg. cannot do this do that, cannot go here go there, restrict here restrict there, orkong here orkong there, rent increase here increase there etc) non-stop by them ever since we vote them back to power last year ...

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 蚝烙 蠔烙 peng'im: o5 luah4 from teochew (peng'im) 蚝烙 蠔烙 o5 luah4 oyster omelette ← teochew (peng'im) 蚝 蠔 o5 oyster + teochew (peng'im) 烙 烙 luah4 pan-fry; large cake; bake
Words.Definition: a Teochew fried oyster omelette, made with eggs, oysters, and a batter of mixed flours and starches, such as all-purpose flour, tapioca starch, rice flour, potato starch, etc. It is crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, and is usually topped with white pepper, chopped spring onions, and a sour chilli.
Words.Example: I'm too busy tracking down the best or luak at hawker centres to visit the zoo or snap photos of the Merlion.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 芋泥 poj: ō͘-nî from hokkien (poj) 芋泥 ō͘-nî dessert of sweetened taro purée or paste mixed w. oil and other ingredients ← teochew (peng'im) 芋泥 ou7 ni5 taro purée or paste ← teochew (peng'im) 芋 ou7 Colocasia esculenta, a.k.a. taro or its edible corm + teochew (peng'im) 泥 ni5 paste; mud; pulp
Words.Definition: a Teochew dessert of sweetened taro (or other similar corm or root vegetable) purée or paste, mixed with oil and other ingredients
Words.Example: The one I had that day was superb and just what Or Nee should be. However, there was an occasion when I had some quibbles over the presence of too much syrup which resulted in a rather watery and runny Or Nee.

Words.Word: or ya peh ya 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 乌抑白抑 烏抑白抑 poj: o͘-iah-pe̍h-iah from hokkien (poj) 乌抑白抑 烏抑白抑 o͘-iah-pe̍h-iah children's game played by holding out one hand and flipping it on each syllable ← hokkien (poj) 乌 烏 o͘ black; dark + hokkien (poj) 抑 抑 iah and; then; and then + hokkien (poj) 白 白 pe̍h white + hokkien (poj) 抑 抑 iah and; then; and then
Words.Definition: a children's game where players stand in a circle, each holding out one hand with the palm either facing up or down. They then begin chanting a set phrase in unison while flipping their hand rhythmically on each syllable (or at random if they so please). On the final syllable of the chant, all players stop flipping their hands, leaving a random distribution of players having their palms either facing down ("black") or up ("white"). This may then be used for any required purpose, most commonly for randomly splitting the group into two teams according to "black" and "white".

Words.English Translation: → English: operationally + ready + date from english operationally in a manner regarding effectiveness or functionality ← english operational relating to (esp. military) operations; effective; functional ← middle french operation process of carrying out sth.; military campaign ← latin operātiō operation; role; function + english -al operation; activity ← latin -ālis suffix to form an adj. pertaining to sth. + english -ly suffix to form an adj. pertaining to sth. + english ready prepared + english date point in time ← middle french date date ← latin datus given

Words.Example: Mindef is now in the midst of conducting a pilot trial for online academic programmes to help prepare full-time NSmen for transition as they approach their ORD.

Words.English Translation: → English: ORD + Singlish: lo from english ORD init. of Operationally Ready Date ← english operationally in a manner regarding effectiveness or functionality + english ready prepared + english date point in time + singlish lo particle exp. finality ← hokkien (poj) 啰 囉 --lo͘/--lo͘h already; particle used at the end of a sentence to exp. finality or completion

Words.English Translation: → English: ORD + mood from english ORD init. of Operationally Ready Date ← english operationally in a manner regarding effectiveness or functionality + english ready prepared + english date point in time + english mood feeling; mental or emotional state; atmosphere
Words.Definition: (NS) a mental or emotional state felt by full-time National Servicemen when nearing their Operationally Ready Date (ORD), during which they put less effort into tasks, laze about as much as possible, take a lackadaisical and indifferent approach to military duties, offload work and responsibilities to their understudies, and in general stop caring

Words.English Translation: → English: already from english already completed or happened by the present or specified time ← min nan (poj) 了 liáu particle indicating perfective aspect or change of state; already; (approximately) past tense marker
Words.Definition: indicating perfective aspect (completion of an action)
Words.Example: He say they follow Chinese customs but then his mother ah, wear sarong, eat with fingers and speak Baba Malay. All campur campur oredi ... Aiyoh sei lor, I'm late oredi.

Words.English Translation: → English: orgasm from english orgasm sexual climax ← french orgasme orgasm ← ancient greek ὀργασμός orgasmós orgasm
Words.Definition: to reach a climax of pleasure; to be immensely pleased or satisfied

Words.English Translation: → English: orgy from english orgy closed gathering of people involving drunken or feverish revelries, dancing, partying, secret rituals, etc.; large gathering for group sex; overindulgence in sth. ← french orgies orgy ← latin orgia festival in honour of Bacchus; secret gatherings for revelries ← ancient greek ὄργῐᾰ órgia secret rituals or worship
Words.Definition: a mess; a chaotic jumble
Words.Example: Indeed, the two ongoing exhibits by Yang, 35, Justin Loke, 30, and Fiona Koh, 26, is a veritable text-based orgy of meanings — subtle puns, tongue-in-cheek wisecracks, and a lot of linguistic har-hars.

Related: orbi good, ang moh jiak cerut

Words.English Translation: → Malay: otak-otak from malay otak-otak fish paste or pudding wrapped in a banana leaf and grilled ⇇ malay otak brain
Words.Definition: a dish or snack of a pudding-like spiced paste made from fish (usually mackerel or batang), coconut milk, spices, onions, garlic, egg, and other ingredients, wrapped in a banana or palm leaf and grilled. It usually comes in a spicy and non-spicy version. It has origins in Malay and Peranakan cuisine.
Words.Example: If you are lazy, go for ready-made otak-otak and satay. They're easy to eat, too — you won't even need plates.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: own time, own target from singlish own time, own target (mil.) command given for soldiers to take aim at their own lane's target(s) and to fire at their own pace; at one's own pace; without hurrying; with no urgency ← english own of or belonging to a specific person + english time duration; pace + english own of or belonging to a specific person + english target marked symbol, pattern, or figure for shooting at, usu. uesd to test accuracy ← middle french targette dimin. of 'targe' ← middle french targe small, light buckler or round shield
Words.Definition: (initialism) taking things at one's own pace; without hurrying or any sense of urgency

Words.English Translation: → English: outside + food from english outside external; not a part of; not inside; beyond some area or limit ← english out not in + english side region or area in relation to sth. + english food edible goods which may be consumed for nourishment or sustenance

Words.Example: ... it'll just be an issue like that of cinema operators not allowing outside food into their halls.

Words.English Translation: → English: outside + food + drinks from english outside external; not a part of; not inside; beyond some area or limit ← english out not in + english side region or area in relation to sth. + english food edible goods which may be consumed for nourishment or sustenance + english drinks beverages; edible liquids
Words.Definition: food and/or beverages consumed in an establishment from which they were not purchased, which are usually disallowed and frowned upon in most Singaporean restaurants, eateries, bars, etc.
Words.Example: When she asked the staff if she could wash the grapes on their premises, they promptly pointed to a sign that read: "No outside food and drinks are allowed."

Words.Definition: (military) command given during a live firing exercise (or simulated version of one), just before the order to carry on shooting, for each soldier to take aim at their lane's target(s) and fire at their own pace
Words.Example: After the mood had sobered down, we made a plan for the next day — which was basically to wake up whenever and let it be free and easy, own time own target as we called it ...

Words.Definition: to verify or one's own work or actions by oneself, farcically passing them off as without error; to police oneself
Words.Example: Singaporeans want an opposition to check the PAP, because, in their heart of hearts, we all know that ownself check ownself is not realistic. The inherent nature of power makes this unrealistic.
Related: you think, I thought, who confirm

ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 拍 peng'im: pah4 + 三辇 三輦 peng'im: san1 lêng2 from hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 拍 pah4 do; general action verb + hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 三辇 三輦 san1 lêng2 clipping of 三辇车 ✂ hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 三辇车 三輦車 san1 lêng2 cia1 tricycle; three-wheeled vehicle ← hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 三 三 san1 three + hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 辇 輦 lêng wheel + hokkien / teochew (peng'im) 车 車 cia1 car; land vehicle
Words.Definition: to flail about with the legs (especially in the air), as if one is pedalling a tricycle
Related: gor chiam tua kuay gu chia leng

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 拍针 拍針 poj: phah-cham from min nan (poj) 拍针 拍針 phah-cham give or receive an injection ← min nan (poj) 拍 拍 phah do; hit; general action verb + min nan (poj) 针 針 cham needle; injection
