Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 歹 poj: pháiⁿ from hokkien (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; evil
Words.Definition: (in compounds) bad; evil; naughty; not good

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 跛手 poj: pái-chhiú from hokkien (poj) 跛手 pái-chhiú crippled; cripple, esp. wrt. the arms or hands ← hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 手 chhiú hand
Words.Definition: crippled; having an upper-body injury or condition which prevents one from performing work or other normal tasks properly

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 歹食 poj: pháiⁿ-chia̍h from min nan (poj) 歹食 pháiⁿ-chia̍h bad-tasting; hard to eat ← min nans (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; difficult; tough + min nan (poj) 食 chia̍h eat
Words.Definition: bad-tasting; unappetizing; unpalatable; hard to eat
Words.Example: young people nowadays never really experience eating pai jiak food before ... when i young i used to complain my mom's cooking was bland compared to my grandmother's. after i go NS i learnt to appreciate my mom's cooking.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 跛跤 poj: pái-kha from hokkien (poj) 跛跤 pái-kha crippled; lame; cripple ← hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 跤 kha leg; foot
Words.Definition: crippled; lame; having a lower-body injury or condition which prevents one from walking properly
Words.Example: Pai-kha-e, an amputee, now gets along on crutches. But before his cancerous leg was operated on, it was so painful that he could not walk ...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 跛跤跛手 poj: pái-kha-pái-chhiú from hokkien (poj) 跛跤跛手 pái-kha-pái-chhiú crippled; lame; cripple; medically unfit to work or perform one’s normal duties ← hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 跤 kha leg; foot + hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 手 chhiú hand
Words.Definition: crippled; lame; invalid; having an injury or condition, especially to the limbs, which renders one medically unfit to work or perform one’s normal duties

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 歹看 poj: pháiⁿ-khòaⁿ from hokkien (poj) 歹看 pháiⁿ-khòaⁿ ugly; not good-looking; unsightly
Words.Definition: ugly; not good-looking; unsightly
Words.Example: I look so paĩ khuã in this photo leh. Why you post the one where I look so gong gong sia?

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 歹囝 poj: pháiⁿ-kiáⁿ from min nan (poj) 歹囝 pháiⁿ-kiáⁿ scoundrel; hooligan; delinquent ← min nan (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; evil + min nan (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ child; kid; son
Words.Definition: a scoundrel; a hooligan; a delinquent; a wayward son

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 歹侬 poj: pháiⁿ-lâng from hokkien (poj) 歹侬 pháiⁿ-lâng bad guy; villain ← hokkien (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; evil + hokkien (poj) 侬 lâng person; man; human
Words.Definition: a bad guy; a villain; a bad person

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 歹命 poj: pháiⁿ-miā from min nan (poj) 歹命 pháiⁿ-miā having an unfortunate and uncomfortable life ← min nan (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; difficult; tough + min nan (poj) 命 miā life; fate; luck
Words.Definition: having a misfortunate, uncomfortable, and difficult life

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 排媠 poj: pâi-súi from hokkien (poj) 排媠 pâi-súi for show; arrange beautifully ← hokkien (poj) 排 pâi arrange; display; put + hokkien (poj) 媠 sui beautiful; good-looking; perfect
Words.Definition: for show; just to look nice, without a practical purpose
Words.Example: If it helps you’re most welcome to borrow any of my stuff ... almost all are brand new 😆 ... Pai Swee one..

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 激派头 激派頭 poj: kik-phài-thâu from hokkien (poj) 激派头 激派頭 kik-phài-thâu act haughty; put on airs ← hokkien (poj) 激 激 kik feign; act; pretend + hokkien (poj) 派头 派頭 phài-thâu style; demeanor; temperament
Words.Definition: to be arrogant; to act haughty; to put on airs

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 歹趁 poj: pháiⁿ-thàn from min nan (poj) 歹趁 pháiⁿ-thàn scoundrel; hooligan; delinquent ← min nan (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; evil + min nan (poj) 趁 thàn child; kid; son
Words.Definition: (of work, a task, etc.) too much trouble for what it's worth; not worth the difficulty

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 歹做 poj: pháiⁿ-chò from hokkien (poj) 歹做 pháiⁿ-chò hard to do; difficult ← hokkien (poj) 歹 pháiⁿ bad; evil + hokkien (poj) 做 chò do
Words.Definition: (of work, a task, etc.) difficult; hard to do; troublesome; tough

Words.English Translation: → English: pain from english pain hurt; aching; suffering ← old french peine pain; suffering ← latin poena punishment; torment ← ancient greek ποινή poinḗ blood money; penalty
Words.Definition: painful; aching
Words.Example: Aduh! Pain sia; don't touch!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 歹势 歹勢 poj: pháiⁿ-sè from hokkien (poj) 歹势 歹勢 pháiⁿ-sè sorry; excuse me; embarrassed
Words.Definition: sorry
Words.Example: Pai seh! Did I knock you? Pai seh pai seh.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: paĩseh + English: piece from singlish paĩseh sorry; excuse me; embarrassed ← hokkien (poj) 歹势 歹勢 pháiⁿ-sè sorry; embarrassed; ashamed; shy + english piece small part or item
Words.Definition: the final piece of food left over in a shared dish, which the people at the table are all too good-mannered, courteous, or shy to take (lest they appear greedy, overeat, deprive an eating companion who really wanted it of it, or any other number of reasons). This leads to them all sitting awkwardly and staring at the piece for a long time, while each half-wanting to eat the piece but also being half-hesitant to do so. A surprisingly common phenomenon when meals involve sharing food between a number of people.
Words.Example: Alamak, this is why we 5 people can never go dim sum, always cannot split the number of food evenly sia. Can someone finish the paiseh piece so we can pay up?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 拍 poj: phah from hokkien (poj) 拍 phah (lit.) hit; (generally) do or perform an action; used to verbify a noun
Words.Definition: do; general dummy verb used to mean doing some action, especially one usually performed on or with a given noun
Words.Example: Pak Civ the takeaway is nukes is the only answer

Words.Word: pak chiu cheng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 拍手铳 拍手銃 poj: phah-chhiú-chèng from hokkien (poj) 拍手铳 拍手銃 phah-chhiú-chèng (vg., m.) masturbate; jack off ← hokkien (poj) 拍 拍 phah do; hit; general action verb + hokkien (poj) 手铳 手銃 chhiú-chhèng handgun; pistol
Words.Definition: (vulgar, of males) to masturbate; to jack off
Words.Example: Is this what pangsai on our pao means? To put your pah chiu cheng lam pah jui all over our clothes?

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 拍拖 jyutping: paak3 to1 from cantonese (jyutping) 拍拖 paak3 to1 date; go out on a date with sb.
Words.Definition: go out on a romantic date with somebody
Words.Example: He adds that he goes there with his children once every two months. "A lot of memories. First time I paktor (dated) with my wife was there."

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pakat from malay pakat agree; agreement ← malay muafakat agreement; consensus ← arabic مُوَافَقَة muwāfaqa agree; agreement; consent
Words.Definition: to collude; to conspire; to plan something together
Words.Example: My sister and I will pakat ... when my parents are out. We look for the car turning into the car park and warn each other.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pakcik from malay pakcik uncle ← malay pak father + malay cik uncle; mister; term of respectful address for an older (usually Malay) man ✂ malay Likely, but other possible etymologies exist encik mister; term of respectful address for an older man ← hokkien (poj) 引叔 ín-chek dear uncle ← hokkien (poj) 引 ín dear; honorific prefix + hokkien (poj) 叔 chek uncle; father's younger brother
Words.Definition: uncle; term of address or endearment for an uncle

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: pak thor + English: -(o)logy from singlish pak thor date; go out on a date with sb. ← cantonese (jyutping) 拍拖 paak3 to1 date; go out on a date with sb. + english -(o)logy a branch of learning; a study; (humorous) suffixed tongue-in-cheek to an english word to create a hypothetical subject of study ← latin -logia the study or knowledge of ← greek -λογία -logía denoting the study of something
Words.Definition: (humorous) the study or science of dating
Words.Example: Years of research in the scientific field of 'paktohlogy' have shown that horror movies are the best to watch on a date.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: kepala + butuh from malay kepala head ← sanskrit कपाल kapā́la skull; cranium + malay butuh (vulgar) penis; (general insult)
Words.Definition: (vulgar) dickhead; idiot; general term of insult or abuse
Words.Example: She/her/they palabutoh rainbow people opinion can fuck them off from this world.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 板面 板麵 poj: pán-mī from hokkien (poj) 板面 板麵 pán-mī Hakka hand-cut noodles; noodle dish made from such noodles ← hokkien (poj) 板 板 pán board ← hokkien (poj) 面 麵 mī wheat noodles
Words.Definition: A type of noodle traditionally made by rolling a kneaded dough of wheat flour, salt, and water (and often egg) flat on a board and slicing them with straight cuts by hand using a wooden block as a guide, a technique originating in Hakka cuisine. It is made from the same dough as you mee and mee hoon kueh, and is often white in colour.
Words.Example: ... rather than spend long hours alone in the cold, bleak room, he dropped by his favourite noodle bar and ordered pan mee and a a beer. ... He'd almost finished the noodles when his implant pinged. ... So instead of taking the short walk to his bedsit, he ordered another bowl of pan mee and a beer.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pancit from malay pancit punctured; deflated; leaking
Words.Definition: punctured; deflated; leaking
Words.Example: I'll be a bit late... My tire kena pancit on the way here.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: pandai from malay / baba malay pandai clever; smart; skilled ← prakrit (brahmi) 𑀧𑀁𑀟𑀺𑀅 paṃḍia wise man ← sanskrit पण्डित paṇḍitá scholar; clever; wise
Words.Definition: clever; smart; intelligent
Words.Example: This so called financial expert or analysis very pandai in flipping roti plata ... when market turn to BULL, they will retweet their statement.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pandan from malay pandan plant of the genus Pandanus, usu. P. amaryllifolius; flavour derived from this plant
Words.Definition: any plant of the genus Pandanus, though usually referring to P. amaryllifolius
Words.Example: Think strips of tender, succulent chicken on a bed of fragrant rice that's redolent of ginger and pandan leaves ... what's not to love, really?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放 poj: pàng + English: chance from hokkien (poj) 放 pàng put; release; lend + english chance opportunity ← old french cheance chance; fate; luck; fall ← latin cadēns falling
Words.Definition: to give a chance (especially to somebody)
Words.Example: It will be so "jialat" for the ang moh to interpret Ah Beng's plea for leniency: "Please pang chance a bit, I beg you."

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放尿 poj: pàng-jiō from hokkien (poj) 放尿 pàng-jiō urinate; pee ← hokkien (poj) 放 pàng put; release; emit + hokkien (poj) 尿 jiō/liō urine; pee
Words.Definition: to urinate; to pee
Words.Example: "I feel just fine, doc. But ... Every night when I get up to pang jio (pee), the bathroom light comes on automatically when I open the door."... "Ah Seng! Your father pang jio in the fridge again!"

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放工 poj: pàng-kang from hokkien (poj) 放工 pàng-kang finish work; clock out; get off work ← hokkien (poj) 放 pàng put; release; set down + hokkien (poj) 工 kang work
Words.Definition: to finish work; to clock out; to get off work
Words.Example: Pang kang lo! TGIF.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放 poj: pàng + 球 poj: kiû from hokkien (poj) 放 pàng put; set; give + hokkien (poj) 球 kiû ball
Words.Definition: (betting) to give a handicap of a specified number of goals when betting on a stronger team, especially in football
Words.Example: I tell you, Senegal confirm win one. I pang nng liap kiu give him also no kick.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 放屁 poj: pàng-phùi from hokkien / teochew (poj) 放屁 pàng-phùi fart ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 放 pàng put; release; emit + hokkien / teochew (poj) 屁 phùi fart

Related: ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放 poj: pàng + 半粒 poj: pòaⁿ-lia̍p from hokkien (poj) 放 pàng release; free; put out; let out + hokkien (poj) 半粒 pòaⁿ-lia̍p type of handicap in sports betting, (lit.) 'half a granule / ball' ← hokkien (poj) 半 pòaⁿ half + hokkien (poj) 粒 lia̍p (measure word) granules; round objects; grains; balls; pieces
Words.Definition: to reveal a lot of cleavage; to display a large proportion of the breasts uncovered and visible
Words.Example: zhun boh mai anyhow post my gf pang pua liap leh

Words.Word: pang puay kee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放飞机 放飛機 poj: pàng-poe-ki from hokkien (poj) 放飞机 放飛機 pàng-poe-ki stand sb. up; miss an appointment ← cantonese (jyutping) 放飞机 放飛機 fong3 fei1 gei1 stand sb. up; miss an appointment ← cantonese (jyutping) 放 放 fong3 put; release + cantonese (jyutping) 飞机 飛機 fei1 gei1 aeroplane
Words.Definition: to stand someone up

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放屎 poj: pàng-sái from hokkien (poj) 放屎 pàng-sái defecate; excrete faeces; poop ← hokkien (poj) 放 pàng release; let out; lay down; emit + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion
Words.Definition: to defaecate; to poop
Words.Example: Tak boleh tahan already! Siam please, need to pang sai!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放捒 poj: pàng-sak from hokkien (poj) 放捒 pàng-sak release; abandon; give up; forsake.
Words.Definition: give up on; forsake; abandon

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 放生 poj: pàng-seⁿ from hokkien (poj) 放生 pàng-seⁿ release a captive animal; spare sb.
