Words.English Translation: → Malay: panggang from malay panggang grill; grilled
Words.Definition: to grill
Words.Example: Chef Eric Neo, the executive sous chef of Marina Mandarin, predicts that the hotel's bestselling turkeys this year will be its Nonya-style turkey panggang ... "The Nonya turkey, for example, was inspired by a dish called chicken panggang that I made years ago."

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pangkat from malay pangkat rank (esp. military)
Words.Definition: (military) rank

Words.English Translation: → English: panic + balls from english panic sudden, overwhelming fear; freak out ← middle french panique panic; of or relating to Pan ← ancient greek πᾱνῐκός pānikós panic; of or relating to Pan + english balls (slang) testicles; expn. of dismay, frustration, etc.
Words.Definition: to freak out; to panic severely
Words.Example: Dear Gahmen,We know, that's why we so panicballs when you say NRIC no need XXXXX.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pantang from malay pantang taboo
Words.Definition: taboo; superstition
Words.Example: Don't walk beneath other people's underwear, or you'll never grow taller. That was one of the hundreds of pantang (taboo) commandments handed to me by my mother. Yes, my mum has always been quite the pantang queen.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pantat from malay pantat (vulgar) ass; buttocks; female genitalia
Words.Definition: (slightly vulgar) ass; buttocks; arse
Words.Example: Ur husband is a cockanaathan - he deserves to be shouted at for such a stupid suggestion. This kinda husband buay tahan. Basket. Men these days have their pantat for their brains.

Words.English Translation: → English: PAP + Singlish: IB from english PAP abbr. of 'People's Action Party' ← english People's Action Party incumbent and longest-ruling political party in Singapore ← english people's of the people ← english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english -'s possessive suffix + english action carrying out sth.; doing ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action + english party united political group ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division + singlish IB init. of 'Internet brigade' ← singlish Internet Brigade grp. of netizens who try to influence public opinion on sth. ← english Internet global communicational and informational computer network ✂ english internetwork network of and between multiple networks ← english inter- between; connecting ← latin inter between + english network system of interconnected devices ← english net mesh of connected lines or cords + english work sth. made or produced + english brigade coordinated group of people with a common purpose, view, etc. ← french brigade (mil.) large unit comprising several battalions ← italian brigata group; party, (mil.) brigade
Words.Definition: a government-sanctioned group of netizens who vehemently support and praise the PAP in online spaces such as forums and social media, and try to positively influence public sentiment towards it. According to various accounts, they may either be genuinely zealous and earnest supporters of the PAP, or paid off by them to favourably influence the public’s views on the party.
Words.Example: In truth, the PAP IB’s lack of objectivity undermines the very cause that it so aggressively campaigns for. It bolsters the perception that the establishment isn’t particularly interested in listening to the voices on the ground, but more intent on suppressing the opposition.

Words.English Translation: → English: PAP + Singlish: IB + English: dog from english PAP abbr. of 'People's Action Party' ← english People's Action Party incumbent and longest-ruling political party in Singapore ← english people's of the people ← english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english -'s possessive suffix + english action carrying out sth.; doing ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action + english party united political group ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division + singlish IB init. of 'Internet brigade' ← singlish Internet Brigade grp. of netizens who try to influence public opinion on sth. ← english Internet global communicational and informational computer network ✂ english internetwork network of and between multiple networks ← english inter- between; connecting ← latin inter between + english network system of interconnected devices ← english net mesh of connected lines or cords + english work sth. made or produced + english brigade coordinated group of people with a common purpose, view, etc. ← french brigade (mil.) large unit comprising several battalions ← italian brigata group; party, (mil.) brigade + english dog Canis lupus familiaris
Words.Definition: (pejorative) someone who vehemently supports and praises the PAP in online spaces such as forums and social media, and tries to positively influence public sentiment towards it. According to various accounts, they may either be genuinely zealous and earnest supporters of the PAP, or paid off by them to favourably influence the public’s views on the party.
Words.Example: Once people know you support the PAP, you become the lightning rod of criticism ... by extension of being a PAP supporter, it’s almost as if i’m a party spokesperson. I’m just a private citizen who agrees with most of PAP policies [sic]. But you get labelled as a “PAP IB dog”.

Words.English Translation: → English: PAP + Singlish: Internet Brigade from english PAP abbr. of 'People's Action Party' ← english People's Action Party incumbent and longest-ruling political party in Singapore ← english people's of the people ← english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english -'s possessive suffix + english action carrying out sth.; doing ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action + english party united political group ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division + singlish Internet Brigade grp. of netizens who try to influence public opinion on sth. ← english Internet global communicational and informational computer network ✂ english internetwork network of and between multiple networks ← english inter- between; connecting ← latin inter between + english network system of interconnected devices ← english net mesh of connected lines or cords + english work sth. made or produced + english brigade coordinated group of people with a common purpose, view, etc. ← french brigade (mil.) large unit comprising several battalions ← italian brigata group; party, (mil.) brigade
Words.Definition: a group of netizens who vehemently support and praise the PAP in online spaces such as forums and social media, and try to positively influence public sentiment towards it. According to various accounts, they may either be genuinely zealous and earnest supporters of the PAP, or paid off by them to favourably influence the public’s views on the party.
Words.Example: Similar to other countries around the world, Singapore also has its share of internet trolls whose main job is to defensively comment on social media or other web forums. One such group is the PAP Internet Brigade or PAP IB ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa-apa + Manglish: roger from malay apa-apa anything; whatever ⇇ malay apa what + manglish roger call; contact; notify; let one know ← english roger (radio comms.) acknowledge; received ← english Roger letter R in pre-NATO US/RAF phonetic alphabet ← english Roger male given name
Words.Definition: 'let me know if anything comes up'; used to convey that a matter has been settled a conversation concluded, etc., but the listener should feel free to notify the speaker at any later point in time if something changes

Words.English Translation: → English: paper from english paper sheet made of pulp or fibres, esp. used for writing and printing on
Words.Definition: (metaphor, especially gaming) frail; flimsy; easily damaged; of low durability
Words.Example: This champion is damn paper sia, not easy to play.

Words.English Translation: → English: paper + Singlish: prata from english paper sheet made of pulp or fibres, esp. used for writing and printing on + singlish prata type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha ← tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread
Words.Definition: a very thin, crispy, usually single-layered form of prata which is usually served in sweet flavours and rolled to form a large cone
Words.Example: There's also a prata counter where prata chefs roll out creations such as paper prata with chocolate sauce ...

Words.English Translation: → English: paper + Tamil: தோசை tōcai from english paper sheet made of pulp or fibres, esp. used for writing and printing on + tamil தோசை tōcai thin, spongy, South Indian crepe ← tamil தோய் tōy soak; curdle; mix
Words.Definition: a very thin, crispy, single-layered form of thosai which is usually served in sweet flavours and rolled to form a large cone

Words.English Translation: → English: PAP + -ie from english PAP abbr. of 'People's Action Party' ← english People's Action Party incumbent and longest-ruling political party in Singapore ← english people's of the people ← english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english -'s possessive suffix + english action carrying out sth.; doing ← old french aucion action ← latin āctiō action + english party united political group ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth.
Words.Definition: (politics, derogatory) of or relating to the People's Action Party (PAP)
Words.Example: No pappies gov, life still goes on ... We'll still have a non pappies gov.

Words.English Translation: → English: Paradise from english Paradise (mil.) code-word to announce end of a mission; heaven; pleasant place or experience ← old french paradis paradise ← latin paradīsus Paradise; Eden; garden; park ← ancient greek πᾰρᾰ́δεισος parádeisos walled park or garden; Paradise; Eden
Words.Definition: (military) used to announce the end of a mission
Words.Example: After we capture the objective, we still have to set up a proper defense. Don’t go close eyes see ancestors until we paradise.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: parang from malay parang heavy blade resembling a machete
Words.Definition: a one-handed, machete-like tool with a heavy, straight-edged blade around 30 - 40 cm in length, meant for cutting through and clearing jungle plants, but also used as a weapon by gangsters

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: பறையர் paṟaiyar from tamil பறையர் paṟaiyar drummer; low caste in India, or a person thereof
Words.Definition: an outcast; an outsider; a despised and detested person (or group)
Words.Example: I have been visiting my ancestor's village in Fujian, China, for nearly 30 years. I was probably first seen by my relatives as a pariah teen who did not know how to speak the "ancestor's language".

Words.English Translation: → English: parking lot from english parking lot open, cleared area of land with space to leave vehicles
Words.Definition: a single space to leave a vehicle within a car park
Words.Example: Please display the notification on your container or the parking lot(s) for inspection by our staff.Use of parking lots without prior approval will be subject to enforcement action.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: paru-paru from malay paru-paru lung(s)
Words.Definition: lung, especially beef lung, as an ingredient in cuisine
Words.Example: If you've never tried paru (beef lungs), the paru belado (S$12) here is a good place to start.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pasal/fasal from malay pasal/fasal affair; matter; reason; legal article ← arabic فَصْل faṣl chapter; paragraph; decision
Words.Definition: business; affair; matter; problem
Words.Example: An even worse reaction is to sit back helplessly and say, "Well, not my pasal, man!", let somebody else take care of the problem.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pasang from malay pasang shoot; install; set up
Words.Definition: to be singled out for something, especially to play a role in a game; to be chosen as ‘it’
Words.Example: The montage of childhood is complete with games like pasang (catching), infused with the magic words chope (you can't get me) and taunts of pasang nek-nek! (got you!)

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pasar from malay pasar market ← classical persian بازار bâzâr market; bazaar
Words.Definition: market

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pasar + malam from malay pasar market ← classical persian بازار bâzâr market; bazaar + malay malam night
Words.Definition: night market
Words.Example: - Bro tomorrow night want to go pasar malam buy Ramly?- Cannot, I so gemuk oredi la...

Words.English Translation: → English: pass + motion from english pass excrete or eliminate from the body ← old french passer walk; step; pass ← vulgar latin passāre walk; step + english motion movement, (euph.) bowel movement ← anglo-norman motion movement; motion ← middle french motion movement; motion ← latin mōtiō movement; motion
Words.Definition: to defaecate; to poop

Words.English Translation: → English: pass + up from english pass give; hand over to + english up away; out of one’s possession; aspect marker
Words.Definition: to hand in a piece of work, an assignment, etc.
Words.Example: ... they attend neighbourhood schools where as long as they pass up their homework, they're fine. There's no overdue emphasis on grades or extra tuition.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 噼噼 jyutping: pet1 pet1 from cantonese (jyutping) 噼噼 pet1 pet1 (childish, dimin.) buttocks ⇇ cantonese (jyutping) 噼 pet1 phonetic/onom. character
Words.Definition: (childish) butt; buttocks

Words.English Translation: → English: pattern from english pattern characteristic sequence, arrangement, method, or set of behaviours
Words.Definition: a wont or habit to cause an annoyance or bother; antics; trouble, or characteristically troublesome behaviour
Words.Example: Be careful with that girl's pattern ah, at first she will seem like ar with you but got problem straight away will pau toh.

Words.Word: pattern more than badminton 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: pattern + English: more than + badminton from singlish pattern wont or habit to cause an annoyance or bother; antics; trouble, or characteristically troublesome behaviour ← english pattern characteristic sequence, arrangement, method, or set of behaviours + english more than calqued from 济过/濟過 ↻ hokkien (poj) 济过 濟過 chōe kòe more than ← hokkien (poj) 济 濟 chōe many; much; a lot + hokkien (poj) 过 過 kòe exceeding; more than + english badminton sport played by hitting a shuttlecock across a net to the opponent(s)'s side using a racquet ← english Badminton estate in Gloucestershire, England
Words.Definition: (simile) describing a person who exhibits an excessive and frustrating amount of troublesome behaviour and antics; when one's actions and motives are impenetrable, inexplicable, and complex to the point of deviousness
Words.Example: She taunted her political opponent and claimed that the crafty man employed "pattern more than badminton".

Words.Word: pattern zuay kuay badminton 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: pattern + Hokkien: 济过 濟過 poj: chōe kòe + English: badminton from singlish pattern wont or habit to cause an annoyance or bother; antics; trouble, or characteristically troublesome behaviour ← english pattern characteristic sequence, arrangement, method, or set of behaviours + hokkien (poj) 济过 濟過 chōe kòe more than ← hokkien (poj) 济 濟 chōe many; much; a lot + hokkien (poj) 过 過 kòe exceeding; more than + english badminton sport played by hitting a shuttlecock across a net to the opponent(s)'s side using a racquet ← english Badminton estate in Gloucestershire, England
Words.Definition: (simile) describing a person who exhibits an excessive and frustrating amount of troublesome behaviour and antics; when one's actions and motives are impenetrable, inexplicable, and complex to the point of deviousness
Words.Example: Wah lau, ask him to do anything, very difficult. He pattern tzuay kuay badminton.

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 包 poj: pau from general chinese (poj) 包 pau soft Chinese bun or bread, often with filling
Words.Definition: a soft Chinese bun or bread, usually steamed, and containing some kind of filling such as tau sar, char siew, etc.
Words.Example: The streets of Chinatown are filled with a plethora of Chinese street food vendors, prominently stalls selling paus, mantous and fried pancakes.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 包食 poj: pau-chia̍h from hokkien (poj) 包食 pau-chia̍h guaranteed to be delicious, (lit.) assured eating ← hokkien (poj) 包 pau guarantee; ensure; assure + hokkien (poj) 食 chia̍h eat
Words.Definition: (of durians) delicious; tasty; yummy
Words.Example: ... along with more subtle distinctions. For example, bao jiak and ho jiak both mean "very good to eat", but bao jiak seems to specifically refer to durians.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 包甲了 poj: pau-kah-liáu from hokkien (poj) 包甲了 pau-kah-liáu including anything and everything ← hokkien (poj) 包 pau wrap; include; encompass; cover + hokkien (poj) 甲 kah/kàu until + hokkien (poj) 了 liáu finished; complete; the end
Words.Definition: inclusive of anything and everything; all-encompassing; complete
Words.Example: It's like a one stop shop, bao ka liao (all-in-one), a mother, a doctor, a nurse, a maid, a cleaner ... their emotional needs we have to learn, even being a psychologist also ... so [a] caregiver is really all-rounded ... It's like everything in one, and wearing many hats.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 包山包海 poj: pau-soaⁿ pau-hái from min nan (poj) 包山包海 pau-soaⁿ pau-hái including or taking care of anything and everything ← min nan (poj) 包 pau wrap; include; encompass; cover + min nan (poj) 山 soaⁿ mountain + min nan (poj) 包 pau wrap; include; encompass; cover + min nan (poj) 海 hái sea
Words.Definition: a person whose job it is to take care of anything and everything
Words.Example: Lim Hwee Ghee, Marketing Executive, was recruited into the committee — "One more job for you, Hwee Gwee!" There we have the three-member publication committee, pau sua, pau hai.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 包头 包頭 poj: pau-thâu from min nan (poj) 包头 包頭 pau-thâu wrap in a turban; turban; headdress ← min nan (poj) 包 包 pau wrap; bun; bundle + min nan (poj) 头 頭 thâu head
Words.Definition: a man or boy (usually Sikh) who wears a turban

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 包刀 poj: pau-to from hokkien (poj) 包刀 pau-to rat out; tell on others; backstab ← hokkien (poj) 包 pau cover; wrap; conceal; include + hokkien (poj) 刀 to knife; blade
Words.Definition: to tell on somebody behind their back; to backstab; to rat someone out
Words.Example: Have you ever wondered how the hack did your boss or your colleagues know about the small, little mistakes that you make? ... Well, you know who the culprit is! It is the gossip monger a.k.a the bao toh king/queen!

Words.English Translation: → English: Paul + Lampard from english Paul common male given name ← latin Paulus common male given name; biblical figure ← latin paulus small; little + english Lampard English surname ← old french / old high german Lambert Germanic given name and surname
Words.Definition: (vulgar, humorous, euphemistic) to suck up to someone; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone; to bootlick; to brownnose

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: phua chee bai from singlish phua chee bai (vg., offensive) broken/torn/ruined vagina; slut; whore ← hokkien (poj) 破膣屄 phòa-chi-bai (vg., offensive) broken/torn/ruined vagina; slut; whore ← hokkien (poj) 破 phòa broken; torn; ruined; destroyed + hokkien (poj) 膣屄 chi-bai (vg., offensive) cunt; vagina; vulva
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) abbreviation of phua chee bai

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: pak chiu cheng from singlish pak chiu cheng (vg., m.) masturbate; jack off ← hokkien (poj) 拍手铳 拍手銃 phah-chhiú-chèng (vg., m.) masturbate; jack off ← hokkien (poj) 拍 拍 phah do; hit; general action verb + hokkien (poj) 手铳 手銃 chhiú-chhèng handgun; pistol
Words.Definition: Initialism of pak chiu cheng.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: apa + apa-apa from malay apa what + malay apa-apa anything ⇇ malay apa what
Words.Definition: used at the end of a suggestion to form a question asking for the listener's agreement or opinion; 'do you want ... or not?'; 'what about ...'
Words.Example: Sarjen say from now till 6pm can OTOT already. Canteen pe?

Words.English Translation: → English: peach ↻ Teochew: 红桃粿 紅桃粿 peng'im: ang5 to5 guê2 from english peach fruit of the tree Prunis persica ↻ teochew (peng'im) 红桃粿 紅桃粿 ang5 to5 guê2 red peach kueh ← teochew (peng'im) 红 紅 ang5 red + teochew (peng'im) 桃 桃 to5 peach + teochew (peng'im) 粿 粿 guê2 kueh
Words.Definition: a Teochew snack consisting of a glutinous rice flour skin, usually dyed pink, stuffed with a filling such as savoury glutinous rice (in which case it is known specifically as a png kueh) or other sweet fillings such as tau sar. It is usually made in the shape of a 'peach' (though somewhat more resmbling a shark's fin).

Words.English Translation: → English: peanut + soup ↻ Min nan: 涂豆湯 塗豆湯 poj: thô͘-tāu-thng from english peanut legume from the plant Arachis hypogaea + english soup liquid-based dish with water or stock and other ingredients; broth ← french soupe soup ↻ min nan (poj) 涂豆湯 塗豆湯 thô͘-tāu-thng peanut soup ← min nan (poj) 涂豆 塗豆 thô͘-tāu peanut ← min nan (poj) 涂 塗 thô͘ mud + min nan (poj) 豆 豆 tāu bean; pea + min nan (poj) 汤 湯 thng soup
Words.Definition: a traditional Fujianese dessert soup of peanuts boiled in water with added sugar. It may often come combined with other dessert soup ingredients such as lotus root, tang yuan, or ah balling.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pecah from malay pecah shatter; break; broken
Words.Definition: to break; to shatter

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pecah lubang from malay pecah lubang (slang) reveal or expose a secret ← malay pecah shatter; break; broken + malay lubang hole
Words.Definition: (metaphor) to reveal or expose a secret; to poke a hole in someone’s facade or deception; to let the cat out of the bag
Words.Example: For the "0.01 per cent" , they are able not only to marry but also to live "normative heterosexual lives", as Chua puts it. "For the 99.99 per cent , we will pecah lobang."

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pecah + minyak from malay pecah break; split + malay minyak oil
Words.Definition: (cooking) for oil to visually “separate” from a spice paste (e.g. rempah) or condiment when stir-frying, dry-frying, or otherwise heating. This is often used to identify the point at which the ingredients and oil have emulsified, meaning that the paste is done frying and its fragrance has been developed.
Words.Example: When boiling coconut milk, stir continuously and do not overboil, or it will pecah minyak (split). This means it will curdle and the coconut oil will separate.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 皮蛋 jyutping: pei4 daan6-2 from cantonese (jyutping) 皮蛋 pei4 daan6-2 century egg
Words.Definition: century egg, a Chinese delicacy made by preserving an egg (usually duck or chicken) in an alkaline solution for weeks to months, resulting in a transparent, dark brown, jelly-like albumen, a black yolk, and a strong, characteristic flavour

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 皮蛋粥 jyutping: pei4 daan6-2 zuk1 from cantonese (jyutping) 皮蛋粥 pei4 daan6-2 zuk1 century egg porridge ← cantonese (jyutping) 皮蛋 pei4 daan6-2 century egg ← cantonese (jyutping) 粥 zuk1 congee; porridge
Words.Definition: congee with slices of century egg (pei daan) and often other ingredients such as minced pork or chicken, commonly eaten as a breakfast food

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 迫促 poj: pek-chhek from min nan (poj) 迫促 pek-chhek urgent; annoyed; frustrated; stressed; fed up ← min nan (poj) 迫 pek urgent; pressing + min nan (poj) 促 chhek urgent; short on time
Words.Definition: annoyed; frustrated; stressed; fed up; exasperated
Words.Example: It's better to go out and let strangers teach you. Otherwise, your children will as you, 'Like that also don't know?' and it will make you feel pek chek (exasperated).

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 白粉 poj: pe̍h-hún from min nan (poj) 白粉 pe̍h-hún white powder; heroin ← min nan (poj) 白 pe̍h white + min nan (poj) 粉 hún powder
Words.Definition: heroin
Words.Example: The offender was found to have actual knowledge because he was told that the substance was “peh hoon” and “number 3” and the court found that he understood those terms to refer to heroin and “heroin number 3” respectively.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 白粉 poj: pe̍h-hún + 囝 poj: kiáⁿ from min nan (poj) 白粉 pe̍h-hún white powder; heroin ← min nan (poj) 白 pe̍h white + min nan (poj) 粉 hún powder + min nan (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ son; child; dimin. suffix
Words.Definition: a drug addict, especially one addicted to heroin or other narcotics
Words.Example: We parked our bikes nearby and I was wary of a drug addict that was glaring at our bikes ... Since this is a crime of opportunity, we kept our eyes peeled on the bikes as the Pek Hoon Kia was on the prowl.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 帛金 poj: pe̍h-kim from hokkien (poj) 帛金 pe̍h-kim money given at funerals as condolences for the bereaved ← hokkien (poj) 帛 pe̍h silk + hokkien (poj) 金 kim gold
Words.Definition: money given at wakes and funerals as condolences for the bereaved
Words.Example: '... He's really something else. Do you know he actually contacted the school to ask us when we were going to send him the pek kim. Can you imagine?''Send him the pek kim? Isn't he going to hold a wake?' I had the vague impression that you didn't have pek kim without a wake.

Words.Word: pek tor he 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 白肚鱼 白肚魚 poj: pe̍h-tó͘-hîr from hokkien / teochew (poj) 白肚鱼 白肚魚 pe̍h-tó͘-hîr Siganus canaliculatus or other Siganus spp., a.k.a. rabbitfish or spinefoot ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 白 白 pe̍h white + hokkien / teochew (poj) 肚 肚 tó͘ belly; stomach
Words.Definition: Siganus canaliculatus (or other Siganus spp.), also known as the white-spotted rabbitfish or spinefoot. It is a common food species, and is particularly enjoyed in Teochew culture as part of Chinese New Year celebrations.
Words.Example: ... and the Teochews consume steamed or pan-fried white-spotted rabbit fish or pek tor he with roe, to ensure good luck for the year ahead.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 冰 poj: peng from hokkien (poj) 冰 peng ice; ice-cold
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) iced; with ice

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pengat from malay pengat sweet dish of yam, sweet potato, etc. w. coconut milk and sugar; meat or fish cooked w/o sauce
Words.Definition: a sweet Malay and Peranakan dessert pudding or very thick soup often including sweet potato or yam, and other ingredients such as coconut milk (santan), durian, etc.
Words.Example: The pengat ... is luscious and has bits of durian pulp in it.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pengsan from malay pengsan faint; lose consciousness
Words.Definition: faint; lose consciousness
Words.Example: When he heard the news, he nearly pengsan from shock.

Words.English Translation: → English: penguin from english penguin flightless seabird found primarily in the Southern Hemisphere, known for its upright posture, black-and-white colour, and swimming ability ← english penguin greak auk (Pinguinus impennis) ← welsh Possible, but not certain pen head; front + welsh Possible, but not certain gwyn white
Words.Definition: (military) the book-out outfit worn by officer cadets, consisting of a white dress shirt and long black pants with black socks and shoes, sometimes also including other standardized accessories such as a black book-out bag and black umbrella

Words.English Translation: → English: people + mountain + people + sea ↻ Mandarin: 人山人海 pinyin: rén shān rén hǎi from english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english mountain large, natural, prominent elevation ← anglo-norman muntaine mountain ← early medieval latin montānia mountain + english people persons ← anglo-norman people people ← old french pueple people ← latin populus people; nation + english sea large saltwater body ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 人山人海 rén shān rén hǎi extremely crowded; packed (with people) ← mandarin (pinyin) 人 rén person; people; human + mandarin (pinyin) 山 shān mountain + mandarin (pinyin) 人 rén person; people; human + mandarin (pinyin) 海 hǎi sea
Words.Definition: (idiom) extremely crowded; bustling; packed (with people)
Related: no come no come one come all come
don't come don't come one come all come
no come no come, one come all come

Words.English Translation: → English: Pepsi-Cola + 1, 2, 3 from english Pepsi-Cola soft drink created by Caleb Bradham in 1893, now produced by PepsiCo ← english dyspepsia mild digestive disorder; indigestion ← english dys- difficult; unable; abnormal; disease ← ancient greek δῠσ- dus- dificult; bad; hard + ancient greek πέψῐς pépsis digestion + english -ia suffix to form the name of a disease ← latin -ία -ia suffix to form a f. abstract noun & ancient greek -ía suffix to form a f. abstract noun + english cola drink made with flavouring from the kola nut ← english kola tree of the genus Cola or its seeds ('nut') ← general niger-congo kola* tree of the genus Cola or its seeds ('nut') + english 1, 2, 3 the first three natural numbers, used to count
Words.Definition: a children's game where players begin by standing in a circle facing inwards, then chant 'Pepsi Cola 1, 2, 3!' together while jumping a step backwards on each count of '1', '2', and '3'. Play then proceeds in turns. On their turn, a player jumps one step in any direction while trying to step on another player's foot with either foot, while all other players must stand still. A player whose foot is stepped on is eliminated from the round. The last player left is declared the winner.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: peranakan from malay / baba malay peranakan descendant; person of mixed descent ← malay per-...-an circumfix used to form sth. to do with the root word + malay anak child
Words.Definition: a descendant of early Chinese immigrants to Nusantara, who usually intermarried with the local population to produce mixed offspring, resulting in a new syncretized culture distinct from that of later 19th and 20th-century Chinese immigrants, and the development of a creole language known as Baba Malay based mainly on Malay and Hokkien
Words.Example: I come from a Peranakan family, where the dining table caters to huge numbers, and seating during meal-time is hierarchical.

Words.English Translation: → Indonesian / javanese / malay: perkedel/begedil from indonesian / javanese / malay perkedel/begedil deep-fried mashed potato patty ← dutch frikadel type of meatball or meat patty ← middle french fricandeau dish of finely-chopped or sliced veal or other meat in a sauce
Words.Definition: a deep-fried mashed potato patty, sometimes mixed with ground meat, commonly associated with Indonesian and Malay cuisine

Words.English Translation: → Malay: petai from malay petai edible bean in the genus Parkia
Words.Definition: any of several edible species of beans in the genus Parkia, most commonly P. speciosa (also known as the stink bean) but also e.g. P. javanica or P. singularis. When used as a culinary ingredient, they are known for their strong smell and flavour, and as such are often paired with other strong-smelling foods such as sambal belacan.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: petis udang from malay petis udang black shrimp paste ← javanese ꦥꦼꦠꦶꦱ꧀ petis black shrimp paste + malay udang prawn; shrimp
Words.Definition: a sweetened prawn paste used as a condiment in cooking, such as as a primary ingredient in rojak sauce. It may be fermented or non-fermented. It has a thick, molasses-like consistency and black colour, due to the molasses and/or sugar that is often added to it.
Words.Example: Petis udang is a shrimp paste that has syrupy texture. It is commonly used in local street foods such as popiah spring rolls, Asam laksa, chee cheong fan rice rolls and rojak salads.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 扶 poj: phô͘ from hokkien (poj) 扶 phô͘ suck up to sb.; bootlick; brownnose
Words.Definition: (vulgar) to suck up to someone; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone; to bootlick; to brownnose
Words.Example: He is the king of phor lam pha, whenever any higher ranking occifer come he will kiss their ass all day.
Related: giah lam pa chut lai tom toh teng
chiu kãna kha, kha kãna lam pa

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 扶𡳞脬 poj: phô͘-lān-pha from hokkien (poj) 扶𡳞脬 phô͘-lān-pha suck up to sb.; bootlick; brownnose ← hokkien (poj) 扶 phô͘ support with one's hand; hold onto, (slang) suck up to sb.; bootlick; brownnose + hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 lān-pha (vulgar) scrotum; ballsack; balls
Words.Definition: (vulgar) to suck up to someone; to use obsequious flattery and perform favours to gain privileges from someone; to bootlick; to brownnose
Words.Example: He is the king of phor lam pha, whenever any higher ranking occifer come he will kiss their ass all day.
Related: giah lam pa chut lai tom toh teng
chiu kãna kha, kha kãna lam pa

Words.English Translation: → English: photostat from english photostat make a photocopy, esp. on a Photostat machine ← english Photostat brand name of early photocopying machine ← english photo- of or relating to light or photography ← ancient greek φωτω- phōtō- light + english stat fixed; unchanging; stationary ← latin staticus fixed; unchanging; stationary ← ancient greek στᾰτῐκός statikós causing to stand or come to rest
Words.Definition: a photocopy
Words.Example: The above is a photostat of a card I mailed to the above-mentioned company on behalf of my aunt.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 破膣屄 poj: phòa-chi-bai from hokkien (poj) 破膣屄 phòa-chi-bai (vg., offensive) broken/torn/ruined vagina; slut; whore ← hokkien (poj) 破 phòa broken; torn; ruined; destroyed + hokkien (poj) 膣屄 chi-bai (vg., offensive) cunt; vagina; vulva
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) 'broken vagina'; 'ruined vagina'; general term of abuse or insult, especially (but not strictly) for female people

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 呸 poj: phùi from hokkien (poj) 呸 phùi spit; (interjection) expressing contempt, disdain, or disgust; mimicking the action of spitting on sth.
Words.Definition: (strong, rude) expressing contempt, disdain, or disgust; mimicking the action of spitting on something
Words.Example: Pui! I don't care what that cheating fellow has to say.

Words.Word: phui chao nua 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 呸 poj: phùi + 臭 poj: chhàu + 澜 瀾 poj: nōa from min nan (poj) 呸 phùi spit; (interjection) expressing contempt, disdain, or disgust; mimicking the action of spitting on sth. + min nan (poj) 臭 chhàu smelly; repulsive + min nan (poj) 澜 瀾 nōa saliva
Words.Definition: used to express severe disgust, contempt, or disdain
Words.Example: Worst still when you alight the basket is still sitting down. Pui Chao nua. *******!

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 鼻屎 poj: phīⁿ-sái from min nan (poj) 鼻屎 phīⁿ-sái booger; piece of solid or semi-solid snot; snot; mucus ← min nan (poj) 鼻 phīⁿ nose + min nan (poj) 屎 sái bodily excretion; faeces
Words.Definition: a booger; a piece of solid or semi-solid snot

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 拼 poj: piàⁿ from hokkien (poj) 拼 piàⁿ put all one's effort into; go all out, fight; quarrel
Words.Definition: to put all one's effort into something; to go all out; to risk life and limb to do
Words.Example: An chua? Ai piã tioh lai piã lah!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 抨 poj: piaⁿ + 水 poj: chúi from hokkien (poj) 抨 piaⁿ recklessly throw; toss carelessly; throw forcefully away; hurl; smash down + hokkien (poj) 水 chúi water
Words.Definition: (metaphor) to get into or start a gang fight
Words.Example: U pia zui where? If fps like valorent or overwatch can. If diablo or maplestory I haven't play for long time, need to lvl character first

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 拍 poj: phiak from hokkien (poj) 拍 phiak hit; slap; clap; whack, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap or hokkien (poj) 擗 phia̍k/pia̍k hit, (onom.) sound of a hit; sound of a flap or flutter
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic) to slap; to hit; to strike
Words.Example: Agree, single has more freedom and options to piak different girls. So u better dun marry, best

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: piak from singlish piak hit; slap, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap ← hokkien (poj) 拍 phiak hit; slap; clap; whack, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap or hokkien (poj) 擗 phia̍k/pia̍k hit, (onom.) sound of a hit; sound of a flap or flutter
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic, euphemistic, intransitive) to have sexual intercourse
Words.Example: "You young people ah, care too much about face, too kiam siap with your money and try to use technology for everything ... What is this thing called online dating? If you want to piak piak, just use the good ol' method of Geylang lah."

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 砰/乓/唪 poj: phiàng from hokkien (poj) 砰/乓/唪 phiàng (onom.) pop; bang
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeia) pop!; bang!; the sound of something popping or exploding, especially e.g. a gun firing

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 迸欸 poj: piàng--eh from hokkien (poj) 迸欸 piàng--eh oh my God, man; oh my goodness; wow; woah ← hokkien (poj) 迸 piàng 'oh no'; 'what a disaster' + hokkien (poj) 欸 --eh general intensifying particle; used to exp. surprise, shock, get attention, etc.
Words.Definition: oh my God, man; oh my goodness; my God; damn; exclamation of shock, dread, distress, frustration, disbelief, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 婊囝 poj: piáu-kiáⁿ from min nan (poj) 婊囝 piáu-kiáⁿ bastard; son of a whore ← min nan (poj) 婊 piáu prostitute; whore + min nan (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ child; son; kid
Words.Definition: (vulgar, derogatory) bastard born of a prostitute; child of a whore; term of insult for a contemptible person

Words.English Translation: → Malay: picit from malay picit squeeze; press; pinch
Words.Definition: to call; to contact by phone

Words.English Translation: → English: pig + ear + biscuit from english pig animal in the genus Sus, esp. Sus domesticus + english ear organ used to hear and collect sounds + english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook
Words.Definition: a hard, mildly savoury biscuit with a cupped or shell-like shape made from wheat and/or soya bean flour, often with a spiral pattern, said to resemble an ear
Words.Example: This is the first time I have ever thought about going back to a stall to buy Pig Ear Biscuits and Cuttlefish. If you have never craved Pig Ear Biscuits before, a trip to this place will change your mind. Just one piece of advise, buy two packets at least. One is not enough.

Words.English Translation: → English: piggy + biscuit from english piggy pig; small pig; piglet ← english pig animal in the genus Sus, esp. Sus domesticus + english -y dimin. suffix + english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook
Words.Definition: a pastry made from the same ingredients as the outer skin of a traditional mooncake, or effectively a mooncake without any fillings, which is molded into the shape of a pig or piglet. Each pastry is often sold in a colourful little plastic basket, like how pigs would be sold in woven baskets at a traditional market. It is a popular snack that can be found at most local bakeries, especially during the Mooncake Festival season.

Words.English Translation: → English: piggy + mooncake from english piggy pig; small pig; piglet ← english pig animal in the genus Sus, esp. Sus domesticus + english -y dimin. suffix + english mooncake Chinese pastry with a sweet lotus paste or other filling, traditionally eaten during the Mid-Autumn Festival ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 月饼 月餅 yuè bǐng pastry with a sweet lotus paste or other filling, traditionally eaten during the Mid-Autumn Festival ← mandarin (pinyin) 月 月 yuè moon + mandarin (pinyin) 饼 餅 bǐng pastry; cookie; biscuit
Words.Definition: a pastry made from the same ingredients as the outer skin of a traditional mooncake, or effectively a mooncake without any fillings, which is molded into the shape of a pig or piglet. Each pastry is often sold in a colourful little plastic basket, like how pigs would be sold in woven baskets at a traditional market. It is a popular snack that can be found at most local bakeries, especially during the Mooncake Festival season.
Words.Example: All participants will get a "piggy" mooncake for your efforts and the winners' parents or guardians will receive a box of mooncakes. So start making your lanterns, kids.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 跛跤跛手 poj: pái-kha-pái-chhiú + English: Pikachu from hokkien (poj) 跛跤跛手 pái-kha-pái-chhiú crippled; lame; cripple; medically unfit to work or perform one’s normal duties ← hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 跤 kha leg; foot + hokkien (poj) 跛 pái crippled; lame + hokkien (poj) 手 chhiú hand + english Pikachu yellow Electric-type Mouse Pokémon with a National Dex number of #0025 ← japanese ピカチュウ Pikachū yellow Electric-type Mouse Pokémon with a National Dex number of #0025 ← japanese ピカ pika sparkle; glitter + japanese ちゅう chū (onom.) squeak
Words.Definition: crippled; lame; invalid; having an injury or condition, especially to the limbs, which renders one medically unfit to work or perform one’s normal duties

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 聘金 pinyin: pìn jīn from general chinese (pinyin) 聘金 pìn jīn betrothal gifts ← general chinese (pinyin) 聘 pìn betroth; get married off + general chinese (pinyin) 金 jīn gold; money
Words.Definition: betrothal gifts given by the groom’s family to the bride’s family in Singaporean Chinese cultures; a bride price or dower
Words.Example: During the Guo Da Li ceremony, the groom presents the Pin Jin to the bride's family as a gesture of sincerity. Among all the red packets, the Pin Jin has the highest rates, typically ranging from $1,888 to $8,888.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pinjam from malay pinjam lend or borrow
Words.Definition: to borrow; to receive something with the expectation of returning it in the future

Words.English Translation: → English: pink + identity card from english pink pale magenta or red ← english pink carnation (flower in the genus Dianthus) + english identity card small official document used to contain a person’s particulars, information, etc. ← english identity individual details e.g. name, by which one is recognized + english card flat, stiff, usually rectangular piece of plastic, paper, etc.
Words.Definition: a pink-coloured identity card issued to every Singaporean citizen which holds information such as a photograph, name, NRIC number, date of birth, race, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pisang from malay pisang banana
Words.Definition: banana, the edible fruits of plants of the genus Musa

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pisang berangan from malay pisang berangan breed of banana ← malay pisang chestnut + malay berangan banana
Words.Definition: a breed of banana with a slightly tangy and less sweet taste than other breeds, making it a popular breed for cooking or frying. It has thick skin and slightly dry, yellowish-white flesh.
Words.Example: Pisang Berangan bananas are sweet and buttery with a rich, creamy texture. Perfectly balanced in flavor, they’re ideal for snacking, baking, or blending into smoothies for a tropical taste delight!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pisang + goreng from malay pisang banana + malay goreng fry; fried
Words.Definition: deep-fried banana fritters
Words.Example: For dessert, I tried ... the banana tempura with ice cream ($7.80). The jelly was passable, but I prefer pisang goreng to the fried banana here.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pisang + emas from malay pisang banana + malay emas gold
Words.Definition: a variety of banana which is small and short, with a bright yellow, very thin peel and golden-yellow flesh. It is also known as the Lady’s Finger banana in English.
Words.Example: Those who prefer to go loal can try apom with pisang mas and coconut sorbet, durian sago melaka and many more.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pisang + raja from malay pisang banana + malay raja king; monarch ← sanskrit राजन् rā́jan king; prince; sovereign
Words.Definition: a variety of banana which is popular throughout Southeast Asia for its large size and flavour. It is a popular choice for making pisang goreng (goreng pisang).
Words.Example: Finish with a cold dessert. Otherwise barbecue ripe pisang raja. Eat it plain or with a sprinkle of brown sugar and freshly-grated coconut.

Words.English Translation: → English: plain from english plain ordinary; (food) without additional toppings or ingredients ← anglo-norman pleyn flat; level & middle french / old french plain flat; level ← latin plānus flat; level
Words.Definition: a plain prata; a roti prata with no additional toppings or ingredients

Words.English Translation: → English: plaster + Singlish: prata from english plaster adhesive bandage applied to a wound + singlish prata type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha ← tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread
Words.Definition: a prata cooked with an egg (usually a sunny-side-up) stuck to one side, as opposed to an egg prata which has the egg mixed into the middle

Words.English Translation: → English: play ↻ General chinese: 玩/嫽/耍/弄 pinyin / jyutping / poj / hts: wán / liu6 / sńg / nam2 from english play act; behave like; act as; do sth. for fun; use; deploy ↻ general chinese (pinyin / jyutping / poj / hts) 玩/嫽/耍/弄 wán / liu6 / sńg / nam2 play; play at; dabble in; toy with; trifle
Words.Definition: to dabble in; to trifle; to play at; to act a role
Words.Example: Just curious, nowadays xmm ah lian etc still got play step kor gan kor all these?

Words.English Translation: → English: play the fool from english play the fool act or behave in an idiotic, silly, and unserious manner; act dumb or oblivious
Words.Definition: to mess around; to act or behave in an idiotic, silly, naughty, mischievous, or unserious manner
Words.Example: I threw cigarette butts at a monkey just to play a fool. The monkey started chasing me around the stadium.

Words.English Translation: → English: play + cheat from english play act; behave like; act as + english cheat flout and bend rules to attempt to gain an advantage; deceive; swindle
Words.Definition: to play foul; to cheat; to play dirty
Words.Example: ... because fairness, like race or self-defence, is a basic instinct. Just watch children at play: No one needs to teach them to say: "You play cheat!"

Words.Word: play chinese chess 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: play + Chinese chess + Singlish: PCC from english play do an activity for fun + english Chinese chess xiangqi ← english Chinese of or relating to China ← english China country and civilization in Asia ← portuguese China China ← persian چین čin China ← sanskrit चीन Cīna China ← old chinese (zhengzhang) 秦 *zin Qin (state, dynasty) + english -ese suffix used to form a demonym + english chess two-player strategy board game ← old french eschés chess; (chess) check ← medieval latin scaccus (chess) check ← medieval latin scaccī chess ← arabic شَاه šāh shah; (chess) king ← persian شاه šâh king; shah; (chess) king + singlish PCC abbr. of pak chiu cheng ← singlish pak chiu cheng (vg., m.) masturbate; jack off ← hokkien (poj) 拍手铳 拍手銃 phah-chhiú-chèng (vg., m.) masturbate; jack off ← hokkien (poj) 拍 拍 phah do; hit; general action verb + hokkien (poj) 手铳 手銃 chhiú-chhèng handgun; pistol
Words.Definition: (idiom, euphemism, humorous) to masturbate

Words.English Translation: → English: play ↻ Malay: main-main from english play do sth. to have fun ↻ malay main-main playful; unserious; play a fool
Words.Definition: mess around; play a fool; be unserious

Words.English Translation: → English: play + punk from english play act; behave like; act as + english punk rascal; delinquent; someone who engages in petty criminal behaviour
Words.Definition: to act like a delinquent; to be rebellious and deliberately obtuse; to be a rascal; to commit mischief; to deliberately provoke or aggravate

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: play + English: rank from singlish play wield; play at ← english play use; deploy; act + english rank standing or status in an organisation
Words.Definition: (military) to wield one’s superior rank over the other party in a dispute, in order to get one’s way
Words.Example: Nobody respected the regular PS, because all he knew how to do was to play rank.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: play + English: shirt from singlish play dabble in; play at ← english play act; do sth. for fun + english shirt type of clothing worn on the upper body covering the torso
Words.Definition: to take part in gangsterism and secret societies
Words.Example: the influence or power that these gangs hold are waning pretty fast. Mainly reduced to recruitment of ginnas from sec sch to do the mule work. Only a few ever actually play shirt until they are old, most will grow out of it or end up in prison.

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 饭粿 飯粿 peng'im: bung7 guê2 from teochew (peng'im) 饭粿 飯粿 bung7 guê2 rice kueh ← teochew (peng'im) 饭 飯 bung7 cooked rice + teochew (peng'im) 粿 粿 guê2 kueh
Words.Definition: a Teochew snack consisting of a glutinous rice flour skin, usually dyed pink, stuffed with a savoury filling of glutinous rice and often other ingredients such as mushrooms or ground peanuts. It is usually made in the shape of a 'peach' (though somewhat more resmbling a shark's fin), and is a type of peach kueh.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 饭桶 飯桶 poj: pn̄g-tháng from hokkien (poj) 饭桶 飯桶 pn̄g-tháng (lit.) rice bucket, (fig.) glutton; good-for-nothing; useless person ← hokkien (poj) 饭 飯 pn̄g cooked rice + hokkien (poj) 桶 桶 tháng bucket
Words.Definition: (metaphor) a glutton; someone with a bottomless stomach

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 保庇 poj: pó-pì from min nan (poj) 保庇 pó-pì bless and protect ← min nan (poj) 保 pó protect; defend + min nan (poj) 庇 pì protect; cover
Words.Definition: incantation used to ask for divine blessing, favour, or protection
Words.Example: Good Luck to all of you and me! *po-pi po-pi*

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: போடா pōṭā from tamil போடா pōṭā go away; get lost
Words.Definition: ‘go away’; ‘get lost’
Words.Example: Poda dei. You come here to earn get your money and scram. Dont get involved in our culture like rats. I get baygon and rat killers for you.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: போடா pōṭā + புண்டை puṇṭai from tamil போடா pōṭā go away; get lost + tamil புண்டை puṇṭai (vg., offensive) vulva; vagina; cunt; idiot; moron; fool
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) ‘get lost, cunt’; ‘piss off, fool’
Words.Example: I have been trying to advocate this beautiful word with so many different meanings. But people only focus on the negatives. Oh well. Poda pundeh.
Related: kan ni na bu chao chee bai
kan ni na chao chee bai

Words.English Translation: → English: POFMA from english POFMA abbr. ← english Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act 2019 law in Singapore allowing government authorities to carry out censorship and enforcement against 'fake news' or other online statements deemed as misinformation
Words.Definition: (of government authorities) to censor or take legal enforcement action against misinformation or 'fake news'
Words.Example: We were POFMA-ed by the Minister for Home Affairs and Law, K Shanmugam, on Thursday. It made the news before any of us knew of it, because we’d missed the email they sent at about 2pm. I only realised that we’d been POFMA-ed when I saw the follow-up email sent at 8:02pm—two minutes after the deadline they’d given us earlier to comply with the order.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 薄 poj: po̍k from hokkien (poj) 薄 po̍k thin; light
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) thinner; less strong

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / cantonese: 报 報 poj: pò + 马打 馬打 poj: má-tâ from min nan / cantonese (poj) 报 報 pò report; inform + min nan / cantonese (poj) 马打 馬打 má-tâ police; policeman ← malay mata-mata police ⇇ malay mata eye
Words.Definition: to inform the police; to make a police report
Words.Example: Every time a controversy arises that points to a social divide, some dutiful citizen, sworn to protect multi-everything Singapore, gets triggered enough to ‘poh mata’.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 薄脆 poj: po̍k-chhùi from hokkien (poj) 薄脆 po̍k-chhùi crispy puffed pillow crackers ← hokkien (poj) 薄 po̍k thin; light + hokkien (poj) 脆 chhùi crispy
Words.Definition: a type of small, deep-fried, puffed, pillow-shaped cracker which is thin and crispy. It is typically used as an ingredient in yu sheng (lo hei).

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 仆街 jyutping: puk1 gaai1 from cantonese (jyutping) 仆街 puk1 gaai1 fall forward onto the street; (vg., offensive) go and die; go to hell ← cantonese (jyutping) 仆 puk1 fall forward or face-first ← cantonese (jyutping) 街 gaai1 street
Words.Definition: broke; penniless; having no money

Words.English Translation: → English: police + and + thief from english police government department in charge of maintaining public order and law enforcement ← middle french police governing; management ← latin polītīa government; management; state ← ancient greek πολῑτείᾱ polīteíā citizenship; government of a state + english and conj. used to connect two elements together + english thief sb. who steals sth. from others
Words.Definition: a children's playground game where one team (the 'police') attempts to catch members of an opposing team (the 'thieves'), and bring them to a designated area in the playing field known as the 'jail'. 'Thieves' who are caught must follow the 'police' and stay inside the 'jail'. However, uncaught 'thieves' can attempt to break them out by touching them, while the 'police' simultaneously try to stop them from doing so. The objective for the 'police' is to place every 'thief' in the 'jail', while the 'thieves' attempt to avoid this until time runs out.Variations of these rules may include the 'thieves' having their own base, with the objective being to steal all items from another location and bring them back to their base without being caught. It was likely derived from the Western game cops and robbers (or its variants).
Words.Example: Liang Wei couldn't decide what sport she loved best and wanted to focus on. So she did them all, and she represented Fuchun Primary School in athletics, badminton, basketball and table tennis. Then a game of tag — or "police and thief" as it's popularly known here — helped her make her mind up.

Words.Word: policemen wear shorts 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: policemen + wear + shorts + Hokkien: 马打 馬打 poj: má-tâ + 穿 poj: chhēng + 短裤 短褲 poj: tér-khò͘ from english policemen police officers + english wear don; put on; dress oneself with + english shorts pants that end above the knees + hokkien (poj) 马打 馬打 má-tâ police; policeman ← malay mata-mata police ⇇ malay mata eye + hokkien (poj) 穿 chhēng wear; put on (clothes); have (clothes) on + hokkien (poj) 短裤 短褲 tér-khò͘ shorts ← hokkien (poj) 短 短 tér short + hokkien (poj) 裤 褲 khò͘ trousers; pants
Words.Definition: (metaphor) used to allude to a bygone era before the modernization of Singapore; an earlier time; a different era; a long time ago
Words.Example: Ya, your cai png go up by 30 cents already complain last time the price lower, liao also give more. Next you gonna tell me policeman also wear shorts isit?

Words.English Translation: → English: politicize + Hokkien: 屎 poj: sái from english politicize make political; make a political issue out of sth. ← english politic of or relating to policy, polity, etc. ← middle french politique political ← latin politique political ← ancient greek πολῑτῐκός polītĭkós public; civic; governmental; of or relating to citizens + english -ize/-ise (suffix) make into or do ← middle french -iser (suffix) make into or do ← latin -izō similative suffix ← ancient greek -ῐ́ζω -ĭ́zō similative suffix + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion; (vg.) shit; lousy; useless
Words.Definition: to politicize, especially in an unpleasant or excessive manner; to turn something into a political issue when uncalled for

Words.English Translation: → English: polytechnic from english polytechnic educational institute that focuses on applied technology, arts, and sciences over academics ← french polytechnique educational institute that focuses on applied technology, arts, and sciences over academics ✂ french [École] polytechnique elite science/engineering tertiary educational institute in Paris ← french poly- many ← ancient greek πολύς polús many; a lot + french technique technology; technical ← ancient greek τεχνικός tekhnikós of or related to art, craft, trade, skill, etc.
Words.Definition: a technical or vocational college offering a three-year diploma course in various fields, equivalent to a community college degree in the United States
Words.Example: The first educational institution of its kind, Singapore Polytechnic offers 30 full-time diploma courses and 4 common entry programmes to prepare students for university and work.

Words.Word: pom pi pi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𬅫觱觱 歕觱觱 poj: pûn-pi-pi from hokkien (poj) 𬅫觱觱 歕觱觱 pûn-pi-pi whistle; blow a whistle ← hokkien (poj) 𬅫 歕 pûn blow + hokkien (poj) 觱觱 觱觱 pi-pi (onom.) whistling sound
Words.Definition: to whistle; to blow a whistle
Words.Example: No wor. Referee poon pee pee meaning concludes for me le.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: ponteng from singlish ponteng play truant ✂ malay ponteng truant; truancy; play truant
Words.Definition: to play truant; to skip school or work

Words.English Translation: → English: pond from english pond small inland body of water; form such a body of water; (of water) collect in low-lying areas
Words.Definition: (sarcastic, jocular) to flood, especially severely
Words.Example: There was no flooding at Orchard Road. However, water ponded at the open area of Liat Towers, the underpass between Lucky Plaza and Ngee Ann City, and the basement of Lucky Plaza due to the sustained heavy downpour.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: pondan from malay pondan transvestite; hermaphrodite
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a transvestite; a hermaphrodite

Words.English Translation: → English: ponding from english ponding collection of unusual amounts of water in low-lying areas ← english pond small inland body of water; form such a body of water + english -ing suffix used to form a noun from a verb
Words.Definition: (sarcastic, jocular) flooding; a flood, especially a severe one
Words.Example: Let me just say that as far as I am concerned, PUB should not have used the word "ponding". As far as I am concerned, I call a spade a spade – a flood is a flood. As long as there is water accumulating somewhere where it is not supposed to be, as long as it has implications on human safety or business operations, that is a flood, and it is a problem that needs to be resolved.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 碰 poj: pōng + Dubious or unconfirmed 睾丸 睪丸 poj: ko͘/e̍k-oân from hokkien (poj) 碰 pōng bang; hit; collide + hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 睾丸 睪丸 ko͘/e̍k-oân testes; testicle
Words.Definition: (idiom) to be extremely frustrated

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 膨饼 膨餅 poj: phòng-piáⁿ from hokkien (poj) 膨饼 膨餅 phòng-piáⁿ a hollow cookie filled with a sticky, sweet filling made of scallion oil and malt ← hokkien (poj) 膨 膨 phòng swell; inflate; bulge + hokkien (poj) 饼 餅 piáⁿ pastry; cookie; biscuit
Words.Definition: a large, round, and hollow pastry with a dense, flaky crust, filled with a sweet and sticky filling made of scallion oil and malt. The top of the pastry is usually decorated with a red stamp or sesame seeds. According to legend, the common people used it for sacrifices, awards, quarrels, and reconciliation in their lives.Similar to beh teh soh/hiong piãh, which mostly differs in that it is around half the size of pong piãh and has a slightly crispier crust.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 滂滂 poj: pông-pông from hokkien (poj) 滂滂 pông-pông (onom.) sound of pattering rain or rushing or torrential water; (childish) shower ⇇ hokkien (poj) 滂 pông (onom.) sound of pattering rain or rushing or torrential water
Words.Definition: (childish) to shower
Words.Example: Lai who's next to bom bom?

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ponteng from malay ponteng truant; truancy; play truant
Words.Definition: to play truant; to skip school or work
Words.Example: It's a once in a lifetime chance to watch our legends, we must go. If our boss won't let us go, sorry lah, we'll just ponteng ...

Words.English Translation: → English: poot + poop from english poot (imit., childish) sound of a fart + english poop (imit., inf.) defaecate; faeces
Words.Definition: (childish) to defaecate; to poop; to go for a poop
Words.Example: Shortly after her departure, Jeremy, our two-year-old son, came into the bedroom and said: "Pa, pa, poot poot."I turned pale. "Poot poot" for the benefit of the uninitiated is baby talk for wanting to answer nature's call — and I don't mean urinating.

Words.English Translation: → English: pop + yeah, yeah, yeah from english pop popular music; music genre made for general appeal ← english popular widely accepted or enjoyed ← old french populaire people’s; popular ← latin populāris of the people; popular + english yeah, yeah, yeah vocable in the hook of “She Loves Me” ← english yeah (colloq.) yes
Words.Definition: a genre of popular music that emerged in Malaysia, Singapore, Brunei, and the wider Malay world in the 1960s and 70s, inspired by rock and roll, pop rock, psychedelic rock, and R&B bands of the era (especially The Beatles), featuring a fusion of these genres with traditional Malay rhythms and Malay lyrics
Words.Example: Arising from the 1960s and 1970s, pop yeh yeh combines psychedelic, pop and rock ‘n’ roll sounds with Malay melodies and lyricism, resulting in a unique genre that found deep resonance with fans across Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 薄饼 薄餅 poj: po̍h-piáⁿ from hokkien / teochew (poj) 薄饼 薄餅 po̍h-piáⁿ Fujianese wrap with filling ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 薄 薄 po̍h thin; light + hokkien / teochew (poj) 饼 餅 piáⁿ round, flat cake; biscuit
Words.Definition: a Hokkien and Teochew wrap derived from the spring roll, consisting of a very thin wrap skin rolled around fillings. These commonly include shredded vegetables such as bangkuang (jicama), carrots, daikon radish, and cucumber, as well as ground peanuts, minced garlic, egg, etc.
Words.Example: There will be live stations in the restaurant with chefs making the popiah skin ... Diners can also enjoy golden, crisp kueh pie tee with the hearty popiah rolls.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 薄饼 薄餅 poj: po̍h-piáⁿ + Malay: goreng from hokkien / teochew (poj) 薄饼 薄餅 po̍h-piáⁿ Fujianese wrap with filling ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 薄 薄 po̍h thin; light + hokkien / teochew (poj) 饼 餅 piáⁿ round, flat cake; biscuit + malay goreng fry; fried, (slang) flatter
Words.Definition: a deep-fried variant of popiah

Words.English Translation: → English: popular + Singlish: -z from english popular well-liked; widely admired ← old french populaire people’s; popular ← latin populāris of the people; popular + singlish -z colloquializing suffix; used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang ← english -z (urban slang) suffix used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang
Words.Definition: (usually of a person) popular; well-liked; widely admired
Words.Example: Stacy wanted to hang out with the popz kids at school, but end up only kena ji siao by everyone.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / mandarin: 婆婆 jyutping: po4 po4-2 from cantonese / mandarin (jyutping) 婆婆 po4 po4-2 grandmother
Words.Definition: grandmother

Words.English Translation: → English: pork + ball ↻ Hokkien: 𫼱丸 摃丸 jyutping: kòng-oân/îⁿ from english pork pig meat ← old french porc pig; pork ← latin porcus domestic pig; pig + english ball roughly spherical object ↻ hokkien (jyutping) 𫼱丸 摃丸 kòng-oân/îⁿ pork meatball ← hokkien (poj) 𫼱 摃 kòng beat or hit with a blunt object e.g. hammer or club ← hokkien (poj) 圆 圓 oân/îⁿ small, roundish object
Words.Definition: a meatball made from pounded and seasoned pork, sometimes with other meats such as cuttlefish added for depth of flavour. The pounding process causes the pork to adopt a texture similar to surimi (which is the paste used to make fishballs). The resulting meatball has a firm, bouncy texture.

Words.English Translation: → English: pork + floss from english pork pig meat ← old french porc pig; pork ← latin porcus domestic pig; pig + english floss light, thread-like or fibrous material
Words.Definition: a food made by stewing pork together with spices and sugar until soft enough to be pulled into individual fibres. It is then further beaten and broken down while being heated e.g. by frying in a large wok until it is dry and slightly crispy. The finished product has a texture similar to coarse wool.
Words.Example: And don't forget to pick up inspired snacks such as the pork floss meringue (S$10 a jar) while you're there.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: potong from malay potong cut; chop; slice; cut off
Words.Definition: to cut; to chop; to slice

Words.English Translation: → Malay: potong + English: ice cream from malay potong cut; chop; slice; cut off + english ice cream sweet frozen dairy dessert
Words.Definition: a traditional style of ice cream typically sold by itinerant hawkers, where blocks of ice cream are cut into slabs around 3 x 5 x 10 cm in dimension and served either in a slice of rainbow-coloured bread, between two flat wafers, or (more rarely) in a disposable cup

Words.English Translation: → Malay: potong + jalan from malay potong cut; chop; slice; cut off + malay jalan walk; road; way; go
Words.Definition: to cut in and take something away from somebody else, especially a girlfriend or boyfriend, but also e.g. a spot in a queue, an opportunity, etc.
Words.Example: The bertunang (Malay engagement) used to be a grand occassion. It was to tell people that the couple was betrothed, and that no third party could potong jalan ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: potong + kaki from malay potong cut; chop; slice; cut off + malay kaki leg; foot
Words.Definition: (drink ordering, idiom, humorous) extremely sweet; with extra sugar or condensed milk
Words.Example: The level of sweetness is on the higher side, though it isn’t ‘potong kaki’ sweet by any means. We don’t know if we can request for 'kurang manis', would be great if there’s that option.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: potong + Singlish: stim from malay potong cut; chop; slice; cut off + singlish stim pleasure; stimulation; excitement ← english steam up make angry or excited; arouse &/or english stimulate arouse; excite ← latin stimulātus stimulated
Words.Definition: to be a killjoy or buzzkill; to spoil someone’s pleasure or excitement; to ruin a moment

Words.English Translation: → English: powder + bath from english powder fine, dust-like particles ← old french poudre powder; dust ← latin pulvis dust; powder + english bath clean one’s body with liquid, usu. soap and water
Words.Definition: (military) a dusting of talcum powder used by soldiers on dirty or sweaty parts of their bodies when a proper bath is not available, such as when outfield

Words.English Translation: → English: powerful + powder from english powerful mighty; potent; strong ← english power might; strength, ability ← old french poeir can; able to; power; ability ← vulgar latin potēre able to + english -ful suffix used to form an adj. describing sth. full of a noun + english powder fine, dust-like particles ← old french poudre powder; dust ← latin pulvis dust; powder
Words.Definition: strong; highly skilled; exemplary; of great ability
Words.Example: The jokes are coarse (audiences with powderful Hokkien will recall the pair of KTV hostess-sisters in the film who bear the frightful monikers Nini Mo and Gigi Mo).

Words.English Translation: → English: power from english power might; strength, ability ← old french poeir can; able to; power; ability ← vulgar latin potēre able to
Words.Definition: used to express amazement, praise, etc. at something impressive or outstanding
Words.Example: This is the lowest I ever seen here. Power la this weather no aircon.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: பரோட்டா parōṭṭā from tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread
Words.Definition: a shorter name for roti prata, a type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha
Words.Example: A recent job advertisement promising a monthly pay of RM5,000 (S$1,420) for a Malaysian prata chef in Singapore has sparked debate on the wages of prata cooks.
Related: or ya peh ya som balik ah roti prata char kway teow
or ya peh ya som balik ah roti prata chai tow kway

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: prata + English: bomb from singlish prata type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha ← tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread + english bomb explosive device
Words.Definition: a sweet prata filled with butter (or margarine) and a sweetener such as sugar or condensed milk. It is often made thicker or coiled up to accommodate these extra fillings.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: prata + Malay: goreng from singlish prata type of local flatbread with influence from Indian paratha ← tamil பரோட்டா parōṭṭā paratha; type of Indian flatbread + malay goreng fried
Words.Definition: a South Indian or Indian-Muslim dish of prata chopped into small strips or pieces and stir-fried with other ingredients such as egg, meat, vegetables, chillies, soya sauce, and curry sauce or powder. It is similar to dishes like mee goreng or maggi goreng, but with the noodles replaced by prata.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 虾面 蝦麵 poj: hê-mī + English: prawn from hokkien (poj) 虾面 蝦麵 hê-mī prawn noodles ← hokkien (poj) 虾 蝦 hê prawn; shrimp + hokkien (poj) 面 麵 mī wheat noodles + english prawn crustacean in the suborder Dendrobranchiata; shrimp
Words.Definition: a soup noodle dish of Hokkien origin, featuring prawns and pork (usually ribs or slices of meat) and yellow noodles in a spicy, savoury bowl of soup. The soup is made from fried prawn shells and heads boiled, simmered, and strained into an intensely flavourful stock, together with other ingredients such as pork stock, fried shallots, and chilli.
Words.Example: The Hokkien prawn mee was also excellent and, dare I say it, on par with some of the best prawn mee in Singapore. The stock is rich and deeply flavoured, and for $5.90 it is a very generous bowl. Plus, you get unlimited servings of soup.

Words.English Translation: → English: PRC from english PRC (init.) People's Republic of China ← english People's Republic of China full official name of Communist China ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 中华人民共和国 中華人民共和國 zhōng huá rén mín gòng hé guó full official name of Communist China ← mandarin (pinyin) 中华 中華 zhōng huá China; Chinese + mandarin (pinyin) 人民 人民 rén mín people + mandarin (pinyin) 共和国 共和國 gòng hé guó republic
Words.Definition: (metonym, derogatory) a person from mainland China
Words.Example: In other cases, local institutes of tertiary education may offer plum scholarships to PRC students ... only to see many of these leaving for the United States upon completion of their studies.

Words.Example: A table piled with samosas, pineapple tarts, putri salat and lapis cake lay waiting for Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong and his entourage ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: putu from malay putu South Indian cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut ← tamil புட்டு puṭṭu cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut
Words.Definition: any of various types of South-Indian-inspired Malay kueh primarily made from rice flour

Words.English Translation: → Malay: putu + bambu from malay putu South Indian cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut ← tamil புட்டு puṭṭu cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut + malay bambu plate; saucer; small dish ← tamil வேம்பு vēmpu neem tree &/or kannada ಬಂಬು bambu bamboo

Words.English Translation: → Malay: putu + mayam from malay putu South Indian cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut ← tamil புட்டு puṭṭu cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut + malay mayam altered pronunciation of 'mayang' ← malay mayang still-sheathed coconut flower; tangled, wavy, or curly hair
Words.Definition: a South Indian type of steamed rice vermicelli; string hoppers. It may be eaten with curry, sugar, grated coconut, gula melaka, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: putu + piring from malay putu South Indian cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut ← tamil புட்டு puṭṭu cylindrical steamed rice cake with grated coconut + malay piring plate; saucer; small dish ← classical persian پرنگ piring copper

Words.Example: We're quickly herded up the bus where we're comforted by warm putu piring bought from Haig Road.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 巧 pinyin: qiǎo from mandarin (pinyin) 巧 qiǎo opportune; coincidental; perfect

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 清明节 清明節 pinyin: qīng míng jié from mandarin (pinyin) 清明节 清明節 qīng míng jié a Chinese festival of tomb-cleaning observed 15 days after the spring equinox
Words.Definition: a festival celebrated 15 days after the spring equinox (usually between 4 - 6 April depending on the year), where Chinese families visit their relatives' graves (or columbarium spaces in modern times) to clean them, pay their respects, and make offerings. Many modern Singaporeans who are not religious still use the occasion to visit their relatives' graves, albeit without performing the traditional rites.[1]
