Words.English Translation: → English: shilling from english shilling historically-used coin worth 12 pence (or whatever the equivalent monetary denomination was called), or 1/20 of a pound (240 pence), in the UK and other Commonwealth countries
Words.Definition: (dated) 20 cents; a 20-cent coin; a small coin of loose change in general
Words.Example: Granddad said that a two fresh baskets of char siew pau from the itinerant hawker who used to ply this street cost less than a a shilling when he was a child.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: syok from malay syok interesting; fun; feel good; enjoyable; interested ← punjabi ਸ਼ੌਕ shauk interest; eagerness; desire; longing ←* classical persian شُوْق šoḵ desire; zeal; cheerful; spirited ← arabic شَوْق šawq longing; desire; passion ← aramaic שוקא šwq desire; long for; pleasure; satisfaction
Words.Definition: extremely pleasurable; satisfying; feel-good; enjoyable; comfortable
Words.Example: Of course a lot of my shiok moments have to do with food. One of the shiok-est moments? Standing in line, feeling hungry and anticipating the food I am about to buy and eat. Shiok man.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: syok sendiri from malay syok sendiri self-absorbed; full of oneself ← malay syok interesting; fun; feel good; enjoyable; interested ← punjabi ਸ਼ੌਕ shauk interest; eagerness; desire; longing ←* classical persian شُوْق šoḵ desire; zeal; cheerful; spirited ← arabic شَوْق šawq longing; desire; passion ← aramaic שוקא šwq desire; long for; pleasure; satisfaction + malay sendiri on one’s own; oneself
Words.Definition: self-absorbed; self-important; conceited; narcissistic; full of oneself
Words.Example: It must have been strange saying all these "funny" things without getting immediate feedback, no laughter, no approving faces. "Easy. Shiok sendiri, I just entertained myself."
Related: Sinkie pwn Sinkie, can sleep good tonight

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: shiok + English: -licious from singlish shiok delicious; extremely pleasurable; satisfied ← malay syok interesting; fun; feel good; enjoyable; interested ← punjabi ਸ਼ੌਕ shauk interest; eagerness; desire; longing ←* classical persian شُوْق šoḵ desire; zeal; cheerful; spirited ← arabic شَوْق šawq longing; desire; passion ← aramaic שוקא šwq desire; long for; pleasure; satisfaction + english -licious suffix to form an adjective for sth. delicious, amazing, pleasurable, etc. ✂ english delicious tasty; pleasurable ← old french delicious tasty; delicious ← latin dēliciōsus delicious; delicate
Words.Definition: (of food) delicious; pleasurable; extremely satisfying
Words.Example: The sauce has a wonderful umami that has been extracted from the large “Ang Kah” prawns and tasted a little like a melted version of prawn crackers. An absolutely shiokalicious, no brainer dish that everyone would order whenever they visit the place!

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: shiok + English: -licious + -ness from singlish shiok delicious; extremely pleasurable; satisfied ← malay syok interesting; fun; feel good; enjoyable; interested ← punjabi ਸ਼ੌਕ shauk interest; eagerness; desire; longing ←* classical persian شُوْق šoḵ desire; zeal; cheerful; spirited ← arabic شَوْق šawq longing; desire; passion ← aramaic שוקא šwq desire; long for; pleasure; satisfaction + english -licious suffix to form an adjective for sth. delicious, amazing, pleasurable, etc. ✂ english delicious tasty; pleasurable ← old french delicious tasty; delicious ← latin dēliciōsus delicious; delicate + english -ness suffixed to an adj. to form a noun meaning "having the quality or state of (the adj.)"
Words.Definition: (of food) deliciousness; pleasurableness; delectability
Words.Example: Round up your makan kakis and sink your teeth into the juiciest, most shiok burgers in town. Don’t miss out, come down this weekend and taste the shiokness for yourself!

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain English: show one's true colours &/or Possible, but not certain General chinese: 色 pinyin: sè from english Possible, but not certain show one's true colours (idiom) drop a facade; reveal one's true nature &/or general chinese (pinyin) Possible, but not certain 色 sè colour, (in compounds) expression; look
Words.Definition: (idiom, transitive) to become angry; to frown; to make an angry face
Words.Example: As long as you've already set the equal-opportunity time with both sides, there's nothing much to show colour about anymore ...

Words.English Translation: → English: show + Singlish: face from english show display outwardly; appear; make an appearance + singlish face reputation; public image; dignity; face ← min nan / cantonese (poj) 面 poj / jyutping face; reputation; public image; dignity
Words.Definition: to make a token appearance, often without any intention or ability to stay or contribute any more beyond that
Words.Example: I'd only show face at home, once a fortnight so my folks know I'm still alive. other times, I'd just be running some personal errands ...

Words.English Translation: → English: show + half + ball ↻ Hokkien: 放 poj: pàng + 半粒 poj: pòaⁿ-lia̍p from english show display; exhibit + english half 0.5 + english ball roughly spherical object ↻ hokkien (poj) 放 pàng release; free; put out; let out + hokkien (poj) 半粒 pòaⁿ-lia̍p type of handicap in sports betting, (lit.) 'half a granule / ball' ← hokkien (poj) 半 pòaⁿ half + hokkien (poj) 粒 lia̍p (measure word) granules; round objects; grains; balls; pieces
Words.Definition: to reveal a lot of cleavage; to display a large proportion of the breasts uncovered and visible

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 帅哥 帥哥 pinyin: shuài gē from mandarin (pinyin) 帅哥 帥哥 shuài gē handsome guy ← mandarin (pinyin) 帅 帥 shuài handsome + mandarin (pinyin) 哥 哥 gē older brother
Words.Definition: a handsome guy; a handsome man

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 水饺 水餃 pinyin: shúi jiǎo from mandarin (pinyin) 水饺 水餃 shúi jiǎo soup dumpling
Words.Definition: a Chinese soup dumpling, usually stuffed with seasoned minced pork or some other meat and vegetables such as chives, and prepared by boiling
Words.Example: A Western dish which looks like shui jiao or steamed prawn dumpling is ravioli of snails with smoked goose breast and chestnut sauce ... Try this dish and comapre it with shui jiao.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 顺便 順便 pinyin: shùn biàn from mandarin (pinyin) 顺便 順便 shùn biàn coincidentally; conveniently; incidentally
Words.Definition: coincidentally; at the same time; conveniently; incidentally
Words.Example: Usually go JB re fuel i will shun bian go for foot massage, eat seafood, shopping. In spore, i juz pump and go home... No seafood, massage and shopping. lol

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / cantonese: 是 poj: sī from min nan / cantonese (poj) 是 sī be; yes; indeed
Words.Definition: yes; correct; right
Words.Example: Oei! Wa si lim peh, understand?
Related: you die, I die, everybody die

Words.Word: si dian jin 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 四点金 四點金 pinyin: sì diǎn jīn from mandarin (pinyin) 四点金 四點金 sì diǎn jīn gold jewellery given as a betrothal gift to the bride ← teochew (peng'im) 四点金 四點金 si3 diam2 gim1 gold jewellery given as a betrothal gift to the bride ← teochew (peng'im) 四 四 si3 four + teochew (peng'im) 点 點 diam2 point + teochew (peng'im) 金 金 gim1 gold
Words.Definition: a betrothal gift of four pieces of gold jewellery given by the groom’s family to the bride, typically consisting of a bangle or bracelet, a ring, a necklace, and earrings. It is most particularly associated with the Teochews, but is sometimes also practiced by other Singaporean Chinese families.
Words.Example: Jewellery brands are constantly creating new designs for Chinese customary wedding gold jewellery (si dian jin) to add sparkle to the business.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 死囡仔 poj: sí-gín/kín-á from hokkien (poj) 死囡仔 sí-gín/kín-á damned kid; brat ← hokkien (poj) 死 sí die; death; damned + hokkien (poj) 囡仔 gín/kín-á kid; child
Words.Definition: (slightly vulgar) damned kid; rascal; brat; little ruffian
Words.Example: Oh my tian, not this si ginna again. Help lah.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 蛳蚶 螄蚶 jyutping: si1 ham1 from cantonese (jyutping) 蛳蚶 螄蚶 si1 ham1 Tegillarca granosa, a.k.a. blood cockle
Words.Definition: Tegillarca granosa, also known as the blood cockle or simply cockle, a species of edible marine clam with red flesh that is a common ingredient in Singaporean cuisine
Words.Example: The spiky finish caught the imagination of the public ... Singaporeans had started to call it by what it looked like to them: an inverted bra, then sea hum (cockles), papaya and finally the durians.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 四跤蛇 poj: sì-kha-chuâ from hokkien (poj) 四跤蛇 sì-kha-chuâ lizard; monitor lizard ← hokkien (poj) 四 sì four ← hokkien (poj) 跤 kha leg; foot ← hokkien (poj) 蛇 chuâ snake
Words.Definition: a monitor lizard, most commonly the Malayan water monitor, Varanus salvator (the South-East Asian subspecies being V. s. macromaculatus)

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / general chinese: 死 poj: sí + Min nan: 了 poj: liáu from min nan / general chinese (poj) 死 sí die; death; damned; screwed + min nan (poj) 了 liáu particle indicating perfective aspect or change of state; already; (approximately) past tense marker
Words.Definition: expressing that something is over and cannot be undone or rectified, and its consequences are inevitable
Related: you die, I die, everybody die

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 是 poj: sī + Hokkien: 毋是 poj: m̄-sī + Teochew: 唔是 peng'im: m6 si6 from min nan (poj) 是 sī be; yes; indeed + hokkien (poj) 毋是 m̄-sī not be + teochew (peng'im) 唔是 m6 si6 not be
Words.Definition: 'is it or not?'; used at the start of a sentence or statement to form it into a question, similar in function to auxiliary verbs like do/did.
Words.Example: Got chance one.→ Si m si got chance one?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h from hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what
Words.Definition: what; which
Words.Example: Si mi? Louder abit lah.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h + 𡳞 poj: lān from hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 𡳞 lān penis
Words.Definition: (interrogative, vulgar) what the hell; what the shit

Words.Word: si mi lan jiao 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h + 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 poj: lān-chiáu from hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu penis
Words.Definition: (interrogative, vulgar) what the hell; what the shit
Words.Example: so you no sin jiao, also no lao jiao? then you simi lanjiao?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h + 屎 poj: sái from hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion; (vg.) shit; lousy; useless
Words.Definition: (vulgar, rude) what; what the shit; what crap
Words.Example: I think we have reached peak “simi sai also AI” in #Singapore.

Words.Word: si mi tai chi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 什物 poj: sím-mi̍h + Hokkien / hinghua: 代志 代誌 poj: tāi-chì from hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien / hinghua (poj) 代志 代誌 tāi-chì problem; affair; matter
Words.Definition: 'what's the matter?'; 'what's the problem?'; 'what is it?'; used to curtly ask someone to get to the point, or speak their mind
Words.Example: She kept coming. I kept backing ... 'Si mi tai ji?' Auntie Fong had showed up just in time. Great! Back-up!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 死爸 poj: sí-pē from hokkien / teochew (poj) 死爸 sí-pē (slightly vg.) extremely; very ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 死 sí bloody; damned; die; death; screwed + hokkien / teochew (poj) 爸 pē father
Words.Definition: (slightly vulgar) extremely; very
Words.Example: While the place looked sibei lavish and the food served also looked sibei delicate, the influencer with more than 868,000 followers on her Instagram, however, said that she didn’t quite enjoy the fine dining experience.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 四色牌 poj: sì-sek-pâi from hokkien (poj) 四色牌 sì-sek-pâi traditional four-suited card deck ← hokkien (poj) 四 sì four + hokkien (poj) 色 sek colour + hokkien (poj) 牌 pâi playing card; card
Words.Definition: a card deck used to play various card games, such as chap ji ki. It consists of 112 cards in four suits of 28 cards each as denoted by the cards’ colours (usually red, green, white, and yellow), with the values on each card represented by the seven piece types in Chinese chess.
Words.Example: a friend just told me that he had seen some aunties playing si sek pai at a void deck in ang mo kio.

Words.Word: si tiam kim 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 四点金 四點金 peng'im: si3 diam2 gim1 from teochew (peng'im) 四点金 四點金 si3 diam2 gim1 gold jewellery given as a betrothal gift to the bride ← teochew (peng'im) 四 四 si3 four + teochew (peng'im) 点 點 diam2 point + teochew (peng'im) 金 金 gim1 gold
Words.Definition: a betrothal gift of four pieces of gold jewellery given by the groom’s family to the bride, typically consisting of a bangle or bracelet, a ring, a necklace, and earrings. It is most particularly associated with the Teochews, but is sometimes also practiced by other Singaporean Chinese families.
Words.Example: If gold is no longer a commercial item of value becoz it can be mass produced, I wonder if a prospective mother-in-law will still ask for Si Tiam Kim for her daughter's dowry.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sial from malay sial damn; bastard; unlucky
Words.Definition: used at the end of a clause as an intensifier; adds a degree of coarseness
Words.Example: Aiseh! This stall the chilli power sia!

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Hokkien: 削𡳞 poj: siah-lān from hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 削𡳞 siah-lān arrogant; cocky; conceited ← hokkien (poj) 削 siah pare; sharpen; mock; ridicule; try to embarrass; compete + hokkien (poj) 𡳞 lān penis
Words.Definition: arrogant; cocky; conceited

Words.Word: sia suay /ˌsjɑː ˈsweɪ/ 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 泻衰 瀉衰 poj: sià-soe from hokkien (POJ) 泻衰 瀉衰 sià-soe to lose face
Words.Definition: to embarrass; to disgrace
Words.Example: In other words, I think what Mr Ha means is that Xiaxue had “sia suay” their industry.
Related: giah lam pa chut lai tom toh teng

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sial from malay sial damn; bastard; unlucky
Words.Definition: (slightly vulgar) damn; 'bastard!'
Words.Example: Sial! The queue damn long today!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 闪 閃 poj: siám + Cantonese: 闪 閃 jyutping: sim2 from hokkien (poj) 闪 閃 siám evade; dodge; avoid + cantonese (jyutping) 闪 閃 sim2 evade; dodge; avoid, (slang) leave quickly or hurriedly
Words.Definition: (direct, may be rude) 'get out of the way'; 'move aside'; 'move!'
Words.Example: Siam! Sio sio sio, ah ger watch out!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: Siam + Hokkien: 母 poj: bú from malay Siam former name of Thailand; Thai; Siamese ← thai สยาม sà-yǎam former name of Thailand + hokkien (poj) 母 bú mother; female
Words.Definition: (derogatory) a Thai girl; a woman of Thai ethnicity, especially a young and attractive one working at a siam diu (Thai disco)
Words.Example: The extent some of these men decorate their favourite Siam Bu with Garlands and sashes is insane. With each garland and sash ranging from $10 to $10,000, some spend thousands a night just to impress.
Related: Siam bu for wife, Siam diu for life

Words.Word: Siam bu for wife, Siam diu for life
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: siam bu + English: for + wife + Singlish: siam diu + English: for + life from singlish siam bu Thai woman, esp. one working at a Thai disco ← malay Siam former name of Thailand; Thai; Siamese ← thai สยาม sà-yǎam former name of Thailand + hokkien (poj) 母 bú woman; female + english for as + english wife female spouse + singlish siam diu Thai disco ← malay Siam former name of Thailand; Thai; Siamese ← thai สยาม sà-yǎam former name of Thailand + cantonese (jyutping) 吊 diu3 hang + english for as + english life existence; social activities
Words.Definition: (derogatory) describing the phenomenon of men that exclusively date Thai girls or are married to Thai women, and also spend all their free time and money partying in siam dius
Words.Example: I think a number of Singaporean men go for Thai ladies not because they have no luck with Singaporean women, but because they just prefer the type of love that Singaporean women cannot or may not be willing to offer. And for the guys who are Thai club regulars, as the saying goes, “Siam diu for life, Siam bu for wife.”

Words.English Translation: → Malay: Siam + Cantonese: 吊 jyutping: diu3 from malay Siam former name of Thailand; Thai; Siamese ← thai สยาม sà-yǎam former name of Thailand + cantonese (jyutping) 吊 diu3 hang
Words.Definition: a Thai disco or nightclub, usually featuring young, attractive Thai hostesses (or hostesses from other countries in the region) who customers can diao hua for (pay to hang flower garlands or coloured sashes on) in exchange for their time and attention. Unlike a stereotypical club, siam dius usually feature a cozier atmosphere (in part due to a smaller size) and calmer music genres, with one of the most popular being manyao (slow Chinese pop).
Words.Example: TBH, all the entertainment you need at a siam diu is laid out in front of you — talking, drinking and playing games with the siam bus.
Related: Siam bu for wife, Siam diu for life

Words.Word: siam one corner 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: siam + English: one + corner from singlish siam evade; escape; avoid; leave hurriedly ← hokkien (poj) 闪 閃 siám evade; dodge; avoid & cantonese (jyutping) 闪 閃 sim2 evade; dodge; avoid, (slang) leave quickly or hurriedly + english one a; a given thing + english corner secluded or out-of-the-way place
Words.Definition: to seclude or withdraw oneself away, especially to avoid some undesired activity or work; to hide from one’s superiors; to skive

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𤺪 poj: siān from hokkien (poj) 𤺪 siān tired
Words.Definition: boring; tiresome; insipid
Words.Example: This lecture damn sian, somemore had to wake up so early for it. Waste time sia.

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Hokkien: 煽 poj: siàn + Min nan: 查某 poj: cha-bó͘ from hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 煽 siàn incite; arouse emotions + min nan (poj) 查某 cha-bó͘ girl; woman
Words.Definition: to chase after, hit on, or try to attract girls
Words.Example: Transport in sg is also cheap and accessible. Car only needed when u have family or want sian zha bor.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𤺪 poj: siān + 一半 poj: chi̍t-poàⁿ from hokkien (poj) 𤺪 siān tired + hokkien (poj) 一半 chi̍t-poàⁿ half
Words.Definition: boring; insipid; tiresome

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 𤺪 poj: siān + English: half ↻ Hokkien: 一半 poj: chi̍t-poàⁿ from hokkien (poj) 𤺪 siān tired + english half 1/2; partially ↻ hokkien (poj) 一半 chi̍t-poàⁿ half
Words.Definition: boring; insipid; tiresome

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 谁 誰 poj: siâng + 敲 poj: khà from hokkien (poj) 谁 誰 siâng who ← hokkien (poj) 啥侬/啥人 啥儂/啥人 siáⁿ-lâng who ← hokkien (poj) 啥 啥 siáⁿ what + hokkien (poj) 侬/人 儂/人 lâng person + hokkien (poj) 敲 khà call (by phone, pager, etc.); knock; hit
Words.Definition: 'who called?'
Words.Example: Siang kha? Alamak, is my client; hold on, I need to take this call hor.

Words.Word: siang kha pager 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 谁 誰 poj: siâng + 敲 poj: khà + English: pager from hokkien (poj) 谁 誰 siâng who ← hokkien (poj) 啥侬/啥人 啥儂/啥人 siáⁿ-lâng who ← hokkien (poj) 啥 啥 siáⁿ what + hokkien (poj) 侬/人 儂/人 lâng person + hokkien (poj) 敲 khà call (by phone, pager, etc.); knock; hit + english pager wireless electronic device used to receive and display messages ← english page call; contact; summon; young servant or attendant ← old french page young attendant ← late latin pagius servant + english -er suffix used to form a noun which performs the action of the root verb
Words.Definition: (dated) 'who paged me?'; 'who tried to contact me?'
Words.Example: He takes out his handphone and shouts the uniquely Singaporean line: "Har-lo, siang kar pager?"

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: sian + English: sensation from singlish sian tired; bored; expn. of frustration, boredom, listlessness, etc. ← hokkien (poj) 𤺪 siān tired + english sensation feeling; sensory perception ← old french sensatio sensation; feeing; understanding ← latin sēnsātiō sensation; feeing; understanding
Words.Definition: a feeling of remarkable exhaustion, exasperation, boredom, and/or listlessness
Words.Example: Waiting for school to end really tak boleh tahan... What is this siansation...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy
Words.Definition: crazy; mad; insane
Words.Example: You want me go all the way to Yishun? Siao!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + Min nan: 查某 poj: cha-bó͘ from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + min nan (poj) 查某 cha-bó͘ girl; woman
Words.Definition: a crazy woman; a girl who acts unreasonably and irrationally
Words.Example: "Takeshi could not resist calling her siao cha bor, or crazy girl ..." Terri is Taiwanese, but there are many like her in Singapore.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + 个 個 poj: ê from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + hokkien (poj) 个 個 ê *possessive particle; one (who is sth.)
Words.Definition: (military) a close friend or buddy in the military; term of address or endearment for a friend or buddy

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟侬 痟儂 poj: siáo-lâng from hokkien (poj) 痟侬 痟儂 siáo-lâng crazy person ← hokkien (poj) 痟 痟 siáo crazy; mad; insane + hokkien (poj) 侬 儂 lâng person; man; human
Words.Definition: a crazy person; a madman; someone who acts unreasonably and irrationally

Words.Word: siao lang keng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟侬间 痟儂間 poj: siáo-lâng-keng from hokkien (poj) 痟侬间 痟儂間 siáo-lâng-keng mental hospital; insane asylum ← hokkien (poj) 痟侬 痟儂 siáo-lâng crazy person; madman + hokkien (poj) 间 間 keng room; building
Words.Definition: a mental hospital; an insane asylum; an institution; a madhouse

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + 了 poj: liáu from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + hokkien (poj) 了 liáu particle indicating perfective aspect or change of state; already; (approximately) past tense marker
Words.Definition: 'oh no'; 'alas'; expression of despair, distress, or resignation after e.g. something crazy or disastrous has happened, something has been messed up beyond repair, etc.
Words.Example: I thought: "Siao liao. How do we do this, everything is closed."

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + Singlish: on1 from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + singlish on1 enthusiastic; attentive; motivated; highly interested ← singlish switched on extremely focused; highly attentive; mentally engaged ← english switched on turned on, esp. e.g. of a device; (inf.) excited; extremely focused, attentive, and mentally engaged ← english switched changed from one state to another + english on enabled; operating; powered
Words.Definition: enthusiastic to the point of madness; overzealous; overly eager or motivated; unwaveringly on the ball
Words.Example: I think I was siao on about it that year, that's why they called me back the second year to join the committee.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + 兵 poj: peng from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + hokkien (poj) 兵 peng soldier; warrior
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier who acts crazy and is always clowning around; a jokester in the military

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟 poj: siáu + 丈夫 poj: ta/cha-po͘ from hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; go crazy + hokkien (poj) 丈夫 ta/cha-po͘ male person; man; husband

Words.Example: I guess only a Siao Char Bo would befit a Siao Ta Por. heh heh....

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 痟叮噹 poj: siáu tin/ting-tang/tong from hokkien (poj) 痟叮噹 siáu tin/ting-tang/tong crazy; mad; insane ← hokkien (poj) 痟 siáu crazy; mad; insane + hokkien (poj) 叮噹 tin/ting-tong/tang (onom.) sound of bells or metal ringing; ding-dong
Words.Definition: crazy; mad; silly; wacky; insane
Words.Example: The kidnappers are not only amateur and naïve, they are siao ting tong !! where they want to hide in Singapore ? Never plan one meh ?

Words.Example: I send by email already, can check your side got receive anot?

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 烧卖 燒賣 jyutping: siu1 maai6-2 from cantonese (jyutping) 烧卖 燒賣 siu1 maai6-2 steamed pork dim sum dumpling with yellow skin ← mongolian (mxttt) суумай ᠰᠤᠤᠮᠠᠢ suumai type of meat dumpling with very thin skin or mandarin (pinyin) Possible, but not certain 捎卖 捎賣 shāo mài sold or provided on the side with a purchase of sth. else
Words.Definition: a Cantonese-style open-faced steamed pork dumpling, originating from a similar dish from Hohhot, Inner Mongolia. It consists of a filling of ground pork (sometimes mixed with other ingredients such as prawn, fish, and mushroom), and is typically wrapped with a characteristic yellow skin and topped with something bright orange such as a drop of crab roe or small cube of carrot. It is a popular dim sum dish.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 烧肉 燒肉 jyutping: siu1 juk6 from cantonese (jyutping) 烧肉 燒肉 siu1 juk6 Cantonese roast pork ← cantonese (jyutping) 烧 燒 siu1 roast; grill + cantonese (jyutping) 肉 肉 juk6 meat; pork
Words.Definition: a Cantonese dish of roast pork with crispy skin

Words.English Translation: → English: sign on from english sign on join, esp. under a signed contract ← english sign mark with one’s signature for validation ← old french signe sign; mark ← latin signum sign; mark; seal; emblem + english on at; in; unto

Words.Definition: a little; a bit
Words.Example: How much you changing? 100k? You think lah, actually the difference if you change a few k is only sikit sikit. Worth it to go out of the way to change? Just change where it's convenient

Words.English Translation: → English: silver + fish ↻ General chinese: 银鱼 銀魚 pinyin: yín yú from english silver precious metal (Ag) or colour resembling this metal + english fish animal which lives in water ↻ general chinese (pinyin) 银鱼 銀魚 yín yú whitebait ← general chinese (pinyin) 银 銀 yín silver + general chinese (pinyin) 鱼 魚 yú fish
Words.Definition: whitebait; small fish fry eaten as food
Words.Example: These include Gao Peng’s Prosperity Lo Hei with silver fish and abalone slices in yuzu sauce; Noodlestar’s abalone slices with fruits; and House of Roasted Duck’s choice of duck meat as the main ingredient.

Words.English Translation: → English: silver + serpent from english silver precious metal (Ag) or colour resembling this metal + english serpent snake ← old french serpent snake ← latin serpēns snake; creeping creature
Words.Definition: (humorous) a civil servant; someone who works for the government
Words.Example: What's the mid year bonus sia. Silver serpent sleeping on the job again isit?

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 心疼 poj: sim-thiàⁿ from min nan (poj) 心疼 sim-thiàⁿ pity; sad; sad to the point of heartache ← min nan (poj) 心 sim heart + min nan (poj) 疼 thiàⁿ pain; hurt; ache; painful
Words.Definition: (hyperbole) expression of sadness, pity, or disappointment in response to an unfortunate or pitiable situation
Words.Example: Wah, see my bank account balance go down really heart pain one.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: si mi sai + also + politisai from singlish si mi sai (vg.) any old thing; anything; everything ← hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what ← hokkien (poj) 屎 sái faeces; poop; excrement; bodily secretion; (vg.) shit; lousy; useless + singlish also as well; too; used for emphasis; even; still ← english also in addition; too; besides + singlish politisai make excessively political; unpleasant politics ← english politicize make political; make a political issue out of sth. ← english politic of or relating to policy, polity, etc. ← middle french politique political ← latin politique political ← ancient greek πολῑτῐκός polītĭkós public; civic; governmental; of or relating to citizens + singlish -sai humorous or irreverent suffix ← english -ize/-ise (suffix) make into or do ← middle french -iser (suffix) make into or do ← latin -izō similative suffix ← ancient greek -ῐ́ζω -ĭ́zō similative suffix
Words.Definition: expression of exasperation or displeasure at a tendency for everything and anything to be politicized, especially in an unpleasant or excessive manner
Words.Example: A: Why is my uniform white? Why does my supervisor speak Mandarin? Why here got rainbow cakes? How come I hear religious music?B: Eh can dun simi sai oso politisai? Listen to you until sian oredi.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 新鸟 新鳥 poj: sin-chiáu from hokkien (poj) 新鸟 新鳥 sin-chiáu newbie; beginner; inexperienced person ← hokkien (poj) 新 新 sin new + hokkien (poj) 鸟 鳥 chiáu bird
Words.Definition: a newbie; a beginner; a novice; an inexperienced person
Words.Example: just look at how long the trays at tray return stations are being cleared is good enough indication. it basically send a signal to surrounding lao jiao & sin jiao that there're free food available in multiple windows of minutes every hour

Words.English Translation: → English: sing + karaoke from english sing produce harmonious or musical vocalizations + english karaoke form of entertainment where participants sing the vocals to a popular song while an instrumental version is played and its lyrics are displayed on a screen ← japanese カラオケ karaoke karaoke + japanese 空 から kara empty ← japanese オケ oke clipping of オーケストラ ✂ japanese オーケストラ ōkesutora orchestra ← english orchestra large band of musicians playing various instruments together ← latin orchēstra space for dancers in front of a stage ← ancient greek ὀρχήστρᾱ ὀρχήστρᾱ space for dancers in front of a stage
Words.Definition: to participate in a session of karaoke
Words.Example: My favorite place to go to sing k. Cheap and good. Used to go every week. All the song can be found there.

Words.English Translation: → English: Singapore from english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city
Words.Definition: an island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore

Words.English Translation: → English: Singapore + girl from english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english girl young female person; female person younger than the speaker
Words.Definition: an iconic marketing and branding motif used by Singapore Airlines (SQ) of an air stewardess dressed in the SQ sarong kebaya uniform
Words.Example: Until today, SIA and its Singapore Girl are symbols of national pride. The Singapore Girl is showcased at the National Day Parade alongside military vehicles. In 1993, the Singapore Girl's wax model was even installed at Madame Tussaud in London ...

Words.English Translation: → English: Singapore + sling from english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english sling cocktail made with gin and other ingredients, e.g. sugar, water, nutmeg, fruit juice, etc.
Words.Definition: a cocktail made from gin and cherry liqueur, and sometimes other fruit-based ingredients such as pineapple juice or lime juice as well. It was invented in or before 1915 by the Hainanese bartender Ngiam Tong Boon in the Long Bar at Raffles Hotel, Singapore.
Words.Example: I did some pretty obvious tourist things, such as having a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar at the Raffles Hotel - which was fun.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: Singapura from malay Singapura island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city
Words.Definition: Singapore

Words.English Translation: → English: Singapore + English from english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english English language originating in England, now widely spoken across the world
Words.Definition: a creole language spoken in Singapore by at least 2.5 million native speakers. Its lexifier is English, but it incorporates vocabulary from the native languages of early Singaporean immigrants, including Hokkien, Malay, Cantonese, Teochew, Tamil, Mandarin, and others. Its grammar and syntax are based on those of southern Chinese languages. It is used in Singapore on a continuum with the acrolectal register of Singaporean English, across which the majority of speakers are able to code-switch.[1] Due to its lack of recognition on a national level, there is not much official government census data on the use of the language. However, reported use of Singlish is positively correlated with higher class and education level.[1]
Words.Example: Singlish is valid because we speak it, us Singaporeans, as a real language. You can save the world in Singlish. You can fall in love in Singlish, have sex in Singlish, break hearts in Singlish. We cannot let the lack of mainstream representation tell us otherwise. Singlish can express concepts, ideas and feelings that English cannot. Some things are not pretty; they can only be chio. Some things are not delicious—they are just shiok. There are so many things that mean so much more in Singlish: they become richer, more complex, and closer to the truth. My voice is one of those things. I do not have my mother’s Cantonese nor my father’s Hokkien, but my first language is, and always will be, Singlish. I am sure of that now. I can speak for myself.

Words.English Translation: → English: Singapore + -ie from english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth.
Words.Definition: (derogatory, offensive) a Singaporean; someone from Singapore
Words.Example: i never see the sinkie pwn sinkie attitude with sinkies abroad but when in sg, there are too many sinkies who try to put down others, just seem hateful, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Sinkie + English: pwn + Singlish: Sinkie from singlish Sinkie Singaporean person ← english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth. + english pwn dominate; own ← english own dominate; lord over + singlish Sinkie Singaporean person ← english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth.
Words.Definition: (derogatory, offensive) a phrase describing the stereotypical Singaporean 'crab mentality' of being hypercompetitive, selfish, driven by money, averse to creativity and unorthodoxy, wont to complain and nitpick, feeling dissatisfied with others' successes, and needing to step over and put down others to feel successful; encapsulating all the negative and sour traits of the overcompetitive Singaporean mindset
Words.Example: “Sinkie pwn Sinkie” is a very real summary of our crab mentality as an entire society.

Words.Word: Sinkie pwn Sinkie, can sleep good tonight
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: Sinkie pwn Sinkie + can + English: sleep + good + tonight from singlish Sinkie pwn Sinkie stereotypical Singaporean hypercompetitive, selfish 'crab mentality' of needing to put down others to feel successful ← singlish Sinkie Singaporean person ← english Singapore island city-state in South-East Asia, officially known as the Republic of Singapore ← malay Singapura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंहपुर siṃhá-pura Singapore ← sanskrit सिंह siṃhá lion + sanskrit पुर pura city + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth. + english pwn dominate; own ← english own dominate; lord over + singlish Sinkie Singaporean person + singlish can affirmative particle; able to; permitted to ← english can able to; may; be possible; permitted + english sleep state of reduced consciousness for resting + english good great; pleasant; well + english tonight the night of the current day
Words.Definition: (derogatory, sarcastic) used to imply that doing their dutiful part in perpetuating the dog-eat-dog, hyper-competitive Sinkie pwn Sinkie mentality must give a Singaporean a sense of immense fulfilment and self-contentment; thus, by pulling down other fellow Singaporeans that were just harmlessly minding their own business, they can be satisfied at having done their fun-ruining deed for the day

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 先生 poj: sin-seⁿ from hokkien (poj) 先生 sin-seⁿ doctor; honorific for older men; teacher, (lit.) 'born earlier'
Words.Definition: a traditional Chinese physician; term of address for a traditional Chinese physician
Words.Example: Beat your fellow Sinsehs to rise to the rank of Master Sinseh! Prescribe TCM herbs and remedies with pin-point accuracy to relieve your patients of their ailments!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 烧 燒 poj: sio from hokkien (poj) 烧 燒 sio roast; grill; hot; burn
Words.Definition: 'hot!'; used to warn others in the vicinity that something (especially a dish of food one is carrying) is very hot, and thus to be careful or make way
Words.Example: Sio! Lai, scuse ah ah ger, careful.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 烧肉 燒肉 poj: sio-bah from hokkien (poj) 烧肉 燒肉 sio-bah Cantonese roast pork ← hokkien (poj) 烧 燒 sio roast; grill + hokkien (poj) 肉 肉 bah meat; pork
Words.Definition: a Cantonese dish of roast pork with crispy skin
Words.Example: Consider the joy of roasted meats cooked on site. Clearly, we love our char siew and sio bak ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: siol from malay siol intensifying particle or interjection ← malay sial damn; bastard; unlucky
Words.Definition: used at the end of a clause as an intensifier; adds a degree of coarseness

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 伤 傷 poj: siong from hokkien (poj) 伤 傷 siong injure; injurious; hurt, (slang) extremely difficult; tough, (as siuⁿ) excessively; too
Words.Definition: extremely difficult; tough
Words.Example: Life was si peh siong for Singapore’s early immigrants, like those who worked as coolies and the Samsui women.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: siput from malay siput snail; any shelled mollusc
Words.Definition: Laevistrombus canarium, an edible marine snail found in the region around South-East Asia. It is eaten in Malay cuisine.
Words.Example: The siput sedut was also really good and tasty, except that I felt the gravy could have been just slightly thicker and a bit more savoury.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: siput gonggong from malay siput gonggong Laevistrombus canarium, a.k.a. dog conch, an edible marine snail ← malay siput snail; shelled mollusc + malay gonggong (onom.) bark; dog's bark
Words.Definition: Laevistrombus canarium, an edible marine snail found in the region around South-East Asia. It is eaten in Malay cuisine.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: siput sedut from malay siput sedut Cerithidea obtusa; dish featuring Cerithidea obtusa cooked in gravy or otherwise ← malay siput snail; any shelled mollusc + malay sedut suck; inhale (w. the mouth, nose, etc.)
Words.Definition: Cerithidea obtusa (or sometimes other closely related species such as C. quadrata), an edible marine snail with a cone-shaped shell popular in Malay cuisine. It is typically prepared in a sambal or coconut milk-based curry gravy, and is eaten by slurping or sucking the meat out of the shell (hence the Malay name). The tip of the shell is usually snipped off to facilitate this.
Words.Example: The siput sedut was also really good and tasty, except that I felt the gravy could have been just slightly thicker and a bit more savoury.

Words.English Translation: → English: sir from english sir term of respectful address for a man of higher status or rank, (mil.) term of address for an officer ← old french sire Mr.; sir; master; term of respectful address for a man ← latin senior older; elder
Words.Definition: (military) title used before a commissioned officer's first name by enlisted men or non-commissioned officers to respectfully address or refer to them. Especially used for an officer who is closer in terms of age, military experience, or familiarity, or is holding a relatively small position such as platoon commander.
Words.Example: Sir Jasper, when the next IPPT ah?

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: sireh from baba malay sireh Piper betle, a climbing vine whose leaves are chewed with areca nut ← malay sirih various plants of the genus Piper
Words.Definition: Piper betle, also known as betel, a climbing vine whose leaves were traditionally chewed with areca nut and slaked lime as a stimulant, or used in traditional medicine

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 少 jyutping: siu2 + 底 jyutping: dai2 from cantonese (jyutping) 少 siu2 less; little; reduce + cantonese (jyutping) 底 dai2 bottom; base
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) less sweet; with less sugar or condensed milk
Words.Example: Now, I love my kopi gao siu tai. It's what starts me up in the morning, keeps me up after lunch and gives me that extra boost towards the end of the day.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 少 jyutping: siu2 + 底 jyutping: dai2 from cantonese (jyutping) 少 siu2 less; little; reduce + cantonese (jyutping) 底 dai2 bottom; base
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) barely sweetened; with very little sugar or condensed milk

Words.English Translation: → English: slang from english slang informal language; language of a particular social group; jargon specific to a field
Words.Definition: an accent perceived as a prestige or upper-class, such as a vaguely British or American accent, especially when put-on, affected, or obviously inauthentic, carrying undertones of being embarrassed or disdainful of a native Singaporean accent, and often used in a way that is entirely inappropriate for and oblivious to the present social context
Words.Example: Okay i've got nothing against ppl who speak in perfect english, after all that's what the singapore govt wants us to do ... but pls, CUT THE SLANG ALRIGHT? [sic]

Words.English Translation: → English: sleep + game from english sleep state of reduced consciousness for resting + english game activity played for amusement or competition
Words.Definition: (gaming) an extremely easy or boring match or game
Words.Example: This is such a sleep game… when does NA play?

Words.English Translation: → English: smart + No. 4 from english smart (of a style of dress) good-looking; neat; well-kempt; fine + english No. 4 (mil.) abbreviation of 'Number 4', the designation of the camouflaged combat uniform of the SAF
Words.Definition: (military) a variant of the No. 4 uniform worn by soldiers with the sleeves folded high to the upper arm level, leaving about 4 fingers from the shoulder to the folded section. It is used in most cases when wearing the uniform outside of a combat or training situation.

Words.English Translation: → English: smart + Malay: mat from english smart clever; intelligent + malay mat (slang) guy; dude; John Doe ← malay Ahmad popular Muslim male given name ← arabic أَحْمَد ʔaḥmad popular Arabic male given name + malay Muhammad* extremely popular Muslim male given name ← arabic مُحَمَّد muḥammad prophet of Islam; extremely popular Arabic male given name, (lit.) praised; exalted; extolled ← arabic حَمِدَ ḥamida thank; praise; exalt
Words.Definition: (possibly derogatory) a well-educated, intelligent, or academically excellent Malay man
Words.Example: Eh this guy read law in UK sial, he not just some mat, he is smat.

Words.English Translation: → English: smelly ↻ Possible, but not certain Malay: busuk &/or Possible, but not certain General chinese: 臭 pinyin: chòu from english smelly stinky; having an unpleasant odour ↻ malay Possible, but not certain busuk smelly; rotten; bad; corrupt &/or general chinese (pinyin) Possible, but not certain 臭 chòu smelly; repulsive; bad; detestable
Words.Definition: (of work, money earned, etc.) without care or effort, often implying underhandedly or undeservedly
Words.Example: All in all, you learn so much and relearn and work like a dog in the end all the money goes to the boss. Smelly smelly the project the boss earn 200k+ without doing anything but just ordering us to do it.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: si mi lan jiao from singlish si mi lan jiao what ← hokkien (poj) 什物 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu penis
Words.Definition: (interrogative, vulgar) what the hell; what the shit
Words.Example: If you are looking for a place where you can find birds of all sizes, check out a quaint little bird shop in Eunos.The shop's name is "SMLJ Small Medium Large Jiao".

Words.English Translation: → English: smoke from english smoke visible cloud of fine particulate matter and vapour given off during combustion or some other chemical process; sth. used to obscure
Words.Definition: to deceive; to make misleading or intentionally vague statements; to exaggerate
Words.Example: Even though I completely smoked my answers to the interview, I somehow still got called back for the second round.

Words.English Translation: → English: snake from english snake long, thin, legless reptile in the suborder Serpentes
Words.Definition: someone who is always selfishly scheming and plotting; a backstabber; a rat; a treacherous and untrustworthy person; someone who puts on facades to deceive others of their ulterior intentions
Words.Example: The specs knew that the snakes in the jungle were nothing compared to the snakes in the Alpha coy office back in camp.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: snake1 + king from singlish snake1 scheme against; backstab; rat; be treacherous and untrustworthy; sb. who acts in such a manner ← english snake long, thin, legless reptile in the suborder Serpentes + singlish king (suffix, usu. sarcastic or pejorative) the epitome of sth. ← english king (usu. male) the ruler of a monarchy; a powerful or preeminent person
Words.Definition: someone who is always selfishly scheming and plotting; a serial backstabber; a rat; someone who is the epitome of a treacherous and untrustworthy person; someone who constantly puts on facades to deceive others of their ulterior intentions

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 霜包 poj: sng-pau from min nan (poj) 霜包 sng-pau ← min nan (poj) 霜 sng ice; frost + min nan (poj) 包 pau packet; package
Words.Definition: an ice lolly or popsicle made from sweet syrup frozen in a long, tubular plastic pouch, which comes in various flavours and is often brightly and attractively coloured
Words.Example: Do you remember sucking on a sng pao (ice pop) to cool off after a game of "catching"? Or thrusting your hand into a salty bag of Kaka to grab the crunchy, chicken-flavoured tidbit? If you do, you're probably from the generation that also grew up on Hiro Choc Cake, bottled Kickapoo soft drinks and Haw Flakes.

Words.English Translation: → English: snow + skin ↻ Mandarin: 冰皮 pinyin: bīng pí from english snow precipitated fine ice + english skin outer layer; covering ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 冰皮 bīng pí type of pastry crust made from glutinous rice flour ← mandarin (pinyin) 冰 bīng ice + mandarin (pinyin) 皮 pí skin
Words.Definition: a type of pastry crust made from glutinous rice flour, resulting in a translucent, frosty, slightly chewy skin
Words.Example: Also irresistible is the newly launched Mango Pomelo Snowskin Mooncake (S$95 nett for four), a refreshing blend of mango and pomelo enveloped in melt-in-the-mouth snowskin.

Words.English Translation: → English: so from english so to the extent that; very
Words.Definition: very; placed before a noun to make a strong comparison or equivalence between it and someone or something else; adjectifier for any noun
Words.Example: He's so uncle and she's so auntie, it's like they met each other at Whatapps University.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 锁匙 鎖匙 poj: só-sî from hokkien (poj) 锁匙 鎖匙 só-sî key
Words.Definition: a key

Words.English Translation: → English: standard + obstacle course from english standard used as a basis of normalcy, comparison, or judgement + english obstacle course series of physical challenges or stations hindering ordinary movement which one must overcome in order ← english obstacle obstruction; sth. that blocks progress + english course path; route; defined series
Words.Definition: (military) an obstacle or assault course which combat-fit soldiers have to attempt as part of training, consisting of physical stations such as a low wall, vaults, balancing beam, apex ladder, etc.

Words.English Translation: → English: soft-boiled from english soft-boiled (of an egg) cooked until the white is set but the yolk is still runny ← english soft not hard + english boiled cooked in boiling water
Words.Definition: (of an egg) cooked until the white is opaque but not yet set, such that both the white and yolk are still runny; half-boiled

Words.English Translation: → English: soft-boiled egg from english soft-boiled egg egg cooked until the white is set but the yolk is still runny ← english soft not hard + english boiled cooked in boiling water + english egg round or ovoid, shelled body laid by certain animals where the embryo develops (usu. from chickens in a culinary sense)
Words.Definition: an egg cooked until the white is opaque but not yet set, such that both the white and yolk are still runny; a half-boiled egg
Words.Example: Kaya toast is typically served with soft-boiled eggs, which I realise means a different thing in the West. While only the yolk of the Western-style soft-boiled egg is creamy, both the yolk and whites of the kopitiam egg remain tender and velvety.

Words.English Translation: → English: SOG from english SOG short-form brand name of the knife manufacturer SOG Specialty Knives, Inc. ✂ english SOG [knife] unmarked knife issued to members of the Studies and Observations Group during the Vietnam War ← english Studies and Observations Group covert, highly-classified special operations force in the US military during the Vietnam War
Words.Definition: (military) a multi-tool; a 'Swiss Army' knife, regardless of brand

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 傻𲈹 傻閪 jyutping: so4 hai1 from cantonese (jyutping) 傻𲈹 傻閪 so4 hai1 stupid cunt; idiot; dumbass; contemptible person ← cantonese (jyutping) 傻 傻 so4 stupid; dumb; foolish + cantonese (jyutping) 𲈹 閪 hai1 (vg.) cunt; vulva; female genitalia; fucking
Words.Definition: (vulgar, offensive) stupid cunt; stupid fuck
Words.Example: Malaysians in particular seem to love this word. People who spend a lot of time with Malaysian gamers on games like DoTA or League of Legends (LoL) would be familiar with the oft-repeated ‘sohai’.

Words.English Translation: → English: stoppage + of + leave from english stoppage ceasing or putting on hold of sth. + english of relating to; having the quality; indicates possession + english leave permission; permitted time off from work or duty
Words.Definition: a punishment levied upon a soldier who has committed a transgression by removing their right to leave and restricting their movement to and around camp.
Words.Example: Because of the ND incident, our whole section kena SOL... actually quite chill lah, we all just nua in bunk all day and play soccer at the parade square in the evening.

Words.English Translation: → English: solid from english solid firm; fast; strong, (slang) excellent; reliable ← old french solide firm; fast; secure; solid ← latin solidus solid; firm; whole
Words.Definition: excellent; great
Words.Example: We all think the new plan is damn solid.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: solid + English: bird from singlish solid reliable; calm and cool; excellent; great ← english solid firm; fast; strong, (slang) excellent; reliable ← old french solide firm; fast; secure; solid ← latin solidus solid; firm; whole + english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: solid + English: chap from singlish solid reliable; calm and cool; excellent; great ← english solid firm; fast; strong, (slang) excellent; reliable ← old french solide firm; fast; secure; solid ← latin solidus solid; firm; whole + english chap man; guy; fellow ← english chapman merchant; dealer; buyer
Words.Definition: a great, reliable fellow
Words.Example: I sumpah that Mark is a solid chap; have known him since army days.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sombong from malay sombong arrogant; cocky; conceited; proud; opinionated
Words.Definition: arrogant; cocky; conceited; proud; opinionated
Words.Example: "Eh, you think you go OCS become occifer only can act so sombong, is it?"

Words.Example: My local hawker centre food lagi nicer than your atas cafe… somemore cost less than half the price.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爽 poj: sóng from hokkien (poj) 爽 sóng happy; satisfied; pleased; feel good; enjoyable
Words.Definition: happy; satisfied; pleased; feeling good; enjoying oneself

Related: ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 爽 poj: sóng + 到 poj: kàu + Malay: Jurong from hokkien (poj) 爽 sóng happy; satisfied; pleased; feel good; enjoyable + hokkien (poj) 到 kàu arrive; to; until; to the extent that + malay Jurong major district or geographical area in the west of Singapore ← malay Sungei Jurong name of a river which flows in the Jurong area
Words.Definition: to be so satisfied and pleased that one is taken all the way to Jurong
Words.Example: Wa eh sai 予汝 songSong kao JurongBut whatever you do some people still gon’ be buay song

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 笋壳 筍殼 jyutping: seon2 hok3 from cantonese (jyutping) 笋壳 筍殼 seon2 hok3 Oxyeleotris marmorata, a.k.a. marble goby
Words.Definition: Oxyeleotris marmorata (commonly known as the marble goby), a large goby which lives in fresh and brackish water bodies such as rivers. It is a very popular fish in Chinese cuisine due to its large size (typically around 30 cm, but reaching up to 65 cm) and succulent white flesh.

Words.English Translation: → Teochew / hokkien: 笋粿 筍粿 peng’im: sung2 guê2 from teochew / hokkien (peng’im) 笋粿 筍粿 sung2 guê2 Teochew steamed dumpling filled with julienned bamboo shoots and other ingredients ← teochew / hokkien (peng’im) 笋 筍 sung2 bamboo shoot + teochew / hokkien (peng’im) 粿 粿 guê2 kueh
Words.Definition: a Teochew steamed dumpling with a translucent skin of mixed rice and tapioca flour, filled with julienned bamboo shoots, bangkuang, and other ingredients (such as dried shrimp or mushrooms for their umami flavour). It is sometimes pressed into decorative shapes with a mold, and is often served with chilli and a sweet soya sauce.
Words.Example: Soon kueh deserves more attention than it gets. … it’s an old-school snack that is both healthy and tasty.

Words.English Translation: → English: sorry + no + cure from english sorry expression of remorse, apology, regret etc. + english no not; not at all + english cure sth. that heals; solution to a problem
Words.Definition: used to express that a simple apology will not make things right or solve the problem that has been created
Words.Example: Sorry no cure, Anwar, whether you’re merely citing a historical source or just a slip of the tongue ... Anwar could not have used the K-word at a more inopportune time.

Words.English Translation: → English: sorry + no + Baba malay: pakeh from english sorry expression of remorse, apology, regret etc. + english no not; not at all + baba malay pakeh wear (clothes); use ← malay pakai wear (clothes); use
Words.Definition: used to express that a simple apology will not make things right or solve the problem that has been created
Words.Example: Wah champion ah you... this time your sorry no pakeh.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: short jyutping: sot1 from cantonese (jyutping) short sot1 crazy; insane; having a screw loose ← english short short circuit ✂ english short circuit usu. unintentional electrical connection of low resistance causing excessive current to flow through it ← english short of small distance or duration; abrupt + english circuit closed path for electrical current
Words.Definition: crazy; mad; insane; having a screw loose
Words.Example: But girl tattoo especially those girly type... Abit sot sot one

Words.English Translation: → Malay / indonesian: soto ayam from malay / indonesian soto ayam traditional spiced soup with chicken and rice noodles ← malay soto traditional spiced soup ← hokkien (poj) 牛草肚 gû-chháu-tō͘ beef tripe + malay ayam chicken
Words.Definition: a traditional spiced chicken soup originating from Indonesian cuisine. It has a characteristic yellowish colour due to the use of turmeric as a key ingredient. Other ingredients may include hard-boiled eggs, fried shallots, lontong, etc.
Words.Example: The heart of every mee soto dish is the soto ayam (chicken broth). The broth is made from chicken cooked with rempah (spice paste).

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sotong from malay sotong squid; cuttlefish
Words.Definition: squid; cuttlefish
Words.Example: These sotong pieces were eaten with chilli sauce. It was mouth-wateringly delicious. ... Usually Ah Chin would manage to sell 10 dried sotong.

Words.English Translation: → English: soup from english soup liquid-based dish with water or stock and other ingredients; broth ← french soupe soup
Words.Definition: (of food, usually noodles) with soup served as part of the main dish instead of on the side

Words.English Translation: → English: soya + bean from english soya the legume Glycine max or substances derived from it; soya sauce ← dutch soja soya ← satsuma japanese 醤油 そい soi soya sauce ← japanese 醤油 しょうゆ shōyu soya sauce orthog. early modern chinese (pinyin) 酱油 醬油 jiàng yóu soya sauce + english bean plant of the family Fabaceae producing edible seeds, or the seeds thereof
Words.Definition: the edible seeds of the legume plant Glycine max, which are widely used in Asian cuisine — such as in soya sauce, desserts like tau huay, and drinks like tau huay chui.
Words.Example: Soya bean products (e.g. beancurd, tempeh and soya milk) belong to the meat and alternatives food group and this food group provides protein, which is an essential nutrient that serves numerous functions.

Words.Word: soya bean milk 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: soya + bean + milk from english soya the legume Glycine max or substances derived from it; soya sauce ← dutch soja soya ← satsuma japanese 醤油 そい soi soya sauce ← japanese 醤油 しょうゆ shōyu soya sauce orthog. early modern chinese (pinyin) 酱油 醬油 jiàng yóu soya sauce + english bean plant of the family Fabaceae producing edible seeds, or the seeds thereof + english milk opaque, whitish liquid produced by mammals; liquid similar in appearance pressed from a plant source
Words.Definition: an opaque, creamy-white to white drink produced from soya beans. It is made by soaking the beans overnight, then grinding or blending them until smooth and boiling the mixture. The milk is then obtained by straining away the soya bean pulp, and is usually sweetened before serving. It is a popular traditional drink which has been enjoyed in Singapore for generations.
Words.Example: He sells fresh soya bean milk and tau huey (soybean pudding) at Tiong Bahru Market. And when I say fresh, I mean FRESH.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / hakka: 傻仔 jyutping: so4 zai2 from cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 傻仔 so4 zai2 idiot; fool; moron; silly kid ← cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 傻 so4 stupid; dumb; foolish + cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 仔 zai2 kid; young; young male
Words.Definition: a fool; a moron; a silly person

Words.English Translation: → English: spare parts from english spare parts extra pieces kept or produced as replacements
Words.Definition: offal; the internal organs of an animal which are eaten as food
Words.Example: The spare parts here have nothing to do with cars. Rather, they come from pigs. This stall is famous for its ter huang kiam chye, a distinctively Chinese concoction consisting of pig intestines, livers, blood cubes and other organs together with salted vegetables.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: sarong party girl from singlish sarong party girl (derog.) Asian girl who dates, hooks up with, and chases after white men ← english sarong party party for expatriates, usually well-off Western professionals, where guests dress up in sarongs ← malay sarung traditional lower garment worn in various forms by South-East and South Asians, usu. a light, decoratively-printed cloth tied around the waist + english party social event or gathering for fun and entertainment ← anglo-norman partie part; section ← latin partīta part; division + english girl young female human
Words.Definition: (initialism, derogatory) an Asian girl who goes to parties and other social events with the intention of hooking up with white expatriate men or other non-Asian foreigners; an Asian girl who dates a white expatriate man or other foreigner, especially if said girl is perceived to be attracted to their supposed racial or socioeconomic privilege
Words.Example: AMDK brings SPG to eat zichar = so cool, cosmopolitan, can integrate and eat local foodSinkie wants to bring SPG to eat zichar = low ses, no standard, loser.

Words.Definition: (humorous or ironic) to speak; to talk

Words.English Translation: → English: spoiled/spoilt from english spoiled/spoilt broken; out of order; having become unusable or inedible
Words.Definition: broken; out of order
Words.Example: Sian, the lift spoil already, need to take the stairs.

Words.English Translation: → English: spoil + market from english spoil ruin; damage + english market set place for trade of goods; set or demographic of customers for a product or industry ← latin mercātus trade; market
Words.Definition: to do something so extraordinarily, conscientiously, rule-abidingly, or generally unnecessary and over what is usually required (extra), that one raises the bar for expectations too high, making the efforts and contributions of people doing things normally look bad in comparison
Words.Example: Her-Aku-Punya-Lutut was among them, having begun her day far earlier than anyone else. She waved at the boys, and told them she had been in class for an hour already. ... "I think I know most of the first-year spells in our syllabus.""Eh sista, don't spoil market can?" said Ron.

Words.English Translation: → English: sponsor from english sponsor pay for all or part of the cost of sth. ← latin sponsor promise to pay money; one who is bonded to pay a sum of money
Words.Definition: to sponsor; to pay for
Words.Example: Bro, can spon me one Marlboro?

Words.English Translation: → English: stand + by + area from english stand positioned upright on one's feet + english by next to; beside; near + english area place; region
Words.Definition: (military) an inspection conducted by a commander on the condition, cleanliness, and orderliness of an entire area, most often a bunk and the region immediately outside such as the corridor, plus any communal areas used by the soldiers such as the toilet and water cooler. Soldiers are expected to leave their locker open and stand in senang diri beside their bed while the inspection is being conducted. It encompasses more than simply a stand-by-bed, and as such is conducted less frequently (around once a week).

Words.English Translation: → English: stand + by + bed from english stand positioned upright on one's feet + english by next to; beside; near + english bed flat, usu. soft place where one lays down to sleep or rest
Words.Definition: (military) an inspection conducted by a commander on the condition, cleanliness, and orderliness of the personal area around a soldier's bed and locker. Soldiers are expected to leave their locker open and stand in senang diri beside their bed while the inspection is being conducted. Typical points of order include whether the furniture is wiped clean of dust and the floor is clean, and whether the bed is made properly, clothes are folded correctly, and standard items are displayed and arranged neatly, and all done so according to the standard fashion.

Words.English Translation: → English: stand + by + bunk from english stand positioned upright on one's feet + english by next to; beside; near + english bunk (mil., met.) soldiers' sleeping quarters ← english bunk bed in a series of beds, often arranged in two or more levels; bed
Words.Definition: (military) an inspection conducted by a commander on the condition, cleanliness, and orderliness of the personal area around a soldier's bed and locker. Soldiers are expected to leave their locker open and stand in senang diri beside their bed while the inspection is being conducted. Typical points of order include whether the furniture is wiped clean of dust and the floor is clean, and whether the bed is made properly, clothes are folded correctly, and standard items are displayed and arranged neatly, and all done so according to the standard fashion.

Words.English Translation: → English: stand + by + universe from english stand positioned upright on one's feet + english by next to; beside; near + english universe entirety of the cosmos ← latin ūniversum entire; altogether; whole
Words.Definition: (military) a drastic and unusual event conducted by a commander on the entirety of their soldiers’ personal effects and belongings, plus the entire company area. Unlike a standard stand-by-bed or stand-by-area, for example, the purpose of the stand-by-universe is often not the inspection of orderliness, but rather either an attempt to uncover a missing or contraband item, or simply to exact a cruel punishment.

Words.English Translation: → English: standard from english standard acceptable quality or grade; recognized benchmark of quality
Words.Definition: of great quality; pretty good; outstanding
Words.Example: Wah, standard sia this satay sauce.

Words.English Translation: → English: staple + bullet from english staple thin, U-shaped metal strip used to fasten items together, esp. sheets of paper + english bullet projectile fired from a gun ← old french bullete small ball

Words.Example: Making bugs out of staple bullets and erasers is a favourite pastime of primary school students.

'see what see' ← hokkien (poj) 看 khoàⁿ see; look + hokkien (poj) 什物 sím-mi̍h what + hokkien (poj) 看 khoàⁿ see; look

Words.Example: Ah Soon damn steady one, never siam work never keng never take MC.

Words.Word: steady pom pi pi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: steady1 + pom pi pi from singlish steady1 cool-headed; reliable; solid; ready ← english steady unwavering; firm; resolute + singlish pom pi pi whistle; blow a whistle ← hokkien (poj) 𬅫觱觱 歕觱觱 pûn-pi-pi whistle; blow a whistle ← hokkien (poj) 𬅫 歕 pûn blow + hokkien (poj) 觱觱 觱觱 pi-pi (onom.) whistling sound

Words.Definition: capable; ready; solid; reliable; trustworthy; composed; keeping cool under any situation. An emphasized variant of steady1.

Words.English Translation: → English: stimulate + steam up from english stimulate arouse; excite ← latin stimulātus stimulated + english steam up make angry or excited; arouse
Words.Definition: sexually excited; stimulated

Words.English Translation: → English: steamboat from english steamboat ship or vessel propelled with steam power; steamer ← english steam ship or vessel propelled with steam power; steamer + english boat gaseous form of water
Words.Definition: a type of communal meal where diners sit around a large, boiling hot pot of stock or broth and dip in various pieces of food, such as thinly-sliced meats, fishballs, vegetables, mushrooms, noodles etc. for just long enough that they become cooked, then typically eat them with a dip or sauce. It has origins in ancient China.
Words.Example: Marina Bay, wah, their steamboat the best last time. Best in Singapore. And now it's gone.

Words.English Translation: → English: steamed + chicken from english steamed cooked using steam + english chicken member of the subspecies Gallus gallus domesticus
Words.Definition: the “white” variety of Hainanese-style chicken, derived from a traditional Hainanese dish called Wenchang chicken. It is most commonly and famously used in chicken rice, but often also appears in related dishes such as curry chicken noodles or chicken porridge. Contrary to its name, it is actually cooked by successive steps of poaching or boiling followed by immersion in iced water, and never actually steamed.
Words.Example: My mother was a huge fan of the wonton noodles, while I particularly liked the fried carrot cake and steamed chicken rice.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: setengah from malay setengah half ← malay se- one + malay tengah middle; centre
Words.Definition: to share a cigarette
