Words.Example: They ban pmd also not ban delivery in singapore, still can use bike or bicycle what, you shout shout step fierce got what use??

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: step + English: cool from singlish step try or feign to be sth. one is not ← english Possible, but not certain step pace; gait; stride + english cool stylish; suave; hip; dashing; enviable
Words.Definition: to pretend as if one is extremely stylish, suave, dashing, etc.
Words.Example: lol cringe sia, u confirm lurk here everyday like a dog wan step cool knn lame la

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: step + Malay: jambu from singlish step trying to be something one is not; acting; feigning ← english Possible, but not certain step pace; gait; stride + malay jambu any plant of the genus Syzygium or its edible fruit, (slang) cute; adorable; pretty; beautiful ← javanese / old javanese ꦗꦩ꧀ꦧꦸ jambu any plant of the genus Syzygium or its edible fruit ← sanskrit जम्बु jambu Syzygium cumini or its edible fruit
Words.Definition: (by a girl or young woman) to act cute; to attempt to make oneself look more adorable, pretty, or attractive
Words.Example: Come to work step jambu.. go home look like never shower 3 days

Words.English Translation: → English: sticky from english sticky able or tending to adhere
Words.Definition: the adhesive face, part, or layer of an adhesive item, such as adhesive tape
Words.Example: Eh, this tape koyak liao. Got no more sticky already.

Words.English Translation: → Likely, but other possible etymologies exist English: stingy + -o from english Likely, but other possible etymologies exist stingy miserly; niggardly + english -o colloquializing suffix
Words.Definition: stingy; miserly; niggardly
Words.Example: You know Grandma very stinko... that's why I always know when my money sekali go missing.

Words.English Translation: → English: stir the pot + stir shit from english stir the pot deliberately raise dissent; cause trouble + english stir shit deliberately raise dissent; cause trouble
Words.Definition: (idiom) to deliberately raise dissent; to cause trouble

Words.English Translation: → English: STOMP from english STOMP acronym of former ← english Straits Times Online Media Print citizen journalism website
Words.Definition: to have a photograph taken of oneself in public, especially without consent, out of context, and when one is appearing to be doing something socially unacceptable, then posted online (to STOMP itself, or some other news aggregator or social media) to be publically shamed
Words.Example: Seriously, these kinds of stompers all damn bo liao and no life. We are humans, we get tired too, we sacrifice 2 years of our time and effort for Sgporeans like them and in the end kena stomp by them when we tired and want to take a seat.

Words.English Translation: → English: STOMP + -er from english STOMP acronym of former ← english Straits Times Online Media Print citizen journalism website + english -er suffix used to form a noun which performs the action of the root verb
Words.Definition: someone who posts images and articles to the citizen jounalism website STOMP
Words.Example: Stomper Arthur had witnessed the heartwarming act while he was on the way to lunch on Tuesday (Jan 3), and alerted Stomp to it ... After Stomp posted the photo taken by Stomper Arthur on our website, the soldier's kind gesture stole the hearts of netizens.

Words.English Translation: → English: stoned + stone from english stoned high on drugs (esp. marijuana) + english stone rock; pebble
Words.Definition: to space out; to go blank; to sit or stand around doing nothing
Words.Example: At work I always got nothing to do one. So I just sit there and stone whole day.

Words.English Translation: → English: storeman + commando from english storeman sb. who works in a store or warehouse ← english store place where items are kept or held + english -man person working or specialized in an area + english commando small, highly trained combat force specialised in difficult operations or raids; soldier in such a force ← afrikaans kommando militia; raid; raiding party ← portuguese comando command; order; commando ← latin commendare recommend; commend
Words.Definition: (military, slightly derogatory) a soldier whose vocation is as a storeman, or in the supply division

Words.English Translation: → English: strawberry + Mandarin: 草莓 pinyin: cǎo méi from english strawberry edible fruit of the Fragaria × ananassa plant + mandarin (pinyin) 草莓 cǎo méi (lit.) strawberry; (fig.) sb. or sth. easily bruised
Words.Definition: (metaphor, pejorative) something or someone that is easily bruised, or unable to cope with hardships
Words.Example: Many older people snigger openly at the concerns of the young people of today, who they perceive as strawberries for caring about effete issues like mental health and a healthy workplace environment instead of toughing it out like they did in the old days.

Words.English Translation: → English: strawberry + generation ↻ Mandarin: 草莓族 pinyin: cǎo méi zú from english strawberry any plant in the genus Fragaria or its edible fruit + english generation people of the same genealogical stage ← anglo-norman generacioun generation ← latin generātiō generation ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 草莓族 cǎo méi zú generation of people that is perceived as effete and feeble, and unable to cope with hardships ← mandarin (pinyin) 草莓 cǎo méi strawberry + mandarin (pinyin) 族 zú clan; ethnicity; group
Words.Definition: (pejorative) a generation of people (typically younger) that is perceived as effete and feeble, and unable to cope with the hardships of the real world.
Words.Example: No matter how hard you had it in NS, there's always an old uncle ready to regale you with tales of how torturous and gruelling their 2.5 years were, and how you kids are a strawberry generation for complaining about the intensity of your daily tekan sessions.

Words.English Translation: → English: study + Mandarin: 陪读妈妈 陪讀妈妈 pinyin: péi dú mā mā from english study learn; take an academic course; be a student of; read ← old french estudier study ← latin studium study + mandarin (pinyin) 陪读妈妈 陪讀妈妈 péi dú mā mā mother who accompanies their child overseas when they go to study ← mandarin (pinyin) 陪读 陪讀 péi dú to accompany one’s child overseas when they go to study ← mandarin (pinyin) 陪 陪 péi accompany; follow + mandarin (pinyin) 读 讀 dú read; study + mandarin (pinyin) 妈妈 妈妈 mā mā mother
Words.Definition: a mother, usually from Mainland China, who accompanies their child overseas when they go to study as a scholar

Words.English Translation: → English: stuff + -s from english stuff miscellaneous things + english -s plural marker
Words.Definition: variant plural form of stuff

Words.English Translation: → Dubious or unconfirmed Singlish: steng from singlish Dubious or unconfirmed steng share; steal; take without permission
Words.Definition: to confiscate; to take something from another person without them noticing; to steal
Words.Example: My encik ninja snuck into our bunk once and stun someone’s rifle. Really nothing to do so come cause problem.

Words.English Translation: → English: stunned + like + vegetable from english stunned dumbfounded; dazed; unable to act or move + english like similar to + english vegetable edible plant used as a culinary item ← old french vegetable plant; vegetable ← latin vegetābilis able to grow; enlivening
Words.Definition: (simile) to be completely dumbfounded or left unable to act
Words.Example: Look at that blur cock, cannot make it as occifer lah. Just start mission only he already so stun like vegetable.

Words.English Translation: → English: stupid + Singlish: piak from english stupid idiotic; dumb; unintelligent + singlish piak hit; slap, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap ← hokkien (poj) 拍 phiak hit; slap; clap; whack, (onom.) sound of a hit or slap or hokkien (poj) 擗 phia̍k/pia̍k hit, (onom.) sound of a hit; sound of a flap or flutter
Words.Definition: to be so stupid that one cannot help but slap one’s forehead in disbelief; extremely dumb or idiotic
Words.Example: More of the finest e-Stupiaks in our sunny island set to pounding Ah Beng techno! Huat huat huat ah!

Words.English Translation: → English: stylish + -o from english stylish fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool + english -o colloquializing suffix
Words.Definition: stylish; fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool
Words.Example: I had a classmate — one day he went to Cathay in his new dancing shoes and white pants to see a picture show. You know what happen? A gangster came up to him and ask, 'Wah, somebody stylo, ah? You think this area belong to you? Trying to make me lau kui, is it?' I tell you, that guy ran for his life.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: stylo + English: Milo from singlish stylo stylish; fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool ← english stylish fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool + english -o colloquializing suffix + english Milo Nestlé chocolate-flavoured malted drink and drink powder product ← ancient greek Μῆλος Mêlos Milo of Croton, six-time Olympic wrestling champion who competed between c. 540 - 512 BC
Words.Definition: stylish; fashionable; elegant; glamorous; cool
Words.Example: During the tea break, I remember seeing this exotic petite tanned beauty with a stylo milo leather jacket on and damn was she gorgeous.

Words.Word: stylo milo kopi O 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: stylo milo + kopi + O from singlish stylo milo stylish; fashionable; elegant; glamorous; cool ← singlish stylo stylish; fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool ← english stylish fashionable; elegantly dressed; cool + english -o colloquializing suffix + english Milo Nestlé chocolate-flavoured malted drink and drink powder product ← ancient greek Μῆλος Mêlos Milo of Croton, six-time Olympic wrestling champion who competed between c. 540 - 512 BC + singlish kopi coffee ← hokkien / teochew (poj) 咖啡 ko-pi coffee ← malay kopi coffee & malay kopi coffee ← dutch koffie coffee ← italian caffè coffee ← ottoman turkish قهوه kahve coffee ← arabic قَهْوَة qahwa coffee + singlish O (drink ordering) black ← hokkien / teochew (poj/peng'im) 乌 烏 o͘/ou1 black; dark
Words.Definition: stylish; fashionable; glamorous; cool; good-looking
Words.Example: bmw oem coolant is good enough ... no need stylo milo kopi-o coolant with designer name

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 绁 紲 poj: sòa from hokkien (poj) 绁 紲 sòa continue; follow on; add
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) added to the end of a drink order to ask for a second order of the same drink
Words.Example: Uncle, two kopi-O kosong sua. One for me, one for my friend.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 煞 poj: soah from hokkien (poj) 煞 soah give up; stop; let things be; leave it
Words.Definition: to let things be; to give up; to stop trying
Words.Example: Suah lah, you tell her how many times she also won't change one.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 山龟 山龜 poj: soaⁿ-ku from hokkien (poj) 山龟 山龜 soaⁿ-ku bumpkin; uncultured or uninformed person ← hokkien (poj) 山 山 soaⁿ mountain + hokkien (poj) 龟 龜 ku tortoise; turtle
Words.Definition: a country bumpkin; a backwards, uninformed, uncultured, or unsophisticated person
Words.Example: I am that suaku newly arrived from Malaysia, and have never bought ready-made clothes. A relative takes me to a shop called Hilda's, and I spend two glorious hours trying on dresses, skirts and blouses. It is in Singapore that I do a lot of things for the first time ...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / mandarin: 酸 poj / pinyin: soan / suān from hokkien / mandarin (poj / pinyin) 酸 soan / suān sour; ridicule; mock
Words.Definition: to ridicule; to mock; to deride
Words.Example: Like that also suan? So glassheart? He did say he took some of the good feedback mah. SG's complaints were addressed in Malaysia concert what.

Words.Word: suan pan zi 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 算盘子 算盤子 pinyin: suàn pán zǐ from mandarin (pinyin) 算盘子 算盤子 suàn pán zǐ abacus bead (Hakka dish) ← hakka (hrs) 算盘子 算盤子 son panˇ ziiˋ abacus bead ← hakka (hrs) 算盘 算盤 son panˇ abacus ← hakka (hrs) 子 子 ziiˋ grain-like object; small object; seed
Words.Definition: a Hakka dish, made with a dough of taro and tapioca flour that is typically shaped into rounded biconcave discs and boiled, before being stir-fried with various ingredients like minced pork, mushrooms, and spring onions. Since its namesake - the abacus - is associated with accounting, abacus beads are often taken as a symbol of wealth and prosperity.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 酸笑 poj: soan-siàu from hokkien (poj) 酸笑 soan-siàu ridicule; mock; laugh at; deride ← hokkien (poj) 酸 soan sour; ridicule; mock + hokkien (poj) 笑 siàu laugh; laugh at; ridicule
Words.Definition: to laugh at; to make fun of; to ridicule; to tease; to mock; to sneer at; to deride

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / cantonese / hakka: 衰 poj: soe from min nan / cantonese / hakka (poj) 衰 soe bad luck; unlucky; awful
Words.Definition: unlucky; unfortunate; having bad luck
Words.Example: I damn suay. I dated the most guai lan biatch ever. Never dating college girl again.

Words.English Translation: → English: [to] suck [one’s] thumb from english [to] suck [one’s] thumb put one’s thumb in one’s mouth, often seen as a childlike action ← english suck draw into one’s mouth by creating a region of lower pressure + english thumb short, thick, opposable digit of each hand
Words.Definition: (idiom) to bear with something unpleasant or unfavourable without complaint; to accept the current situation and having to wait around while nothing can be done
Words.Example: Why is it wrong to “suck thumb” at work? … I hope that more people will stand up for their rights and ask reasonably for restitution …

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sudah from malay sudah done; finished; enough; already ← sanskrit Possible, but not certain शुद्ध śuddhá pure; clean; simple
Words.Definition: done; over with; finished

Words.Word: sue until pants drop 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 输甲褪裤 輸甲褪褲 poj: su kah thǹg-khò͘ + English: sue the pants off + until + drop from hokkien (poj) 输甲褪裤 輸甲褪褲 su kah thǹg-khò͘ lose heavily and devastatingly ← hokkien (poj) 输 輸 su lose ← hokkien (poj) 甲 kah until; to the point/extent of + hokkien (poj) 褪 thǹg take off (clothes) + hokkien (poj) 裤 褲 khò͘ pants; trousers + english sue the pants off sue heavily and devastatingly + english until up to; to the point that + english drop fall; fall down to the ground
Words.Definition: (idiom) to sue someone so heavily and devastatingly that they are left with nothing
Words.Example: Own sibling, cannot sue. After all, we all brother and sisters. But political opponents and critics? Sue until your pants drop!

Words.English Translation: → Hindi: सूजी sūjī from hindi सूजी sūjī semolina ← ashokan prakrit *𑀲𑀽𑀚𑁆𑀚𑀻 *sūjjī semolina
Words.Definition: a type of semolina; a coarsely ground wheat grain that is not yet so fine as to be a powder

Words.English Translation: → Hindi: सूजी sūjī + English: cake from hindi सूजी sūjī semolina ← ashokan prakrit *𑀲𑀽𑀚𑁆𑀚𑀻 *sūjjī semolina + english cake baked good or confectionery, usually sweet and made from a batter or dough ← old norse kaka cake
Words.Definition: a rich cake made from semolina flour (sugee), lots of butter and eggs, almond or cashew nut flour, and sometimes brandy and other flavourings and ingredients. It likely originated in Kristang Eurasian cuisine.
Words.Example: Auntie Pat, with all the traditions of a true-blue Eurasian, does her sugee cake with strict discipline in approach. This version is as authentic as it gets, with all those butters and even spoons of brandy inside. ... It's softly, sinfully good and very nutty yet not overly sweet.

Words.Word: sui sui bo zao zui 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 媠媠无走水 媠媠無走水 poj: súi súi bô cháu chúi from hokkien (poj) 媠媠无走水 媠媠無走水 súi súi bô cháu chúi made or done extremely well ← hokkien (poj) 媠 媠 súi beautiful; perfect; excellent + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not have; don't + hokkien (poj) 走 走 cháu run; leak + hokkien (poj) 水 水 chúi water
Words.Definition: used to describe something made or done extremely well; near-perfect; ideal; beautifully made or done

Words.English Translation: → Malay: suka from malay suka like; love ← sanskrit सुख sukhá prosperous; pleasant; joyful; happy
Words.Definition: to like; to love

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sesuka-suka from malay sesuka-suka as one wishes; according to one’s desires ⇇ malay suka like; love ← sanskrit सुख sukhá prosperous; pleasant; joyful; happy
Words.Definition: as one pleases; at one’s leisure; according to one’s desires
Words.Example: At last boleh relax, right? Sorry, story not finish!… cannot yak-yak any how we wish:… Cannot suka-suka speak Singlish!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tiga suku from malay tiga suku slightly crazy; a bit dumb or foolish, (lit.) three quarters; 3/4 ← malay tiga three ← prakrit *तिग tiga triple; triplet ← sanskrit त्रिक trika triple + malay suku quarter; 1/4
Words.Definition: having a screw loose; a bit dumb or foolish; silly; crazy; not all there
Words.Example: Alex is bit suku, and can be really annoying at times, but we still love him.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sumpah from malay sumpah promise
Words.Definition: to promise; to swear; to pledge
Words.Example: I sumpah, I never see this person before in my life.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sungai from malay sungai river
Words.Definition: a river; a large stream

Words.English Translation: → Malay / indonesian: sup from malay / indonesian sup soup ← english soup liquid-based dish with water or stock and other ingredients or dutch soep soup ← french soupe soup
Words.Definition: (used in compounds) soup
Words.Example: In the wee hours of about 2 to 3 AM after work, Baharudeen cooked Tulang together with chilis and tomatoes for his own consumption. As you guessed it, this formed the early version of Sup Tulang.

Words.English Translation: → Malay / indonesian: sup buntut from malay / indonesian sup buntut oxtail soup ← malay / indonesian sup soup ← english soup liquid-based dish with water or stock and other ingredients or dutch soep soup ← french soupe soup + malay / indonesian / javanese buntut tail; rear end
Words.Definition: an Indonesian- and Malay-style oxtail soup made with beef tails, potatoes, mirepoix, shallots, garlic, and various other spices and ingredients
Words.Example: Try also the sup buntut (oxtail soup), which is thick and a little bit spicy ...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sup kambing from malay sup kambing mutton soup ← malay sup soup + malay kambing goat; mutton
Words.Definition: a soup of mutton (usually from goat) cubes boiled in a rich, oily broth of several spices including cumin, turmeric, fennel, curry powder, and coriander. It is often topped with fried shallots and served with bread. It is believed to ultimately be inspired by Arab cuisine, though the version often associated with Indian Muslim eateries in Singapore and Malaysia (and which is the most common one found there) has several original innovations and ingredients, and has diverged significantly from the original dish. It is commonly eaten in Malay and related cultures throughout Nusantara.
Words.Example: 'I remember. Oh, that sup kambing.' Prakesh rolled his eyes. 'That soup was magic. It’s from a secret recipe. No ordinary human knows what goes into it!'

Words.Word: sup sup sui 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 湿湿碎 濕濕碎 jyutping: sap1 sap1 seoi3 from cantonese (jyutping) 湿湿碎 濕濕碎 sap1 sap1 seoi3 (metaphor) trivial; no big deal; easy-peasy
Words.Definition: (metaphor) trivial; no big deal; easy-peasy
Words.Example: I leaned in for a closer look. “Aiya! I’ve never seen anyone do that.”Po-Po beamed, trying and failing to appear humble and surprised. “Sup sup sui la” …

Words.English Translation: → Malay: sup tulang from malay sup tulang mutton (sometimes beef) bone soup ← malay sup soup + malay tulang bone
Words.Definition: a soup of mutton bone stewed in a rich, often bright red stew of tomatoes, chilli, garlic, ginger, mutton stock, and other ingredients and spices. It can be eaten with the hands, and a straw is sometimes used to slurp out the bone marrow, which is often considered the centrepiece of the dish itself. Some experienced diners may knock the marrow out without the aid of a straw.It originated in Indian Muslim cuisine — specifically invented in the 1950s or 1960s by either Baharudeen or Abdul Kadir, hawkers who wanted to find a use for the leftover mutton bones they had after making dishes such as sup kambing, which often still had a good amount of meat left on them.[1][2]
Words.Example: 'Ask a random person on the street about dishes invented in Singapore, and you’ll get a mix of answers, from Chili Crab and Fish Head Curry to Yu Sheng. … But most people won’t know that Sup Tulang or Sup Tulang Merah was invented in Singapore.

Words.English Translation: → English: super + Singlish: white horse from english super very; extremely; extraordinarily ← latin super- over; above; beyond + singlish white horse (mil.) soldier whose parents or family are from a highly wealthy or influential background, and who is usually given preferential treatment
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier whose parents or family are from an extraordinarily wealthy or influential background. Such soldiers are usually given more preferential treatment and privilege than even a white horse.
Words.Example: Tonight swim by milo boy ....Then jitao play black and white see who the sway one to get this super white horse

Words.Definition: 'are you certain?'; used to express doubt or questioning

Words.English Translation: → English: sure from english sure certain; certainly ← old french seür sure; certain ← latin sēcūrus carefree; unconcerned
Words.Definition: 'are you certain?'; used to express doubt or questioning

Words.English Translation: → Malay: susah from malay susah difficult

Words.Definition: (derogatory) a Japanese girl or woman; a woman of Japanese nationality, ethnicity, etc.
Words.Example: Sushi bu cannot be wife, they are not expected to work and earn money ... So you gonna prepare to one man carry the whole family.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: susu from malay susu milk; breast
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) with milk (as opposed to the default condensed milk)

Words.Definition: beautiful, good-looking

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 媠 poj: súi + Min nan: 查某 poj: cha-bó͘ from hokkien (poj) 媠 súi beautiful; good-looking + min nan (poj) 查某 cha-bó͘ girl; woman

Words.Example: Wah, hear say there can meet a lot of chais.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 媠 poj: súi + 菜 poj: chhài + English: butterfly from hokkien (poj) 媠 súi beautiful; good-looking + hokkien (poj) 菜 chhài vegetable, (slang) attractive girl or woman ← cantonese (jyutping) 菜 coi3 vegetable, (slang) girlfriend; attractive girl or woman + english butterfly usu. colourful flying insect in the order Lepidoptera
Words.Definition: 'beautiful'; 'awesome'; 'nice!'
Words.Example: Today sibei good day for me. go out with wife tio kan cos keep betting, cant focus with her ... 5 win in a row. swee chai butterfly wee u wee ... HUAT lah!!

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: super white horse from singlish super white horse (mil.) soldier whose parents or family are from an extraordinarily wealthy or influential background, and who is usually given preferential treatment ← english super very; extremely; extraordinarily + singlish white horse (mil.) soldier whose parents or family are from a highly wealthy or influential background, and who is usually given preferential treatment
Words.Definition: (military) abbreviation of super white horse.
Words.Example: Think they are considered SWH. Should also be under their medical records as well for the MO to see.

Words.Definition: to stop caring about something; to stop paying attention to something; to lose interest

Words.English Translation: → English: switch on from english switch on turn sth. on, esp. e.g. of a device; (inf.) excite; get excited; become extremely focused, attentive, and mentally engaged ← english switch change from one state to another + english on enabled; operating; powered

Words.English Translation: → English: T-Rex from english T-Rex large carnivorous dinosaur ← translingual Tyrannosaurus rex large carnivorous dinosaur ← translingual Tyrannosaurus genus of dinosaurs in the family Tyrannosauridae ← ancient greek τῠ́ρᾰννος túrannos tyrant; despot; absolute ruler + ancient greek σαῦρος saûros lizard + latin rēx king; ruler; tyrant
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) iced, with a scoop of ice cream or dollop of whipped cream, and topped with a scoop of the drink’s (usually Milo or Horlicks) powder. Equivalent to a dinosaur with the addition of the cream or ice cream.

Words.English Translation: → Min: 焦 ta from min 焦 ta dry; (Hk.) 'cheers'

Words.English Translation: → English: tackle from english tackle confront or deal with a problem; bring someone forcefully to the ground ← middle dutch / middle low german takel ship's rigging
Words.Definition: to pursue romantically; to chase after; to woo
Words.Example: Taxi-driver Yap Chin Guan believes music is the best way to a woman's heart. "Singing is the oldest, most effective and productive way to tackle girls," asserted the 37-year-old ...

Words.English Translation: → English: tactical + movement from english tactical carefully planned to achieve some goal; strategic ← new latin tactica tactic ← ancient greek τακτικός taktikós fit for ordering; tactician; tactic + english movement motion in physical space ← old french movement movement; motion
Words.Definition: (military) behaviours or actions blatantly performed by a soldier to make themself look good to their superiors

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tahan from malay tahan endure; bear with; persist; tolerate
Words.Definition: to endure; to bear with; to tolerate

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tahi lalat from malay tahi lalat mole; dark lesion on the skin ← malay tahi feces; droppings; excrement + malay lalat fly (insect)
