Words.Example: ... let me hasten to explain that tahi in Bahasa is not as crude as its equivalent in English. A charming mole on a girl's face, for example, is called tahi lalat manis ...

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 太极拳 太極拳 pinyin: tài jí quán from mandarin (pinyin) 太极拳 太極拳 tài jí quán ancient Chinese martial art, now usu. softened and practiced as a form of exercise ← mandarin (pinyin) 太极 太極 tài jí Chinese philosophical concept of the 'great cosmological absolute' + mandarin (pinyin) 拳 拳 quán fist; boxing (martial arts)
Words.Definition: to pass off undesired work to another colleague
Words.Example: it's everywhere, in some cases, the more senior your colleagues are, the more tai chi you will see.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hakka: 癞𰣻 癩𰣻 poj: thái-ko from min nan / hakka (poj) 癞𰣻 癩𰣻 thái-ko leprosy; unclean; filthy
Words.Definition: extremely lucky
Words.Example: I can't believe he nailed that shot in one try. So tai ko.

Words.English Translation: → General chinese: 太太 pinyin: tài tai from general chinese (pinyin) 太太 tài tai Mrs; Madam; wife
Words.Definition: a married woman, often middle- to upper-class, who does not work but instead spends her time on leisure activities, shopping, and socializing with friends

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tak from malay tak not ✂ malay tidak not
Words.Definition: (used in compounds) not
Words.Example: I talk singlish in Australia, other singaporean bo hew me leh, say i tak atas :( only angmoh xiao mei mei find it cute....

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tak + boleh from malay tak not ✂ malay tidak not + malay boleh can; able to; may
Words.Definition: to be unable to; cannot

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tak + boleh + tahan from malay tak not ✂ malay tidak not + malay boleh can; able to; may + malay tahan endure; bear with; persist; tolerate
Words.Definition: to be unable to withstand any longer; cannot tolerate
Words.Example: Though the cities weren’t as clean as Singapore, … The climate was less oppressive, cooler. “Now back here, tak boleh tahan the heat and humidity. Can’t take it, so hot!”

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tak + jalan from malay tak not; does not ✂ malay tidak not; does not + malay jalan walk; go; way, (fig.) progress
Words.Definition: (of ideas, suggestions, comments etc.) to be ignored; to get turned down; to get rejected
Words.Example: No wonder he is so frustrated at work — all his good ideas tak jalan because the bosses see him as some inexperienced sin jiao.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tak laku from malay tak laku unwanted ← malay tak not ✂ malay tidak not + malay laku marketable; sellable
Words.Definition: (of a person) unwanted; undesired
Words.Example: Face already quite ugly. Then worse got Karen attitude. This kind is super tak laku, men siam far far one.

Words.English Translation: → English: take from english take receive sth. given; get
Words.Definition: (military, transitive) to accept or receive a specified number of extra2 duties as punishment
Words.Example: Siva had to take three after he forgot to turn up for his weekend COS duty. Damn suay bro.

Words.English Translation: → English: take cover from english take cover seek shelter or protection ← english take go to; assume + english cover (mil.) obstacle providing protection from enemy fire ← old french covrir cover ← latin cooperīre cover; clothe
Words.Definition: (military, idiom, intransitive) to avoid work; to avoid one’s superiors; to shirk or hide from one’s duties
Words.Example: Better take cover before we kena arrowed by Oliver for his new saikang project.

Words.English Translation: → English: take out from english take out remove, esp. from swh. or sth. ← english take remove; get in one's hands + english out away; out of one’s possession; aspect marker
Words.Definition: remove; take off, especially something worn on the body
Words.Example: haha my friend asked me," eh, your helmet got aircon ah? why never take out? " ... coz i was just plain lazy to take it off when going fr a smoke. =p

Words.English Translation: → English: take one’s time from english take one’s time go about sth. at one’s own pace; do without hurry
Words.Definition: (military, sarcastic) used to chide someone who is doing something slowly and unhurriedly, when they ought to be taking it its exigency, efficiency, and urgency seriously

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / hakka: 讲三讲四 講三講四 jyutping: gong2 saam1 gong2 sei3 from cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 讲三讲四 講三講四 gong2 saam1 gong2 sei3 gossip; criticize; badmouth ← cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 讲 講 gong2 talk; say + cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 三 三 saam1 three + cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 讲 講 gong2 talk; say + cantonese / hakka (jyutping) 四 四 sei3 four
Words.Definition: to talk nonsense; to chatter idly away
Words.Example: Don't talk three talk four. By all means, walk your talk laa, if you got balls.
Related: ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.English Translation: → English: talk + cock ↻ Hokkien: 讲鸟话 講鳥話 poj: kóng chiáu-ōe from english talk say; speak + english cock male bird, esp. chicken; penis ↻ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu-ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu-ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language
Words.Definition: to talk rubbish; to spout nonsense
Words.Example: "Don’t talk cock," Aunt Pandora retorted. "Some fool girl’s been getting at you again."
Related: talk cock sing song play ping pong
ka ki kong, ka ki song

Words.Word: talk cock sing song 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: talk cock + English: sing + song from singlish talk cock talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ↻ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language + english sing produce harmonious or musical vocalizations + english song piece of music
Words.Definition: to speak idle drivel; to engage in aimless chit-chat
Words.Example: As with any communication platform, spam is inevitable, too. Someone just added me to "The Talk Cock Sing Song Play Ping Pong Wave" with 69 other people — which has me clamouring for the Mute and Trash button.
Related: talk cock sing song play ping pong

Words.Word: talk cock sing song play ping pong 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: talk cock sing song + English: play + ping pong from singlish talk cock sing song talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ← singlish talk cock talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ↻ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language + english sing produce harmonious or musical vocalizations + english song piece of music + english play do sth. to have fun + english ping pong (onom.) table tennis
Words.Definition: to speak idle drivel; to engage in aimless chit-chat
Words.Example: As with any communication platform, spam is inevitable, too. Someone just added me to "The Talk Cock Sing Song Play Ping Pong Wave" with 69 other people — which has me clamouring for the Mute and Trash button.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tambah from malay tambah add
Words.Definition: to add
Words.Example: I always tambah egg to my nasi lemak for a little bit more protein.

Words.Word: Tan Ah Kao 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 陈阿九 陳阿九 poj: tân a-káu from hokkien (poj) 陈阿九 陳阿九 tân a-káu stereotypically common Hokkien male name ← hokkien (poj) 陈 陳 tân stereotypically common Hokkien surname + hokkien (poj) 阿九 阿九 a-káu stereotypically common Hokkien male given name or nickname
Words.Definition: a stereotypically common Hokkien name, used as a substitute for an anonymous Hokkien or other Singaporean Chinese person; a John Doe; a Tom, Dick, or Harry
Words.Example: We can't just hire any Tan Ah Kow; we need someone who actually has the technical know-how.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 等久久 poj: tán-kú-kú from hokkien (poj) 等久久 tán-kú-kú used to exp. that sth. has a very low chance of happening; 'in your dreams'; 'not in a million years' ← hokkien (poj) 等 tán wait + hokkien (poj) 久久 kú-kú ages; for a long time ⇇ hokkien (poj) 久 kú (of time) long
Words.Definition: used to express that something has a very low chance of happening, and that hoping upon it is a futile endeavour; 'in your dreams'; 'not in a million years'
Words.Example: "I was told, 'Why you so stupid? If Singapore wants your son to swim for them, they should pay.' I said, 'Tan ku ku' ... That's why I keep telling everybody, if you feel your son or daughter has it, it's up to you whether you want to support them. If you're going to wait for people, don't do it, okay?"

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 冬粉 poj: tang-hún from hokkien (poj) 冬粉 tang-hún transparent noodles made from starch
Words.Definition: transparent noodles made from starch, such as green bean or potato starch
Words.Example: Add in the tang hoon. Lower the heat and allow to simmer, until the water has almost evaporated and the tang hoon is soft.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: 童乩 poj: tâng-ki from hokkien / teochew (poj) 童乩 tâng-ki spirit medium ← min nan (poj) 童 tâng child + min nan (poj) 乩 ki divine; divination
Words.Definition: a spirit medium, often associated with Taoism and Chinese folk religion
Words.Example: ... a tang-ki must have a quick mind as well as a keen understanding of human motivation. Most tang-ki recommend medical help for obvious illness …

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 糖水 pinyin: táng shuǐ from mandarin (pinyin) 糖水 táng shuǐ sweet soupy dessert ← mandarin (pinyin) 糖 táng sugar + mandarin (pinyin) 水 shuǐ water; beverage
Words.Definition: alternative form of tong sui.

Words.English Translation: → Mandarin: 汤圆 湯圓 pinyin: tāng yuán from mandarin (pinyin) 汤圆 湯圓 tāng yuán glutinous rice balls; dessert of glutinous rice balls in sweet syrup ← mandarin (pinyin) 汤 湯 tāng soup + general chinese (pinyin) 圆 圓 yuán round; circular; ball
Words.Definition: Chinese boiled glutinous rice balls, often coloured in various colours, normally plain but sometimes filled with a filling such as sweetened crushed peanuts or tau sar
Words.Example: ... frozen tang yuan was so readily available that her family ate them for breakfast and supper.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tangkap from malay tangkap catch; arrest; capture
Words.Definition: to catch, especially in the midst of wrongdoing
Words.Example: trying to gey siao pull a fast one in the end tio tangkap

Words.English Translation: → English: tank from english tank armoured, self-propelled battle vehicle, (games) class whose role is to absorb damage ← english tank large container for storing liquids e.g. water ← portuguese tanque tank; cistern; reservoir ← general indian ṭanki tank; cistern; reservoir
Words.Definition: to endure; to bear with; to tolerate
Words.Example: Wah the professor voice macam giving lullaby sia ... I cannot tank liao.

Words.English Translation: → English: tank + -ie from english tank armoured, self-propelled battle vehicle ← english tank large container for storing liquids e.g. water ← portuguese tanque tank; cistern; reservoir ← general indian ṭanki tank; cistern; reservoir + english -ie dimin. suffix; (sometimes derog.) used to form a noun for a person associated with sth.
Words.Definition: (military) a soldier in a tank unit

Words.Word: tao gong gong 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 头怳怳 頭怳怳 poj: thâu-gông-gông from min nan (poj) 头怳怳 頭怳怳 thâu-gông-gông dizzy; giddy ← min nan (poj) 头 頭 thâu head + min nan (poj) 怳 怳 gông dizzy; giddy; dazed
Words.Definition: dizzy; giddy
Words.Example: Yalor sinkies always kena played merry-go-round until tao gong gong still duno what happened. Sibeh cham.

Words.English Translation: → Min: 头眩 頭眩 thâu-hîn from min 头眩 頭眩 thâu-hîn dizzy; giddy; vertiginous ← min 头 頭 thâu head + min 眩 眩 hîn dizzy; giddy; vertiginous
Words.Definition: dizzy; giddy; vertiginous
Words.Example: no wonder kopsy go rd n rd 6x tao hin liaos

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 丈夫 poj: ta/cha-po͘ from hokkien (poj) 丈夫 ta/cha-po͘ male person; man; husband
Words.Definition: a man or boy; a male person
Words.Example: In my experience, it's not so much whether one more than the other but the type of politics played. Ta por office politics deeper and more subtle, zha bor one more chor(loud), direct and some times bo liao.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / cantonese: 豆 poj: tāu from min nan / cantonese (poj) 豆 tāu bean; pea; soya bean
Words.Definition: (used in compounds) bean

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆酱 豆醬 poj: tāu-chiòⁿ/chiùⁿ from hokkien (poj) 豆酱 豆醬 tāu-chiòⁿ/chiùⁿ bean; pea; soya bean ← hokkien (poj) 豆 豆 tāu bean; soya bean + hokkien (poj) 酱 醬 chiòⁿ/chiùⁿ paste; fermented bean paste
Words.Definition: a fermented soya bean paste, used as an ingredient in dishes such as babi pongteh
Words.Example: It is also crucial that the ginger and garlic are fried until fragrant before the tau cheo is added ... the aim is to get a tasty soup with a hint of ginger and garlic counterbalanced by the taste of tau cheo.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 豆腐 jyutping: dau6 fu6 from cantonese (jyutping) 豆腐 dau6 fu6 tofu ← cantonese (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean; soya bean; pea + cantonese (jyutping) 腐 fu6 decayed; rotten; curd
Words.Definition: tofu

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 豆芽 poj: tāu-gê from min nan (poj) 豆芽 tāu-gê beansprout ← min nan (poj) 豆 tāu bean; soya bean + min nan (poj) 芽 gê sprout; shoot; bud
Words.Definition: beansprouts of the green bean, Vigna radiata (also known as 'mung bean' outside of Singapore), used as a culinary ingredient. Because they are so quick and easy to grow, they are often used as a model organism in science classes.
Words.Example: Using 2 tbsp butter and 1⁄2 cup oil, fry the bee hoon and taugeh.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 豆腐 poj: tāu-hū from min nan (poj) 豆腐 tāu-hū tofu ← min nan (poj) 豆 tāu bean; soya bean; pea + min nan (poj) 腐 hū decayed; rotten; curd
Words.Definition: tofu

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 豆花 poj: tāu-hoe from min nan (poj) 豆花 tāu-hoe soft dessert tofu ← min nan (poj) 豆 tāu bean; soya bean + min nan (poj) 花 hoe flower; essence
Words.Definition: a soft, silky tofu pudding, often sweetened with a sweet syrup such as honey or gula melaka and eaten as a dessert. It may be served hot or cold.
Words.Example: I grew up with “tau huay”, no matter breakfast or supper, slurping down the soft, silken, sweet beancurd, warms my stomach and brings great comfort to my soul.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 豆花水 poj: tāu-hoe-chúi from min nan (poj) 豆花水 tāu-hoe-chúi soya bean milk ← min nan (poj) 豆花 tāu-hoe soft dessert tofu + min nan (poj) 水 chúi water; drinks
Words.Definition: an opaque, creamy-white to white drink produced from soya beans. It is made by soaking the beans overnight, then grinding or blending them until smooth and boiling the mixture. The milk is then obtained by straining away the soya bean pulp, and is usually sweetened before serving. It is a popular traditional drink which has been enjoyed in Singapore for generations.
Words.Example: Alter egos like Lim Huat Bee the nerd and Lam Hin Kong the jock can forge an enduring freindship over a cup of tau huay chwee.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆枝 poj: tāu-ki from hokkien (poj) 豆枝 tāu-ki dried tofu skin ← hokkien (poj) 豆 tāu bean + hokkien (poj) 枝 ki branch; stick
Words.Definition: dried strips of tofu skin, used in Chinese cuisine
Words.Example: Tao Kee is a fantastic meat alternative, soaking up rich umami flavors from soy sauce and mushrooms in Chinese stocks.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 豆干 豆乾 poj: tāu-koaⁿ from min nan (poj) 豆干 豆乾 tāu-koaⁿ soft dessert tofu ← min nan (poj) 豆 豆 tāu bean; soya bean + min nan (poj) 干 乾 koaⁿ dry
Words.Definition: a very firm, dense form of tofu, usually with a tough, creamy-white or yellow outer skin. It is made by pressing tofu blocks to remove some of their water content. It is used when cooking with techniques such as stir-frying or stewing as it more easily holds its structure.
Words.Example: … tau kwa pao stuffed with tao gey and cucumber, grilled over small stoves filled with charcoal, and eaten with prawn paste and chili …

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 豆苗 jyutping: dau6 miu4 from cantonese (jyutping) 豆苗 dau6 miu4 pea sprouts ← cantonese (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean; pea + cantonese (jyutping) 苗 miu4 seeding; sprout; shoot
Words.Definition: sprouts of the snow pea (Pisum sativum), eaten as a vegetable in Cantonese and other cuisines
Words.Example: I wipe my bum with toile’ paper, I check carefully. Lass time got many pieces of baby dao mio. Before that, big-big lines of towgay … Means cannot digest baby dao mio or towgay. So I stop eating them, lah.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆皮 poj: tāu-phôe/phê from hokkien (poj) 豆皮 tāu-phôe/phê dried tofu skin ← hokkien (poj) 豆 tāu bean + hokkien (poj) 皮 phôe/phê skin
Words.Definition: dried strips of tofu skin, used in Chinese cuisine

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / min nan: 豆泡/卜 jyutping: dau6 pok1/bok1 from cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆泡/卜 dau6 pok1/bok1 deep-fried puffed tofu ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 泡 pok1/bok1 puffed; spongy
Words.Definition: a deep-fried puffed tofu with a spongy texture. It is popularly used in dishes with sauce, soup, or gravy which it can soak up, such as laksa and yong tau foo.
Words.Example: We eat bean curd puffs or taupok all the time, but seldom do we see it featured as the main "star" of the meal.

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / min nan: 豆沙 poj: dau6 saa1 from cantonese / min nan (poj) 豆沙 dau6 saa1 (red) bean paste ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean; pea + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 沙 saa1 sand; mushy; granular
Words.Definition: a paste made from red beans (Vigna angularis), usually sweetened and used as a filling in pastries or as a topping

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese / min nan: 豆沙包 poj: dau6 saa1 baau1 from cantonese / min nan (poj) 豆沙包 dau6 saa1 baau1 steamed red bean paste bun ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆沙 dau6 saa1 (red) bean paste ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean; pea + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 沙 saa1 sand; mushy; granular + general chinese (jyutping) 包 baau1 steamed bun
Words.Definition: a steamed bun (pau1) with a thick, fluffy, white skin filled with sweetened red bean (Vigna angularis) paste
Words.Example: In describing my teacher's face as a tau sar pau … I was trying to tell her just how beautiful she seemed to me, because, like the bun, her face was smooth and round and sweet. But sadly for me, my teacher misunderstood my good intentions …

Words.Word: tau sar piah 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆沙饼 豆沙餅 poj: tāu-sa-piáⁿ from hokkien (poj) 豆沙饼 豆沙餅 tāu-sa-piáⁿ flaky pastry with caked bean paste filling ← hokkien (poj) 豆沙 豆沙 tāu-sa bean paste ← hokkien (poj) 豆 豆 tāu bean; pea + hokkien (poj) 沙 沙 sa sand; mushy; granular + hokkien (poj) 饼 餅 piáⁿ pastry; cookie; biscuit
Words.Definition: a flaky round pastry filled with a paste made of green beans (Vigna radiata). The paste is produced by frying green bean paste until it is dry and caked, together with ingredients like shallots and shallot oil (for the savoury version) or sugar (for a sweet version). The pastries are usually puck-shaped and around 8 cm in diameter, but smaller, spherical versions sometimes known as 'tambun biscuits' are also popular. The snack originated from traditional Teochew cuisine.
Words.Example: Back then, each and every tau sar piah — which comprises six to seven layers of thin pastry layers to meet the benchmark of ultimate flakiness — was handmade. Each item took seven hours to make.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆爽 poj: tāu-soàn from hokkien (poj) 豆爽 tāu-soàn split green bean dessert soup ← teochew (peng'im) 豆爽 dau7 suang2 split green bean dessert soup ← teochew (peng'im) 豆 dau7 bean; pea + teochew (peng'im) 爽 suang2 (of food) crisp; refreshing, break
Words.Definition: a Teochew dessert made from split green beans boiled in a sugary syrup flavoured with pandan, often topped with bite-sized pieces of you char kueh

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 豆油 poj: tāu-iû from hokkien (poj) 豆油 tāu-iû soya sauce ← hokkien (poj) 豆 tāu bean; pea + hokkien (poj) 油 iû oil
Words.Definition: soya sauce

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tauhu + goreng from malay tauhu tofu ← hokkien (poj) 豆腐 tāu-hū tofu ← hokkien (poj) 豆 tāu bean; soya bean; pea + hokkien (poj) 腐 hū decayed; rotten; curd + malay goreng fry; fried
Words.Definition: a dish of fried tofu, usually a firmer kind like tau kwa, sliced into bite-sized cubes or triangular prisms and garnished with a salad of vegetables such as julienned carrots and cucumber, tau geh, etc. It is topped with a sauce, which may be based on kicap manis or peanuts. The form in which it exists today in Singapore has origins in Malay and Indonesian cuisine, and was developed at some point during their contact with Chinese cultures.
Words.Example: The satay (skewered meat), mee rebus (steamed vermicelli) and the tauhu goreng (fried bean cake) sellers made their rounds about the same time.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tau pok + English: -ed from singlish tau pok deep-fried puffed tofu, (slang) ragging practice of piling on to a target ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆泡/卜 dau6 pok1/bok1 deep-fried puffed tofu ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 泡 pok1/bok1 puffed; spongy + english -ed suffix used to form past tense or participle, or form a noun which is the subj. of a verb
Words.Definition: the target in a tau pok, a ragging or hazing ritual where said person is tackled to the ground and piled onto by others

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tau pok + English: -ee from singlish tau pok deep-fried puffed tofu, (slang) ragging practice of piling on to a target ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆泡/卜 dau6 pok1/bok1 deep-fried puffed tofu ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 泡 pok1/bok1 puffed; spongy + english -ee suffix used to denote sb. or sth. on which a verb is done
Words.Definition: the target in a tau pok, a ragging or hazing ritual where said person is tackled to the ground and piled onto by others
Words.Example: It is also the term used to describe the ragging that takes place during junior college orientation, where someone shouts “taupok!” and as many guys as possible will try to pile themselves on top of the target, or the taupokee.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tau pok + English: -er from singlish tau pok deep-fried puffed tofu, (slang) ragging practice of piling on to a target ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆泡/卜 dau6 pok1/bok1 deep-fried puffed tofu ← cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 豆 dau6 bean + cantonese / min nan (jyutping) 泡 pok1/bok1 puffed; spongy + english -er suffix used to denote a noun that does an action
Words.Definition: a participant in a tau pok, a ragging or hazing ritual where said person and others tackle a target to the ground and pile onto them

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: tauyu bak from baba malay tauyu bak dish of pork belly braised in soya sauce ← hokkien (poj) 豆油肉 tāu-iû-bah dish of pork belly braised in soya sauce ← hokkien (poj) 豆油 tāu-iû soya sauce ← hokkien (poj) 豆 tāu bean; pea + hokkien (poj) 油 iû oil + hokkien (poj) 肉 bah meat; pork
Words.Definition: a Peranakan dish of Hokkien origin, consisting of pork belly (or other fatty cuts of pork) braised or fried in a gravy of soya sauce (both light and dark) and spices such as garlic, star anise, pepper, cinnamon, etc. Additional ingredients such as hard-boiled eggs and tau kwa are often added as well.
Words.Example: Tau Yew Bak! Tow You Bak! Toyu Bak! (Oh dear, how do you anglicize or 'engli-pinyin' this?) … This dish has been blogged and 'reciped' to death. It can be found in just about any Nonya (almost synonymous with Singaporean) cookbook out there.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: talk cock sing song from singlish talk cock sing song talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ← singlish talk cock talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ↻ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language + english sing produce harmonious or musical vocalizations + english song piece of music
Words.Definition: abbreviation of talk cock sing song.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: talk cock sing song play ping pong from singlish talk cock sing song play ping pong talk rubbish; speak idle drivel; relax and while away the time ← singlish talk cock sing song talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ← singlish talk cock talk rubbish; speak idle drivel ↻ hokkien (poj) 讲鸟话 講鳥話 kóng chiáu ōe talk rubbish; spout nonsense ✂ hokkien (poj) 讲𡳞鸟话 講𡳞鳥話 kóng lān-chiáu ōe (vg.) talk rubbish; spout nonsense ← hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng speak; say; talk + hokkien (poj) 𡳞鸟 𡳞鳥 lān-chiáu (vg.) penis; cock + hokkien (poj) 话 話 ōe speech; words; language + english sing produce harmonious or musical vocalizations + english song piece of music + english play do sth. to have fun + english ping pong (onom.) table tennis
Words.Definition: abbreviation of talk cock sing song play ping pong.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 铁齿 鐵齒 poj: thih-khí from hokkien (poj) 铁齿 鐵齒 thih-khí stubborn; argumentative; obstinate ← hokkien (poj) 铁 鐵 thih iron ← hokkien (poj) 齿 齒 khí tooth
Words.Definition: (idiom) stubborn; argumentative; obstinate
Words.Example: If you are saying he high beam you on lane 1, then you are travelling too slow. Don't tee kee, go to the next lane.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 铁管 鐵管 poj: thih-kóng from hokkien (poj) 铁管 鐵管 thih-kóng empty tin or metal (lit. iron) can
Words.Definition: an empty tin can, such as one formerly used to hold condensed milk, which is reused as a drink container. Such a can normally has the lid still attached at one end with a hole poked through its centre, through which a raffia string is threaded to be used as a handle (to prevent having to hold the hot drink can directly).A drink can be ordered for takeaway in such a can by using the specifying adjective kong2.
Words.Example: To get it served in a condensed milk tin can, you will need to request it. ... In today’s era, it is a rarity to find coffee to be served in a ‘tee kong’.

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 铁脯 鐵脯 peng'im: tih4 bou2 from teochew (peng'im) 铁脯 鐵脯 tih4 bou2 dried and smoked flounder fish with bones ← teochew (peng'im) 铁 鐵 tih4 iron + teochew (peng'im) 脯 脯 bou2 dried meat
Words.Definition: air-dried and smoked flounder with bones, used as a key umami ingredient in authentic Teochew cuisine as well as dishes from other related cuisines
Words.Example: That was how tee po came about – sole fish bones are not thrown out but sun dried and smoked. The result, a slice of crispy dry fish bone that harbours all the oceanic umami and saltiness.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teguk from malay teguk gulp; sip; drink
Words.Definition: to drink copiously or excessively (especially alcohol)

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teguk + English: session from malay teguk gulp; sip; drink + english session period of time dedicated to an activity ← old french session session; sitting ← latin sessiō session; sitting
Words.Definition: an extended period or session of alcohol drinking

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 茶 poj: tê from hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea; drink made by infusing leaves of Camilla sinensis in water
Words.Definition: tea; a drink made by infusing leaves of Camilla sinensis in water
Words.Example: Lao uncle go teh nehneh also no scared, because cannot kena rotan.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 地牛 poj: tē-gû from hokkien (poj) 地牛 tē-gû Kaloula pulchra (banded bullfrog), (mythology) bull who lives underground and causes earthquakes when moving, (slang) hawker/sanitation inspector
Words.Definition: (historical) a sanitation inspector who conducted raids on and fined unlicensed hawkers

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teh + halia from malay teh tea ← hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea + malay halia ginger
Words.Definition: tea brewed or flavoured with ginger; ginger tea

Words.Word: teh lam pa chir sat 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 捏𡳞脬自杀 捏𡳞脬自殺 poj: tīⁿ/tēⁿ lām-pha chīr/chū-sat from hokkien (poj) 捏𡳞脬自杀 捏𡳞脬自殺 tīⁿ/tēⁿ lām-pha chīr/chū-sat (fig.) harshly self-criticize or self-flagellate over a mistake, (lit.) squeeze one's testicles until one kills oneself ← hokkien (poj) 捏 捏 tīⁿ/tēⁿ squeeze tightly; grasp; pinch; press + hokkien (poj) 𡳞脬 𡳞脬 lām-pha (vulgar) scrotum; ballsack; balls + hokkien (poj) 自杀 自殺 chīr/chū-sat commit suicide
Words.Definition: (idiom) to harshly criticize oneself or self-flagellate over a mistake, especially one particularly stupid, embarrassing, or causing one to lose face
Words.Example: When I found out that swee char bo I had been flirting with all night was my cousin, wah I tell you, want to teh lam pa chir sat already.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teh + serbat from malay teh tea ← hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea + malay serbat sweet drink made with water, ginger, sugar, etc.; sweet West and South Asian drink ← urdu شربت sharbat sweet West and South Asian drink from flower petals ← persian شربت šarbat sweet West and South Asian drink from flower petals ← arabic شَرْبَة šarba drink
Words.Definition: tea brewed or flavoured with ginger; ginger tea

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teh + tarik from malay teh tea ← hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea + malay tarik pull
Words.Definition: tea with milk and sugar that is frothed by pouring it back and forth between two mugs from a height, which causes the appearance of a stream of tea being “pulled” from the mugs. The action of “pulling” the tea is often done with much spectacle and flourish, which has helped popularise it as a novelty overseas in places such as Taiwan.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: teh + -cino from singlish teh tea ← hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea; drink made by infusing leaves of Camilla sinensis in water + singlish -cino made w. a base of milk, or condensed milk and water, w. the preceding drink layered on top ✂ italian cappuccino espresso coffee with steamed or frothed milk, so named due to dark brown colour resembling Capuchin monks' habits ← german Kapuziner Capuchin (monk of the Capuchin order) ← italian [frate] cappuccino Capuchin (monk of the Capuchin order) ← italian cappuccio hood; monk's cowl ← italian -ino suffix used to indicate a profession or form a diminutive
Words.Definition: a base of milk, or condensed milk and water, with sweetened black tea layered on top in a milk-tea ratio of around 1:1. The milk is usually frothed, with the resulting drink being similar in composition and texture to teh tarik; however, among other differences, teh-cino is often served with the layers of milk and tea not fully mixed.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tekan from malay tekan push; press; pressure
Words.Definition: to punish
Words.Example: ... instead of having to top up about S$100,000, we have to top up about S$200,000. We feel like the Government is trying to "tekan" (punish) us.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tekan + English: session from malay tekan push; press; pressure + english session period of time dedicated to an activity ← old french session session; sitting ← latin sessiō session; sitting
Words.Definition: (military) an extended period of punishment, heavy duty, or bullying inflicted upon a soldier or group of soldiers by a superior
Words.Example: Being “tekanned”, or bullied, was part and parcel of NS. Even the smallest thing could earn a recruit a tekan session.

Words.English Translation: → English: Telegram from english Telegram (brand name) phone messaging app ← english telegram message sent wirelessly using a telegraph ← english tele- at a distance ← ancient greek τῆλε têle far away; distant + english -gram sth. written, drawn, printed, etc. ← ancient greek γράμμα grámma sth. written or drawn; letter; writing
Words.Definition: Telegram, a popular instant messaging app
Words.Example: Chio sial… can give me her Tele?

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Hokkien: 贴 貼 poj: thiap or Possible, but not certain English: tarp from hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 贴 貼 thiap paste; stick; attached to or english Possible, but not certain tarp heavy waterproof sheet used as a cover, usually made of cloth
Words.Definition: (military) transparent plastic sheets which are used to wrap field maps for waterproofing, as well as pasted or overlain onto the maps so that markings or notes can be made without permanently marking the original map or the waterproofing layer

Words.English Translation: → Malay: temak from malay temak Shorea spp.
Words.Definition: any of various hardwood trees in the genus Shorea, popularly used for timber
Words.Example: Bukit Timah could have been named for a species of the tall rainforest tree, Temak, which the Europeans rendered wrongly as Timah, the Malay word for tin.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tembak from malay tembak shoot
Words.Definition: to guess or choose randomly out of a set of options

Words.English Translation: → Indonesian: tempe from indonesian tempe fermented soybean cake
Words.Definition: a fermented soybean cake, commonly used in Malay and Indonesian cuisine

Words.English Translation: → Malay / baba malay: tengik / tengek from malay / baba malay tengik / tengek rancid; (of oils or fats) rotten
Words.Definition: (especially of oils or fats) rancid; rotten
Words.Example: I do not want another bottle of Aramis shampoo (I use Fab), a face towel, tengek (rancid) butter cookies, a picture frame in pink shells ... I like gifts given with sincerity ...

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 潮州 peng'im: dio5 ziu1 from teochew (peng'im) 潮州 dio5 ziu1 Chaozhou, Guangdong, a prefecture in China ← teochew (peng'im) 潮 dio5 tide; wave; rising tide + teochew (peng'im) 州 ziu1 province; prefecture; state
Words.Definition: a widely-spoken Southern Min (Min Nan) language with several related dialects spoken by people from parts of Chaoshan (a region in Guangdong, China) and its diaspora, especially in maritime South-East Asia. It is closely related to other Min Nan languages, such as Hokkien.
Words.Example: I was entranced by the fluting and cascading Teochew inside. ... At the same time, I was an outsider because there was no music in my Teochew.

Words.English Translation: → Teochew: 潮州 peng'im: dio5 ziu1 + English: porridge from teochew (peng'im) 潮州 dio5 ziu1 Chaozhou, Guangdong, a prefecture in China ← teochew (peng'im) 潮 dio5 tide; wave; rising tide + teochew (peng'im) 州 ziu1 province; prefecture; state + english porridge dish of grains boiled in liquid (e.g. water) until thick ← english pottage thick stew of vegetables, grains, and other miscellaneous foods; oat porridge ← anglo-norman potage soup or stew cooked in a pot + english porray medieval leek pudding simmered with other vegetables in milk or broth ← old french poree leek; leek soup
Words.Definition: a thin rice congee typical of Teochew cuisine, typically flavoured with simple and savoury ingredients such as salted or preserved vegetables (kiam chye) or fish tee poh, tau pok in soya sauce, etc. It is eaten as a staple with other dishes, and is often seen as a simple, unglamourous, everyman's food.
Words.Example: News of Singapore Airlines introducing Teochew dishes across all cabin classes on Monday was eagerly lapped up by travellers ... passengers will get to enjoy dishes such as Teochew porridge, bak chor mee and braised duck with rice.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 猪跤 豬跤 poj: tir-kha from hokkien (poj) 猪跤 豬跤 tir-kha pork trotter; pig's foot ← hokkien (poj) 猪 豬 tir pig + hokkien (poj) 跤 跤 kha foot; leg
Words.Definition: a traditional Hokkien dish of a pork trotter braised in a rich soya-sauce-based gravy
Words.Example: We must have the “ter kah”, he drooled. Before we could say “pig's trotters in black sauce”, a claypot filled with the stuff arrived ... The ter kah was an instant favourite with us.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ter- from malay ter- prefix to indicate sth. accidental, sudden, perfective, etc.
Words.Definition: (humorous) used to form a passive verb implying an action is accidental or sudden

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ter- + Singlish: ji ba boom from malay ter- prefix used to form passive momentane (sudden), accidental, perfective, etc. aspects + singlish ji ba boom (onom.) sound of a large explosion
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic) the sound of a large explosion
Words.Example: Last time we pack the gunpowder in the badminton tiangThen lightThen terbaboomThen about 2 years don't have badminton court ... My family donate some money to RA to fix the tiang

Words.English Translation: → Malay: terbalik from malay terbalik upside-down; inverted ← malay ter- prefix used to form passive momentane (sudden), accidental, perfective, etc. aspects + malay balik return; behind; turn; back
Words.Definition: upside-down; inverted
Words.Example: And the commonest answers: “Aiyah, my number terbalik.” (The number was drawn in reverse or jumbled up).
Related: or ya peh ya som balik ah roti prata char kway teow
or ya peh ya som balik ah roti prata chai tow kway
or ya peh ya som balik ah

Words.English Translation: → English: terrible + incorrigible from english terrible horrible; extremely bad; awful; dreadful ← old french terrible terrible; terrifying ← latin terribilis terrifying; terrible; dreadful ← latin terreō fear; frighten; terrify + latin -ibilis -able; able to be + english incorrigible unable to be corrected or reformed; ← middle french incorrigible unpunished; not correctable ← latin incorrigibilis unable to be corrected ← latin in- un-; not + latin corrigere correct; reform; improve ← latin con- with; used to indicate completeness + latin regō control; govern; straighten + latin -ibilis -able; able to be
Words.Definition: terrible; extremely bad; awful; beyond correction; hopeless
Words.Example: Lexie Bean has tested and approved the cooling mats by @ohpopdog ! Keep your dogs cool during this Horrigible Heatwave.

Words.English Translation: → English: terror from english terror extreme fear; dread; sb. or sth. that brings about such dread ← old french terreur fear; terror; dread ← latin terror terror; fear; dread; panic
Words.Definition: undisciplined; rambunctious; rowdy; wild

Words.English Translation: → Malay: teruk from malay teruk severe; heavy; difficult
Words.Definition: severe; bad; heavy
Words.Example: When I kena dengue that time I could barely move out of bed. It was si peh teruk man.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: terus + mati from malay terus directly; straight away; immediately + malay mati die; dead
Words.Definition: to be screwed; to be done for; to be dead meat
Words.Example: Mt Trusmadi trail is steeper, more raw and considered tougher. Dubbed 'Terus Mati' by the local, it is truly a challenging trek and suited for the adventurous.
Related: you die, I die, everybody die

Words.English Translation: → English: techno from english techno style of electronic dance music featuring heavy bass, high tempo, and a repetitive beat ← english technology application of science, research, and design in developing machines, tools, mechanisms, etc. ← ancient greek τεχνολογία tekhnología systematic study of grammar
Words.Definition: techno, a style of electronic dance music featuring heavy bass, high tempo, and a repetitive beat
Words.Example: You can feeling the tetno beatMy bass tube sibei tua

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: தைப்பூசம் taipusam from tamil தைப்பூசம் taipusam ← tamil தை tai 10th month of the Tamil calendar + tamil பூசம் pusam nakshatra (constellation or zodiac sign) in Indian astrology, corresponding to γ, δ, and θ Cancri ← sanskrit पुष्य puṣya nakshatra (constellation or zodiac sign) in Indian astrology, corresponding to γ, δ, and θ Cancri
Words.Definition: a festival celebrated by Tamil Hindus during the month of Thai (the 10th month of the Tamil calendar, around January and February). It is most well known for the carrying of the kavadi, a large, often well-decorated frame which is lined with a hundred or so spears and needles which pierce the carrier’s skin. During the festival, public roads are often lined with solemn processions of devout Hindus bearing their kavadi. The festival and month is one of the most important of the year for Tamil Hindus, and is seen as a time for sombre repentance and purification of the body.
Words.Example: From 1973 to 2015, the playing of musical instruments on the streets during Thaipusam was banned due to fights that would occur between competing groups, which in turn, disrupted the procession.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 读册 讀冊 poj: tha̍k-chheh from hokkien (poj) 读册 讀冊 tha̍k-chheh read; study; go to school ← hokkien (poj) 读 讀 tha̍k read; study + hokkien (poj) 册 冊 chheh book; (cl.) books
Words.Definition: to read (a book)
Words.Example: But you're the one with the brains hor. You've always been. Got brains, then must study! ... Hor hor tak chek ... Don't waste your future on somebody like me, can or not?

Words.Word: thak cheh kia 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 读册 讀冊 poj: tha̍k-chheh + Min nan: 囝 poj: kiáⁿ from hokkien (poj) 读册 讀冊 tha̍k-chheh read; study; go to school ← hokkien (poj) 读 讀 tha̍k read; study + hokkien (poj) 册 冊 chheh book; (cl.) books + min nan (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ son; child; dimin. suffix
Words.Definition: a studious person; someone who studies hard
Words.Example: No lah... aiyah, he's not the same as us, lah. People tak chek kia.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 贪食 貪食 poj: tham-chia̍h from min nan (poj) 贪食 貪食 tham-chia̍h gluttonous; having an insatiable appetite ← min nan (poj) 贪 貪 tham greedy; fond of; insatiable + min nan (poj) 食 食 chia̍h eat; food
Words.Definition: gluttonous; having an insatiable appetite

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: தம்பி tampi from tamil தம்பி tampi younger brother; term of endearment for a younger male person
Words.Definition: term of address or endearment for a young male person or a male person slightly younger than oneself

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 趁食 poj: thàn-chia̍h from hokkien (poj) 趁食 thàn-chia̍h earn money however one can to survive, (euph.) prostitute oneself ← hokkien (poj) 趁 thàn earn (money) + hokkien (poj) 食 chia̍h food; eat
Words.Definition: to earn a living however one can; to work just to feed oneself and survive

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 趁食 poj: thàn-chia̍h + 兵 poj: peng from hokkien (poj) 趁食 thàn-chia̍h earn money however one can to survive, (euph.) prostitute oneself ← hokkien (poj) 趁 thàn earn (money) + hokkien (poj) 食 chia̍h food; eat + hokkien (poj) 兵 peng soldier; army
Words.Definition: (military, derogatory) a soldier who signed on to the army solely to earn a living and survive, especially if they had no other choice
Words.Example: After his second conviction for drug possession, Syafik had nowhere else to turn to but to become a than chiak peng.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: தங்கச்சி taṅkacci from tamil தங்கச்சி taṅkacci younger sister
Words.Definition: younger sister; term of address or endearment for a younger sister

Words.English Translation: → English: thank you from english thank you polite expression of gratitude or appreciation ← english thank express gratitude or appreciation + english you 2p. sing. & pl. pronoun
Words.Definition: polite expression of gratitude or appreciation
Words.Example: Na, I got for you the seafood bee hoon, no tau geh, right anot?- Orh, tioh. Thank yout.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: தண்ணி taṇṇi from tamil தண்ணி taṇṇi water; (slang) alcoholic drink ← tamil தண்ணீர் taṇṇīr water ← tamil தண் taṇ cool; cold + tamil நீர் nīr water
Words.Definition: to drink, especially an alcoholic beverage
Words.Example: Thanni on my mind 'cause she got thirstI'ma pull up with some fresh Jilebi just for her

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 踢球 poj: that-kiû from min nan (poj) 踢球 that-kiû kick a ball; play football or soccer ← min nan (poj) 踢 that kick + min nan (poj) 球 kiû ball
Words.Definition: Milo, a malted chocolate-flavoured drink

Words.English Translation: → English: that’s why from english that’s why used to introduce or emphasise an explanation ← english that used to indicate sth. further from the speaker than 'this' + english is 3p. sing. present of ‘be’ + english why for what reason
Words.Definition: used in response to something said that one agrees with; ‘precisely!’; ‘exactly!’; ‘I know, right?’; ‘that’s what I’m saying’
Words.Example: - Wah piang, this match damn boring one sia.- That’s why.

Words.English Translation: → English: then from english then next; afterwards; in that case
Words.Definition: (rude, rhetorical) 'so what?'; used in reply to a statement the speaker feels is irrelevant, unhelpful, unimportant, nonsensical, etc.
Words.Example: Then? My problem ah?

Words.English Translation: → English: then + you + know from english then after; followingly; later + english you 2p. s. & p. pronoun + english know understand; be cognizant of; comprehend
Words.Definition: used to caution someone against a course of action (or inaction) in light of the possible and/or likely consequences
Words.Example: Always so last minute go airport one… Later the plane leave without you, then you know.

Words.Word: theory zuay zuay 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: theory + Hokkien: 济济 濟濟 poj: chōe-chōe from english theory hypothesis (formally, sup. by evidence, experiment, etc.) ← middle french théorie theory ← latin theoria theory; speculation ← ancient greek θεωρῐ́ᾱ theōríā theory; speculation; viewing + hokkien (poj) 济济 濟濟 chōe-chōe many; much; a lot
Words.Definition: used to characterize highly abstract or academic suggestions that might not be the most practical or pragmatic; used to criticize plans that sound sophisticated but cannot get the job done
Words.Example: My new boss is a scholar just come back from Cambridge. He theory zuay zuay but simple thing orso cannot make it.

Words.English Translation: → English: there from english there distinct or indicated location not near to the speaker
Words.Definition: 'you see?'; 'I told you so'; used to demonstrate to the listener that something the speaker had talked about or predicted has been validated
Words.Example: There?! Is inside here the whole time what!

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 听 聽 poj: thiaⁿ + 无 無 poj: bô from hokkien (poj) 听 聽 thiaⁿ hear + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô no; not; don't
Words.Definition: to not understand; to be unable to comprehend
Words.Example: Ha? Louder leh. My side damn noisy, thia bo.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 听讲 聽講 poj: thiaⁿ-kóng from hokkien (poj) 听讲 聽講 thiaⁿ-kóng hear it said of something; hear stories or rumours of ← hokkien (poj) 听 聽 thiaⁿ hear; listen + hokkien (poj) 讲 講 kóng say; speak; talk
Words.Definition: to hear it said of something; to hear stories or rumours of
Words.Example: Cannot anyhow “tia gong” in parliament, liddat any coffee shop uncle also can be MP.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 汤 湯 poj: thng from min nan (poj) 汤 湯 thng soup
Words.Definition: (of food, usually noodles) with soup served as part of the main dish instead of on the side

Words.English Translation: → English: marathon from english marathon race of 42.195 km, (fig.) prolonged or sustained activity ← french marathon marathon (coined for the 1896 Olympics in Athens) ← ancient greek Μᾰρᾰθών Marathṓn town in Attica, Greece ← ancient greek μᾰ́ρᾰθον márathon fennel
Words.Definition: to stay up all night; to pull an all-nighter; to elucubrate
Words.Example: I thon to chiong my tutorial homework while Darcy and her chiongster clique thon at the club three nights a week. Some courses really not the same.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 涂虱 塗蝨 poj: thô͘-sat from hokkien (poj) 涂虱 塗蝨 thô͘-sat small catfish ← hokkien (poj) 涂 塗 thô͘ mud; earth + hokkien (poj) 虱 蝨 sat louse; flea
Words.Definition: Clarias batrachus (also known as the walking catfish), a freshwater airbreathing catfish native to Southeast Asia which can grow up to 0.5 m in length. It is common as both a feeder species in the aquarium trade (when young), and as a food species (when grown).

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: தோசை tōcai from tamil தோசை tōcai thin, spongy, South Indian crepe ← tamil தோய் tōy soak; curdle; mix
Words.Definition: a thin, spongy, South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil flour mixed with water

Words.English Translation: → English: three-star general + stripe from english three-star general (mil.) lieutenant general (due to their rank insignia of three stars), the highest rank in the Singaporean military + english stripe straight bar of a colour on a background of another colour
Words.Definition: (military) a sergeant who behaves self-importantly and arrogantly, as if they were of a much higher rank
Words.Example: BMT is full of three-stripe generals who cmi in SCS.

Words.English Translation: → English: throw + letter from english throw toss; hurl; discard + english letter written or printed missive ← old french letre letter (printed character) ← latin littera letter (printed character) or piece of writing
Words.Definition: (idiom) to resign; to quit; to break a job contract
Words.Example: I complain to boss already he still keep anyhow arrow me work, tomorrow I throw letter then he know.

Words.English Translation: → English: throw + paper from english throw toss; hurl; discard + english paper sheet made of pulp or fibres, esp. used for writing and printing on
Words.Definition: to resign; to quit; to break a job contract

Words.Word: thunder tea rice 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → English: thunder + tea + rice ↻ Mandarin: 擂茶饭 擂茶飯 pinyin: léi chá fàn + General chinese: 雷 pinyin: léi from english thunder loud sound caused by lightning + english tea drink made by infusing leaves of Camilla sinensis in water ← dutch tee tea ← hokkien (poj) 茶 tê tea + english rice edible seeds, used as a food grain, of the Oryza sativa cereal crop ↻ mandarin (pinyin) 擂茶饭 擂茶飯 léi chá fàn ground tea rice (Hakka dish) ← hakka (pfs) 擂茶饭 擂茶飯 lùi-chhà-fan ground tea rice (Hakka dish) ← hakka (pfs) 擂茶 擂茶 lùi-chhà ground tea (Hakka ingredient made of tea, grains, herbs, and other ingredients ground into a powder ← hakka (pfs) 擂 擂 lùi grind + hakka (pfs) 茶 茶 chhà tea + hakka (pfs) 饭 飯 fan rice + general chinese (pinyin) 雷 léi thunder; lightning
Words.Definition: a Hakka dish made of ground tea powder (tea leaves ground with herbs, seeds, grains etc. into a fine powder) cooked together with rice

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: auntie from singlish auntie aunt; respectful term of address for a woman of an older generation than the speaker, regardless of relation ← english auntie dimin. of aunt (female relative of the same generation as one's parent) ↻ asian languages "auntie" equivalent of 'auntie' in various languages and cultures; woman of older generation than oneself
Words.Definition: short form for auntie
Words.Example: Ti Nya and Ti Guek would always bring a selection of delicious, homemade kueh when they came to visit.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 猪哥 豬哥 poj: ti-ko from hokkien (poj) 猪哥 豬哥 ti-ko pervert; lecher; perverted ← hokkien (poj) 猪 豬 ti pig + hokkien (poj) 哥 哥 ko elder brother
Words.Definition: a pervert; a lecher
Words.Example: .....wow...many tiko uncles kena questioned by spf when caught visiting 'happy ending' massage parlours at parklane mall..... [sic]

Words.Word: ti ko pek 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 猪哥伯 豬哥伯 poj: ti-ko-pek from hokkien (poj) 猪哥伯 豬哥伯 ti-ko-pek pervert; lecher; perverted ← hokkien (poj) 猪哥 豬哥 ti-ko pervert; lecher; perverted + hokkien (poj) 伯 伯 pek uncle
Words.Definition: a pervert; a lecher
Words.Example: His look already so 'ti ko pek', wonder why in the first the panel of interviewers granted his scholarship years ago.This panel of interviewers didn't have long term vision.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 点 點 poj: tiám from hokkien (poj) 点 點 tiám dot; point; drop
Words.Definition: a tattoo worn by gangsters and members of Chinese secret societies in Singapore, usually in the form of a number of dots on the hands and/or the forehead
Words.Example: Members of this secret society often tattoo lines of dots called 'tiam' in Hokkien on their foreheads or even five dots on each knuckle on their fingers to identify themselves as 'fighters'.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hainanese: 谁 誰 poj: tiâng from min nan / hainanese (poj) 谁 誰 tiâng who ← min nan / hainanese (poj) 底侬/底人 底儂/底人 tī-lâng who ← min 底 底 tī what + min 侬/人 儂/人 lâng person
Words.Definition: who; whom; what person

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hainanese: 谁 誰 poj: tiâng + Hokkien / teochew: 敲 poj: khà from min nan / hainanese (poj) 谁 誰 tiâng who ← min nan / hainanese (poj) 底侬/底人 底儂/底人 tī-lâng who ← min 底 底 tī what + min 侬/人 儂/人 lâng person + hokkien / teochew (poj) 敲 khà call (by phone, pager, etc.); knock; hit
Words.Definition: 'who called?'

Words.Word: tiang kha pager 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hainanese: 谁 誰 poj: tiâng + Hokkien: 敲 poj: khà + English: pager from min nan / hainanese (poj) 谁 誰 tiâng who ← min nan / hainanese (poj) 底侬/底人 底儂/底人 tī-lâng who ← min 底 底 tī what + min 侬/人 儂/人 lâng person + hokkien (poj) 敲 khà call (by phone, pager, etc.); knock; hit + english pager wireless electronic device used to receive and display messages ← english page call; contact; summon; young servant or attendant ← old french page young attendant ← late latin pagius servant + english -er suffix used to form a noun which performs the action of the root verb
Words.Definition: (dated) 'who paged me?'; 'who tried to contact me?'
Words.Example: 'Tiang kah pager?' ... "Pager" is a 50-minute one-man performance about a salesman Peter, who is "chained" to his pager and handphone.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 吊白仁 poj: tiàu-pe̍h-lîn from hokkien (poj) 吊白仁 tiàu-pe̍h-lîn to roll one's eyes ← hokkien (poj) 吊 tiàu hang + hokkien (poj) 白仁 pe̍h-lîn sclera; white of the eye
Words.Definition: used to verbally indicate rolling one's eyes, e.g. in response to a situation that one finds ridiculous or where one is at a loss for words

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 吊水 poj: tiàu-chúi from hokkien (poj) 吊水 tiàu-chúi draw water; have an IV ← hokkien (poj) 吊 tiàu hang; lift w. a rope + hokkien (poj) 水 chúi water
Words.Definition: (metaphor) to call for reinforcements, especially during a gang fight

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 钓鱼 釣魚 poj: tiò/tiàu-hîr/hî/hû from hokkien (poj) 钓鱼 釣魚 tiò/tiàu-hîr/hî/hû to fish
Words.Definition: (drink ordering) tea, usually Chinese tea, made with a teabag (instead of tea dust, which is the default way tea is made at a drink stall)
Words.Example: The uncle preferred the taste of tio he to teh, and had it daily at the kopitiam downstairs.

Words.English Translation: → Possible, but not certain Hokkien: 肇囝 poj: tiāu-kiáⁿ from hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 肇囝 tiāu-kiáⁿ have a baby ← hokkien (poj) Possible, but not certain 肇 tiāu cause; begin + hokkien (poj) 囝 kiáⁿ child; son; kid
Words.Definition: to have a baby, usually with the implication of being a shotgun or unplanned pregnancy
Words.Example: Her son gong gong dai dai face, 17 yr old full leg ang kong and diao kia liao ...

Words.English Translation: → English: tiger + ear + biscuit from english tiger Panthera tigris, a large predatory feline ← latin tigris tiger ← ancient greek τῐ́γρῐς tĭ́grĭs tiger + english ear organ used to hear and collect sounds + english biscuit small baked item; cookie ← old french bescuit twice-baked bread ← latin biscoctus twice-cooked ← latin bis twice; two times + latin coctus cook
Words.Definition: a cookie with a sweet and savoury, usually orange- or brown-coloured icing flavoured with sugar, ginger, five spice powder, salt, and other spices laid in a characteristic spiral pattern. The icing may be inlaid or overlaid. It is similar in appearance to a pinwheel cookie, and is said to resemble an ear.

Words.English Translation: → English: Thai + girl + show + tiger from english Thai of or relating to Thailand ← thai ไทย tai person; human being; Thai person; Thailand; Thai + english girl young female human + english show exhibition; entertainment event or program + english tiger Panthera tigris, a large predatory feline ← latin tigris tiger ← ancient greek τῐ́γρῐς tĭ́grĭs tiger
Words.Definition: any live performance in front of an audience featuring an explicit sexual act, often associated with Thailand's infamous sex tourism industry
Words.Example: On one night, they took us to an excursion to a red-light district in Johor Road and encouraged us to watch a tiger show, which some of us goody two shows sheepishly declined.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tikam from malay tikam stab, (slang) randomly choose
Words.Definition: a lottery-like game sometimes found at sarabat stalls, pasar malams, and fun fairs where players pay to pick a ticket from a decorated display of tickets. Winning tickets usually entitle the player to prizes such as drinks, toys, or snacks.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tikam-tikam from malay tikam-tikam stabs, (slang) randomly choose ← malay tikam stab, (slang) randomly choose
Words.Definition: to randomly choose out of a set of options

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tikus from malay tikus mouse; rat
Words.Definition: a mouse or rat
Words.Example: Jiuhu restoran got tikus...

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tilam from malay tilam mattress
Words.Definition: a mattress
Words.Example: Best to sleep lying down back on the tilam face upwards ... Dun sleep lying down on ur side, especially ass facing his direction.

Words.English Translation: → English: times + × from english times multiplied by ← english time occurrence of sth. + english × mathematical symbol for 'times' (no. of occurrecnces of sth.)
Words.Definition: (after a numerical quantity) general measure word for listed quantities; used to indicate discrete amounts of items, objects, people, etc.
Words.Example: Gennermen, last night got one time joker try to play phone after lights out, thought I won't catch. Now he can OTOT enjoy playing phone in camp all he wants when he is serve his three times extra.
Related: confirm plus guarantee times 2 with 3 year warranty

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien / teochew: * poj: ti-bun/mun & Malay: timun from hokkien / teochew (poj) * ti-bun/mun cucumber ← malay timun cucumber & malay timun cucumber
Words.Definition: cucumber
Words.Example: why satay bo tibun or bawang or ketupat

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 镇块 鎮塊 poj: tìn-tèr/tè from min nan (poj) 镇块 鎮塊 tìn-tèr/tè taking up space; blocking the way; hindering ← min nan (poj) 镇 鎮 tìn block; hinder + min nan (poj) 块 塊 tèr/tè piece; chunk
Words.Definition: taking up or wasting space; blocking the way; hindering
Words.Example: The other day, my Singlish-impaired Singaporean friend asked me what is “‘tin teh'” ... And i replied that it means “zor teng”. Then me and my other friends had a good laugh, leaving my poor ‘handicapped’ friend lost in what seemed like a personal joke between the rest of us.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: mangkuk tingkat from malay mangkuk tingkat multi-tiered tiffin container for food ← malay mangkuk bowl + malay tingkat storey; level; tier
Words.Definition: a multi-tiered tiffin container used to contain food

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 着 著 poj: tio̍h from hokkien (poj) 着 著 tio̍h correct; right; then
Words.Definition: correct; right; true
Words.Example: - You last time were handling this project, right?- Tioh. Why ah?
Related: khiang tioh ho, mai keh khiang

Words.Word: tioh beh pio 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 着 著 poj: tio̍h + 马票 馬票 poj: bé-pio from hokkien (poj) 着 著 tio̍h get; receive; strike + hokkien (poj) 马票 馬票 bé-pio horse racing betting ticket; (in gen.) lottery ticket ← hokkien (poj) 马 馬 bé horse + hokkien (poj) 票 票 pio ticket
Words.Definition: (sarcastic) to be chosen for an unpleasant or undesirable task
Words.Example: Will it be the Main Upgrading Programme? If not, how about Interim Upgrading Programme? Better still, give us the Selective En Bloc Redevelopment Scheme. ... being picked for any of these schemes is like tio beh pio ...

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 着 著 poj: tio̍h + 无 無 poj: bô from hokkien (poj) 着 著 tio̍h correct; right; then + hokkien (poj) 无 無 bô or not; no
Words.Definition: 'am I right?'; 'correct?'; used to ask for confirmation that a previous statement, opinion, etc. was true.
Words.Example: You live in west, tioh bo? I think we meet central better then.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 着 著 poj: tio̍h + 奸 姦 poj: kan/kàn from hokkien (poj) 着 著 tio̍h get; receive + hokkien (poj) 奸 姦 kan/kàn evil; adultery; rape; fuck
Words.Definition: (vulgar) to get scolded harshly; to be chewed out
Words.Example: I heard they tioh kan until damn rabak by the CO yesterday.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 着 著 poj: tio̍h + Malay: makan from hokkien (poj) 着 著 tio̍h get; receive + malay makan eat; consume
Words.Definition: to be taken advantage of; to be swindled
Words.Example: Your friend need to grind his tooth to find his next job liao ... Sad to say, your friend tio makan liao.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 中 中 poj: tiong from hokkien (poj) 中 中 tiong China, (lit.) middle ← hokkien (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China
Words.Definition: (derogatory slur or endearing) a person from mainland China

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 忠心 poj: tiong-sim from hokkien (poj) 忠心 tiong-sim loyalty; faithfulness; devotion
Words.Definition: loyalty; faithfulness; devotion
Words.Example: I tell you ah, Alice got no tiongsim one. 1 year change 4 boyfriend.
Related: tiong sim is a lie, hongster never die
hongster never die, tiong sim is a lie

Words.Word: tiong sim is a lie, hongster never die 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 忠心 poj: tiong-sim + English: is a lie + Singlish: hongster + never + English: die from hokkien (poj) 忠心 tiong-sim loyalty; faithfulness; devotion + english is a lie be untrue; be misleading; be deceiving + singlish hongster flirt; coquette; womanizer; playboy; promiscuous person ← hokkien (poj) 风 風 hong demeanor; promiscuous; lewd; dissolute; love; sexual attraction ← english -ster sb. who does or is associated with sth. + singlish never will not; did not; has not ← english never not ever + english die stop living; become dead; fade off or away
Words.Definition: faithfulness and loyalty is overrated, and will result in heartbreak and betrayal, while cheaters and those who flirt and sleep around will never get their hearts broken

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 中国 中國 poj: tiong-kok from hokkien (poj) 中国 中國 tiong-kok China
Words.Definition: Mainland China; the People's Republic of China

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 直落 poj: ti̍t-lo̍k from hokkien (poj) 直落 ti̍t-lo̍k added straight; poured directly ← hokkien (poj) 直 ti̍t straight; direct + hokkien (poj) 落 lo̍k drop; fall; (of food) add; pour in
Words.Definition: (drink ordering, usually of coffee) without any added water; straight (vs. diluted). Stronger than kau, which still has hot water added to it.
Words.Example: Sarah ventured to try a kopi di lo when she needed something really strong to get her through work yesterday, but soon regretted ordering it kosong like she did her normal kopi.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tomolo from singlish tomolo tomorrow; the day after today ← english tomorrow the day after today
Words.Definition: abbreviation of tomolo ('tomorrow; the day after today')

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 倒 poj: tó from min nan (poj) 倒 tó fall over; collapse; fall down; recline; lie down; fall
Words.Definition: to collapse; to fall, especially in bed or asleep from fatigue
Words.Example: Wah, today damn shag. I sit down the MRT want to toh already.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 督公 poj: tok-kong from hokkien (poj) 督公 tok-kong excellent; superb; top-quality ✂ hokkien / cantonese (poj) 拿督公 ná-tok-kong local guardian ancestor-deities worshipped in Singapore, Malaysia, and Indonesia ← hokkien / cantonese (poj) 拿督 ná-tok datuk (honorific Malay male title) ← malay datuk honorific male Malay title; grandfather; elder + hokkien / cantonese (poj) 公 kong honorific male Chinese title; grandfather; elder
Words.Definition: excellent; superb; top-quality

Words.English Translation: → Baba malay: tok panjang from baba malay tok panjang long table; feast celebration ← hokkien (poj) 桌 toh table + baba malay / malay panjang long
Words.Definition: a grand Peranakan feast, usually held to celebrate special occasions such as birthdays, festivals, weddings, anniversaries, etc., centred around a long table found in most Peranakan households on which several lavish dishes are laid
Words.Example: … the everyday house cook may not have the skills and time to prepare these lavish dishes themselves. Thus people really look forward to a Tok Panjang, where they have the opportunity to savour the delicious and sumptuous feast.

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tok tok from singlish tok tok (onom.) knocking sound
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic) a knocking sound

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tok tok + English: man from singlish tok tok (onom.) knocking sound + english man adult male person
Words.Definition: an itinerant hawker who sold noodle dishes, distinguished by their characteristic use of two wooden sticks which they would repeatedly knock together while plying the streets to alert customers of their presence

Words.Word: tok tok mee 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Singlish: tok tok + Hokkien: 面 麵 poj: mī from singlish tok tok (onom.) knocking sound + hokkien (poj) 面 麵 mī wheat noodles
Words.Definition: various noodle dishes traditionally sold by a tok tok man

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tolong from malay tolong help; provide assistance
Words.Definition: 'please'; used to request for help, assistance, compliance, etc.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: ikan toman from malay ikan toman Channa micropeltes (giant snakehead) ← malay ikan fish + malay toman snakehead fish
Words.Definition: Channa micropeltes (a.k.a. giant snakehead), a predatory tropical freshwater fish native to South-East Asia. It is a popular food species due to its versatile, tender meat and large size, with some specimens growing up to 1.3 m long and weighing 20 kg.[1] Its meat is also traditionally believed to have wound-healing properties. It is sometimes kept as a pet fish in large aquariums.

Words.English Translation: → English: tomorrow from english tomorrow the day after today
Words.Definition: tomorrow; the day after today
Words.Example: Haiz, OK lah. Tomolo I help you do.

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 当 當 poj: tong/tng from hokkien (poj) 当 當 tong/tng withstand; endure; resist
Words.Definition: to withstand; to endure; to resist; to bear with
Words.Example: Now late already lah... you can tong until tomorrow?

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 冬菜 poj: tong-chhài from hokkien (poj) 冬菜 tong-chhài preserved Chinese cabbage (bok choy) ← mandarin (pinyin) 冬菜 dōng cài preserved Chinese cabbage (bok choy)
Words.Definition: a type of finely-diced, salted, and preserved Chinese cabbage (bok choy, Brassica rapa chinensis) used in Chinese cuisine

Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 糖水 jyutping: tong4 seoi2 from cantonese (jyutping) 糖水 tong4 seoi2 sweet soupy dessert ← cantonese (jyutping) 糖 tong4 sugar + cantonese (jyutping) 水 seoi2 water; beverage
Words.Definition: a class of sweet, soupy Southern Chinese or southern-Chinese-style desserts, which may come in various forms; examples range from green bean soup to orh nee to bubur cha cha
Words.Example: Chinese cuisine includes many dessert soups called tong sui. They can be served hot or cold, depending on whether you want something comforting or refreshing.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tongkang from malay tongkang barge; large, flat-bottomed boat used to transport goods
Words.Definition: (historical) a barge; a large, flat-bottomed boat used to transport goods

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tongkat from malay tongkat walking stick; staff
Words.Definition: a staff; a cane; a walking stick
Words.Example: "I’ll be more than 80 at the time, so I may need a tongkat … If I can’t use the tongkat to help me walk on the bridge, I'll use the tongkat on the people who built the bridge"!

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tongkat ali from malay tongkat ali Eurycoma longifolia (or sometimes also Polyalthia bullata) ← malay tongkat walking stick; staff + malay Ali Muslim male given name
Words.Definition: Eurycoma longifolia (or sometimes also the similar-looking species Polyalthia bullata), a bitter-tasting medicinal plant traditionally used as an aphrodisiac, sexual health supplement, analgesic, general medicine, and food additive or supplement
Words.Example: The jungle shrub — popularly known as Tongkat Ali (Walking Stick Ali) — is a traditional sex tonic, long peddled by roadside medicine men and sold by the inch.

Words.English Translation: → Unknown: ? from unknown ? possibly hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 突 突 thu̍t/tu̍t stick out; affront; clash with or hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 秃 禿 thu̍t/thut bald; bare, (of a tool) blunt; dull or cantonese (jyutping) Dubious or unconfirmed 嘟 嘟 dut1 (onom.) bleep sound or hokkien (poj) Dubious or unconfirmed 揬 揬 tu̍h poke; prod; jab
Words.Definition: dumb; stupid; inept
Words.Example: Huan Tong is damn toot and dresses like it, but tia kong everyone likes him because he's quite a solid guy.

Words.English Translation: → English: top + Hokkien: 菜 poj: chhài from english top most prominent or eminent; best; number one + hokkien (poj) 菜 chhài vegetable, (slang) attractive girl or woman ← cantonese (jyutping) 菜 coi3 vegetable, (slang) girlfriend; attractive girl or woman
Words.Definition: a particularly good-looking girl; an outstandingly attractive young woman
Words.Example: WOWOWOW TEMASEK HALL TOP CHAI

Words.English Translation: → English: topography + general from english topography detailed survey or description of the surface features of a terrain ← latin topographia description of a place or country ← ancient greek τοπογρᾰφῐ́ᾱ topographía description of a place or country + english general senior military officer in charge of an army ← anglo-norman general general ← latin generālis generic; general; non-specific
Words.Definition: (military) someone extremely skilled at navigation and map-reading

Words.English Translation: → English: topography + Singlish: king from english topography detailed survey or description of the surface features of a terrain ← latin topographia description of a place or country ← ancient greek τοπογρᾰφῐ́ᾱ topographía description of a place or country + singlish king (suffix, usu. sarcastic or pejorative) the epitome of sth. ← english king (usu. male) the ruler of a monarchy; a powerful or preeminent person
Words.Definition: (military) someone extremely skilled at navigation and map-reading

Words.English Translation: → English: totalisator + lotto from english totalisator computerized system used to run pari-mutuel betting (pooled lotteries) ← english totalize sum up; combine into a total ← english total sum ← old french total total ← latin tōtālis total + english -ize suffix used to form verbs ← middle french -ise suffix used to form verbs ← medieval latin -izāre suffix used to form verbs + english -ator suffix used to form a noun performing an action of a verb ← latin -ātor suffix used to form a noun performing an action of a verb ← latin -āt- suffix used to form a verb + latin -or suffix used to form a noun + english lotto lottery ← italian lotto lottery; lot; plot of land ← old french lot lot; plot of land
Words.Definition: a lottery and gambling game where players pick 6 numbers out of 49, with three or more matches entitling the player to a monetary prize, and the jackpot of all numbers matching having a guaranteed minimum $1 million prize. It was introduced in the 1968 as a legal, regulatable alternative in an effort to curb and control illegal gambling. It is the second-most popular gambling or lottery game in Singapore, after 4D.

Words.Word: tou chee peng 简 繁
Words.English Translation: → Cantonese: 肚脐饼 肚臍餅 jyutping: tou5 ci4 beng2 from cantonese (jyutping) 肚脐饼 肚臍餅 tou5 ci4 beng2 small, light, airy, round biscuit ← cantonese (jyutping) 肚脐 肚臍 tou5 ci4 belly button; navel + cantonese (jyutping) 饼 餅 beng2 cookie; biscuit
Words.Definition: small, airy, round biscuits in the shape of an oblate spheroid or scallop about 1.5 cm in diameter
Words.Example: Talking about snacks reminds me of tho chee paeng or Belly Button Biscuit. These fat little oval biscuits no bigger than your fore thumb were very popular and came in a bluish rectangular tin that was pretty sharp at the edges ... Another variation of the biscuit had a tuff of hardened, colored sugar icing on it.

Words.English Translation: → English: touch + your + heart from english touch physically make contact with, esp. using the hands + english your 2p. possessive pron. + english heart organ which pumps blood through the body
Words.Definition: be honest with yourself; speak truthfully
Words.Example: Touch your heart and be honest, do you think those big MNCs like Apple/BMW/Airbus will set up a real R&D Centre in Singapore?

Words.English Translation: → Min nan: 头家 頭家 poj: thâu-ke from min nan (poj) 头家 頭家 thâu-ke boss; proprietor of a shop or business ← min nan (poj) 头 頭 thâu head + min nan (poj) 家 家 ke home; family; business; company
Words.Definition: a boss; the proprietor of a shop or business
Words.Example: A trusted towkay was looked up to for more than just employment ... If disputes between lightermen occurred it would likely be the towkay who stepped in to resolve the conflict.

Words.English Translation: → Min nan / hakka: 头家娘 頭家娘 poj: thâu-ke-niû/niô͘ from min nan / hakka (poj) 头家娘 頭家娘 thâu-ke-niû/niô͘ boss's wife; lady boss; proprietress ← min nan / hakka (poj) 头家 頭家 thâu-ke boss; proprietor of a shop or business ← min nan / hakka (poj) 头 頭 thâu head + min nan / hakka (poj) 家 家 ke home; family; business; company + min nan / hakka (poj) 娘 娘 niû/niô͘ wife; lady

Words.English Translation: → Hokkien: 大䑩 poj: tōa-ko͘ from hokkien (poj) 大䑩 tōa-ko͘ wooden cargo boat used to transport goods ← hokkien (poj) 大 tōa big + hokkien (poj) 䑩 ko͘ wooden boat

Words.Example: Grandpa was working in one of the huge Tua Kow ... He would from time to time bring us to his Tua Kow. While it was fun, it was also frightening. We had to jump from Tua Kow to Tua Kow from the river side. If we fell outside the Tua Kow, it would be into the murky, dirty and foul smelling river. If we fell into the Tua Kow, we were to have broken bones, as what my uncle did.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tulang + merah from malay tulang bone + malay merah red
Words.Definition: a rich, often bright red stew of mutton bones, tomatoes, chilli, garlic, ginger, mutton stock, and other ingredients and spices. It can be eaten with the hands, and a straw is sometimes used to slurp out the bone marrow, which is often considered the centrepiece of the dish itself. Some experienced diners may knock the marrow out without the aid of a straw.It originated in Indian Muslim cuisine — specifically invented in the 1950s or 1960s by either Baharudeen or Abdul Kadir, hawkers who wanted to find a use for the leftover mutton bones they had after making dishes such as sup kambing, which often still had a good amount of meat left on them.[1][2]
Words.Example: Ever on the hunt for new taste experiences, it shamed me to realise that while I’m a big fan of peppery sup kambing (mutton soup), I’ve never actually tried its decidedly more flamboyant relative, sup tulang merah.

Words.English Translation: → Malay: tumpang from malay tumpang hitch a ride; join in; ride; carry

Words.English Translation: → English: up there + Singlish: -z from english up there prominent; outstanding ← english up on top; above ← english there distinct or indicated location not near to the speaker + singlish -z colloquializing suffix; used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang ← english -z (urban slang) suffix used to add a quirky, silly, cool, or cute twang

Words.Example: Hi, if is it possible to use back the same valuation report if were to re otp? what is the complication of otp? can the seller back out after the buyer execise the otp?

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: uwu from singlish uwu (onom.) koel’s call
Words.Definition: (onomatopoeic) the distinctive call of Eudynamys scolopaceus, also known as the Asian koel, a medium-sized omnivorous bird in the cuckoo family which is commonly known as the uwu bird in Singapore

Words.English Translation: → Singlish: uwu + English: bird from singlish uwu (onom.) koel’s call + english bird animal in the class Aves, having feathers, wings, a beak, and laying eggs
Words.Definition: Eudynamys scolopaceus, also known as the Asian koel, a medium-sized omnivorous bird in the cuckoo family. It is a brood parasite, laying its eggs in the nests of mynas and similar birds. It is well-known for its distinctive call, after which it is named, and which can sometimes be heard in the mornings in Singapore. The English name koel is also imitative in origin.

Words.English Translation: → Tamil: வடை vaṭai from tamil வடை vaṭai Indian deep-fried fritter made of dough and gram flour ← prakrit 𑀯𑀝𑁆𑀝 vaṭṭa round; circular ← sanskrit वृत्त vṛtta round; circular
Words.Definition: a roughly spherical Indian deep-fried fritter made of dough and gram flour with several spices, sometimes containing a filling such as a whole prawn

Words.English Translation: → English: very + the from english very to a strong degree; extremely; rather + english the definite article
